accessory-design-as-a-career-in-india.title: Accessory Design
accessory-design-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Accessory Designing is one of the most upcoming and interesting field in the world of Fashion. Accessories can add a splash of color, personality, and style to the wearer. Accessories range from jewelry, footwear, scarves to handbags, belts, hats etc. Therefore, there is a wide scope for the field. To be successful in the field, the person should use their creativity and imagination to design unique products while keeping in mind the current fashion trends. They are up- to-date with the ongoing developments in the fashion industry, as well as they keep a close eye on the market. They use both paper- pencil as well as computer- aided designing.

career-opportunities.apparel_manufacturers: Accessory designers work in apparel manufacturing industry to amalgamate accessories that best suit the garment and complete the look.
career-opportunities.apparel_wholesalers: Accessory designers tie up with wholesalers to mass produce/ mass retail their accessories. They design a variety of accessories that pair up with garments to complete the look.
career-opportunities.television_and_film_industry: They design costumes and apparel to be donned by the who's who of the film and television industry. They often consider the plot of the movies and complexities of the characters in doing so.
career-opportunities.leather_accessory_designing: Accessory designers specializing in leather accessories make use of leather to design and then create designs that complement garments. This is a relatively new take in accessory designing and often encompass belts and bands.
career-opportunities.jewellery_designing: Accessory designers specializing in jewelry design, design and then create jewelry that complement garments. This profile encompasses designing earrings, rings, neck pieces, bands, bracelets etc.
career-opportunities.freelance_accessory_designing: Freelancers in accessory designing either create their own brand of accessories or take up projects independently with other designers to design and create pieces that complement the apparel to be worn with it.
career-opportunities.gemologists: As a gemologist, one is academically trained to identify and evaluate gems. One may be involved in diamond grading or identification of colored gemstones.

path 1.stream: Pass Class XII in Any Stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. Fashion Designing/ B. Des. Accessory Design for 3- 4 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M. Des. (Master of Design) for 2 years

path 2.stream: Pass Class XII in Any Stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue Diploma in Fashion Designing/ Diploma in Accessory Designing for 1 year
path 2.after graduation: Pursue PG Diploma in Fashion Designing

path 3.stream: Pass Class XII in Any Stream
path 3.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. Fashion Designing/ B. Des. Accessory Design for 3- 4 years
path 3.after graduation: Study Abroad and Pursue Master's program in luxury accessories design & management/ Masters in Fashion Design for 1 -2 years

accessory-design-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: Practical, industrial experience is a must. This can be achieved via internships or upon getting a job.

work description: Research past, present and future fashion and accessory trends to predict the upcoming demands of the customers or consumers
Design the accessories either by sketching or using software such as CAD
Develop concept that fulfils the demand and desire of the clients
Ensure the quality and standard of the product and the materials used
Create samples before the actual production and modify it
Supervise and manage production and sale
Make reports of the market's situation or reaction towards the product
Negotiate with dealers and clients and work within the financial budget to ensure the profitable running of the business
Stay abreast of the latest developments in technology and accessory trends

pros: Once you will design the accessories, different individuals will use it to enhance their appearance that will provide personal satisfaction.
You will get the opportunity to start your own business.
You will get the opportunity to show your creativity.
Opportunity to travel and meet different individuals.
cons: It is a highly competitive field.
Criticism from seniors and customers.
There will be a pressure to be up-to-date with the trends.
You will work for longer hours to meet the deadlines.

acting-as-a-career-in-india.title: Acting/Dramatics
acting-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Actors imbibe the characters they play, and become the face of the production. They are the ones who bring the vision of the director to life, and stun the audience with their performance. Be it the theatre, films, or television, actors over the due course of time, become a brand themselves.

career-opportunities.television: An actor can work in TV serials.
career-opportunities.movies: An actor can act in Movies and showcase his/her skills.
career-opportunities.theatre: Performing in a theatre on stage is the biggest challenge for an actor as he has to perform in front of a live audience and the option of retakes isn't present.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in any stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue Bachelors In Mass communication/Any Discipline for 3 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII in any stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue Diploma In Acting (Multiple Specialization) for 1-2 years

path 3.stream: Clear Class XII in any stream
path 3.graduation: Pursue Graduation in Mass Media course
path 3.after graduation: Pursue specialisation in Acting course

work description: Portray different roles and characters for entertainment purposes
Work as a part of a film, television, theatre or drama
Direct and produce drama for the live audience
Understand the mood, feeling and emotion of the character before acting
Captivate the viewers by generating diverse emotions such as humour, anger, love, etc.
Understand the storyline and the script to form a contextual basis for the character
Provide voice-over in advertisements, animated movies, radio, etc
Gain popularity by developing skills of dancing and singing
Look attractive through good health and personality
Practice and rehearse for several hours for a refined performance

pros: You get to live different characters.
You get to travel different destination as a part of your job.
This is a field wherein you earn well from the begning itself.
The fame you get in this industry can not be matched with any other industry.
cons: Being a part of this field, your life will be scrutanised all the time.
As there is a lot of competition in this path, you need to have a lot of resilience and perseverance.
You have to follow a very hectic schedule.

acturial-sciences-as-a-career-in-india.title: Actuarial Science
acturial-sciences-as-a-career-in-india.summary: A course in actuarial sciences equips you to scientifically assess risk in various fields, but mainly in insurance, business and finance. Actuaries are an important component of risk-assessment as well as risk-management for any organization. They use various statistical, mathematical and computational methodologies to give their assessment. Some of the job responsibilities of this job profile in life and general insurance business include designing and pricing of policies, monitoring the funds, recommending fair rate of bonus where applicable, insurance risks like legal liability, loss of profit, etc

career-opportunities.insurance_sector: In the Insurance Sector actuaries look at determining and managing risk for the insurance company. They use complex statistical and mathematical model to analyse the rates of morbidity, mortality, retirement, disability, survivorship and other contingencies for a property or a life insurance applicant.
career-opportunities.business_sector: In business actuaries analyses risk arising from various economic, legal and social trends on the financial health of an organization. They are actively involved in managing Total Cost of Risk (TCR) and containing costs for various liabilities of the organization. In essence, actuaries play a pivotal role in managing the financial health of the organization.
career-opportunities.banking_and_financial_services: Many leading banks now actively use actuarial services to manage and price risk while giving out loans. The trend has also been fostered by the 2008 debacle of some American banks. In financial institutions, actuaries are involved in assessing the risk and profitability of investments in shares and various other funds.
career-opportunities.health_and_medical_sector: Off lately, Actuaries are being hired by big hospitals and medical care providers, although the trend is majorly in western countries to assess the risk of changes in various legal policies and in medical assessment procedures such as a change in mental health manual from ICD 9 to ICD 10 or DSM 4 to DSM 5.

path 1.stream: Commerce/Science with Math
path 1.graduation: Graduation in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics or Related Subjects
path 1.after graduation: Masters in Applied Actuarial Science/ M.Sc. in Actuarial Sciences/ PG Program in Actuarial Science

path 2.stream: Commerce/Science with Math
path 2.graduation: Graduation in Any Discipline

path 3.stream: Commerce/Science with Math
path 3.graduation: Bachelor in Mathematics/ Statistics, Bachelor in Economics, Bachelor in Computer Science
path 3.after graduation: M.Sc. in Actuarial Sciences/ MBA in Actuarial Sciences

path 4.stream: Commerce/Science with Math

path 4.after graduation: M.Sc. in Actuarial Sciences/ MBA in Actuarial Sciences 1 year diploma course *PG Program in Actuarial Science

path 5.stream: Clear Class XII in any stream

work description: Use statistical models to analyze data and calculate the probability of and costs associated with product failure, accidents, property damage, injury and death
Estimate the likelihood of catastrophic events, such as hurricanes, earthquakes, pandemics and terrorist attacks, as well as assess the risk exposure of insurance companies
Design investment and pension plans for financial services
Aid businesses lower their insurance premiums by reducing their risk exposure
Do exhaustive data analysis and statistical modelling
Ensure that premium rates are set accurately and adequate funds exist to meet claims
Be Responsible for legislative and advisory work
Manage staff and report financial forecasts to management

pros: High Income :Actuaries make above average salary. It is one of the most highest paying jobs.
Job Security: Chances of finding a higher job security is more with experience and expertise.
cons: It is one of the most difficult courses.
If your mathematical aptitude is not brilliant, this field is not for you.
The job can be very stressfull due to long working hours and greater responsibility.

adtech-as-a-career-in-india.title: Ad-tech
adtech-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Ad-tech is the short term for "Advertising Technologies". It includes all the technologies, softwares and tools that are used for delivering, controlling and targeting the advertisements. It includes the entire process of delivering ads from selecting the topic of an ad to choosing the audience to which it has to be delivered. Ad-tech is operated by Ad Agencies and Advertisers.

career-opportunities.account_director_manager: An account director is a person who establishes a link between the client and the creative team. He/ she works with both in ternal teams and customers to ensure clear communication. They deliver creative work that meets then clients' needs.
career-opportunities.marketing_director_manager: A marketing director makes sure that the marketing process is consistent and flawless across different advertising campaigns, and he also ensures the client's brand is recognizable and appealing. Marketing director establish cost parameters and sales estimates.
career-opportunities.production_manager: Production managers are responsible for handling logistics and coordinating & ensuring the orderly flow. They assure that tracking, reporting, and billing are functioning optimally.
career-opportunities.brand_strategist: A brand startegist analyse current market research data and trends. They advice on and developing practical solutions for marketing plans. They also define brand elements and tone. The brand strategist aims to ensure a compelling brand message to the right target audience.
career-opportunities.digital_strategist: A digital strategist plays a significant role in the successful planning and implementation of digital marketing strategies, taking into consideration offline marketing efforts as well. They provide solutions based on consumer insight and data.
career-opportunities.media_buyer: A media buyer's role is to classify the most suitable media platforms to market a brand, product or service. He/ she ensures that the campaigns reach the highest number of people. Besides placements, media buyers also negotiate the price for all advertisements.
career-opportunities.creative_director: Creative directors are the final decision makers regarding a copy or design. They lead a creative team of art directors, designers, and copywriters. They work with sales team and marketers to create the concept for the product. The creative director guides a creative team.
career-opportunities.art_director: An art director is responsible for outlining a product's, services campaign's, or a brand's visual characteristics. The art director is responsible for the visuals, aesthetics, and artistic aspects of the project. He/ she also directs others to develop the layouts of the artworks required.
career-opportunities.graphic_designer: Graphic designers bring ideas to reality and create visual concepts on the art directors' design direction.
career-opportunities.design_illustrator: Illustrators create 2-D drawings which are used in advertisements, books, magazines, packaging, greeting cards, newpapers, etc.
career-opportunities.image_retoucher: Image retouchers are responsible for enhancing the appearance of a picture to suit a project's specifications. They are incharge of combining images, consolidating or eliminating backgrounds, playing with colors, and anything that creates an entirely new copy.
career-opportunities.ux_ui_designer: A User experience (UX) designer is responsible for creating how aproduct will function. They are also responsible for mapping out the functionality of every screen that a user will interact with. A User Interface (UI) designer is responsible for creating the look nad feel of a product and taking the charted out user experience and then designing the visual factors.
career-opportunities.web_developer: Web developer create programs and applications for the internet. They can develop a website from scratch with layouts, features, and functions.
career-opportunities.web_designer: A web designer is required to make websites more aesthetically appealing and easy-to-use. These professionals need to be connected with the trends and online consumer preferences that usually change at a fast pace.
career-opportunities.copywriter: A copywriter develops concepts and ideas for advertising campaigns. They also write the text used in promotional campaigns.

pros: One get to work with a variety of professionals. Get to work on multiple clients. Working is in a fast paced role.
cons: Working late in evening is a norm in some agencies. You don't work on something end-users appreciate or want. You are working on behalf of the advertisers.

advertising-as-a-career-in-india.title: Advertising
advertising-as-a-career-in-india.summary: In today's world where new companies are coming up everyday, while some reach the pinnacle, others—is collapse without even making a ripple. In such scenario, manufacturing the best product and providing the best service is not going to be enough to attract the target audience, it requires much more than that. This is were advertising professionals come in, who design adverts and make use of marketing collaterals to help their clients reach their consumers and establish positive brand image. Advertising professionals need to have a creative bend of mind, good imaginary skills, and flexible in approach in order to be successful in the field of advertising.

career-opportunities.corporate_sector: In this sector advertisers create campaigns for the company in order to create a positive brand image and have an edge over the competitors.
career-opportunities.advertising_agencies: In advertising agencies the role will be to create adds based on the requirements of the client. They decide the media channel, duration, content, tone, etc. for the advertisement.
career-opportunities.publication_houses: This form of advertising creates advertisement for magazines, newspapers, etc. by deciding the content as well as the way of presenting the advertisement so that it serves the attended purpose and catches the target audience.
career-opportunities.media_agencies_firms: In media agencies one will be involved in creating ad films for various media, be it television, radio, print, internet, etc. by basing it on the demand and keeping in mind its impact on the target audience.
career-opportunities.freelancer: As a freelancer, one may take up assignments from a diverse set of clients ranging from corporate to media agencies.

work description: Plan and prepare advertising and promotional material to increase sales of products or services
Work with customers, company officials, sales departments, and advertising agencies to plan ad campaigns
Gather and organize information to plan advertising campaigns
Confer with departmental heads or staff to discuss topics such as contracts, selection of advertising media, or product to be advertised
Prepare budgets and submit estimates for programme costs as part of campaign plan development
Prepare and negotiate advertising and sales contracts
Plan and execute advertising policies and strategies for organizations
Track programme budgets and expenses and campaign response rates to evaluate each campaign based on programme objectives and industry norms

pros: It is a highly creative field.
Work hours can be flexible.
Potential to earn is high, depending on the ideas and effort you are willing to put in.
cons: Requires client- customer interaction on regular intervals, which can be exhausting.
Work environment is dynamic, it doesn’t follow 9 to 5 working hours.

agricultural-biotechnology-as-a-career-i.title: Agricultural Biotechnology
agricultural-biotechnology-as-a-career-i.summary: Agricultural biotechnology, also called Agritech, is an area of agricultural science that involves the use of scientific instruments and techniques, such as molecular markers, genetic engineering, molecular diagnostics, tissue culture and vaccines, to modify living organisms: animals, plants and microorganisms. Biotechnology enhances the ability of breeders to make improvements to crops and livestock through the identification and modification of certain genes. Biotechnology enables improvements that are can't be achieved through the traditional method of crossing related species alone. Biotechnology is being used in improving crop yields and increasing plants? resistance to insects, disease and drought; increasing milk production; preventing and treating animal disease; and developing better ways of processing foods.

career-opportunities.product_development_scientist: Development scientists are required in the companies which manufacture products to understand and control the processes used to make the final product. They work across the manufacturing industry, on products as diverse as medicines, cosmetics paints and food.
career-opportunities.industries: Industries engaged in processing and development of agricultural and biological products, pharmaceutical and chemical industries, bio-processing industries are the major recruiters. There are ample opportunities in industries producing cosmetics, healthcare products, textile industry, and organizations engaged in different types of industrial research and development.
career-opportunities.agricultural_consultant: Agricultural consultants or advisers offer support, solutions and advice to their clients to ensure that their enterprise or business is running as effectively and efficiently as possible.
career-opportunities.agriculture_management: Agriculture managers tend to work in either dairy, crop or animal production. Their work includes planning tactics/strategies for maximum yield, organization of farm administration, working machinery, organization of associated businesses and staff management.
career-opportunities.selfemployment: Free lancers can work in agricultural firms, agriculture product shops and the agro-base industry.
career-opportunities.process_development_scientist: Their aim is to optimize the performance of manufacturing systems. They are responsible for identifying and developing new processes for product manufacturing, as well as implementing process controls to make sure that the products are of a high quality and are manufactured in a reproducible manner.
career-opportunities.research_and_development: Research and development is the process of discovering new products and developing them all the way to the market. These two processes keep the agricultural biotechnology industry running by creating new products to sell.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in Science Stream with PCB/PCM (Mathematics is recommended)
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. (Agricultural Biotechnology) for 3 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M. Sc. (Agricultural Biotechnology) for 2 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII in Science Stream with PCB/PCM (Mathematics is recommended)
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.Tech. (Biotechnology in agriculture) for 4 years
path 2.after graduation: Pursue M. Tech for 2 years

work description: Use computer aided design (CAD) technology to design agricultural & horticultural machinery components and equipments
Design food-processing plants and supervise manufacturing operations
Test agricultural machinery and equipments to ensure their performance
Employ statistical methods and theories to solve practical problems in agricultural field
Collaborate with and work with agriculture and food scientists
Assess the environmental impact of intensive agricultural production methods
Provide consultancy & advise on water quality and issues related to managing pollution and protecting and using other water resources
Design and monitor environmental & land reclamation projects in agriculture and related arena

pros: An individual in the field has numerous opportunities and prospects for obtaining a job since agricultural biotechnology is an up and coming field.
Professionals in the field get to work in laboratories which might an attractive work environment for some.
It can be a satisfactory career since the research and work of agricultural biotechnologists has the potential to improve the quality of food crops and solve global food problems.
cons: There is the potential of exposure to dangerous and hazardous subtances on the job.
The salaries are average.

agricultural-engineering-as-a-career-in-.title: Agricultural Engineering
agricultural-engineering-as-a-career-in-.summary: Agricultural engineers are professionals who design and develop new procedures, systems and tools for agricultural operations and products. They are required to go to work sites so that they can observe whether the equipment or processes are working appropriately. Agricultural engineers integrate technology with farming. New forms of biofuels from non-food resources such as agricultural waste and algae are developed by them. Bio-energy production and conservation, farm mechanization and water and soil conservation techniques are some of the exciting domains they work on.

career-opportunities.agricultural_consultants: Support, solutions and advice is offered by agricultural consultants or advisers to their clients, to ensure their enterprise or business is running as effectively and efficiently as possible.
career-opportunities.farm_managers: Farm managers tend to work in either dairy, crop or animal production.Their work includes planning strategies for maximum yield, organization of farm administration, working machinery, organization of associated businesses and staff management.
career-opportunities.free_lancers: Free lancers can work in agricultural firms, agriculture product shops and the agro-base industry.
career-opportunities.rural_practice_surveyor: Strategic and practical knowledge to a range of clients is provided by a rural practice surveyor involved in rural land and property.
career-opportunities.floriculturist: Floriculturists deals with the study of growing foliage flowers and plants and then marketing them. Their specialization is in planning and designing of interior/exterior landscapes for recreational areas, parks, industrial sites, shopping malls or other projects.
career-opportunities.government_sector_jobs: Agricultural Engineers who specialize in various fields like agricultural mechanization, food processing, soil conservation and so on can find various job opportunities in both state government as well as central government firms.
career-opportunities.private_sector_jobs: Students who graduated in Agricultural Engineering can work in Agri Business, Agricultural Research, Agro Industry, Agricultural Journalism, Agricultural Education, floriculture, Agricultural Management and Horticulture.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in Science Stream with PCB/PCM (Mathematics is recommended)
path 1.graduation: Pursue B. Tech in Agricultural Engineering for 4 years

agronomy-as-a-career-in-india.title: Agronomy
agronomy-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Agronomy is defined as the science and technology of producing and utilizing plants for different uses such as obtaining fuel, land reclamation, food and fiber. Agronomy is a branch of agricultural science that includes work in the fields of plant physiology, soil science, meteorology, and plant genetics. Agronomists focus on developing techniques to enhance the production of food and fiber crops.

career-opportunities.plant_scientists: The focus of plant scientists is on increasing the amount and quality of food produced by the national food suppliers.
career-opportunities.rural_practice_surveyor: They provide strategic and practical knowledge to a range of clients on rural land and property.
career-opportunities.soil_scientist: A soil scientist gathers, interprets and evaluates information about different typed of soils to inform and influence issues such as agricultural production, biodiversity, climate change; environmental quality, human health, land remediation.
career-opportunities.agricultural_consultant: Support, solutions and advice is offered by agricultural consultants or advisers to their clients to ensure their enterprise or business is running as effectively and efficiently as possible.
career-opportunities.agroindustry_sector_jobs: The agro-industry sector makes jobs available for scientists, engineers, sales, marketing people and technologists.
career-opportunities.services_sector_jobs: This sector provides jobs to agricultural technicians, graders, agricultural consultants, veterinarians, agricultural statisticians, etc. Jobs by Banks, finance and insurance companies are also available for agriculturists.Many job opportunities are available in estates and tea gardens as well.
career-opportunities.corporations: Various corporations viz. National Seed Corporation, the State farm Corporation, Warehousing Corporation and Food Corporation, etc. provide job opportunities to agriculturists.
career-opportunities.agriculture_management: Farm managers tend to work in either dairy, crop or animal production. Their work includes planning tactics/strategies for the maximum yield, organization of farm administration, working machinery, organization of associated businesses and staff management.
career-opportunities.selfemployment: Free lancers can work in agricultural firms, agriculture product shops and agro-base industries.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in Science Stream with PCB/PCMB
path 1.graduation: Pursue B. Sc Agriculture (Hons.) for 3 years

air-traffic-controller-as-a-career-in-in.title: Air Traffic Controller
air-traffic-controller-as-a-career-in-in.summary: Air Traffic Controller is a job which involves managing the traffic in air, monitoring and managing aircraft and runways. They provide with the information to the pilots via radio about the location, runway and monitor the altitude and speed of the aircraft. Air traffic controllers are the back end people who are majorly responsible to overlook that aircraft collision and air traffic mishappenings don’t happen as these mishappenings can cause major loss of property and life. This job is of great responsibility as is given to those individuals who have strong basis in technical aspects as their main aim is safety and smooth flow of air traffic which involves attention to landing and take off of the aircraft, managing the flights which are arriving and departing and so on. Airport Authority of India conduct an examination on the basis of which they hire individuals as air traffic controller. The examination tests the individuals on the basis of medical test, voice test and a written test. Air traffic controllers are the eyes and ears of the pilot, they need to have attention to details and the skill of multi tasking. As a Air Traffic Controller, you can work as Town Controller, Approach Controller, Area Controller etc. All the metioned departments work with each other in unity, so as to ensure safe and smooth functioning of aircraft and the airport.

career-opportunities.town_controller: They direct and monitor the traffic on runways, giving clearances to the aircraft about landing and take off. They work from tower centres, as from there they have a clearer view of the runway. They are responsible for getting the aircraft on the runway and from there other departments of the air traffic controller take charge.
career-opportunities.approach_controller: Approach controllers take over when the aircraft is landing, so as to ensure the most effective and fuel efficient form of landing. They are constantly in touch with safety areas so that the landing is safe.
career-opportunities.area_controller: Approach and Departure Controller are responsible for monitoring the aircraft in the controlled airspace in order to ensure saftety. They use technical equipments to monitor the path of the aircraft and provide with important information to the pilot about the weather conditions and critical notices with regard to the path the aircraft is following.

path 1.stream: Class XII with science stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.Tech. degree in any related fields like Mechanical, Aeronautical etc.
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M.Tech

path 2.stream: Class XII with science stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue Bachelors of Science in Physics and Mathematics
path 2.after graduation: Pursue Masters of science in Physics and Mathematics

work description: The job of air traffic controllers involves multi tasking as they have to coordinate among the various departments in air traffic control itself and take into account the safety measures.
Air traffic controllers have to stay in contact with the pilot through out and provide them with necessary information so as to avoid any mishappenings while in air or on a runway.
They are also responsible for alerting the airport response staff in case of any aircraft emergency, hence this job requires vigilance and quick decision making.

Air traffic controllers involves the use of radars and technical equipments to guide the aircraft in the air and they also need to coordinate with the the other departments to ensure smooth arrival and departure of the aircraft.

pros: Air traffic controller is a job for those individuals who have high ability of strategic thinking, quick decision making and are highly vigilant.
Jobs can be exciting and interesting for those who are aviation enthusiast.
Air traffic controllers can take pride in their job as they are constantly working with the pilots and ensuring safety arrival and departure of thousands of people and aircrafts
cons: Becoming a successful Air traffic controller requires years of training and experience in order to gain knowledge.
Professionals might have to work long hours and it might become stressful sometimes
As this is a job which aims at safety and it is a major responsibility, so there is no room for error.

aircraft_maintenance_engineering.title: Aircraft Maintenance Engineering
aircraft_maintenance_engineering.summary: Aircraft Maintenance Engineering is a fast-growing career option in the aviation industry. It is a three-year license based course that involves the repairing, upgrading and maintaining an aircraft. The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA), Government of India regulates this program and issues license to practice as a Aircraft Maintenance Engineer. These highly qualified and trained professionals possess theoretical as well as practical knowledge and their chief responsibilities consists of repairing, overhauling, problem solving, modifying, replacing, and inspecting the air vehicles prior to the take-off and sign the Flight Releasing Certificates (FRC) indicating that the aircraft is safe to fly. Along with this, these professionals are also acquainted with the current trends and developments in the aviation industry so as to keep regulary upgrading and maintaining the aircrafts.

career-opportunities.mechanical_stream: B1 category of license is for mechanical stream. This involves training in Light Aeroplanes, Heavy Aeroplanes, Rotary Wing Aircraft Piston and Jet Engine.
career-opportunities.avionics_stream: B2 category of license is required in avionics stream of AME. Institutes train individuals in electronic components of the aircraft like the electrical system, instrumental system and radio communication and navigation system.

path 1.stream: Class XII in Science Stream with minimum 45% marks in Chemistry, Physics and Maths subject combination
path 1.graduation: Aircraft Maintenance Engineering course approved by the DGCA - Four year license course with 2 years of theoretical and 2 years of practical training in the actual environment
path 1.after graduation: Clear the DGCA License Exams, Candidates must pass papers I, II and III written examination and paper IV approved course on the specific aircraft/engine/systems; they should also pass the oral-cum-practical examination; they should have minimum 4 years of practical experience in the field of aircraft maintenance engineering.

path 2.stream: Science
path 2.graduation: B.Sc with Maths, Physics & Chemistry.
path 2.after graduation: Aircraft Maintenance Engineering training course approved by the DGCA and Clear the DGCA License Exam

path 3.stream: Engineering
path 3.graduation: Three-year Diploma in Engineering or B. Tech - AICTE approved 3 years engineering diploma in any stream
path 3.after graduation: Aircraft Maintenance Engineering training course approved by the DGCA and Clear the DGCA License Exam

path 4.stream: Aeronautical Engineering
path 4.graduation: B.E/B.Tech Aeronautical Engineering
path 4.after graduation: Clear the DGCA License Exam

pros: It is listed as one of the hottest careers in the field of Aviation There is a huge scope in this sector in India and abroad and the opportunities are growing at tremendous rate It is a niche career in this industry as it offers respect, dignity, authority and a high salary package It is a rare but specialized branch in engineering and recognised globally
cons: The AMEs may be required to be on-call even during the weekends or holidays. There are shifts but they might be called to work at any time of the day Sometimes the work responsibilities can be dangerous as it can involve working with chemicals. The work conditions can become noisy and stressful and require sharp presence of mind and problem-solving skills Only the AME has the authority to sign the FRC and one mistake on the part of the AME can have fatal consequences i.e. there is a lot at stake in this work. The AME can be required to travel overseas

anesthesiologist.title: Anesthesiologist
anesthesiologist.summary: Anesthesiology is the field of medical sciences that deals with the patients from the pain. Anesthesiologists take care of the patients who are in chronic pain, and in various cases, they are in charge to take care of patients with respiratory or cardiac problems. They decide on the dosage of drugs that is to be given to the patients. Their main duty is to be with the patient, before during and after surgery, and check up on the anesthesia that is given to the patient.

career-opportunities.critical_care_medicine: Focuses patients with acute, life- threatning illnesses or injuries.
career-opportunities.hospice__palliative_medicine: Focuses on preventing or relieving pain and other symptoms of people with critical or terminal illnesses.
career-opportunities.pain_medicine: Focuses on diagnosing, treating and managing painand a range of painful disorders.
career-opportunities.pediatric_anesthesiology: Focuses on relieving pain and providing total medical care for children before, during and after surgery.
career-opportunities.sleep_medicine: Focuses on health conditions that prevent sleep, occur during sleep, or result from a lack of sleep.
career-opportunities.neuroanesthesia: Deals with the complex relationships of anesthetic medications, neurosurgical procedures, and the critical care issues that surround the management of the patients.
career-opportunities.cardiac_anesthesiology: Cardiovascular anesthesiologists are physicians who provide patient care and monitoring during cardiothoracic and vascular surgery.
career-opportunities.obstetric_anesthesia: Obstetric Anesthesia refers to peripartum anesthetic and analgesic activities performed during labor and vaginal delivery, cesarean delivery, removal of retained placenta, and postpartum tubal ligation.

path 1.stream: Class XII in science stream with Biology
path 1.graduation: Pursue MBBS for 5.5 years ( 4.5 years of study + 1 year internship)
path 1.after graduation: Pursue MD in Anesthesiology for 2 years

path 2.stream: Class XII in science stream with Biology
path 2.graduation: Pursue MBBS for 5.5 years ( 4.5 years of study + 1 year internship)

pros: • Unless the candidate specialize in only one area, he/ she can expect to care for a widw variety of patients, ages, and medical conditions in one day• While anesthesia can have its own risks, they tend to be less than those faced by surgeons or other medical doctors.
cons: • Anesthesiologists are required to stand for long hours till the surgery ends, just like everyone who are involved in the surgery.• Being an anesthesiologist would mean to be present on-call, whenever there is a surgery is scheduled. The working hours for an anesthesiologist are long and tiring.• The chances of an emergency while surgery is under procedure are always very high,thus an anesthesiologist will have to be present from the start till the end.

anthropology-as-a-career-in-india.title: Anthropology
anthropology-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Anthropologists take a broad approach to study human beings and many different aspects of human experience by considering the past and the present. Anthropology is a science that deals with the study of the origins, physical and cultural development, biological characteristics and social customs as well as beliefs of human beings. There are many subfields of anthropology, some of them being archaeology, biological anthropology, cultural anthropology, and linguistic anthropology.

career-opportunities.academic: Anthropologists can teach in the anthropology department at the undergraduate and the post graduate level or conduct research in the research settings. Anthropological Survey of India conducts fellowship programmes for carry out research for the young and promising scholars.
career-opportunities.corporate_and_business_organizations: Anthropologists are in demand in the business settings paying heed to their research skills which are useful in analyzing consumer preference patterns in order to find out ways to improve the products and services that better meets the needs of the consumers.
career-opportunities.government_organizations: State and local governmental organizations use anthropologists in planning and research. Forensic anthropologists may work with police departments to help identify mysterious or unknown remains or also work in university and museum settings. Possible career paths include: cultural resource management, forensic and physical anthropology, natural resource management, and defence and security sectors.
career-opportunities.nongovernmental_organizations: Non-governmental organizations, employ anthropologists to help design and implement a wide variety of programs. Many anthropologists work in local, community-based settings for non-profit agencies and also work for established organizations in a community like the YMCA, local schools, or environmental organizations.

path 1.stream: Class XII with any Stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue Bachelor’s Degree in History/Anthropology and/or related fields such as Sociology/ Psychology , etc.
path 1.after graduation: Pursue Master’s Degree in Anthropology in India or Abroad

path 2.stream: Class XII with Humanities Stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.A(H) Anthropology for 3 years
path 2.after graduation: Pursue M.A Anthropology for 2 years in India or Abroad

path 3.stream: Class XII with Science Stream
path 3.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. Anthropology for 3 years
path 3.after graduation: Pursue M.Sc Anthropology for 2 years in India or Abroad

work description: Plan and direct research to characterize and compare the economic, demographic, health care, social, political, linguistic, and religious institutions of distinct cultural groups, communities, and organizations
Formulate general rules that describe and predict the development and behaviour of cultures and social institutions
Explain origins and physical, social, or cultural development of human beings including their physical attributes,traditions, beliefs and settlement patterns
Develop intervention procedures, using techniques such as individual and focus on group interviews, consultations, and participant observation of social interaction
Collaborate with economic development planners to decide on the implementation of proposed development policies
Build geographic information systems (GIS) to record, analyze, and cartographically represent the distribution of languages, cultural and natural resources

pros: Opportunity to contribute to Culture and History
Opportunity to work with organizations such as UNICEF, UNESCO, etc.
Interesting subject to study
cons: Tedious work and long working hours
Requires a lot of patience and need to stay away from home for long periods
Limited Institutions in India offer jobs

archeology-as-a-career-in-india.title: Archaeology
archeology-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Archaeology is the scientific and orderly study of human cultures through the recovery, analysis and documentation of material remains and environmental data, like artifacts, seals, inscriptions, monuments, edifices, landscapes and bio-facts. Most of archaeologists in India work in the Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) in its exploration, excavation, epigraphy, pre-history and museum branches (for these jobs, the ASI diploma is a must) for the conservation and maintenance of the 3,600 centrally protected sites and monuments, chemical preservation of antiquarian remains and the organization and maintenance of site museum, and publications among other things.

career-opportunities.numismatists: Numismatics is the study of currency, i.e. coins, banknotes, or money as an exchange object in some other form like beads, tokens, and related objects. It also has numerous specialization like Exonumia (Study of Coin), Notaphily (Study of paper money) and Scripophily (study of stocks or bond).
career-opportunities.epigraphists: Epigraphy is the study of inscriptions or epigraphs as writing involving identifying graphemes, clarifying their meanings, classifying their uses according to dates and cultural contexts, and drawing conclusions about the writing and the writers. Thus, it has an artistic value of literary composition which aims to understand the purpose, style, political, religious and cultural traditions of the symbols of the inscriptions.
career-opportunities.archivist: Archivists acquire, manage and maintain documents and other materials that have historical importance for individuals, organizations and nations. They work with paper documents, photographs, maps, films, and computer record projects describing or preserving a body of records.
career-opportunities.museologist: Museology, or museum studies the art of studying museums, museum curation, and how museums developed into their institutional role in education in the context of social and political forces. Museologist also maintain the record of each item - the origin, age and conservation details.
career-opportunities.heritage_and_environment_management: Heritage management is a growing field that is concerned with the identification, protection, and stewardship of cultural heritage in the public interest whereas the environment management is concerned about the protection of natural resources and historic buildings.
career-opportunities.ethno_archaeology: Application of modern day ethnological or anthropological data on past societies to gain an insight into them.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII with any stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.A. / B.Sc. in any field or Archaeology for 3 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue Post-Graduate Diploma in Archaeology and Museology for 1-2 years

work description: Examine sites using a variety of methods, including field walking, geophysical surveys and aerial photography
Work on field excavations or digs, usually as part of a team, using a range of digging equipment
Project manage an excavation, including managing teams of diggers
Record sites using drawings, detailed notes and photography
Analyze findings by grouping, identifying and classifying them
Use computer applications, such as computer-aided design (CAD) and geographical information systems (GIS) to record and interpret finds, sites and landscapes
Carry out research and desk-based assessments of sites
Provide advice on the conservation or records of archaeological remains
Ensure that important buildings, monuments and sites are protected and preserved
Generate publicity materials and publish articles about research, site interpretations or excavations

pros: Multiple opportunities to travel to different places
Opportunity to contribute to Culture and History
Increasing demand for archaeologists
cons: Tedious work and long working hours
Requires a lot of patience and need to stay away from home for long periods
Limited Institutions in India offer jobs

architecture-as-a-career-in-india.title: Architecture
architecture-as-a-career-in-india.summary: An Architect designs new buildings, makes changes to existing buildings and advises on conservation and restoration of old buildings. These buildings can be commercial, such as office buildings, factories, and restaurants, as well as residential, such as apartment complexes. They work very closely with end users and clients to customize the designs to their needs and specifications. They make sure that these potential designs are safe, economical, functional and aesthetically pleasing. They often employ the use of Computer-Aided Design (CAD) software to diagram their designs and ensure their feasibility. They usually work on a project from start to finish and with lot of engineers and designers to ensure maximum customer satisfaction.

career-opportunities.architect: Architects work on planning, designing and oversight of construction of buildings. They can work either independently or for some architecture company or real estate developing firm.
career-opportunities.architecture_designer: Architecture Designers are involved in the design of houses and other small buildings. They design various structures such as buildings, light-frame buildings including family homes, agricultural buildings, etc. They also design decorative facades for malls and buildings of various sizes.
career-opportunities.architectural_engineer: Architectural Engineers have the dual qualifications of an architect and a civil engineer. They coalesce the principles of engineering with those of design to plan, design and construct highly efficient buildings.
career-opportunities.interior_designer: Interior Designers create a balance between style and functionality to design comfortable and visually appealing living spaces for clients. They work independently or with firms to offer services in serene interiors, home interior, bedroom interior, bathroom interior, kitchen, furniture designing, luxury interiors etc.
career-opportunities.landscape_architect: Landscape architects are concerned with the careful planning and design of public outdoor spaces such as parks and patios to ensure their beauty and practicality. An additional and increasingly important concern for landscape architects is to make their designs environment-friendly.
career-opportunities.naval_architect: Naval Architects engage themselves in the design and construction of naval or water vessels for the government as well as private companies. They work at boatyards, shipyards, and ship design offices to design watercraft such as merchant ships, submarines, cruise liners, aircraft carriers, warships etc.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Maths
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.Arch for 5 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M.Arch for 2 Years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Maths
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.Arch for 5 years
path 2.after graduation: Pursue MURP for 2 years

architecture-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: For Most colleges have eligibility performance criteria of minimum 50% aggregate marks in Class XII.For B. Tech degree in Architecture, most colleges require a minimum score of 60% and for M. Tech and Ph.D. programs the eligibility criteria is 60% in B.Tech and M.Tech respectively. Besides that some colleges/ universities also have an age limit. For admissions into IITs, NITs and SPAs, the candidate is required to clear 10+2 with Physics/Chemistry/Mathematics. However, for other institutions, candidates from all streams are eligible if they have Mathematics as a subject

work description: Discussing about the aims, needs and financial plan of a project
Formulating, designing and presenting possible plans & drawings to the client;
Recommending to the client the functionality of their plans;
Working within the given budget and time limit
Bargaining with multiple service providers and contractors
Managing the project and ensuring timely and proper functioning of service providers
Supervise projects from its starting stage to its completion stage
Frequent site visits to know about the development of the projects
Solving complications and matters that surface during construction stage
Ensuring that the ecological balance of the project is achieved

pros: Architecture is a very rewarding and satisfying career for those who are driven by the need for creativity in their field of work.
Architects work in environments that are continually changing, where they are faced by diverse challenges everyday. Thus, the likelihood of boredom is very low.
It is a highly respectable career that will make you feel good about yourself.
Architects make a difference to our surroundings, ensuring that our living environment is safe, practical and aesthetically pleasing.
cons: Architects are required to undergo lengthy and extensive training.
Salary compensations received by architects are average, and a bit on the low side compared to other professions that require similar amount of training and specialization.
Architects are expected to carry the project through to the deadline, which can often mean working overtime and at odd hours.
It is subject to changes in the economy and the real estate market, and is thus volatile.

artificial-intelligence-and-machine-lear.title: Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
artificial-intelligence-and-machine-lear.summary: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is a branch of computer science that creates intelligent machines capable of thinking, behaving and even making decisions like humans do. The essence of Artificial Intelligence is that it can simulate thought and action based on its own algorithms - it does not need to be programmed to deal with a situation, but manages to do so on its own. Machine Learning is a subfield of artificial intelligence, which enables machines to learn from past data or experiences without being explicitly programmed. It enables computer systems to make predictions using historical data. It uses a massive amount of structured and semi-structured data so that a machine learning model can generate accurate results or give predictions based on that data.

career-opportunities.big_data_engineer: Big Data Engineer creates an ecosystem for the business systems to interact efficiently. Their primary task is to build and effectively manage voluminous data of an organization. They also have to carry out the function of obtaining outcomes from business data in a robust manner. Programming languages like Python, R and Java are essential in building career in AI as a Big Data Engineer.
career-opportunities.business_intelligence_developer: Business Intelligence Developer has the primary responsibility of analyzing business data along with AI algorithms and models. They recognize different business trends by assessing complicated data sets. They help in swelling the profits of a company by preparing, analyzing and interpreting business intelligence solutions.
career-opportunities.data_scientist: Data scientist assisst in gathering relevant data from multiple sources for the pupose of assesing it to gain constructive inferences. The inferences gained are influential in tackling various issues concerned with the busines. Depending upon different data patterns, past and present information, data scientists make various predictions.
career-opportunities.machine_learning_engineers: Machine learning engineers are involved in building and maintaining automated solutions that facilitates machine learning initiatives. They work with huge chunks of data and possess extraordinary data management traits.
career-opportunities.research_scientist: Research scientists undertake efforts in performing extensive research dealing with aplications of machine learning and artificial intelligence. A research scientist is one who gained expertise in the field of applied mathematics, statistics, deep learning, and machine learning.
career-opportunities.ai_data_analyst: AI data analyst performs data mining, data cleaning, and data interpretation. By cleaning data, requisite data is made suitable for data interpretation. Any sort of redundant data is discarded by them so that it does not hamper the data interpretation process.
career-opportunities.product_manager: In the field of AI, the duty of a product manager is to resolve challenging problems by strategically evaluating data. He must possess the skill of identifying relevant problems that obstructs the business proceedings. The next step is to get hold of related data sets to facilitate data interpretation. After data interpretation,the product manager is required to estimate business impacts from the outcomes of data interpretation.
career-opportunities.ai_engineer: Artificial intelligence engineers are individuals who use AI and machine learning techniques to develop applications and systems that can help organizations increase efficiency, cut costs, increase profits, and make better business decisions. AI engineers are problem solvers who develop, test and apply different models of Artificial Intelligence. They effectively handle AI infrastructure. They make use of machine learning algorithms and understanding of neural networks to develop useful AI models.
career-opportunities.robotics_scientist: Roboticists are generally involved in the design, programmimg, construction, and testing of robots (automated software). They can work on any stage of development, from creating software to building hardware and troubleshooting the finished product.

path 1.stream: Class XII in Science stream with PCM along with any other subject
path 1.graduation: B.Tech in Computer science / Software/ Information Technology/ Data science/Electrical and Electronics/Robotics /Artificial Intelligence/ AI&ML and more
path 1.after graduation: M.Tech in Computer science / Software/ Information Technology/ Data science/Artificial Intelligence/ AI&ML and more

path 3.after graduation: M.Sc in Maths/Statistics/Operational Research/ Computational Maths

pros: -They are fast growing fields, so these engineers are in demand.-The job is mentally stimulating and rewarding-It allows engineers to work and build real world products, right from autonomous cars to security drones.
cons: -Data handling and processing appropriate data quality is challenging-Training models, handling data, as well as making and testing prototypes on a daily basis can lead to mental exhaustion.-The role demands working in a continuously evolving field that require continual learning

astrology-as-a-career-in-india.title: Astrology
astrology-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Astrology is a science that has been practiced from ancient times. It is based on Sanskrit. Astrology as a discipline studies the movement of planetary bodies’ positions in the universe and make predictions about future events according to that. Astrologers believe that the positions of planetary bodies such as moon, sun, venus, mercury, mars, jupitar, saturn and so on have great influences on our lives. An Astrologer who has an understanding of astronomy, gives him/her an edge on developing a good foundation of astrological knowledge. As an Astrologer, you need to be empathic and keep compassion towards your clients, as they may be vulnerable and sensitive regarding their future events such as marriage, job, health etc. As an Astrologer, you should be able to communicate well and translate lunar terms into layman’s language so that your clients can easily understand them.

path 1.stream: Pursue XII with any Stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue Graduation in Sanskrit for 3 years.
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M.A in Sanskrit with specialization in Jyotish for 2 years

path 2.stream: Pursue XII with any Stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue Graduation in Astrology for 3 years.
path 2.after graduation: Pursue M.A./M.Sc. in Astrology for 2 years.

path 3.stream: Pursue XII with any Stream
path 3.graduation: Pursue Graduation in any discipline for 3 years. (Meanwhile, Pursue Diploma courses in Astrology for 6 months to 1 year)
path 3.after graduation: Pursue M.A./M.Sc. in any discipline for 2 years. (Meanwhile, Pursue Diploma courses in Astrology for 6 months to 1 year)

astrology-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: Must have passed class 12th or Senior Secondary Examination with at least 50% marks.Every college conducts their respective entrance Examination/Admission test or Interview.

3.name: Janardan Rai Nagar Rajasthan Vidyapeeth University

9.name: Shri Lal Bahadur Shastri Rashtriya Sanskrit Vidyapeeth

work description: Preparing and analyzing horoscopes to advise clients regarding future trends and events.
Interpret astrological movement in the correct manner, and explain sufficiently to the client as to how this relates to their personal circumstance.
Translate lunar terms into layman’s language so clients can easily understand them.
Know how to take and schedule appointments for clients.
Maintaining the database for every client’s name, address, and telephone number for record.
Ensure confidentiality and develop trust in relationships with clients.
Sometimes the client’s needs are out of the range of expertise. Thus, you should know how to refuse work that you are not prepared for.

Devising a rapid and reliable way to have the materials that you need, including the client’s chart, ephemeris, graphic ephemeris, dials or whatever you use (either from your own computer and/or a chart service) up and ready, neat and organized, for efficient operation.

pros: Astrologers get a chance to positively impact one’s lives and make a significant difference.
There are regular changes involved, as astrologers you get to meet and help different clients every week.
There are opportunities available for self-employment, as astrologers you have the option of opening up your own setup after a few years of experience.
cons: The work can be emotionally draining.
Initial salary is not very high.
At times, it may become difficult for you to invest time in learning a new software system procedure.

audiology-as-a-career-in-india.title: Audiologist
audiology-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Audiology is the science of hearing, balance and related disorders. Audiologists use advanced technology and procedures to diagnose and treat a patient's hearing and balance problems. Clinical audiologists work in a variety of settings.

career-opportunities.private_practice: The audiologists can open their own practice. They develop consulting arrangements with local hospitals and family physicians. These doctors provide referrals to the audiologists for patients who may need their services.
career-opportunities.working_for_a_medical_device_company: There are a broad range of audiologist jobs available in medical devices companies. Hearing aid, hearing implants, hearing protection, and listening devices are all very popular. An audiologist on staff at a development company can work with the product designers to create a better product and meet users' needs.
career-opportunities.research: Audiologist can work in the area of research. They conduct research in topics e.g. hearing loss and related issues is a huge area of exploration. They get grant from the government agencies, hearing societies and other groups to expand the field of knowledge in this area. Many audiologists who want to explore this career option become university professors. These positions require teaching of university courses, but provides opportunities for extensive research.
career-opportunities.teaching: Audiologists can become instructors at local community or career colleges etc. where they teach to technicians and technologists. They work as a instructor in hearing loss prevention courses for construction workers, mining operations and other industries where hearing protection is required. Learning the most effective way to teach adults can be a huge help when making this career transition.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII with Science stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue Bachelor of Audiology and Speech Language Pathology) for 4 years (3 years study + 1year internship)
path 1.after graduation: Pursue MASLP in Master of Audiology and Speech Language Pathology) for 2 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII with Science stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. in (Audiology) for 3 years
path 2.after graduation: Pursue M.Sc. in (Audiology) for 2 years

path 3.stream: Clear Class XII with Science stream
path 3.graduation: Pursue Diploma in (Audiology and Speech Rehabilitation) for 1-2 years, Pursue B.Sc. in (Audiology and Speech Rehabilitation) for 3 years/PG Diploma in Audiology and Speech Rehabilitation
path 3.after graduation: Pursue M.Sc. in (Audiology and Speech Rehabilitation) for 2 years

audiology-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: Most college have eligibility criteria of minimum 50% aggregate marks in Class XII / and some of minimum 60%.Must have passed class 12th or senior secondary examination with at least 50% marks including English. Some colleges/ universities also have an age limit (17 at 31st December of the year of admission).

work description: Provide treatment to the patients suffering from ear related diseases
Check for issues of hearing, balance and tinnitus problems
Prescribe appropriate medication and treatment such as wax cleaning, hearing aids, cochlear implantation, etc.
Help the clients in coping up with profound hearing loss through lip reading and sign language
Be aware of the techniques and working of different hearing aids/machines
Keep a regular check on the patients and their conditions
Manage records of the patients in accordance with their progress
Remain updated with new research work and discoveries
Perform duties in line with the ethical standards

pros: You will get the opportunity to help people in need, which provides satisfaction.
The demand for the field is on rise.
cons: The work of an audiologist can be very frustrating.
The audiologists are required to work for long hours.

ayurveda-as-a-career-in-india.title: Ayurveda
ayurveda-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Ayurveda is reffered as the "science of life" in the ancient Sanskrit and has been a key part of a comprehensive natural health care system in India as well as Sri Lanka for over 2000 years. An Ayurvedic practitioner uses holistic techniques from India to help patients. The natural therapies are tailored to the needs of each individual to eliminate impurities, reduce stress and fight disease .The Treatment range from diet and lifestyle advice, massages, yoga and meditation to herbal supplements, counseling, or specialized therapies. Ayurvedic practitioners assess diet habits, lifestyle, and mental states of the patient.

career-opportunities.ayurvedic_doctor: One can start his/her own clinic and pratice individually or can work with a hospital.
career-opportunities.retail_shops: They can tie up with pharmaceutical companies engaged in Ayurvedic preparations and open his/her own retail shop of Ayurveda medicines.
career-opportunities.researcher: Pharmaceutical companies hire Ayurveda graduates to work as clinical researchers to supervise/monitor drug research.
career-opportunities.ayurvedic_pharmacist: They can work as a Ayurvedic Pharmacist in government Ayurveda hospitals,pharmaceutical companies,private Ayurvedic colleges
career-opportunities.durg_manufacturing: In the manufacturing sector production of Ayurvedic medicines is a good business. Apart from actual manufacturing, other options such as cultivation of medicinal plants, trading raw materials in the form of powder, extracts, oils, etc.
career-opportunities.ayurvedic_lecturer: They can work in a college as a lecturer.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in Science with Biology stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.A.M.S for 5.5 years (4 and a Half Years of study + 1 Year Internship).
path 1.after graduation: Post Graduation Program (2-3 years)

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII in Science with Biology stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.A.M.S (4 and a Half Years of study + 1 Year Internship).
path 2.after graduation: Diploma/PG Diploma in Ayurveda 1-2 years

work description: Use a combination of modern and ancient techniques to restore the balance between the mind, body and the spirit
Focus on the physical and also on the mental aspect of illness
Use natural remedies to cure disease and illness
Have thorough knowledge on benefits and detriments of different natural products
Remain up to-date with contemporary research on healing qualities of natural products
Communicate with clients with empathy and care
Organise knowledge, accounts and case histories in a proper manner
Perform duties in line with the ethical standards

pros: Being able to help others: Ayurvedic doctors provide a meaningful service using medical science to help others. Many individuals are drawn to the profession because they want to help others.Ayurvedic mediciences are safe to consume with less side effects. By helping others the individual gets the feeling that their knowledge or actions has helped someone specially in the case where allopathy failed to help. It is an old science and is gaining popularity slowly.
Job security: This is one of the few professions which would always be in demand and is not affected by the recession. The society will always need doctors.
Money and security: Doctors have a relatively high salary and income. Their demand is on increasing rate.
Prestige: They generally gain community respect.
cons: Long training route: To practice as a doctor it requires at least four years of college with internship and 2-3 years of masters in the specialized area. It makes the whole process too long before the person actually starts to practice.
High college fees: The fees of medical colleges is generally very high.
Long work hours, high stress and patience: The job is very demanding. It requires physical, mental and emotional involvement and drains his/her energy.
Longer period to establish: As Ayurveda is a new area and is growly slowly, the market is increasing at a slow rate. You will require patience and expertise to be successful in the area.
Knowledge about Sanskrit: The course structure includes Sanskrit and if your class 12th subjects does not include Sanskrit, then you will have hard time in coping up.

banking-as-a-career-in-india.title: Banking
banking-as-a-career-in-india.summary: A career in banking services is one of the most lucrative and stable prospects for individuals who are enthusiastic about the field of commerce and finance. One needs to be good with numbers and should enjoy managing finances. Banking and allied services are the cornerstones of the modern economic structures. With multiple private and public sector banks mushrooming in the country, there is huge demand of talented professionals in this domain. Job opportunities in the domain exist straight after graduation and with specialized degrees one can take on more high paying jobs in this sector.

career-opportunities.publicprivate_sector_banks: To work in a private or a public sector banks one should first clear Bank PO exams for the entry level jobs. For higher level jobs such as that of a manager usually requires a higher degree such as that of a Chartered Account. Banking jobs offer stable and fairly remunerative jobs to individuals with good mathematical and management skills.
career-opportunities.investment_bankingmerchant_banking: An Investment banker is someone who is a specialized professional trained in fund management. He/she is also trained in risk assessment of securities, bonds and other tradable products. A strong interest in numbers and reading patterns is a must to be successful as an investment banker. A qualified professional can either work individually or can work in an investment bank such as JP Morgan and others. It is one of the most remunerative career options in recent times.
career-opportunities.credit_analyst: A credit analyst is a trained professional who analyses, risk in various financial products such as securities, bonds, loans, etc. These professionals not only have the knowledge to predict markets but bigger national economies as well. A good trained individual can work with banks or brokerage firms. Usually a degree in finance and a higher degree in actuarial science is sufficient to enter the profession.

path 1.stream: Commerce
path 1.graduation: B.Com/B.Eco
path 1.after graduation: Certification in Investment Banking

path 2.stream: Commerce
path 2.graduation: B.Com/B.Eco

path 4.graduation: BA/B.Com

banking-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: For Bank PO exams any graduate degree makes one eligible to take the exam. But for other courses, commerce with math in 12th standard is a must.Although Bank PO exams do not have a requirement for math but one should have high proficiency in manipulating numbers and understanding patterns to be successful in banking related services.

Analyze applicants financial status, credit, and property evaluations to determine feasibility of granting loans
Obtain and compile copies of loan applicants' credit histories, corporate financial statements, and other financial information
Meet applicants to obtain information for loan applications and to answer questions on the process
Explain to customers the different types of loans and credit options that are available, as well as the terms of those services
Review loan agreements to ensure that they are complete and accurate according to policy
Help customers manage their funds; answer quaries regarding the bank's products and services; troubleshoot problems related to customers, finances and management

pros: Safe and Secure Job
Rewarding in terms of Money and perks
Good work-life balance
cons: Work pressure can be high
Monotonous and low on creativity job
Needs a person to be very alert and accurate

bba-as-a-career-in-india.title: BBA
bba-as-a-career-in-india.summary: A Bachelor of Business Administration (BBA) is a 3-4 year undergraduate degree or a 5 year Integrated BBA+MBA program that gets you in a variety of positions in many companies. Your job profile would include back- hand work, certain support services to your seniors and maintaining communication with management. If you are good with your work, you could do some customer interface and manage specific departments. BBA graduates can look for jobs in sales, marketing, operations and event department, etc of companies as members and management trainees.

career-opportunities.finance_sector: BBA Graduates can take up role of a financial analyst and help provide guidance regarding investment decisions to individuals. There are various private and public-sector banks such as ICICI, HSBC, YES Bank, Axis Bank, SBI and companies such as Deloitte & KPMG offer various roles in finance sector.
career-opportunities.sales__marketing: Sales and marketing field provides huge opportunity to BBA graduates. A majority of BBA graduates get absorbed by companies as a management trainee, marketing executives, business development executives in leading organization such as FMCG, Retail, Pharma sector etc.
career-opportunities.consulting_services: BBA graduates get hired in leading consulting firms such as IBM, Accenture, Deloitte etc. Consulting firms provide access to individuals with subject matter expert who can help them take right decisions. Being part of Consulting firms allows one to gain experience across diverse set of industries.
career-opportunities.human_resources: The first point of contact in any organization is the Human resource department. Students who have interest in hiring activities, placements, performance evaluation, and appraisals can opt for a career in human resources.
career-opportunities.supply_chain: Supply chain managers inspect the materials, information and finances as they move from supplier to the manufacturer to whole seller to retail to consumer. Students with interest in supply chain management can work in the supply chain department of FMCG, Automotive & Retail Companies amongst others.
career-opportunities.start_ups: With a large number of startup ventures emerging, BBA graduates can take up management roles in these organizations. Typical roles include Growth Hackers, Marketing Specialist, Product Managers etc.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in any Stream with Math as a compulsory subject
path 1.graduation: Pursue BBA(H)/B.Com(H)/B.Sc Economics/B.Sc Finance for 3-4years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue MBA in Finance/Business Analytics/International Business/Operations Management/any specialization for 2 years Or Work for 1.5-2years.

path 3.graduation: Pursue B.Com/BBA/BMS/BBE/BBA Banking & Insurance/BFM for 3-4 years.
