BBA provides base for high value post-graduation course, MBA and help you gain Managerial skills which is required in every field.
cons: Highly Competitive field
Has to be traditionally followed by an MBA

bio-informatics-as-a-career-in-india.title: Bioinformatics
bio-informatics-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Bioinformatics, also referred to as computational biology, is a modern field that combines computer science, statistics, mathematics and engineering with biology. Professionals work on developing tools, techniques and IT systems for analysing and interpreting complex biological data, such as that obtained from biomedical studies. It makes central and globally accessible databases available to scientists, for use in research studies, to analyze data, make comparisons and develop models.

career-opportunities.bioinformatics_analyst: Bioinformatics analyst carry out research studies in laboratories to develop informatics algorithms and bioinformatics databases which facilitate the understanding and awareness of various diseases and other health conditions.
career-opportunities.medical_coding: Medical coders are involved in the coding of healthcare claims made by patients to obtain claims from insurance companies and government healthcare programs.
career-opportunities.pharmaceutical_companies: Bioinformatics researchers and professionals are actively hired by pharmaceutical companies, in research roles and in other departments.
career-opportunities.research: Research is a prime avenue for bioinformatics professionals. Research positions are available at various government agencies, private laboratories, and other organizations.
career-opportunities.scientific_writer: Journalists and writers with a science background also play a major role in informing the general public about relevant and emerging biological issues. Bioinformatics are often employed by high-profile journals as well as online magazines and science blogs or print/media networks.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.Sc.(Hons) in Bioinformatics or B.Sc. (Hons) Biological Sciences or B. Sc. in Life Sciences for 3 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M.Sc. Bioinformatics or M.Sc Bio-sciences for 2 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.Sc.(Hons) in Bioinformatics or B.Sc. (Hons) Biological Sciences or B. Sc. in Life Sciences for 3 years
path 2.after graduation: Pursue PG Diploma in Bioinformatics for 1 year.

bio-informatics-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: Some colleges/University have admissions in B.Sc.(Hons) in Bioinformatics following their own entrance test or consider direct admission on the basis of previous degree marks.

11.name: Institute of Bioinformatics and Applied Biotechnology (IBAB)

13.name: Dr. D. Y. Patil Biotechnology & Bioinformatics Institute

work description: Examining huge molecular datasets for research purposes
Presenting and publishing research results and reports
Creating and developing innovative software applications or modifying existing applications to meet particular need
Developing innovative computational methods and analytical tools according to the need of research
Supervising and managing technicians and other bioinformatics staff
Creating concise statistics of information concerning human genomes
Consulting and coordinating with related departments for product innovation and advancement

pros: The work can be mentally stimulating for those who like to deal with logic, and like to solve problems mentally.
Professionals get the opportunity to work on, and lead advanced research projects.
The field is rapidly growing, and there are a number of research opportunities, both in India and overseas.
Competent and trained professionals have the possibility to earn well.
cons: The educational path for the career is long, as a Ph.D. is generally preferred.
It can be hard to get into the career, as it requires extensive knowledge, skill and traning.
The work can involve long working hours.
It involves spending most of the time indoors, in the laboratory.

bio-physics-as-a-career-in-india.title: Biophysics
bio-physics-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Biophysicists study biological processes through the lens of physics. It is a growing enterprise worldwide, driven primarily by the widespread realization of the major contributions made by biological sciences. Biophysicists study organisms at the cellular and molecular level using the methods and approaches of Physics. The field encompasses the study of a wide range of upcoming academic areas including molecular and cell biology, atomic and molecular physics, organic and physical chemistry, etc.

career-opportunities.clinical_biophysicist: Clinical Biophysics has a number of medical applications. It plays a major role in plastic surgeries, neurology, oncology, orthopedics, etc.
career-opportunities.nuclear_medicine_physicist: Nuclear Medicine Physicists study topics such as the interactions between matter and ionizing radiation, radiation dosimetry, nuclear imaging instrumentation and. They are also experts in computer science and image processing.
career-opportunities.research: Research is a prime avenue for biophysicists. Many biophysicists spend majority of their workday in laboratory settings, conducting research, analyzing and documenting results. They often work with hazardous inorganic chemicals and organic materials.
career-opportunities.education: Biophysicists can work as full-time or guest lecturers at universities and colleges. There are also opportunities for training workshops and educational programs.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. Biophysics or B.Sc. (Hons) Physics or B.Sc. (Hons) Biological Sciences for 3 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M.Sc. Biophysics for 2 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. (Hons) Biophysics or B.Sc. (Hons) Physics or B.Sc. (Hons) Biological Sciences for 3 years
path 2.after graduation: Pursue PG Diploma in Biophysics/Biological Sciences for 1 year

bio-physics-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: Some colleges/University have admissions in B.Sc. (Hons) in Biophysics/Physics/ Biological Sciences following their own entrance test or considers the marks in the qualifying exam.

12.name: All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS)

16.name: National Institute of Mental Health and Neuro Sciences (NIMHANS)

work description: Examining the physical and chemical properties of living organisms
Conducting research and experiments on living organism
Examining the effects of substances like food, drugs, etc., on tissues and living things
Examining the genetic changes in organisms that lead to diseases
Investigating into the evolution of flora and fauna to examine how the genetic characteristics are carried on by following generations
Developing experiments to detect syndromes, genetic disorders and other diseases
Presenting and publishing reports and papers on the basis of experiments and observations
Developing crops that resist water deficiency, insects and other diseases
Developing techniques to guard environment and clean up contamination

pros: Professionals get the opportunities to work on, and lead advanced research projects.
The field is rapidly growing, and there are a number of avenues in research roles, both in India and overseas.
There are opportunities to work across allied fields, such as biochemistry, microbiology, biomedical science, etc.
cons: The educational path for the career is long, as a Ph.D. is generally preferred.
It involves spending most of the time indoors, in the laboratory.
It can be hard to get into the career, as it requires extensive knowledge, skill and traning.

biochemistry-as-a-career-in-india.title: Biochemistry
biochemistry-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Biochemistry, alternatively referred to as Biological Chemistry, brings together the disciplines of Biology and Chemistry. It is the study of chemical processes of living organisms. Biochemistry tries to understand biological organisms through the study of biological molecules, and the chemical processes that occur within living cells. Using this knowledge, biochemists attempt to understand and solve biological problems. They thus make important contributions to the scientific and medical advancements in a number of areas, including health, environment and agriculture.

career-opportunities.pharmaceutical_sales_representative: Pharmaceutical sales representatives utilize their knowledge of medical treatments and drugs to represent the sales for pharmaceutical companies. They are responsible for coordinating meetings with medical staff and doctors at hospitals and clinics to persuade them to prescribe their company's drugs to the patients.
career-opportunities.biomedical_scientist: Biomedical Scientists conduct research in laboratory settings for the advancement of treatments and pharmaceutical drugs. They carry out a wide range of tests and experiments on tissue samples and fluids, for the diagnosis of diseases, and development of treatments.
career-opportunities.clinical_laboratory_technologist: Clinical laboratory technologists with a background in biochemistry, conduct experiments on various microorganisms such bacteria and viruses.?They are employed by different health agencies, pharmaceuticals and health care centers.
career-opportunities.research: Research is a primary avenue for biochemists. They can be employed as research assistants in various government and private laboratories, pharmaceuticals, hospitals and health-care facilities.
career-opportunities.consultant: Biochemists often provide expert advice and review to government and private organizations. Biochemical consultants are also actively employed by various law firms and legal departments, for consulting on forensic and medical matters.
career-opportunities.teaching: Biochemists can work as full-time or guest lecturers at universities and colleges. They may also teach in schools to higher secondary class students.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. (Hons) Biochemistry or B.Sc. (Hons) Biological Sciences or B.Sc. Life Sciences or B.Sc (Hons) Chemistry for 3 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M.Sc Biochemistry for 2 years

biochemistry-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: Some colleges/University have admissions in B.Sc.(Hons)/B.Tech in Biochemistry following their own entrance test or considers the marks in the qualifying exam.
work description: Conduct the chemical analysis for body fluids like blood, urine or spinal fluid, to discover the presence of any normal or abnormal components
Execute and manage with the polymerase chain reaction
Execute and perform the programme for the DNA and the protein analysis,
Work with gene cloning and the micro-organisms genetic manipulation
Purify and characterize the recombinant proteins, from the eukaryotic and the prokaryotic systems
Evaluate the lab findings and examine the accuracy of the results
Manage the liquid handling robotics and handle the software for the sequence analysis
Train and supervise laboratory assistants and other technologists

pros: Professionals get the opportunities to work on, and lead advanced research projects.
The field is rapidly growing, and there are a number of research opportunities, both in India and overseas.
Jobs are available in various industries, such as pharmaceuticals, manufacturing, health-care, etc.
cons: The educational path for the career is long, as a Ph.D is generally preferred.
It involves spending most of the time indoors, in the laboratory.
It can be hard to get into the career, as it requires extensive knowledge, skill and traning.
The work may expose individuals to harmful and toxic substances.

botany-as-a-career-in-india.title: Botany
botany-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Botany, also referred to as Plant Biology, involves the study of plants, including their growth, structure, differentiation, evolution and development etc. Botanists study the interactions of plants and the environment, their life processes, observe their growth in different conditions, conduct experiments to see how they convert chemical compounds to complex chemicals, and their genetic properties that control their development. For this end, botanists employ specialized equipment to conduct their researches and prepare reports on their findings.

career-opportunities.business_and_industries: Individuals with a degree in Botany are hired by pharmaceuticals, nurseries, horticulturists, and different industries such as food, fermentation, chemical, oil etc.
career-opportunities.landscape_industries: Many Botanists are hired in the landscape industry and find work in the development of parks, botanical gardens, biodiversity parks, aesthetic gardens, etc. Jobs in this area are widely available in the public sector.
career-opportunities.natural_resource_centre: Botanists are actively employed in different natural resource centers, in both the public and private sectors. The position of a Forest Resource Manager is one of the most common and popular ones in this area.
career-opportunities.environmental_consultancy: Botanists can find work with environmental consultancies as biodiversity assessors, restoration experts, environment conversationalists, etc. Such consultancies are present both in the private as well as the public sector.
career-opportunities.research: Research is one the major duties of a botanist. Botanists with various specializations can work in their research area of interest with various government and private organizations, as well as educational institutes.
career-opportunities.education: Educational institutes are one of the leading employers of Botany graduates. Botanists can find jobs in schools, colleges and other educational institutions as a teacher/lecturer.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Biology
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. (Hons) Botany or B.Sc. (Hons) Biological Sciences or B.Sc. (Hons) Life Sciences or B.Sc. (Hons) Environmental Sciences for 3 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M. Sc. Botany or M.Sc. in Life Sciences for 2 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII in Science Stream with Biology
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. (Hons) Botany or B.Sc. (Hons) Biological Sciences or B.Sc. (Hons) Life Sciences or B.Sc. (Hons) Environmental Sciences for 3 years
path 2.after graduation: Pursue Diploma/PG Diploma in Botany/Life Sciences for 1-2 years

botany-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: Some colleges/university have admissions in B.Sc. (Hons) in Botany following their own entrance test or consider the marks in the qualifying exam.

16.name: Faculty of Science, Banaras Hindu University

work description: Recognizing, categorizing, recording and monitoring of plant species and biodiversity
Ecological consultancy work, comprising of surveys and environmental impact assessments
Managing a botanical collection
Hunting for novel species
Evaluating the effects of contamination(pollution), or developments such as new buildings, on plant life
Identifying and refining chemicals produced by plants for usage in products such as drugs, food, fabrics, solvents, etc.
Presenting research results in journals, books and at academic conferences

pros: Professionals get a chance to work both in clean, indoor laboratory conditions as well as outside and in the greenhouse.
There are various career opportunities available in research and various private and public sectors.
cons: The path to a successful career in this field is long, and most research organizations require a qualification of Ph.D.
The nature of work can be difficult and involve long working hours.

cabin-crew-as-a-career-in-india.title: Cabin Crew
cabin-crew-as-a-career-in-india.summary: If you are one of those people who feel that a working within the boundaries of a single state is restricting, then working as a cabin crew might just be your calling. Travelling around the globe, experiencing different cultures week by week and at the same time making sure passengers have a great flight all thanks to you is one of the simplest ways to describe the life of a cabin crew member. Cabin crew involves trained individuals, working on flights who are responsible for making sure that the passengers on board travel with the utmost comfort and safety. In addition, the cabin crew is trained to handle situations in case of emergency. The cabin crew is required to perform various duties from starting to end of the flight, i.e pre flight briefing and when the flight is about to land. Pre-flight debriefing and duties involve checking all safety measures to be in working order, taking care of the special requirements of passengers if any, ensuring appropriate first aid and so on. Apart from this cabin crew has to make sure that refreshments and meals are on time, luggage is appropriately handled and passengers follow all instructions during the flight and also while they disembark. The Cabin crew is also required to fill out paper work and flight reports.

career-opportunities.cabin_crew_in_international_airlines: As a cabin crew working of an international airline, would be required to travel to foreign destinations and provide assistance to passengers on- board.
career-opportunities.cabin_crew_in_domestic_airlines: As a cabin crew member of a domestic airline, would be required to travel to various destinations within the country and provide assistance to passengers on- board.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in Any stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue Diploma in cabin crew for 6 months - 1 year

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII in Any stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue Bachelors in Hotel Management Catering & Technology (HMCT) for 3-4 years
path 2.after graduation: Pursue Diploma/Post Graduate Diploma in cabin crew/HMCT for 6 months

work description: Manage the inflight experience of passengers in commercial/ private airlines
Check passenger list and make note of passengers with special needs
Check the whole flight prior to the boarding of passengers for proper availability of supplies, machines and equipment
Be aware of the weather conditions and the possible variations that may occur during the flight
Check whether all the safety measures are in place
Warmly welcome the passengers on the flight and help them in boarding the flight
Help the passengers take their seats and settling their luggage
Make sure that all the things are in place before the take off
Demonstrate the various safety measures that are needed to be taken by the fliers
Serve food, refreshments and duty-free goods to guests during a flight
Make sure that the passengers land safely at their destination points

pros: Working as a cabin crew given you an opportunity to meet people and get to see new places.
It helps you in developing your over all personality
Few flights provide free travel every year for their exployess and their families and sometimes discounted travel.
cons: Tiredness and lack of sleep, due to long working hours.
Have to deal with passesngers with different temperament but still have to maintain a pleasing personality.

career-as-a-chartered-financial-analyst-.title: Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA)
career-as-a-chartered-financial-analyst-.summary: A Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) is a specialized professional who looks after financial decisions and investment policies of big companies. A Chartered Financial Analyst is a person trained in areas of management accounting, financial management and investment. Earning a CFA charter demonstrates mastery of a broad range of practical portfolio management and advanced investment analysis skills that will be a limelight for one's career. CFAsnis are in great demand in the finance sector, especially banks, financial institutions, insurance companies, and large corporations.

career-opportunities.portfolio_manager: A portfolio manager is one who assists an individual in investing in the best available investment plans for guaranteed returns in the future.
career-opportunities.research_analyst: The job of a research analysts is to study market conditions to examine potential sales of a product or service. They help companies understand what products people want, who will buy them, and at what price.
career-opportunities.financial_consultant_and_advisers: Financial advisers, research and consider all retail investment products or providers available to meet the client's needs.
career-opportunities.corporate_financial_analyst: Financial analysts are responsible for financial planning and analysis for companies and corporations. They forecast future revenues and expenditures to establish cost structures and determine capital budgeting for projects.

path 1.stream: Clear class XII in Commerce Stream (Recommended)
path 1.graduation: Pursue bachelor’s (or equivalent) degree in any field (Preferably Finance) for 3-4 years
path 1.after graduation: Take the CFA program of 4 years either after completing or during final year of bachelor’s degree.

career-as-a-chartered-financial-analyst-.Important Facts: Have a bachelor’s (or equivalent) degree,Be in the final year of a bachelor’s degree program, Have four years of professional work experience, or Have a combination of professional work and university experience that totals at least four years
work description: Make investment decisions based on business/ industry forecasts or economic conditions through analyzing financial information
Monitor developments in the fields of industrial technology, business, finance, and economic theory
Interpret data on price, yield, stability, future investment-risk trends, economic influences, and other factors affecting investment programmes
Track fundamental economic, industrial, and corporate developments by analyzing information from multiple channels
Recommend investments and investment timing to companies, investment firm staff, or the public
Determine the prices at which securities should be syndicated and offered to the public
Prepare plans of action for investment, using financial analyses
Evaluate and compare the relative quality of various securities in a given industry

pros: A wide range of knowledge offered by the syllabus
Enhances business finance vocabulary
High demand and respect for individuals
cons: Is a demanding field and time-consuming course
Is only an added certification, not a full-fledged career in itself
Requires patience to clear the exams

career-as-a-choreographer-in-india.title: Choreographer
career-as-a-choreographer-in-india.summary: A choreographer's work is to create and organize dance sequences in cinema, music videos, stage shows, TV shows, drama, theatre, as well as in private gatherings. They are professionals in dance who create not only dances, but themes too.

career-opportunities.film_tv: Choreographers work mostly in movies and TV serials.
career-opportunities.shows__events: Choreographers help in preparing dance performances for shows and events.
career-opportunities.dance_academy: A choreographer can open his/her own dance academy to share his/her knowledge of dance with others.
career-opportunities.dancer: A choreographer can work as a dancer himself/herself.
career-opportunities.dance_teachers: Choreographers can work as teachers and teach dance to students.

path 1.graduation: Pursue Bachelors In Arts And Dance/Any Discipline for 3 years

It is the best form of work out and thus keeps you fit.

career-as-a-counsellor-in-india.title: Counsellor
career-as-a-counsellor-in-india.summary: Counselors are individuals who help people resolve their personal and interpersonal issues. They help people explore their emotions about different incidents by talking it out with them in a confidential setting. Their aim is to empower their clients to face challenges, resolve issues and make positive changes to their life. To facilitate this process, counsellors are required to be patient, sensitive, non-judgmental and accepting of individual differences.

career-opportunities.school_counselor: School counselors are counselors who work with school students of different ages to help with matters related to their education, such as academic achievement, career selection, personal, social and career development, college readiness, etc.
career-opportunities.career_counselor: Career counselors help individuals with career choice and development, taking into consideration factors such as interest, personality, and aptitude. They generally focus on issues such as career exploration, career change, personal career development and other career-related issues.
career-opportunities.psychological_counselor: Psychological counselors are professionals who help people gain control of their feelings and emotions. These professionals focus on treating individuals with a variety of different emotional, behavioral, and social problems related to daily life and adjustment.
career-opportunities.marriage_and_family_counselor: Marriage and family counselors are licensed therapists who help people resolve and deal with issues related to family and married life. They work with couples and families to resolve issues that arise in a relationship, such as domestic violence, jealousy and infidelity, and those that affect families such as child misbehavior, parent-child relationship, temper outbursts etc.
career-opportunities.childadolescent_counselor: Child/Adolescent counselors provide support and counseling to childrean and adolescents with behavioral, emotional and social issues. They also deal with children with developmental disorders, anxiety, personality disorders, sleep or eating disorders, etc.
career-opportunities.forensic_counselor: Forensic Counselors deal with sensitive issues in relation to rape, child abuse, violence and other criminal activites. They also counsel criminals to make their behaviour normal and socially acceptable.
career-opportunities.substance_abuse_counselor: Subtance abuse counselors help people overcome their dependencies on substances such as alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs. Such professionals help people deal with the mental, social and emotional effects of subtances, and make systemic changes to overcome these habits.

path 1.stream: Clear 12th standard in Any Stream with/without Psychology
path 1.graduation: Pursue B. A.(H) Psychology/Applied Psychology or for 3 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue PG Diploma in Counseling and Guidance

path 2.stream: Clear 12th standard in Any Stream with/without Psychology
path 2.graduation: Pursue B. A.(H) Psychology/Applied Psychology or for 3 years
path 2.after graduation: Pursue Masters in Psychology/Applied Psychology/Counselling Psychology for 2 years

path 3.stream: Clear 12th standard in any stream with/without Psychology
path 3.graduation: Pursue B. A.(H) Psychology/Applied Psychology or for 3 years
path 3.after graduation: Pursue Masters in Psychology/Applied Psychology/Counselling Psychology for 2 years

work description: Establish a relationship of trust and respect with clients
Encourage clients to talk about issues they feel they cannot normally share with others
Actively listen to client concerns and empathize with their position
Accept without bias the issues raised by clients
Help clients in deeper understanding of their concerns
Challenge any inconsistencies in what clients say or do
Help clients to take decisions and choices regarding possible ways forward
Refer clients to other sources of help, as appropriate
Attend supervision and training courses
Undertake personal therapy (mandatory for accreditation)

pros: Counselors get a chance to positively impact people’s lives and make a difference.
There are regular changes involved, as counselors get to meet and help different clients every week.
There are opportunities available for self-employment, as counselors have the option of opening their own setup after a few years of experience.
There is a choice of working in different settings, such as NGOs, clinics, government and private counseling centres, etc.
cons: The work can be emotionally draining.
Counselors need to read regularly to up-to-date with developments in research and psychotherapeutic techniques.
Counselors need to constantly update their skills and knowledge through seminars and workshops etc.
Initial salary is not very high.

career-as-a-custom-officer-in-india.title: Customs
career-as-a-custom-officer-in-india.summary: A career in the customs department of the Government of India provides immense job security and other perks related to government services such as housing and concessions. It also gives individuals an opportunity to serve their country. Custom officers work at the airport and their work involves preventing entry and exit of illegal goods such as narcotics, other than that they are also tasked with collection of taxes on various goods going out and coming into the country.

career-opportunities.tax_assistant: Tax Assistans provide administrative assistance. Their main work involves performing tax and accounting duties where in they file taxes for the patrons of the airport they are posted on, and prepare reports and financial documents. They need to have basic understating of tax laws, in order to perform their duties.
career-opportunities.inspector: An inspector at the customs acts as a team leader for a group of preventive officers and like them also has search, seizure and arrest powers if they think any individual on the airport is trying to carry illegal goods.
career-opportunities.preventive_officer: Preventive Officers are posted at various international airports in order to keep a vigil that no illegal goods enter or exit the country through the airport. They have the power to search, seizure and arrest individual or goods.
career-opportunities.assistant_commissioner: The post of the Assistant commissioner is one of the highest entry level posts in the customs department. As an assistant commissioner, one is tasked with the management of the personnel under him/her. But unlike other posts which are filled though SSC exams, these are only filled through Civil Service examination.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII with any stream
path 1.graduation: Graduation in any stream with minimum 55% marks
path 1.after graduation: Clear Staff Selection Committee (Graduate level)

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII with any stream
path 2.graduation: Graduation in any stream with minimum 55% marks
path 2.after graduation: Clear Civil services examination and fill preferences for IRS

Tier-2: Paper-1) Quantitative Ability, Paper-2) English Language and Comprehension, Paper-3) Statistics and Paper-4) General Studies (Finance & Economics). Note: Paper-1 & 2 is compulsory for all posts and Paper-3 is only for the post of "Statistical Investigator Gr. II" & "Compiler" and Paper-4 is only for the post of "Assistant Audit Officer".Tier-3: Personality Test /Interview

Mains There are 8 papers: Paper1 - Indian Language Paper 2- English Paper3- Essay Paper4,5,6,7- General Studies Paper 8,9- Optional paper Interview/ Personality Test

work description: Inspect travellers and goods coming in and going out of the country
Regulate the law and order during import and export
Prevent illegal elements to enter the country
Check and seize any terrorist and illegal activities
Understand the various laws and under what conditions they can be implemented
Record and manage the activities of import and export
Look after the country as well as the state of its affairs

pros: Attractive employee benefit plan
Most respected & prestigious profession
cons: Expected to be updated with laws of different countries
Irregular working hours and hectic work schedule.

career-as-a-excise-officer-in-india.title: Excise
career-as-a-excise-officer-in-india.summary: Excise Department of the Government of India or the various state governments is responsible for collecting taxes on goods manufactured in India or that particular state. A career in the Excise Department provides individuals the chance to work with the revenue department with an advantage of immense job security and other related perks.

career-opportunities.tax_assistant: Tax assistant is mainly an office-desk job in the excise department under the central government or the various state governments. Job responsibility involves assisting in calculation of taxes for the various goods produced in the country.
career-opportunities.inspector: An inspector at the Excise is like a team leader of officers below his rank and he has searching, seizure and arrest powers if he thinks that any organization is not properly paying their taxes.
career-opportunities.assistant_commissioner_of_income_tax: It is one of the highest entry level posts in the Excise Department. As an assistant commissioner, they are responsible for management of the personnel under him/her. These are only filled through Civil Service examinations unlike other posts which are filled though SSC exams.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII with any stream
path 1.graduation: Graduation in any stream with minimum 55% marks
path 1.after graduation: Clear Staff Selection Committee (Graduate level) Exam

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII with any stream
path 2.graduation: Graduation in any stream with minimum 55% marks
path 2.after graduation: Clear Civil services examination and fill preferences for IRS

entrance exam.name: Staff Selection Commission Test : SSC CGL Tier-1Tier-2Tier-3
entrance exam.elements: Tier-1: (1) General Intelligence & Reasoning, (2) General Awareness / General knowledge, (3) Quantitative Aptitude and (4) English Comprehension. Tier-2: Paper-1) Quantitative Ability, Paper-2) English Language and Comprehension, Paper-3) Statistics and Paper-4) General Studies (Finance & Economics). Note: Paper-1 & 2 is compulsory for all posts and Paper-3 is only for the post of "Statistical Investigator Gr. II" & "Compiler" and Paper-4 is only for the post of "Assistant Audit Officer".Tier-3: Personality Test /Interview

entrance exam.name: UPSC CSE
entrance exam.elements: Preliems exam Paper -1 & Paper 2 (MCQ') General Knowledge Vocabulary Social Studies, Science (6th -12th class), Indian polity & constitution, logical reasoning, mathematical aptitude. Mains There are 8 papers: Paper1 - Indian Language Paper 2- English Paper3- Essay Paper4,5,6,7- General Studies Paper 8,9- Optional paper Interview/ Personality Test

work description: Advise business companies about statutory requirements and ensure their fulfilment
Liaison with other government departments
Maintain records through written reports
Remain up to-date with legislative and statutory requirements
Minimise administrative costs and improve policies
Take notice of irregularities and take action against resistant businesses
Supervise staff and provide feedback about performance
Help in undertaking of business audits

pros: Job security
Excellent growth opportunities with government perks
cons: It would take years of experience to move up the ladder
Irregular working hours and hectic work schedule.

career-as-a-historian-in-india.title: History
career-as-a-historian-in-india.summary: Historians study about the past. Their typical job activities include gathering historical data from numerous sources, holding research on historical information, providing advice or guidance on historical topics, as well as writing reports, articles and books on historical findings and theories. A degree in history supports the development of various significant skills like documentation, argumentation, writing and research.

career-opportunities.research_arena: After earning an advanced degree in history, one might choose Research Historian as a career. Indian Council of Historian Research ( ICHR) is an autonomous organization that encourages historical research.
career-opportunities.government_organizations: A history degree is also useful in the civil services. One might conduct research to provide historical context for current policy issues or do some other related work. Intelligence Agencies also hire historians to write history of significant moments or events within the agency.
career-opportunities.historical_associations: Historians preserve artifacts and explain the historical significance of a wide variety of subjects, such as historic buildings, battlegrounds, religious groups etc.
career-opportunities.education: After earning a Ph.D degree in history one may become a professor in the college settings or also choose to become a high school teacher or a post-secondary teacher with a B.Ed. degree.
career-opportunities.editing_and_publishing: Students of history may find employment in a wide variety of publishing areas, including university presses, textbook and trade houses, magazines and journals, professional associations, museums, and institutional publication offices.
career-opportunities.consultants_and_contractors: A career in consulting is ideal for historians who are adventurous or prefer flexibility and a variety of projects. History consultants can perform jobs such as preparing surveying site's, processing an archival collection for a corporation, or researching an exhibit for a museum or court case. Contract historians on the other hand often work on projects in historic preservation, archaeology, architectural history, landscape architecture, and litigation.

path 1.stream: Class XII in Humanities with History as a subject
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.A.(H) History for 3 years
path 1.after graduation: Appear for UPSC examination.

path 2.stream: Class XII with Humanities
path 2.graduation: Pursue B. A.(H) History for 3 years
path 2.after graduation: Pursue Masters in History for 1-2 years in India or Abroad

career-as-a-historian-in-india.Important Facts: No mandatory subject in Class XII.Most of the institutes for post-graduation require bachelors in any field or in History or/and related subjects. For Lectureship in History, National Educational Test (NET) or Ph.D. is mandatory Most colleges have eligibility criteria of minimum 50% aggregate marks in Class XII. Most Colleges/Institutes provide admission on the basis of Class 12th Percentage. Some institutes also conduct interviews. There are various other colleges in Delhi University who offer this course.

1.name: Lady Shri Ram College for Women

17.name: Indira Gandhi Delhi technical University for Woman

work description: Gather historical data from sources such as archives, court records, diaries, news files, and photographs
Conduct historical research for the identification, conservation, and reconstruction of historic places and materials
Research on and prepare manuscripts in support of public programming and the development of exhibits at historic sites, museums, libraries, and archives
Recommend actions related to historical art, such as which items to add to a collection or which items to display in an exhibition
Advise individuals and institutions regarding issues such as the historical authenticity of materials or the customs of a specific historical period
Interview people to gather information about historical events and to record oral histories
Impart and conduct research in colleges, universities, museums, and other research agencies and schools

pros: Is a fascinating subject to study
Teaches analytical, reading and writing skills
Is a flexible subject for higher education and government jobs
cons: A Ph.D. and master’s is required to pursue this field
The number of jobs directly related to this field are low
Initial pay package is low

career-as-a-pilot-in-india.title: Pilot
career-as-a-pilot-in-india.summary: A commercial aircraft pilot controls and operates the flight and is the commander-in-chief right from takeoff to landing. They carry passengers and cargo to destinations around the globe. It is an exciting and challenging career which involves a lot of responsibility. Commercial pilots are not to be confused with the pilots of the Indian Air Force who are selected through the NDA exam. Commercial pilot enjoys one of the high paying careers and also requires high investment, regular training and constant skill up-gradation.

career-opportunities.major_or_regional_airlines: Pilots fly domestic/international flights for major airlines
career-opportunities.corporate_and_business_aviation: Corporate pilots fly smaller, high end, corporate jets for corporations, businesses, and for the rich and famous.
career-opportunities.cargo_pilot: Cargo pilots fly planes larger than the commercial aircrafts and transport cargo for companies.
career-opportunities.medical_and_air_ambulance_pilots: Also known as EMR pilots, medicinal pilots fly for various medical situations and extreme emergencies.
career-opportunities.astronauts_and_space_pilots: With recent aviation and aerospace technological breakthroughs, there will be a growing need for space trained pilots in the next several years who are qualified to take commercial flights into outer space with civilian and non-civilian passengers on board.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in Science Stream (Recommended)
path 1.graduation: Certificate as a Licensed Pilot with a certificate program of 19-24 months (Student Pilot License, Private Pilot License, Commercial Pilot License)

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream (Recommended)
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. Aviation for 3 years
path 2.after graduation: Certificate as a Licensed Pilot with a certificate program of 19-24 months (Student Pilot License, Private Pilot License, Commercial Pilot License)

career-as-a-pilot-in-india.Important Facts: Every institute has their respective specifications concerning physical fitness, and eyesight specificallyOne has to clear the class -I medical exam as prescribed by the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) Private pilot & commercial pilot license requires practical training and completion of flying hours Private pilot license requires a minimum of 60 hours of flying Commercial pilot license requires minimum of 250 hours of flying (including 60 hours of Private pilot license) Physics and Mathematics are necessary subjects in Class XII Non Science students can apply to National Institute of Open School to meet the requirements

work description: Fly commercial planes from one destination to another
Monitor aircraft systems and coordinate with on-ground airport authorities
Study and deal with maps, technology and planes
Send and receive information to the crew flying in an airplane and staff on ground
Check weather and flight plans
Work for long hours and in shifts, often being away from home & family for several days
Ensure safe and efficient operation of the aircraft and the safety of crew members and passengers
Brief cabin crew before a flight takes off and maintain regular touch with base people through out the flight
Respond swiftly to environmental changes and emergency situations
Update aircraft log book and write a report at the end of a flight

pros: Opportunity to fly to different places
High paying job
Get to meet new people and try different things
cons: Have to stay away from home for a long time
Erratic sleeping and eating pattern
Security issues

career-as-a-professor-in-india.title: Professor
career-as-a-professor-in-india.summary: Postgraduates from all fields can hold teaching jobs at the college/university level as professors and lecturers. They are employed by various government and private universities, as well as research institutes across the country. In addition to teaching, many professors also regularly engage in, and contribute to research developments in their field, by writing research papers.

career-opportunities.professor: A Permanent Professor in universities usually holds an open-ended position that covers teaching, research, and administrative responsibilities. Permanent Professorship are tenured positions. A candidate generally starts out as an Assistant Professor, who may be promoted based on his or her research record, to become a Senior Assistant Professor, Associate Professor, Associate Professor (Sr) and Professor on the basis of Basic Pay and Grade Pay. The Promotional experience is different from Central Universities to State Universities and also it is vary for Open Positions and Promotional Positions.

path 1.stream: Pass 12th Class in Any Stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue Graduation for 3-4 years in any discipline
path 1.after graduation: Pursue Post Graduation for 2 years in any discipline/concerned discipline

career-as-a-professor-in-india.Important Facts: Most colleges have an eligibility criteria of minimum 50% aggregate marks in Class XII / and some of minimum 60%. For Post Graduation program some colleges/universities do their own Entrance test and/or Interview for selection.

entrance exam.name: UGC National Eligibility Test (NET)
entrance exam.elements: Subject-matter specific questions

entrance exam.name: CSIR-UGC NET
entrance exam.elements: Subject-matter specific questions

work description: Deliver lectures, seminars and tutorials
Develop and implement new methods of teaching to reflect changes in research
Set exam papers and mark/ score examinations
Support students through a pastoral or advisory role
Undertake personal research projects and actively contribute to the institution's research profile
Write research papers and prepare it for publication
Supervise students' research activities
Complete continuous professional development (CPD) and participate in staff training activities
Carry out administrative tasks related to the department, such as student admissions, induction programmes and involvement in committees and boards

pros: It is a highly respectable and stable profession.
Professionals receive decent monetary benefits and other perks.
Professionals get the ability to influence young minds.
cons: The educational path for the career is long, as a Ph.D is generally needed.
Professionals have to constantly keep their knowledge updated and current.
The job can be monotonous and predictable for many.

career-as-a-stock-broker-in-india.title: Stock Broking
career-as-a-stock-broker-in-india.summary: A Stockbroker is a professional who manages investments in stocks, derivatives, bonds, currency trades, etc., for clients who can either be individuals or big organizations. He is the linchpin between the stock market and the client in buying and selling shares. The services are provided to clients on a compensation pay system, thus profits for the client means profit for oneself.

career-opportunities.brokerage_firms: A certified stock broker can work with a brokerage firm such as Share khan or India bulls as their agent. The work involves contacting clients and managing their investments in stock market products. The benefit of working in a brokerage firm is that it provides more security and stableness than working individually.
career-opportunities.independent_broker: A certified stock broker can also work as an independent agent. He/she has to find new clients herself/himself and thus needs more interpersonal as well domain knowledge than what would typically be required of an agent working with a firm. The positive and the negative side is that an independent agent can determine his/her own commission and thus lose or win big if he manages to invest in a profitable stock.
career-opportunities.equity_analyst: An Equity analyst is one who studies organizations' metrics to determine risk and profitability of its stocks and other financial products. He/she can work independently, but most often are employed by large brokerage firms or even by business organizations.
career-opportunities.bank_broker: A Bank broker does the same work as other brokers do that is to sell and buy shares and other financial products for clients albeit in a bank. The major difference though is that the agent doesn't have to run around prospective customers rather bank provides a steady stream of customers who would themselves contact you.

path 1.stream: Commerce/Science with Math's
path 1.graduation: Graduation in any stream
path 1.after graduation: PGDM/MBA in Capital Markets

path 2.stream: Any Stream preferably statistics and math
path 2.graduation: Short term/Long term courses from NSE/BSE
path 2.after graduation: Practice in a Brokerage firm, then apply for a license

path 3.stream: Clear Class XII in any stream
path 3.graduation: Graduation in any stream preferably in finance related subjects
path 3.after graduation: Short term/Long term course from NSE/BSE

career-as-a-teacher-in-india.title: Teacher
career-as-a-teacher-in-india.summary: A teacher is someone who imparts knowledge and educate others. They engage with student in their pivotal stage of development. By assessing children on various skills, they explain, motivate and inspire them to lead. The specific work role of a teacher depends on his/her work place and position.

career-opportunities.school_teachers: School teacher inspires young mind. Depending on the level one teaches, a teacher could work in elementary, senior or high school. They plan, prepare and present lessons to students which helps in their progression.
career-opportunities.play_school_teachers: Play school teachers work with younger children whom they prepare for primary education, they mostly focus on play, supervision and social skills of the child.
career-opportunities.self_employment_by_starting_institutestu: Another, opportunity in the field of teaching is that of tuitions, depending on the individual's flexibility and comfort, he/ she can either take up private tuitions or join an institute.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in Science stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.El.Ed for 3-4 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue Masters in Education (M.Ed) for 1-2 years

path 2.graduation: Pursue Graduation in any stream for 3 years
path 2.after graduation: After Graduation pursue Education/Bachelors in Education (B.Ed) for 1-2 years

Research on new areas, maintaining up-to-date subject knowledge, and devising and writing new curriculum materials

pros: As you can influence a child’s life and share your passion and learning with them, you feel a sense of satisfaction.
You can be home with your family during holidays or other events.
cons: Repetative work, therefore it can get monotonous

career-as-an-aircraft-maintenance-engine.title: Aircraft Maintenance Engineer
career-as-an-aircraft-maintenance-engine.summary: As critical pillars of the aviation sector, aircraft maintenance engineers are responsible for the maintenance, control and repair of specialized aircraft instrumentation and parts. The maintenance of modern sophisticated aircrafts calls for high degree of technical knowledge, proficiency, dexterity and integrity on part of the concerned personnel. They play a critical role towards keeping the aircrafts in flying condition and to ensure 100% flight safety. Aircraft engineers research, design, manufacture and maintain aircraft. With the fast-paced growth in the aviation sector, aircraft maintenance engineers are in high demand.

career-opportunities.major_or_regional_airlines: All the leading commercial domestic & international regularly hire aircraft maintenance engineers to ensure maintenance and safety of their aircrafts.
career-opportunities.airport_authorities: Airport authorities recruit aircraft maintenance engineers to ensure flight maintenance and safety.
career-opportunities.aircraft_manufacturing_firms: Aircraft maintenance engineers are also hired by aircraft manufacturing firms where they work in research, design and manufacture of aircrafts.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in Science Stream - Physics & Mathematics (Recommended)

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII in Science Stream

path 2.after graduation: Pursue AME Training Courses

path 3.graduation: Pursue B.Tech. in Aeronautical Engineer for 4 years

Refurbish or supplant flawed parts
Examine the security and legal necessities of the aircraft

career-as-an-instructional-designer-in-i.title: Instructional Design
career-as-an-instructional-designer-in-i.summary: Instructional Designing involves creating instructional experiences which facilitate the acquisition of knowledge and skill more efficiently, effectively and in a more appealing manner. It involves identifying the needs of the learner, defining the purpose of instruction and developing efficient learning experiences to meet the purpose. Typically, an instructional designer create blueprints for a training course for corporations/ government, design e-learning and online courses and develop learning tools for educational institutions

career-opportunities.education: Instructional designers are required in the field of education to create or revise teaching materials or curriculum that meet the needs of diverse learners from elementary aged children to college students.
career-opportunities.corporate_sector: Instructional designers are required in this sector to develop and design training modules, e learning modules, or also to develop mobile apps. Instructional designers are usually required to be good at using the latest technology.

path 2.after graduation: Pursue Masters in instructional designing for 1-2 years in India or Abroad

career-as-chartered-accountant-ca-in-ind.title: Chartered Accountant (CA)
career-as-chartered-accountant-ca-in-ind.summary: Behind every successful business is a team of chartered accountants, who are trained to minimize losses and maximize gains while remaining in the jurisdictions of the law and following all industry-specific regulations. The role of a chartered accountant can cover many activities, depending on the type and size of organization they work for. The duties of a CA include preparing financial reports and documents, maintaining records of investments, reviewing potential financial risks as well as providing professional opinions in regard to the fiscal decisions of the firm. They play a strategic role by providing professional advice, aiming to maximize profitability on behalf of their client or employer.

career-opportunities.public_private_practice_practice: Chartered accountants in practice, work within an accountancy firm providing a range of accountancy and tax services to clients. These include business advice, management consultancy, audit and taxation. Firms vary in size from the sole practitioner to multinational accountancy firms.Chartered accountants in practice, work within an accountancy firm providing a range of accountancy and tax services to clients.These include business advice, management consultancy, audit and taxation.Firms vary in size from the sole practitioner to multinational accountancy firms.
career-opportunities.government_organizations: Chartered accountants in the government sector have the important duty of ensuring that governmental bodies are transparent, efficient, ethical and responsible in their use of funds. They investigate white collar crimes, perform financial statement audits for government agencies and conduct research on emerging accounting issues.Chartered accountants in the government sector have the important duty of ensuring that governmental bodies are transparent, efficient, ethical and responsible in their use of funds. They investigate white collar crimes, perform financial statement audits for government agencies and conduct research on emerging accounting issues.
career-opportunities.business_enterprises: Chartered accountants are often employed within a business organisation using their financial knowledge and expertise to control the management of the business and to help it develop. They can occupy roles such as finance director or fund manager within organisations ranging from top listed companies to smaller organisations.Chartered accountants are often employed within a business organisation using their financial knowledge and expertise to control the management of the business and to help it develop. They can occupy roles such as finance director or fund manager within organisations ranging from top listed companies to smaller organisations.
career-opportunities.corporate_finance: Large firms often have specialised departments in corporate finance. Work involves securing finance for company mergers, acquisitions, management buy-ins and buy-outs and capital reconstructions. A job in corporate finance requires skills in negotiation with finance providers, lawyers, researchers and other key professionals.Large firms often have specialised departments in corporate finance. Work involves securing finance for company mergers, acquisitions, management buy-ins and buy-outs and capital reconstructions. A job in corporate finance requires skills in negotiation with finance providers, lawyers, researchers and other key professionals.
career-opportunities.not_for_profit_organisations: Their work in this profile may involve treasury management, procurement, financial management or producing reports and recommendations following internal audits or public-sector audits.The work may involve treasury management, procurement, financial management or producing reports and recommendations following internal audits or public-sector audits.
career-opportunities.banking_and_insurance_sector: Chartered Accountants (CAs) are thrust with responsibility to authenticate various information submitted to the Regulator by an insurance company. While insurance companies need experts to present their performance meaningfully to the public, stakeholders need professional advices for a meaningful interpretation of the same.Chartered Accountants (CAs) are thrust with responsibility to authenticate various information submitted to the Regulator by an insurance company. While insurance companies need experts to present their performance meaningfully to the public, stakeholders need professional advices for a meaningful interpretation of the same.
career-opportunities.law_firms: Chartered accountants working for law firms are trained in financial areas unique to the legal profession. One might handle projects exclusive to legal accounts and work with multiple clients on a diverse range of issues. Forensic accounting is one of the upcoming fields in this domain.Chartered accountants working for law firms are trained in financial areas unique to the legal profession. One might handle projects exclusive to legal accounts and work with multiple clients on a diverse range of issues. Forensic accounting is one of the upcoming fields in this domain.
career-opportunities.civil_services: One of the best career options to be considered for a CA is that of civil services which range from All India Services to Group A services including Indian Audit and Accounts Services, Indian Defence Accounts Services, Indian P & T Accounts and Finance Service, Indian Civil Accounts Service and Indian Railway accounts Service.

path 1.stream: Enrol for the Foundation Course after passing Class 10th Examination. Appear in Foundation Examination after appearing (10+2 examination)
path 1.graduation: Appear in Intermediate ExaminationJoin articleship after passing either of the Group or both Groups of Intermediate Course and also after successfully undergoing ICITSS.
path 1.after graduation: Register for Final Course.Complete articleship of 3 years and Pass Final Examination to enrol as a member of the ICAI.

path 2.stream: Complete Graduation in Commerce or any other field
path 2.graduation: Directly Enrol in Intermediate Examination.Register for Practical Training of three years.Appear in Intermediate Examination on completion of 9 months of Practical Training
path 2.after graduation: Register for Final Course.Complete articleship of 3 years and Pass Final Examination to enrol as a member of the ICAI.

career-as-chartered-accountant-ca-in-ind.Important Facts: The Institute of Chartered Accountants of India (ICAI) administers the CA exams all over India and is the only foremost institutes to do so.Foundation Examinations are held twice a year in the months of May and November. Register for the Foundation Course on or before the 1st day of January or the 1st day of July for the examination to be held in the months of May/June or November/December respectively. Candidates who are pursuing the Final year of Graduation Course shall be eligible for provisional registration to the Intermediate Course. Such candidates would be required to submit satisfactory proof of having passed the graduation examination with the specified percentage of marks within such period not exceeding six months as from the date of appearance in the final year graduation examination The subjects of Intermediate and Final Course are classified into two groups which a student can study and appear in the examination group-wise or both the groups together.
work description: Scrutinize financial statements to ensure that they are accurate and comply with laws and regulations
Calculate taxes owed, prepare tax returns, and ensure that taxes are paid properly
Review account books and accounting systems for efficiency and use of accepted accounting procedures
Assess financial operations and make best-practices recommendations to management
Suggest ways to reduce costs, enhance revenues, and improve profits
Review the company's systems and analyze risk;
Advise clients on tax planning and tax issues on business acquisitions and mergers;

pros: Good remuneration and social status
Good for people who like to work without much social interaction
High demand for CA professionals
cons: Requires much hard-work and patience
Long hours of work and difficult to maintain work-life balance
Takes more time to settle down in the career

career-as-company-secretary-cs-in-india.title: Company Secretary (CS)
career-as-company-secretary-cs-in-india.summary: The company secretary acts a bridge between the company and its Board of directors, shareholders, government and regulatory authorities. The company secretary has to impart various services ranging from advising the companies on good governance practices, compliance of legal and procedural aspects, arbitration, negotiation and conciliation in commercial disputes between the parties to finance, accounting, taxation and management services. The company secretary is responsible for the efficient administration of a company, particularly with regard to ensuring compliance with statutory and regulatory requirements and for ensuring that decisions of the board of directors are implemented.

career-opportunities.independent_practitioners_as_a_cs: Independent practitioners require a certificate from ICSI (after having qualified as a company secretary). They can then issue compliance certificates to companies and undertake diligence report for banks etc. They can also be employed by small firms on a retainership for professional advice and support on issues such as licenses, registrations, loans, taxes and partnership deeds.
career-opportunities.corporate_sector: The role of Company Secretary in corporate sector is widespread and ICSI has projected the same to include: Corporate Laws, Corporate Governance, Corporate Administration, Board and Shareholders meetings, Corporate Compliance Management, Stakeholder Relationship, Mergers and Amalgamations amongst others.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in Commerce Stream (Recommended)
path 1.graduation: Pursue graduation in any Commerce Related field for 3 years Pursue the Executive program for 1 year Pursue the Professional Program for 1 year

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII in Commerce Stream (Recommended)
path 2.graduation: Pursue the foundation program for 8 months Pursue the Executive Program for 1 year Pursue the Professional Program for 1 year

career-as-company-secretary-cs-in-india.Important Facts: The Institute of Company Secretaries of India (ICSI) constituted under an Act of Parliament i.e. the Company Secretaries Act, 1980 (Act No. 56 of 1980) is the only recognized professional body in India to develop and regulate the profession of Company Secretaries in India.The Institute awards the certificate bestowing the designation of Company Secretary to a candidate qualifying for the membership of the Institute of Company Secretaries of India. Admission to the CS course is open throughout the year. Examinations are held twice a year in June & December.

1.name: ICSI-The Institute of Company Secretaries of India

work description: Organize and prepare agendas and drafts for board meetings, committees and annual general meetings
Oversee policies, make sure they are kept up to date and referred to the appropriate committee for approval
Maintain statutory books, including registers of members, directors and secretaries
Deal with correspondence, collate information and write reports, ensure that decisions are made and communicated to the relevant company stakeholders
Contribute to meeting discussions, and advise members on the legal, governance, accounting and tax implications of proposed policies
Monitor changes in relevant legislation and the regulatory environment and take appropriate action
Liaise with external regulators and advisers, such as lawyers and auditors
Take responsibility for the health and safety of employees and manage matters related to insurance and property

pros: Is a high status and respectable profession
High salary packages and perks
Handling affairs of the top management of the company
cons: Long hours of work
Difficult to maintain work-life balance
Requires hard-work and a lot of study

career-as-cost-accountant-in-india.title: Cost Accountant
career-as-cost-accountant-in-india.summary: The duties of a cost accountant include budgeting, cost management, performance evaluation and asset management within a company or organization. They may work with corporate executives to make a strategic financial plan for the company, or they may prepare financial reports for tax authorities, creditors, stockholders and regulatory agencies. Cost accountants may advance to higher-level positions within the management accounting world, such as Finance Director, Financial Controller, Chief Financial Officer, Cost Controller and Chief Internal Auditor among many other important positions.

career-opportunities.government_sector: The Central Government constitutes an All India Cadre known as Indian Cost Accounts Service (ICAS) at par with other Class-I services such as IAS, IFS etc. to advise the Government in cost pricing and in framing the appropriate fiscal and tax policies. Cost Management Accountants are eligible for Indian Cost Accounts Service/Job.
career-opportunities.education_sector: Many Cost Management Accountant (CMAs) choose to get employed in universities and colleges to teach cost and management accountancy. University Grants Commission (UGC) has notified that CMA with first Class Graduation can be appointed as Assistant Professor in universities and colleges in the area of Management/ Business Administration. Various Universities have also recognized CMA qualification as fulfilling the eligibility requirement for admission in PhD in Commerce. It enables CMAs to pursue PhD without any masters degree.
career-opportunities.business_organizations: The Cost Accountants are most sought after in the business world as their skills are considered to be vital in investment planning, profit planning, project management and overall managerial decision making process. They are also empanelled by many Public and Private Companies and Cooperative Societies as Internal Auditor for auditing financial books of accounts.
career-opportunities.banks: Banks have also empanelled CMAs for a variety of work such as Cost Management, Enterprise resource planning, Financial Management, Project Consultancy, Materials Management, Tax Planning, Revival of Sick Units, Incentive Plans, Energy Audit etc.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in Commerce Stream (Recommended)
path 1.graduation: Pursue graduation in any field except fine arts for 3 years. Pursue the program of Certified Management Accountant (U.S)

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII in Commerce Stream (Recommended)
path 2.graduation: Pursue graduation in any field except fine arts for 3 years. Pursue Intermediate course for 10 months. Pursue Final course for 18 months.

path 3.stream: Clear Class XII in Commerce Stream (Recommended)
path 3.graduation: Pursue Foundation course for 8 months. Pursue Intermediate course for 10 months. Pursue Final course for 18 months.

career-as-cost-accountant-in-india.Important Facts: The Institute of Cost Accountants of India holds exams for cost management accountant degree in India.Registration for the ICAI course is open throughout the year However, students who desire to appear for June Term Examination should apply before 31st January of that year and for December Term Examination should apply before 31st July of that year. To be certified as a CMA (U.S) candidates must fulfill both an education requirement and an experience requirement in addition to passing the exam. To be certified as a CMA (U.S) candidates must fulfill both an education requirement and an experience requirement in addition to passing the exam. Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university Foundational knowledge of economics, basic statistics, and financial accounting Two continuous years of professional experience CMA (Certified Management Accountant) awarded by IMA (Institute of Management Accountants, USA) is a global professional qualification.

1.name: Institute of Cost Accountants of India, New Delhi

work description: Perform cost accumulation tasks as a member of the target costing group
Be Responsible for budgeting, cost management, performance evaluation and asset management within a company or organization
Collaborate as part of an executive team to create a financial plan for the organization
Work with corporate executives or heads of companies to strategically plan for a company
Prepare financial reports for tax authorities, creditors, stockholders and regulatory agencies
Plan, study, and collect data to determine costs of business activities such as raw material purchases, inventory and labour
Analyze actual manufacturing costs and prepare periodic reports comparing standard costs with actual production costs
Provide management with reports specifying and comparing factors affecting prices and profitability of products or services

pros: It offers a good growth potential
Demand for cost accountants is high
Remuneration and perks are good
cons: Work can become monotonous at times
Working hours may be long
Have to clear certifications before starting career

career-in-aerospace-engineering-in-india.title: Aerospace Engineering
career-in-aerospace-engineering-in-india.summary: An Aerospace Engineer is crucial in the research, design, development, performance testing and launching of commercial and military airplanes, weapon systems, space vehicles and satellites. Aerospace engineers improve flight safety & fuel efficiency, develop control systems, analyze new materials and use advanced technologies to meet customer needs and reduce the environmental impact of air commute.

career-opportunities.maintenance_of_aircraft_or_missiles: Aerospace Engineers test new aerodynamic and aviation systems, and maintain them.
career-opportunities.aircraft_designer: Aerospace Engineers specializing in this field deal with designing, constructing, and testing aircraft, missiles, and space crafts. They may conduct basic and applied research to evaluate adaptability of materials and equipment to aircraft design and manufacture.
career-opportunities.aviation_engineers: Aerospace Engineers in this field deal with the airspace development, airport design, aircraft navigation technologies, and aerodrome planning.
career-opportunities.satellite_and_space_research: Aerospace Engineers in this field deal with navigation systems, radars and other communication networks.
career-opportunities.defense: Aerospace Engineers in this field deal with creation, maintenance and deployment of defense aircrafts such as fighter jets, choppers, bombers, etc. Also the job requires to be able to handle such aircraft at necessary times.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Maths
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.Tech in Aerospace Engineering for 4 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M.Tech for 2-3 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Maths
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.Tech + M.Tech (Dual Degree)in Aerospace Engineering for 5 years

career-in-aerospace-engineering-in-india.Important Facts: Most college have eligibility criteria of minimum 50% aggregate marks in Class XII / and some of minimum 60%.Must have passed class 12th or senior secondary examination with at least 50% marks including English. Some colleges/ universities also have an age limit. Aerospace Engineering is divided into two parts Aeronautical & Astronautical Engineering

work description: Plan or conduct experimental, environmental, operational, or stress tests on models or prototypes of aircrafts or aerospace systems or equipments
Plan or coordinate activities concerned with investigating into and resolving customers' reports of technical problems with aircraft or aerospace vehicles
Coordinate activities of engineering or technical personnel involved in designing, modifying, or testing of aerospace products

Develop design criteria for aeronautical or aerospace products, including testing methods, production costs, quality standards, environmental standards, or completion dates
Participate in aerospace research and development programmes

career-in-biology-in-india.title: Biology
career-in-biology-in-india.summary: Biology is a branch of the natural sciences, and is concerned with the study of living organisms. Biologists investigate the function, structure, growth, distribution, taxonomy and evolution of living organisms. It is an eclectic field that draws from various disciplines and branches. Their work helps generate awareness and understanding of the natural world in which we live, and forms the basis of many other disciplines like medicine, genetics and biotech

career-opportunities.health_care: The work of Biologists can aid the development of public health campaigns and help defeat various life-threatening illnesses such as AIDS, TB, heart disease, cancer, etc.
career-opportunities.business_and_industries: Biologists research and test new products by working in collaboration with drug companies and scientific products suppliers to services to. They may also work in the domains of sales and marketing.
career-opportunities.environmental_management_and_conservatio: Biologists also work to solve environmental management and conservation issues, to help preserve the natural world for future generations. Potential professional opportunities include working with state/federal natural resource agencies, private ecological consulting firms, or wildlife rehabilitation centers, etc.
career-opportunities.consultant: Biologists may work as policy advocates for scientific organizations and non-profits, at the state or national level, or can even serve as a representative for a political committee or working group. They also collaborate with lawmakers to develop new legislation on topics such as environmental protection and biomedical research.
career-opportunities.research: Biologists involved in research engage in the study of the natural world in the laboratory as well as the natural world, by employing different scientific tools and techniques. This helps to increase our understanding of the natural world.
career-opportunities.writing_and_communication: Biologists can also find work as journalists and writers, as their scientific background makes them the right candidates to inform the public about emerging biological issues. Such Biologists have excellent writing and communication skills, and work with online magazines, science blogs, journals and print/media networks.
career-opportunities.education: Life science educators can find employment opportunities at various schools and colleges, as well as in museums, zoos, aquariums, etc., where they get the chance to share their knowledge with others.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Biology
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. (Hons) Biological Sciences or B.Sc. (Hons) in Life Sciences or B.Sc. (Hons) in Environmental Sciences or Bachelors in any other related fields for 3 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M.Sc. Bio-Sciences or M.Sc. in Life Sciences for 2 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Biology
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. (Hons) Biological Sciences or B.Sc. (Hons) in Life Sciences or B.Sc. (Hons) in Environmental Sciences or Bachelors in any other related fields for 3 years
path 2.after graduation: Pursue Diploma/PG Diploma in Bio-Sciences or Life Sciences for 1 year

path 3.after graduation: Pursue M.Sc. Bio-Sciences or M.Sc. in Life Sciences for 2 years
