work description: Identifying, assorting, reporting and observing organisms and their environment
Study life in different forms, research on important processes and how organisms relate to their environment
Performing experiments by means of various scientific methods
Preparing, presenting and publishing reports of the data collected
Performing field works and laboratory research and experiments
Developing new drugs or medical treatments
Keeping up to date with the latest research and technological developments
Observing the effects of human activities on the organisms

pros: There are a number of avenues available for employment, including pharmaceuticals, health care, environmental management, research and development departments of organizations etc.
There is a wide amount of specializations in the field and many routes for pursuing a career in biology.
Job can be interesting and intellectually stimulating for those who enjoy analytical and scientific work.
Professionals have a chance to provide meaningful contributions to society through discoveries and innovations.
cons: The nature of the work can be hazardous and may involve potential exposure to harmful substances or organisms.
Professionals frequently have to work for long hours and under deadlines.
The path to a successful career in this field is long, and most research organizations require a qualification of Ph.D.

career-in-biomedical-biotech-engineering.title: Biomedical and Biotechnology Engineering
career-in-biomedical-biotech-engineering.summary: Biomedical/Biotech Engineers research, design and develop medical products and apply the principles of engineering and material technology to healthcare. They design and implement new technologies like computer facilitated operations and tissue engineering. They work closely with physicians, surgeons, life science experts and chemists to develop engineering facets of biological systems.

career-opportunities.corporate_firms_pharmaceutical_companies: Biotechnologists & Biomedical Engineers create products that require an in-depth understanding of living systems and technology. They work in research and development or in quality assurance.
career-opportunities.research: Biotechnologists & Biomedical Engineers work with medical scientists, doctors and chemists to conduct research to solve clinical problems.
career-opportunities.hospitals: Biotechnologists & Biomedical Engineers design softwares to run medical equipment, or simulations to test drug therapies. Design and build artificial body parts or replacement body parts.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Maths
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.Tech in Biomedical Engineering/ Biotechnology for 4 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M.Tech for 2-3 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Maths
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.Tech + M.Tech (Dual Degree)in Biomedical Engineering/ Biotechnology for 5 years

career-in-biomedical-biotech-engineering.Important Facts: Most colleges have eligibility criteria of minimum 50% aggregate marks in Class XII / and some of minimum 60%.Must have passed class 12thor senior secondary examination with at least 50% marks including English. Some colleges/ universities also have an age limit. Biomedical Engineering is available as a course only in select colleges and it is different from Biomedical Science.

work description: Conduct research, along with life scientists, chemists, and medical scientists, on the engineering aspects of the biological systems of the humans and animals.
Design and develop medical diagnostic and clinical instrumentation, equipments, and procedures, using the principles of engineering and bio-behavioral sciences.
Develop models or computer simulations of human bio-behavioural systems to obtain data for measuring or controlling life processes.
Write documents describing protocols, policies, standards for use, maintenance and repair of medical equipments.
Advise hospital administrators on the planning, acquisition and use of medical equipments.
Conduct training to educate clinicians and other personnel on proper use of equipments.
Develop new applications for energy sources, such as using nuclear power for biomedical implants.

Chance to improve existing technologies
Practical field, where application oriented minds can work
cons: Limited number of jobs as of now
Limited seats and colleges offering the course

career-in-central-secretariat-service.title: Central secretariat Service
career-in-central-secretariat-service.summary: Central Secretariat Service is the Group A and Group B administrative civil service of the the executive branch of the government. It has five grades, Assistant, Section Officer, Under Secretary, Deputy Secretary and Director. They manage the middle level posts in the central secretariat. The officers work in various ministries in the government. It comes under the Ministry of Personnel, Public Grievances and Pension, Department of Personnel and Training.

career-opportunities.secretary: The secretary is the administrative head of the department/ministry. He/She is the principal adviser to the minister.
career-opportunities.additional_joint_secretary: The officer is responsible for functioning of a particular wing in the ministry.
career-opportunities.deputy_secretary: He acts on behalf of the secretary and assists in the duties.
career-opportunities.under_secretary: The officer submits the important matters to the deputy secretary and assists him/her in work.
career-opportunities.assistant_section_officer: They prepare reports, work in drafting and writing letters, reply to RTI's, public grievances and prepare salary bills.

path 1.stream: Any Stream
path 1.graduation: Any Stream, minimum of 50% marks in any stream from a government recognized university
path 1.after graduation: Clear SSC CGL exam (Staff Selection Commission - Combined Graduate Level Examination)

entrance exam.name: Staff Selection Commission - Combined Graduate Level Examination
entrance exam.elements: General Intelligence, General Awareness, Arithmetic

pros: • The job profile is of esteem and repute• The pay scale is good• Work in close collaboration with high ranking officials • There are ample opportunities for promotions and growth
cons: • In some cases theres is red tapism• There are chances for corruption

career-in-chemical-petroleum-engineering.title: Chemical and Petroleum Engineering
career-in-chemical-petroleum-engineering.summary: Chemical Engineers design and develop processes that transform the physical and chemical state of a substance, suiting commercial applicability. It ranges from improving food processing to fertilizers to even the clothes we wear. Modern day chemical engineers also work on pioneering concepts like nanotechnology. A specialization in chemical engineering, petroleum engineering, deals with optimizing extraction of oil and gas from the surface of earth. Petroleum engineers implement methods that maximize the extraction of hydrocarbons efficiently with least environmental repercussions.

career-opportunities.drilling_engineers: Drilling engineers determine the best way to drill an oil or gas well, taking into account a number of factors, including cost. They also ensure that the drilling process is safe, efficient, and minimally disruptive to the environment.
career-opportunities.production_engineers: Production engineers take over after a well is drilled. They typically monitor the well's oil and gas production. If a well is not producing as much as it was expected to, production engineers figure out ways to increase the amount being extracted.
career-opportunities.completions_engineers: Completion engineers decides the optimal way to finish building a well so that the oil or gas will flow up from underground. They oversee well-completions work, which might involve the use of tubing, hydraulic fracturing, or pressure-control techniques.
career-opportunities.reservoir_engineers: Reservoir engineers estimate how much oil or gas can be recovered from underground deposits, known as reservoirs. They study a reservoir's characteristic and determine which methods will get the most oil or gas out of the reservoir. They also monitor operations to ensure that the optimal levels of these resources are being recovered.
career-opportunities.manufacturing_goods: Chemical Engineers help in manufacturing consumer goods like plastics, clothing, paper, toothpaste etc. They develop new products and aim to improve their existing quality. They even find work in pharmaceutical manufacturing divisions.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Maths
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.Tech in Chemical Engg./ Petroleum Engg. for 4 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M.Tech for 2-3 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Maths
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.Tech + M.Tech (Dual Degree)in Chemical Engineering for 5 years

work description: Evaluate chemical equipments and processes to identify ways to optimize performance or to ensure compliance with safety and environmental regulations.
Conduct research to develop new and improved chemical manufacturing processes.
Determine most effective arrangement of operations such as mixing, crushing, heat transfer, distillation, and drying.
Perform tests and monitor processes in various stages of production.
Develop processes to separate components of liquids or gases or generate electrical currents using controlled chemical processes.
Perform laboratory studies of various steps in manufacture of new product and test proposed process in small scale operation such as a pilot plant.
Work closely with chemists and control engineers to ensure that the process plant is set-up to provide maximum output levels to ensure efficient running of the production facility.

pros: The career is highly rewarding in terms of monetary benefits.
Chemical engineers can work in a variety of settings- manufacturing, pharmaceuticals, research, product testing etc.
Petroleum engineers are high in demand and are expected to stay so in the future.
cons: Much of the time may be spent in lab, for chemical engineers.
Petroleum engineers may find office hours unstructured, work may find them in remote locations.
Working conditions may be hazardous sometimes, in both the branches.

career-in-civil-engineering-in-india.title: Civil Engineering
career-in-civil-engineering-in-india.summary: Civil Engineers plan, design, construct and manage construction projects. The projects span from various domains including transportation, water supply and waste management, estate planning and even taking up offshore projects. Civil Engineers assume two roles, that of a consultant and a contractor. A consultant works with the client to plan, design and manage the projects. A contractor supervises the construction and manages the project on ground level to turn plans into realities.

career-opportunities.structural_engineering: Civil Engineers in this field create structural elements of design for bridges, skyscrapers, ports and airports etc. They also design and assess major projects, such as buildings, bridges, or dams, to ensure their strength and durability.
career-opportunities.geotechnical_engineering: Civil Engineers in this field work exclusively with rock and soil that support the structures and make sure that the foundations are solid. They focus on how structures built by civil engineers, such as buildings and tunnels, interact with the earth (including soil and rock). In addition, they design and plan for slopes, retaining walls, and tunnels.
career-opportunities.environmental_engineering: Civil Engineers in this field design systems and structures for treatment of chemical, biological and thermal wastes.
career-opportunities.materials_engineering: Civil Engineers in this field deal with the inspection of existing and development of new materials which can be used for construction projects.
career-opportunities.maintenance: Civil Engineers in this field ensure that the structures built, are looked after properly and all the necessary repairs and renovations take place.
career-opportunities.water_resource_engineering: Civil Engineers in this field focus on collection, storage and management of water.
career-opportunities.earthquake_engineering: Civil Engineers specializing in this field create buildings and other structures that can withstand the stresses of earthquakes without falling.
career-opportunities.coastal_engineering: Civil Engineers specializing in this field manage the coastal areas, including marshlands. They create defenses against flooding and erosion.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Maths
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.Tech in Civil Engineering for 4 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M.Tech for 2-3 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Maths
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.Tech + M.Tech (Dual Degree)in Civil Engineering for 5 years

Some exams require JEE score as minimum eligibility Some colleges/ universities also have an age limit.

work description: Create graphical representations of civil structures
Inspect project sites to monitor progress and ensure compliance with design specifications and safety standards
Provide technical advice to industrial or managerial personnel regarding design, construction, or structural repairs
Estimate quantities and cost of materials, equipment, or labour cost to determine project feasibility
Test building materials, such as concrete, asphalt, or steel, for use in particular projects
Consider construction costs, government regulations, potential environmental hazards and other factors in planning stages and carry out risk analysis
Compile and submit permit applications to local, state, and federal agencies verifying that projects comply with various regulations
Present findings to public on topics such as bid proposals or environmental impact reports

pros: The demand for civil engineers always remains high, so does the pay package.
They are major figures involved in the development of community.
Opportunity to travel to different locations and work on different sites.
cons: It is a high-pressure job.
There are no fixed work hours, and they spend much time on construction sites and remote locations.
Scrutiny of quality of work and material from third parties.

career-in-computer-application-in-india.title: Computer Application and IT
career-in-computer-application-in-india.summary: Computer Application is the most preferred career option for those who wish to join the IT sector as well as for those who have a quick thinking mind that can analyze the situation at hand and apply concepts towards solving them. It is more professionally oriented as compared to computer science and other similar alternatives. Education in Computer Application includes knowledge of computer fundamentals and programming concepts as well as learning and mastering programming languages. India, being a developing country, has a wide scope for those pursuing Computer Applications.

career-opportunities.computer_programmers: Computer programmers write programs in a variety of computer languages such as C++ and Java, update and expand existing programs, build and use computer-assisted software engineering (CASE) tools to automate the writing of some code, use code libraries to simplify writing and debug programs by testing for and fixing errors.
career-opportunities.software_developers: Software developers are concerned with facets of the software development process such as in design and coding, computer programming, project management, etc.
career-opportunities.web_designer: Web designers develop and create websites and associated applications. They work in a variety of industries and often as independent contractors and help create and maintain the product, as per the need of their client.
career-opportunities.database_administrator: DBA or Database Administrator are bestowed with the job of designing, implementation, maintenance, and repair of an organization's database. Inter alia DBA professionals are also known as Database coordinators or database programmers in IT sector.
career-opportunities.webmultimedia_programmer: A multimedia/web programmer works with different multimedia features such as, text, sound, graphics, digital photography, 2D/3D modelling, animation and video. The role demands a combination of both creative and technical skills.
career-opportunities.software_consultant: Software consultants are responsible for evaluating the client's business and its IT processes to provide software solutions to enhance business efficiency.
career-opportunities.technical_writer: Technical writers have a blend of writing skills and knowledge of technology. As a technical writer one needs to write technical documents such as product descriptions, user manuals, design specifications, project plans and papers.
career-opportunities.system_analyst: System Analysts research about the existing problems in systems and plan solutions for the problem. They also recommend solutions to software and system related problems and coordinate development between business development teams.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII with Any Stream with Maths (Computer Science is recommended)
path 1.graduation: Pursue BCA/ BSc Computer Science for 3 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue MCA for 2-3 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII in Science Stream with IT/Computer Science/ Similar
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.Tech in Computer Science for 4 years
path 2.after graduation: Pursue M.Tech for 2 Years

Produce computer applications, software and utility programmes based on user's requirement
Design and develop website, mobile applications

pros: Wide demand of computer professionals
High paying potential
Growth and learning oriented field
cons: Low salaries in the initial phases

career-in-computer-science-in-india.title: CS, IT and Software Engineering
career-in-computer-science-in-india.summary: Software Engineering is concerned with developing techniques for improving the cost, accuracy and usability of software systems. Computer science engineering is concerned with designing elements that help computers to operate efficiently. They may develop computer chips, create software programme that helps computer systems run or design software applications. Information Technology (IT) is an engineering discipline with focus on utilization of computers and telecommunication systems to control, gather, store and circulate information.

career-opportunities.software_developers: Software developers are concerned with facets of the software development process such as design and coding, computer programming and project management.
career-opportunities.hardware_engineers: Hardware Engineers research, design, develop, test, and oversee the installation of computer hardware which includes computer chips, circuit boards, systems, modems, keyboards, and printers.
career-opportunities.system_designer: System Designers are involved in system designing, logical & physical designing, including structure & characteristics such as output, input, files, database & procedures, etc.
career-opportunities.system_analyst: System Analysts research about the existing problems in systems and plan solutions for the problem. They also recommend solutions to software and system related problems and coordinate development between business development teams.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Maths
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.Tech in Computer Science Engineering / Software Engineering / IT Engineering for 4 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M.Tech for 2-3 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Maths
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.Tech + M.Tech (Dual Degree) for 5 years

work description: Design, build, test, and implement hardware and software applications for computer networks.
Work in research, design, development, testing, and supervision of all aspects of the manufacturing and installing of computer hardware
Advise clients on the right hardware and software for their needs
Provide guidelines regarding system capabilities, user interface, security measures, and other applicable information
Evaluate current systems for effectiveness, make recommendations regarding the scalability of such systems, and troubleshoot any problems that arise during the use of the system.
Review company's security requirements, its use of online applications, and recommend the security measures.
Retrieve data for analysis of system capabilities.

pros: Software/Computer Engineers earn decently well
The work environment and infrastructure is high quality
Always in high demand
cons: It can be stressful at times, since work load is more
Always have stay updated on new technologies and systems
Can result in illnesses realted to eyesight or posture due to sitting for long hours

career-in-development-studies-in-india.title: Development Studies
career-in-development-studies-in-india.summary: Development studies is an interdisciplinary branch of social sciences. This is majorly emerging in the third world countries where they have topics and domains to cover under developmental studies. Developmental studies is a theoretical, inclusive and soul searching enterprise. The primary focus of developmental studies is to study the improvement in people’s life. It helps you get insight into developmental theory, understanding of the structural issues and questions of development. A student pursuing Developmental Studies would attend to various topics such as rural and urban development, philosophy of development research, law and development, women studies etc. Various professional opportunities arise in developmental studies such as in UN, intergovernemental organization, NGOs, journalistic jobs, private sector consultancy firms etc. A career in developmental studies will help you in being involved in your own country’s development and attend to various demands of it.

career-opportunities.consulting_firms: Developmental studies opens up professional opportunities in various consulting and aid firms in private sector PwC, KPMG etc.
career-opportunities.ngos_and_trusts: Most of the NGOs hire people with a degree in developmental studies such as SMILE Foundation, Pratham, GOONJ etc. Sir Dorabji Tata Trust & Allied Trusts: Tata Trusts also work towards the society.
career-opportunities.media_houses: You can look for jobs in Media Houses as a Journalist if you love to write. Apart form that, your work role would include working with social media, activist media, participatory media and specialised broadcast media to inform and engage public social topics like social inequality, human rights, gender issues and environmental change.
career-opportunities.government_organizations: Job opportunities are available in UN, inter governemental organizations as social worker and policy analyst wherein they are directly involved in understanding the development, history and provide with innovative ideas to foster development. Doors to Civil services also opens from here.
career-opportunities.academics: Individuals pursuing developmental studies can also land up in academic area such as in school and colleges, wherein they will teach students about the developmental studies and impart their own knowledge.
career-opportunities.research: As developmental studies course privides with a huge study area, so the individual studies about a lot of things in which they can go for research through the help of their mentors and/or professors or by joining an organization which would provide with the aid for it.

path 1.stream: Class XII with any stream
path 1.graduation: Pursure Bachelors degree in Social Sciences and Humanities (Psychology/History/P.Sc,etc.)
path 1.after graduation: Pursue Masters degree in Developmental Studies

path 2.stream: Class XII with any stream
path 2.graduation: Pursure Bachelors degree in Developmental studies
path 2.after graduation: Pursue Masters degree in Developmental Studies

career-in-development-studies-in-india.Important Facts: To get into a bachelor's program, one must have qualified 10+2 from a recognized board and obtained 55% marksColleges at Master's level conduct entrance exams.
work description: A career in development studies involves being engaged in policy making decision, policy changes, evaluating it etc.
It also involves working as a social worker and attending to the personal needs of the communities and understanding as well as solving the alleviating issues of the society.
Journalistic developmentalists are directly involved in covering sensitive issues related to women, society and talk about the development of the nation.
Governmental organizations also hire development studies students as they provide with suggestions and advices on better development of a nation by attending to various issues.
A role of teacher of development studies is to attend to curriculum and impart their own knowledge and experience to the students.

pros: This provides with a sense of internal satisfaction for doing your bit towards the betterment of the society through understanding the pertaining issues and addressing to them.
Provides with the in depth knowledge and information about the culture, heritage and history of various domains.
Subject also covers huge array of topics such as politics, economics, sociology, psychology, media studies etc.
cons: Requires investment of time and effort for research.
It also involves long working hours and emotional toll on the individuals.

career-in-electrical-electronics-enginee.title: Electrical and Electronics Engineering
career-in-electrical-electronics-enginee.summary: Electrical and Electronics Engineers design, maintain and develop electrical control systems and equipment. They work keeping in view economy and precision of their methodology to build reliable systems that find place across various domains including transportation, telecommunications, power generation, signal transmission and distribution and scientific research. Electrical Engineers concern themselves with developing circuits and generating, distributing and using electrical energy. Whereas, Electronics engineers are concerned about the behavior of these circuits and manipulating them to work automatically. The applications of electrical/ electronic engineering are quite diverse ranging from houses to commercial offices to industries. With the boom in the electronics sector in India, aspirants looking for a specialization in this branch of engineering are likely to have extremely good future prospects.

career-opportunities.electric_power_generation_transmission_a: Electrical & Electronics Engineers can work across industries such as telecom, transportation network, IT, airplane & airspace manufacturing, and production, transmission, measurement & distribution of power.
career-opportunities.navigational_measuring_electrometrical_c: Engineers in this field design, develop and maintain the electrical, electronics and computer control system to the required specifications, while focusing on economy, reliability, safety, sustainability and quality.
career-opportunities.semiconductor_and_other_electronic_compo: Electrical & Electronics Engineers supervise the manufacturing of sensitive electronic components and devices.
career-opportunities.machinery_manufacturing: Electrical & Electronics Engineers help manufacture machinery equipment/ hardware.
career-opportunities.implementation_of_processing_in_equipmen: Electronic Engineers help in implementing algorithms and principles for inculcating self-processing capabilities in electrical equipment.
career-opportunities.academics_and_research: Engineers in this field can go for teaching and research positions related to electrical and electronics domain.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Maths
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.Tech in Electrical Engineering / Electrical and Electronics Engineering / Electronics and Communication Engineering for 4 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M.Tech for 2-3 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Maths
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.Tech + M.Tech (Dual Degree)in Electrical Engineering for 5 years

work description: Design new products, write down requirements for their enhanced performance, as well as develop maintenance schedules and charts.
Test equipment and machinery, solve operational problems, estimate time and cost of electrical and electronic products.

Supervise the production of electrical and electronic equipments and machinery such as broadcast and telecommunication systems, electric motors, controls of machinery, lights and wiring in building complexes, vehicles, aircraft, radar and navigation systems.
Utilize ferroelectric, nonlinear, photo-conductive, and thermoelectric properties of materials.
Develop new applications of conductance of metallic & non-metallic materials to be used in components.
Estimate material, construction, and labour costs, and project timescales
Evaluate electrical systems, products, components, and applications by designing and conducting research programmes.

pros: Opens up a wide number of opportunities in sectors like telecommunication, power, railways, aerospace, IT and artificial intelligence. Hence the scope of it remains wide.
Greater flexibility in switching from one industry to another as the application of Electrical and Electronics remains prevalent in multiple industries.
Ample number of opportunities in both public and private sector.
cons: Risk associated with the hazardous profile of the job.
Never-ending process of learning/certifications as the engineer needs to be updated on newer process like signal processing and biomedical research.
Monetary Packages are expected to grow with substantial experience.

career-in-environmental-engineering-in-i.title: Environmental Engineering
career-in-environmental-engineering-in-i.summary: Environmental Engineers evaluate, study and manage the detrimental effects of human activity on the environment. They find solutions for issues concerning pollution and public health. Their work primarily revolves around three areas - waste management and disposal, reclamation of degraded land and control of pollutants. They also study the impact of technology advancements on environment. With the increasing focus of international and national bodies/ government towards environment conservation, the future prospects for environmental engineers are extremely bright.

career-opportunities.agricultural_engineers: An agricultural engineer makes farming sustainable, safe, and environmentally friendly. They analyze agricultural operations and weigh the use of new technologies and methods to increase yields, improve land use, and conserve resources like seed, water, fertilizers, pesticides and fuel.
career-opportunities.biologists: Biologists study biotic forms like plants and animals and the world they live in. It is a good field for people interested in the natural world and who enjoy practical science.
career-opportunities.chemical_engineers: Chemical Engineers work principally in the chemical industry to convert basic raw materials into a variety of products.
career-opportunities.analytical_chemists: Analytical chemists use a diverse range of methods to investigate the chemical nature of substances. The aim of such work is to identify and understand substances and how they behave in different conditions.
career-opportunities.recycling_plants: Environmental Engineers develop technologies to recycle waste material and ensure their proper utilization.
career-opportunities.ecologists: Ecologists are concerned with ecosystems as a whole, the abundance and distribution of organisms (people, plants, animals), and the relationships between organisms and their environment.
career-opportunities.legal_consultants: Environmental Engineers often work as advisors to legal firms dealing with issues and companies involved in environmental degradation.
career-opportunities.conservationist: Environmental Engineers work towards innovating processes related to conservation of air, soil and water. They work with Government, NGOs as well as multinationals engaged in this act.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.Tech in Environmental Engineering for 4 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M.Tech for 2-3 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.Tech + M.Tech (Dual Degree)in Environmental Engineering for 5 years

work description: Supervise the design of systems, processes, or equipments for control, management, or remediation of water, air, or soil quality.
Collaborate with environmental scientists, planners, hazardous waste technicians, engineers, or other specialists to address environmental problems.
Provide technical support for environmental remediation of projects, including remediation system designing or determination of regulatory applicability.
Prepare hazardous waste manifests or land disposal restriction notifications.
Assess the existing or potential environmental impact of projects on air, water, or land.
Prepare, maintain, or revise quality assurance documentation or procedures.
Assist in budget implementation, forecasts, or administration.
Provide environmental engineering assistance in network analysis, regulatory analysis, or planning or reviewing database development.

pros: Can work in a number of settings. No need to be restricted to Office.
Most work is to be done in a team, which is less burdening.
Satisfaction of helping the environment.
cons: Having to deal with deadlines can be stressful.
Working in polluted or hazardous environment much of the time.
Salary will only increase with experience and hard-work.

career-in-epidemiology-in-india.title: Epidemiology
career-in-epidemiology-in-india.summary: Epidemiology is a discipline which studies how diseases occur to different groups of people and why do they occur. All the information regarding diseases is used to plan and develop strategies which is used to prevent illness. Epidemiologists work as statisticians who work in government offices to find patterns in health related problems. Epidemiologists can be grouped into two categories- Research field and Clinical field. Research epidemiologists conduct research as to develop strategies that can eradicate or control infectious diseases. Clinical epidemiologists work in consulting roles at hospitals, informing the medical staff of infectious diseases and providing solutions to prevent illnesses.

career-opportunities.survey_researchers__statisticians: Survey researchers design surveys and questionnaires. They collect the data from their target population, analyze it from those surveys using statistics tools and present their findings from the data interpreted. Topics of surveys can range from public opinion and education to medical and scientific domains.
career-opportunities.community_health_workers: Community health workers work with the general public in order to teach them the importance of healthy behaviors and implement public health strategies. Their duties often include collection and analysis of health related data as well as implementation of community wellness programs and strategies to prevent illness.
career-opportunities.academics: As an academician, you can teach in various schools or colleges. For school teaching, a Bachelors in Education degree is required. However, to teach college students you have to crack UGC-NET entrance exam. As an academician, you work closely with students who aspire to work for community in future.
career-opportunities.veterinary_epidemiologist: Veterinary Epidemiologists specialize in understanding the diseases occurring in animals. They conduct research so find out important information about the kind of disease, its impact, how it can be transmitted to humans and other animals, what treatments can control the disease and which individuals are most at risk.
career-opportunities.pharmaceutical_epidemiologist: A pharmaceutical epidemiologist has to study the cause, effects, and spread of substance abuse condition in the society. They conduct research on the effects of pharmaceuticals on human health and physiology, and meanwhile track social trends and habits that can lead to the spread of the condition. They try to plot these trends and predict outcomes.
career-opportunities.molecular_epidemiologist: Molecular Epidemiologist are involved in medical research. They try to understand of how the interactions between genetic traits and environmental exposures result in a specific disease. They understand the molecular outcomes and implications of one’s diet, lifestyle, and environmental exposure.
career-opportunities.disaster_epidemiologist: A Disaster Epidemiologist focuses on acute and communicable diseases, environmental health, occupational health, chronic diseases, injuries, mental health, and behavioral health. They provide us situational awareness and help us understand the scenario, and gather the appropriate resources. They help us in preventing or reducing the number of deaths, illnesses, and injuries caused by disasters. They also help in executing prevention and mitigation strategies for future disasters.
career-opportunities.supervisory_epidemiologist: A Supervisory Epidemiologist is involved in a supervisory role such as managing personnel, balancing budgets etc. They focus on a variety of areas such as substance abuse, pharmaceutical development, communicable disease, etc.
career-opportunities.infection_control_epidemiologist: An Infection Control Epidemiologist has to research, monitor, and analyze various infectious diseases. They often educate policy makers and the public about diseases and provide them strategies to prevent illness.

path 1.stream: Pursue XII with Science Stream (PCB as the recommended combination)
path 1.graduation: Pursue MBBS/BDS/MOT/MPT/BVS/AYUSH/Engineering/Pharmacy/Physiotherapy/Occupational Therapy/Nursing/Veterinary Sciences for 3-5 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue Masters of Public Health/ M.Sc. Biostatistics and Epidemiology for 2 years

path 2.stream: Pursue XII with Science Stream (PCB as the recommended combination)
path 2.graduation: Pursue Bachelors in Public Health for 3 years
path 2.after graduation: Pursue Masters of Public Health/ M.Sc. Biostatistics and Epidemiology for 2 years

path 3.stream: Pursue XII with any Stream (Science as the recommended stream)
path 3.graduation: Pursue Bachelors in Sociology/Economics/Psychology/Nutrition/Anthropology/Social Work for 3 years
path 3.after graduation: Pursue Masters of Public Health for 2 years

career-in-epidemiology-in-india.Important Facts: Must have passed class 12th or Senior Secondary Examination with at least 50% marks including English

2.name: Birla Institute of Technology and Science

6.name: Jawaharlal Nehru University- School of Social Sciences, Centre of Social Medicine and Community Health

8.name: MJRP College of Health Care and Allied Sciences

12.name: Postgraduate Institute of Medical Education and Research : School of Public Health

entrance exam.name: CET
entrance exam.elements: General Aptitude, Allied Health Sciences (Biotechnology, Biochemistry, Microbiology and Entomology), Public Health

entrance exam.name: TISS-NET
entrance exam.elements: Social Sensitivity, Logical Reasoning, Analytical Ability, Knowledge on contemporary issues

work description: Gathering medical and health related information, indepth research, analyzing data and presenting the findings.
Designing & implementing strategies in order to treat public health problems.
Management of initiatives taken to promote public health based on current research data and analysis.
Development and improvement of public health strategies and methodology.

pros: The job profile gives you an opportunity to work closely with people.
Epidemiologists are employed in pharmaceutical and medical manufacturing industry and take a good amount of salary.
Epidemiologists contribute to public health by investigating causes and prevention of diseases.
cons: The study of epidemiology involves extensive training in order study diseases and how they affect a given group of people.
The study requires you to spend a lot of time in collecting data and analyzing it.

career-in-foreign-language-in-india.title: Language
career-in-foreign-language-in-india.summary: Proficiency and fluency in a foreign language can open up the gates for a lucrative career in various sectors such as diplomatic services, entertainment, tourism, embassies, international organizations, public relations and mass communication, publishing, interpretation and translation, etc.

career-opportunities.diplomatic_services: Foreign Language Proficiency can prove to be a great asset for career in diplomatic services. Indian Foreign Services is a great career to be looked at. An IFS officer is expected to deal with the external affairs of the country including diplomacy, trade and cultural relations. Even for higher positions in embassies, one needs to clear the IFS exam.
career-opportunities.teaching: One might be interested to work as a foreign language teacher in schools by having a masters in a foreign language or in colleges by pursuing a PhD in foreign language.
career-opportunities.translator_interpreter_jobs: The job of a translator is to convert written words from a 'source' language into a 'target' language. Interpreters convert information from one spoken language into another. After pursuing a diploma course in translation one can find jobs in the embassies or in Multi national companies. One can also consider the option of working as a freelance writer and translator.
career-opportunities.hospitality_and_tourism: A degree in foreign language is an added asset for people pursuing careers in hospitality or tourism.
career-opportunities.public_relations_and_mass_communication: Learning a foreign language can pave way for a career in media, PR and Mass communication.
career-opportunities.air_hostessflight_steward: Foreign languages can help provide a great foundation to the crew of airplanes. It builds a good image for the airline as well as provides ease of communication.

path 1.stream: Class XII with Any Stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue graduation in any subject for 3 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue Certificate course/ Diploma course for 1 year

path 2.stream: Class XII with any stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.A.(H) Language for 3 years
path 2.after graduation: Pursue Post Graduate Diploma in foreign language

path 3.stream: Class XII with any stream
path 3.graduation: Pursue B.A.(H) Foreign Language for 3 years
path 3.after graduation: Pursue Masters in Language for 2 years in India or Abroad ( 1 year)

career-in-foreign-language-in-india.Important Facts: Most colleges have eligibility criteria of minimum 50% aggregate marks in Class XII.No mandatory subject in Class XII. Most of the institutes for post-graduation require bachelors in any field. For Lecturership in Language, National Educational Test (NET) or Ph.D. is mandatory There are various other colleges in Delhi University who offer this course.

9.name: India China Chamber of Commerce & Industry

10.name: Bharatiya Vidya Bhavan, Jawaharlal Nehru Academy of Languages, New Delhi

work description: Conduct a variety of language-based studies, experiments and consultations
Assist in acquiring knowledge of languages for purposes such as historical examinations, code breaking, etc.
Take classes in linguistics at colleges and universities
Give advice to marketing firms and publishing companies on what language to use in advertising and promotions
Predict trends in pronunciation, slang or diction
Develop speech recognition software, check for proper grammar or provide a better understanding of how language is affected by computer use
Convert concepts in the source language to equivalent concepts in the target language during translation
Language guides ensure that foreign visitors are able to communicate effectively during their stay.
Convert journal articles, books, poetry, and short stories from one language into another language

pros: Wide range of scope and different areas of work to choose from
It is an interesting career choice and helps in understanding a language’s history
cons: The demand for every language can fluctuate at different times
It can be difficult to learn an entirely new language

career-in-gender-studies-in-india.title: Gender/Women Studies
career-in-gender-studies-in-india.summary: The field of study recognises that gender, like other markers of caste/class is an important factor to examine socioeconomic, cultural and political issues of our country. This course of study allows one to learn the history of gender studies, how these differences were evolved and how it affects the socio-political economy of our country. This will equip you with requisite skills to do proper planning and make policies for the betterment of the society with issues relating to gender.

career-opportunities.government_and_community_organizations: You can work with various government and community setups to work for a common goal/agenda with respect to Gender and societial issues.
career-opportunities.arts_and_media: You can work in the field of public relations, and media, where you will be publishing articles/blogs on feminist activism, or you will be indulging in grant writing, advocating and promoting women power through strong channels.
career-opportunities.politics_and_law: You can also choose to advocate for social change. You could work with various protective agencies, law firms, social international development organizations, as a person to reform and fight for gender rights and equality. You can take up cases, and create awareness.
career-opportunities.educational_sector: You can work in the field of education and research, where the roles could vary from a lecturer, teacher, activist, to career counsellor.
career-opportunities.mental_health_facilities: You can combine your major of gender studies with a medical field, and expand your job opportunity in the field of mental health care, family care, old age institutions, etc.
career-opportunities.nonprofit_organizations_as_a_social_acti: You can work as a Social Activist to bring about changes in our economy with knowledge about gender equality and policies. You can join non-profit organizations operating at an international level which will help you shape your career with global reach.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII with any stream (humanities recommended)
path 1.graduation: Pursue Bachelor’s with one of the major as Gender studies for 3 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue MA in Gender studies for 2 years.

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII with any stream (humanities recommended)
path 2.graduation: Pursue BA. In Social work/Political science/history/psychology/Ecnomics, etc for 3 years.
path 2.after graduation: Pursue MA in Gender studies for 2 years.

path 3.stream: Clear Class XII with any stream
path 3.graduation: Pursue your bachelors preferably in the field of humanities and sciences (Any field) for 3 years.
path 3.after graduation: Pursue MA in Gender studies for 2 years.

career-in-gender-studies-in-india.Important Facts: Most college have eligibility criteria of minimum 50% aggregate marks in Class XII / and some of minimum 60%. Some colleges/universities also have an age limit.This course is available mostly at post graduate level. Many colleges offer Women Studies instead Gender studies, which majorly falls in the same line.

1.name: Indian Institute of Psychology and Research

3.name: Rajiv Gandhi National Institute of Youth Development.

7.name: Center of Gender Studies, University of Hyderabad

work description: You would be working with people all the time, be it in the field of media and communication, or any social service, your ability to persuade people and connect with them is paramount.
You have to gather information and data, to derive proper analysis of key issues of society.
Writing, critical thinking, and good communication skills, are required in any kind of job after this career. Writing and expressing your view, without hurting masses, is a large part of the job.

pros: Prestige: They generally innovate and improve existing norms, working on various models, creating a change in the society overall. This makes the profession highly demanded and unique, where the work is attached with prestige.
Diverse: You can work in variety of setups after a major in Gender studies, and it allows you to project yourself in couple of areas, working towards creating a change or awareness.
Networking: This career improves your networking skills, and helps you connect with like-minded educated people.
cons: Job security: Since this career has less entrants, finding the perfect job for yourself could be challenging. Stability is more likely in later years of the career.
Salary: The salary prospects are not very high at the start of the career.

career-in-indian-economic-services.title: Indian Economic Service
career-in-indian-economic-services.summary: Indian Economic Service (IES) is an administrative inter-ministerial civil service under group A of the central civil services of the Government of India. In IES one undertakes economic analysis and render information for designing and formulating developmental policies, also monitoring and evaluating various public programs. As it is inter-ministerial therefore the IES officers serve in diverse areas such as policy making, rural developments, social sector, industry, trade etc. Apart from this, IES officers also go for deputation to serve in UN bodies, foreign government, state government etc. Recruitment is based on All India Open Competitive Examination called as IES examination, conducted by the Union Public Service Comission.

career-opportunities.adviser: Chief economic adviser is the ex-officio cadre controlling authority of Indian Economic Service. The CEA reports directly to the Minister of Finance and advises Government of India on matters related to finance, trade, industry etc.
career-opportunities.policy_making: ES supports the government with Policy Making and Development in various areas like Finance, Rural Development, Urban Development, Health Sector, Agro based Sector, Education Sector etc.
career-opportunities.monitoring_and_evaluation: The budgets and policies that are laid by the Government in former years are evaluated and monitored by IES officers. There is frequent monitoring which is required to undersatnd how the Annual budget shoud be planned and if the existent policies and plans are in sync with the changing trends or not.
career-opportunities.deputation_in_different_departments: Besides the above mentioned roles, IES also works as a delegate in bodies like UN, state and foreign government, central ministries and departements.

path 1.stream: Class XII with any stream with/without economics (Mathematics is compulsory)
path 1.graduation: Pursue Bachelor of Arts in Economics/ Applied Economics/ Business Economics/ Econometrics for 3 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue Masters of Arts in Economics/ Applied Economics/ Business Economics/ Econometrics for 2 years

path 2.stream: Class XII with any stream with/without economics (Mathematics is complusory)
path 2.graduation: Pursue Bachelors of Arts in any related discipline eg- economics, statistics, Mathematics etc.
path 2.after graduation: Pursure Masters of arts in Economics/ Applied Economics/ Business Economics/ Econometrics for 2 years

career-in-indian-economic-services.Important Facts: A post graduate degree in Economics/ Applied Economics/ Business Economics/ Econometrics is required.Age should be between 21 years to 30 years.

entrance exam.name: UPSC IES
entrance exam.elements: General English General Studies General Economics-I (including two parts)General Economics-II (concept of national income and social accounting etc.)General Economics-III (Public finance, Industrial economics etc.)Indian Economics

work description: Role of the service can be broadly categorized in terms of economic advice, economic administration, implementation of development policy and programmes, besides dealing with other areas such as economic reforms, regulation etc.
IES officers are exposed to various sectors of government functioning and they provide link and continuity in policy making.
Economic Advisers are required to be associated with and involved in the economic reforms in the Ministry/ Department, to which they are posted.
IES officers provide inputs to Departments on all policy related matters, their implementation and evaluation as well.

pros: Directly involved in policy making and implementation of the same which would use and enhance the decision making skills and sense of responsibility.
The prestige and perks which are attached with this job is very high and will continue with you even after retirement.
This job will help you put your economics related skills along with critical thinking into practicality by working for the betterment of the society.
cons: Studying for the entrance exam and clearing it requires huge amount of effort and dedication with extensive in depth study of the material.
For IES, every year, there are limited number of openings (around 30 seats or so), however, lakhs of people apply. Thus, competition is quite high.

career-in-international-relations-in-ind.title: International Relations
career-in-international-relations-in-ind.summary: International Relations is an academic discipline that focuses on studying one’s nation policy with respect to the competitive world. This field helps you to acquire a systematic approach and ability to analyze political circumstances in the global context. International Relations is a perfect course for students who are enthralled by the study of how different countries are connected economically and politically. During this course, one will grasp the concept of interdependence of countries and their relevance in our growing economy.

career-opportunities.diplomat: A diplomat is a person who stays in touch with government officials of foreign state, representing his nation and protecting it by collecting all information affecting his nation’s interest.He/she is responsible for negotiating and mediating all local governmental issues with regard to International Relations.
career-opportunities.intelligence_specialist: An intelligence specialist is responsible for collecting data and information for a mission, and working with the military, the navy, or any other government agency. He/she maintains intelligence databases, files and statistical reports required for a certain mission.
career-opportunities.political_analyst: A political analyst is a person generally recruited by the government for analysing public policies, identifying various political issues for research, and advising political leaders on foreign government policies. Political Analysts can also work with media houses for political research and news.
career-opportunities.lobbyist: A lobbyist is a person who generally represents his/her organisation or institution in front of government officials. His main role is to persuade them to make a decision or an amendment which would benefit the organisation on whole.
career-opportunities.international_lawyer: International lawyers deal with international trade law, finance and banking, and also mediate disputes between countries.
career-opportunities.nonprofit_organizations_as_a_social_acti: You can work as a Social Activist to bring about changes in our economy with knowledge about international politics and peace. You can join non-profit organizations operating at an international level which will help you shape your career with global reach.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in Humanities stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue BA Hons. In Political Science/Economics/History for 3 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue Post- Graduation Program in International Relations 2 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII in any stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue Graduation in any discipline for 3-4 years.
path 2.after graduation: Pursue Post graduate program/MA in International Relations.

career-in-international-relations-in-ind.Important Facts: No mandatory subject in Class XII.The course duration of Bachelor of International Relations is not fixed, and ranges from 1 year to 3 years. The course duration varies with university. Most college have eligibility criteria of minimum 50% aggregate marks in Class XII / and some of minimum 60%. Some colleges/universities also have an age limit.

5.name: Institute of Language Studies and Applied Social Sciences

entrance exam.name: Jindal Admission Test (JAT)
entrance exam.elements: It is an Online Test comprising of 120 Multiple Choice Questions covering logical reasoning, quantitative aptitude (Math) and verbal ability (English).

entrance exam.name: Jawaharlal Nehru University, New Delhi
entrance exam.elements: The written test is intended to evaluate the knowledge of candidates in Political Science, History and Economics and their general awareness of world affairs. The test is based on essay-type questions.

entrance exam.name: Christ University, Bangalore
entrance exam.elements: Entrance Test • Verbal reasoning • Comprehension skills • Language skills • Subject skills Skill Assessment • The skill assessment will consist of a test on written skills, communication skills and logical reasoning. Personal Interview

work description: They take up roles of diplomat, lobbyist, IR specialist, Political analyst, etc.
They study, research and analyze political systems, theories and trends
In corporate field, they advise companies on how to reduce costs and increase revenues through effective global business strategies
They may involve in qualitative and quantitative research methods to extract data and make reports
They should perform duties in line with the ethical standards.

pros: Job security: Since this career has less entrants, the demand of IR professionals never goes down. There are plenty of jobs in different roles for students majored in International Relations.
Prestige: They generally work with Government organizations, working on policies, for the betterment of our Nation. They gain community respect.
Growth: They get an opportunity to learn new languages and work in diverse countries. They get to travel, as well as explore different work roles.
cons: Long training route : To work full time as a IR specialist it requires at least 2-3 types of internships after your Master’s degree in IR. It makes the whole process too long before the person actually gets secure.
Geographical Restraint: International Relations job are specific and professional opportunities would not be in abudance in small cities.
Long work hours, high stress and patience : The job is very demanding. It requires physical, mental and emotional involvement and drains his/her energy.

career-in-marine-engineering-in-india.title: Marine Engineering
career-in-marine-engineering-in-india.summary: A Marine Engineer works with ships and sailboats, right from their design, down to management. Their work ranges from designing, building, testing and repairing of ships, carriers, barges, cargos, drilling equipment and platforms at sea. They deal with the mechanical facets of the ships like steering and propulsion, and some even venture out into ship designing and naval architecture.

career-opportunities.operation_maintenance_and_construction: Marine Engineers in this profile design, maintain and construct naval ships and vessels. They also are vested with the responsibility of technical management of the ship.
career-opportunities.junior_engineer: Junior engineers assist senior engineers who take a lead on planning, design and construction of naval infrastructures.
career-opportunities.professor: Marine Engineers in this profile teach courses pertaining to the application of physical laws and principles of engineering for the development of machines, materials, instruments, processes, and services.
career-opportunities.research_and_development_rd: Marine Engineers in this field examine ships and offshore installations, looking at their seaworthiness, safety and maintenance needs.
career-opportunities.design_engineer: Marine engineers are employed to design marine structures, for safety as well as to survive the hazards of the marine bodies.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.Tech in Marine Engineering / Ocean Engineering for 4 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M.Tech in Marine Engineering for 2-3 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.Tech in Marine Engineering / Ocean Engineering for 4 years
path 2.after graduation: Pursue GME (Graduate Marine Engineering)

path 3.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream
path 3.graduation: Pursue B.Tech in Marine Engineering / Ocean Engineering for 4 years
path 3.after graduation: Pursue Post Graduate Diploma for 1 year

work description: Work towards designing, construction and development of ships, boats and other marine machinery
Design, build and operate offshore platforms and rigs
Examine ships to evaluate and ensure their sea worthiness and overall safety
Aquire knowledge about all kinds of ships from cargo ships to ferries to cruise liners and military ships
Coordinate with concerned personnel to resolve problems as well as develop or modify designs
Manage the procurement of material and equipment necessary for building and repairing of marine equipments

pros: Rewarding in terms of passion for sea
Rewarding in terms of pay package and perks
Opportunties to travel and explore
cons: Maybe somewhat a hectic job
May have to stay at sea for long periods
Sea-Sickness may occur

career-in-mechanical-automobile-engineer.title: Mechanical and Automobile Engineering
career-in-mechanical-automobile-engineer.summary: Mechanical Engineers are solution providers for development of processes and products that range from tiny component designs to mega manufacturing plants. Likewise, automobile engineers design, facilitate and develop designs of vehicles like cars and motorbikes. Coming from very diverse disciplines of engineering, mechanical/automobile engineers can work right from inception stage, R&D of their product to its final commissioning. They take care of the mechanical, electronic, electric, software and safety elements during the manufacturing.

career-opportunities.design: Mechanical Engineers draft technical drawings, manually or with the aid of computers.
career-opportunities.production: Mechanical Engineers supervise the manufacturing of mechanical components and machines.
career-opportunities.analysis_and_testing: Mechanical Engineers analyze and test different types of machines and their parts to ensure that they function flawlessly.
career-opportunities.installation: Mechanical Engineers install machines and mechanical parts at their client's location.
career-opportunities.maintenance: Mechanical Engineers primarily ensure that machinery is working as per specifications.
career-opportunities.maintenance_of_aircraft_or_missiles: Mechanical Engineers with specialization in Aircraft technology, test new aerodynamic and aviation systems and maintain them.
career-opportunities.structural_engineering: Mechanical Engineers help create structural elements of design, for bridges & skyscrapers and also design and assess major civil projects, such as buildings, bridges, or dams, to ensure their strength and durability.
career-opportunities.aesthetic_compatibility: Mechanical Engineers design machines keeping in mind the aesthetic compatibility of the design with its use.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Maths
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.Tech in Mechanical/ Automobile Engineering for 4 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M.Tech for 2-3 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Maths
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.Tech + M.Tech (Dual Degree)in Mechanical/ Automobile Engineering for 5 years

career-in-mechanical-automobile-engineer.Important Facts: Most colleges have eligibility criteria of minimum 50% aggregate marks in Class XII and some of minimum 60%Must have passed class 12thor senior secondary examination with at least 50% marks including English Some exams require JEE score as minimum eligibility Some colleges/ universities also have an age limit Mechanical & Automobile Engineering is available as a course only in select colleges. Specializations are also available in select colleges.

Monitor and commission plant and systems

career-in-mining-engineering-in-india.title: Mining Engineering
career-in-mining-engineering-in-india.summary: Mining engineering examines the viability, safety and output of potential mines. Mining engineers ensure safe and efficient development of mines and optimize extraction of ore reserves. They also carry out research and develop equipment that reduce the environmental impact of mining and closely work with geotech, surveying and metallurgy experts.

career-opportunities.consultant: Consultants conduct sub-surface surveys to identify the characteristics of potential mining development sites. They specify the ground support systems, processes and equipment for safe, economical, and environmentally sound extraction or underground construction activities. They also inspect areas for unsafe geological conditions, equipment, and working conditions.
career-opportunities.production_manager: Mine managers are responsible for planning, organizing and supervising the activities of a mine. They are responsible for planning future mine production, overseeing the development and tunneling of the mine and inspecting the mine for danger. Mine managers also carry out generic management duties, such as hiring staff and liaising and negotiating with suppliers, contractors and other stakeholders.
career-opportunities.operations_manager: Operations managers oversee project engineering activities during the construction phase of the mine. They are responsible for facility planning, process engineering, maintenance and application of automation and advanced technology and engineering work relating to project development.
career-opportunities.health_and_safety_manger_analyst: Health & Safety Analysts support the Health & Safety department in the development and implementation of the Health and Safety Management System (HSMS), Emergency Management Program, and Security Plan.
career-opportunities.mine_planning: Mine Planners examine mining methods and equipment to improve performance, prepare drilling and blasting strategies, develop production strategies & assist with estimating mine plan costs and economic evaluations.
career-opportunities.mine_ventilation_engineer: A mine ventilation engineer ensures a steady supply of fresh & clean air for miners to work in. This means controlling heat and humidity levels that quickly can become overwhelming inside mines and removing noxious gases that may come from the Earth itself as well as the carbon dioxide generated by miners.
career-opportunities.mining_investment_analyst: Mining Investment Analysts develop and maintain financial models for valuation and other purposes. They review and analyze financial statements of private and public companies & also assist senior members of metals & mining team with tracking and analyzing minerals and metals commodity markets.
career-opportunities.petroleum_engineer: Petroleum engineers are involved in nearly all of the stages of oil and gas field evaluation, development and production. Their aim is to maximize hydrocarbon recovery at minimum cost, while maintaining a strong emphasis on reducing environmental impact.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Maths
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.Tech in Mining Engineering for 4 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M.Tech for 2-3 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Maths
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.Tech + M.Tech (Dual Degree) in Miningfor 5 years

work description: Design, implement, and monitor the development of mines, facilities, systems, or equipments.
Examine maps, deposits, drilling locations, or mines to determine the location, size, accessibility,value and potential profitability of mineral, oil, and gas deposits.
Devise solutions to problems of land reclamation, water and air pollution, such as methods of storing excavated soil and turning exhausted mine sites to natural state.
Select or devise material handling methods and equipment to transport ore, waste materials, and mineral products efficiently and economically.
Test air quality to detect toxic gases and recommend measures to remove them, such as installation of ventilation shafts.
Conduct or direct mining operations to test or prove test findings.
Assess the commercial viability of new mining ventures

pros: Interesting subject to study
Provides opportunity to travel in job
Is rewarding in terms of money
cons: May have to work in hazardous conditions
May have to stay away from home for long periods of time
Ups and Downs in mineral market may affect job security

career-in-museology-in-india.title: Museology
career-in-museology-in-india.summary: Museology involves managing and administrating museums. Museology includes aspects of archeology, history, research and archiving. As a Museologist, you can work in museums, the work profile includes the combination of research, administration, and public relations. You can work both in the private/government sectors, museums, and galleries. Museology can be interesting to those students who are interested in fields like history, science of preserving and conserving museum collections.

career-opportunities.curators: As a Curator, you can procure artifacts, create exhibitions and maintain exhibits. They organize the display of artifacts in museums, organize exhibitions by choosing the display items, labelling them, arranging them, making purchases of rare and new collections for museum enrichment, deciding which art objects have to be identified, examined, cleaned, preserved, displayed or stored, and maintaining the record of each item (origin, age and conservation details).
career-opportunities.museum_educationists: Museums provide a learning situation in which the visitors experience learning. Museum Educationists educate people and students visiting to Museums. They decorate exhibition halls, properly arranged secondary collections, label them, arrange guided tours, organize traveling exhibitions, organize school class visits, training courses to the teachers, illustrate lectures, motion pictures, film trips and publications, etc.
career-opportunities.exhibition_coordinators: The exhibition is the only language through which a museum can communicate with large masses so as to create a direct impact on them. Exhibition Coordinators co-ordinate with their team for organizing the exhibition. They have to select the topic of the Exhibition like irrigation, soil conservation, farm management, industry, social welfare, etc. They can use various mediums to aware visitors such as pictures, photographs, drawings, charts, models and other subsidiary materials.
career-opportunities.consultants: The job role of a consultant is to plan and design management strategies, create content, promote exhibitions and other cultural facilities.

path 1.stream: Class XII with any stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue Graduation in any Discipline for 3 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M.A./M.Sc. in Museology for 2 years

career-in-museology-in-india.Important Facts: Must have passed class 12th or Senior Secondary Examination with at least 50% marks including English
