work description: Managing the activities happening in museums on daily basis.
Planning, Organizing and Executing important events and exhibitions in the museums.
Deciding which artefact to display, arrange them, label them, writing the relevant information about it.
Organizing film trips and publications, guided tours, school visits, traveling exhibitions etc.

Making decisions about the purchases of rare and new collections for museum enrichment, deciding which art objects have to be identified, examined, cleaned, preserved, displayed or stored, and maintaining the record of each item (origin, age and conservation details).

pros: You can participate in new exhibits, programs, special events frequently happening in the museums.
If you love the academic environment, museums would be a great place to work as it involves educating large masses.
If you love to travel, you can be the part of various travel exhibitions, tours, school visits etc.
cons: There is a lot of competition involved and requires huge time investment to become a curator.
It is not easy to make a lot of money in this area.

career-in-oceanography-in-india.title: Oceanography
career-in-oceanography-in-india.summary: The study of physical and biological aspects of the ocean is called Oceanography or Ocenology. There are wide range of domains which are studied in oceanography such as ecosystem dynamics, sea life, waves, tides, ocean currents, geology of the sea floor, plate tectonics etc. An oceanographer is a scientist who investigates ecology of marine organisms, chemistry & geology of ocean, physical attributes of ocean such as temperature, waves, tides etc. in detail. Oceanographers play an important role in mitigating the effects of climate change, overpopulation, and overfishing.

career-opportunities.biological_oceanographers: Biological Oceanographers study marine ecosystems, biological process of aquatic plants and animals. They research about plants and animals living in oceans, studies about their natural environment, take trips into ocean, perform experiments, collect data, and keep track of the activities of aquatic animals and plants.
career-opportunities.physical_oceanographers: Physical Oceanographers use satellite technology as it helps them to study the movement of the water, and the forces that cause motion, such as winds, waves and tides. They also study the interaction of ocean with land, atmosphere, weather, climate, water density, temperature, salinity, underwater formations and seafloor. They seek to understand why, where and how water moves, on all space and time scales. Physical Oceanographers requires to use the combination of theory, observations and experiments to study in detail.
career-opportunities.geological_oceanographers: Geological Oceanographers use remote sensing technology to map the ridges and valleys. They study the formations, composition and history of the seafloor. They examine sediment characteristics such as size, shape, color, weight, age, chemical characteristics, origin, distribution and transport in detail. Also, they closely work with biologists and chemical oceanographers to learn more about historical climate records, animals and plants life by examining sediment.
career-opportunities.chemical_oceanographers: Ocean contains many chemical compounds, elements, gases, minerals, organic and particulate matter. Chemical Oceanographers studies formation of seawater, seafloor sediments, relationships between chemical compounds, how chemical inputs to the ocean affect it, how the chemistry of the ocean is affected by the biological, geological, and physical factors. They also study the impact of pollutants when they interact with seawater and marine life.

path 1.stream: Pursue XII with Science Stream (PCB as the recommended combination)
path 1.graduation: Pursue Graduation in the Biology/Physics/Chemistry/Geology/Zoology/Botany/Microbiology for 3 years.
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M.Sc. in Oceanography/Marine Science/Marine Biology/Marine Geology/Aquatic Biology and Fisheries for 2 years

path 2.stream: Pursue XII with Science Stream (PCB as the recommended combination)
path 2.graduation: Pursue Bachelors of Technology for 4 years.
path 2.after graduation: Pursue Masters of Technology in Ocean Technology & Management/Ocean Engineering for 2 years

career-in-oceanography-in-india.Important Facts: Must have passed class 12th or Senior Secondary Examination with at least 50% marks including English

1.name: Cochin University of Science and Technology

entrance exam.name: Graduate Aptitude Test in Engineering
entrance exam.elements: Atmospheric and Ocean Sciences

work description: Performing experiments, collecting data and keeping the track of the activities of plants and animals living in the ocean.
Studying the relationship between the chemical compounds in the sea and how it affects the ocean.
Measure currents, waves, tides, temperature, salt and gas concentrations other fluid movement.
Use satellite for collecting data such as sea temperature, currents, wave heights and patterning, and wind speeds.
Assist with oceanographic instrumentation system design, specification, construction, and documentation

pros: The job profile gives you an opportunity to travel depending upon the area of oceanography research.
As a Oceanographer, you will always explore natural habitats.
You have the ability to contribute to the preservation of the life of oceans and marine life.
cons: You are not always in control of your time schedule. At times, the research work can be hectic and physically demanding.
Oceanography requires you to invest a huge amount of time, energy, effort into studies.
If you have water phobia then it might be a great deal of you as most of your time will be under or near water.

career-in-pharmacy-in-india.title: Pharmacy
career-in-pharmacy-in-india.summary: Pharmacy is a science and technique of preparing, researching, and distributing medicinal drugs. A career in pharmacy will instruct you to work on preparing medicines, and recommend dosages that patients should receive so that they can recover from their illness and remain healthy. Pharmacists are healthcare professionals who are responsible for ensuring that people derive maximum therapeutic benefit from their medicinal treatment.

career-opportunities.pharmaceutical_industry: Pharmacists perform various tasks in the pharmaceutical industry. Such as developing, and manufacturing drugs, research & development, production & manufacturing, packaging, quality control, quality assurance, sales & marketing, and regulating affairs.
career-opportunities.practice_settings: Pharmacists work as community pharmacists in a medical store, or pharmacy, or as a druggist. They may also explore options in a hospital pharmacy. Many pharmacists practice clinical pharmacy, contributing towards drug research, providing drug and poison information etc.
career-opportunities.education__research: You can work as college professor by writing UGC-NET examination and further pursue research in a wide range of areas.
career-opportunities.pharmacists_in_other_settings: Pharmacists can work in the Drug Control Department, Clinical Research Organizations (CRO’s) which can offer ample job opportunities for pharmacists in quality assurance, data management, bio-analytical services, and report writing etc.

path 1.stream: Class XII with science stream Any combination from PCB/PCM/PCBM
path 1.graduation: Pursue Bachelors in Pharmacy (B.Pharm) for 3 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue Masters in Pharmacy (M.Pharm) for 2 years OR Pursue Doctor of Pharmacy (Post- Baccalaureate) for 6 years

path 2.stream: Class XII with science stream Any combination from PCB/PCM/PCBM
path 2.graduation: Pursue Diploma in Pharmacy (D.Pharm) for 2 years You can get a lateral entry to Bachelors in Pharmacy (B.Pharm) 2nd year on the basis of merit.
path 2.after graduation: Pursue Doctor of Pharmacy (Post- Baccalaureate) for 6 years OR Pursue Masters in Pharmacy (M.Pharm) for 2 years if you have got later entry from Diploma to Bachelors in Pharmacy

path 3.stream: Class XII with science stream Any combination from PCB/PCM/PCBM
path 3.graduation: Pursue Doctor of Pharmacy (Pharm.D) for 6 years

work description: Pharmacists working in pharmaceutical industries contribute in developing, and manufacturing drugs.
They work across domains, such as in research & development, production & manufacturing, packaging, quality control, quality assurance, sales & marketing, and regulating affairs.
They can work as community pharmacists in a medical store, or pharmacy, or as a druggist.
Pharmacists in academia, may work as college faculties, teaching classes and performing research in a wide range of areas.
Pharmacists can work in quality assurance, data management, bio-analytical services, and report writing etc.

pros: As a Pharmaceutical researcher, you can research about new drugs, medicines, etc.
Pharmaceuticals sales and marketing is considered to be a highly technical arena and hence one of the best when it comes to perks.
Pharmacy graduates have important role and can earn attractive remuneration when they work as pharmacists in the hospital pharmacy.
cons: Becoming a pharmacist requires years of training and experience.
The work environment varies according to the type of pharmacy. If you’re working in hospital pharmacy then it is open 24-Hour.
Often being associated with being a merchant and not a professional.

career-in-plant-breeding-and-gentics-ind.title: Plant Breeding and Genetics
career-in-plant-breeding-and-gentics-ind.summary: Plant breeding is the science of modification of plant traits in order to produce desired characteristics. Plant breeding can be accomplished through various techniques ranging from selective breeding of plants with desirable characteristics for propagation, to more complex molecular techniques. It is practiced worldwide by farmers and gardeners, or by plant breeders employed by organizations such as universities, crop-specific industries, research centers and government institutions.

career-opportunities.plant_scientists: Plant scientists focus on increasing the amount and quality of food produced by the national food supply.
career-opportunities.rural_practice_surveyor: They provide strategic and practical knowledge to a range of clients on rural land and property.
career-opportunities.soil_scientist: A soil scientist gathers, interprets and evaluates information about different typed of soils to inform and influence issues such as agricultural production, biodiversity, climate change; environmental quality, human health, land remediation.
career-opportunities.agricultural_consultant: Support, solutions and advice is offered by agricultural consultants or advisers to their clients to ensure their enterprise or business is running as effectively and efficiently as possible.
career-opportunities.agroindustry_sector_jobs: The agro-industry sector makes jobs available for scientists, engineers, sales, marketing people and technologists.
career-opportunities.services_sector_jobs: This sector provides jobs to agricultural technicians, graders, agricultural consultants, veterinarians, agricultural statisticians, etc. Jobs by Banks, finance and insurance companies are also available for agriculturists.Many job opportunities are available in estates and tea gardens as well.
career-opportunities.corporations: Various corporations viz. National Seed Corporation, the State farm Corporation, Warehousing Corporation and Food Corporation, etc. provide job opportunities to agriculturists.
career-opportunities.agriculture_management: Farm managers tend to work in either dairy, crop or animal production. Their work includes planning tactics/strategies for the maximum yield, organization of farm administration, working machinery, organization of associated businesses and staff management.
career-opportunities.selfemployed: Free lancers can work in agricultural firms, agriculture product shops and agro-base industries.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in Science Stream with PCB/PCMB
path 1.graduation: Pursue B. Sc Agricultural (Hons.) for 4 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M. Sc in specialization for 2 years

career-in-power-engineering-in-india.title: Power Engineering
career-in-power-engineering-in-india.summary: Power engineering is a sub-field of energy and electrical engineering with focus on generation, transmission, distribution and utilization of electric power and allied accessories like generators, motors and transformers. A power engineer plans, designs, operates, renovates and maintains different systems in electric power generation, minimizes losses in transmission and improves efficiency of power distribution systems.

career-opportunities.electric_power_generation_transmission_a: Power Engineers apply their domain knowledge and acumen to design systems and minimize power losses during generation, transmission and distribution. They coordinate with clients and consultants for all project activities.
career-opportunities.site_manager: Site managers organize and lead regular site coordination meetings. They ensure the implementation of all planned activities at the site and enforce preventative safety measures.
career-opportunities.data_analyst_diagnostic_engineer: Data Analysts define asset condition with health index of all high, medium & low voltage assets. They link current condition to performance, estimate future conditions, performance and remaining life. They also evaluate consequences of failures in across safety, network performance, sustainability and finance.
career-opportunities.maintenance_manager: Maintenance Managers keep a check on the current systems and verify that they are being maintained properly.

path 1.after graduation: Pursue M.Tech for 2-3 years

career-in-public-administration-in-india.title: Public Administration
career-in-public-administration-in-india.summary: Public Administration deals with the aim to study development, organization and implementation of government policies and prepare civil servants for their work. The understanding of this subject helps in increasing the efficiency of human, financial and material resources, and also helps governmental institutions become more efficient and organized.

career-opportunities.administrative_officers: A wide range of government occupations, from civil servants to legislature to intelligence bodies, are available for those with a major in Public Administration. Administrators in Central, State and Local Government are engaged in administration and management of functions of the Government.
career-opportunities.consultants: The consultants conduct research relating to budgeting and financial analysis, public relations or marketing, shaping organizational policy, program development and implementation. Consultants may be employed in public or private sectors who lead different organizations.
career-opportunities.teaching_professions: Employment opportunities for individuals with public administration majors are available at the school level and at the college level.
career-opportunities.corporate_manager: Corporate Managers are employed by government agencies, small businesses, health care and educational institutions. As a public administrator graduate is trained in these skills, he may seek positions in organizational management or programme management in the public or private sector.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in any Stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue Bachelors in Public Administration/Political Science for 3 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue Masters in Public Administration for 2 years in India or Abroad to become a public administrator.

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII in any Stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.A.(H) Public Administration/any subject for 3 years
path 2.after graduation: Pursue Masters in Public Administration for 2 years in India or Abroad

work description: Maintaining public well being
Manage city budgets, develop policy and legislation, draft and implement policies
Analyze data to determine and solve public needs and ensuring security, etc
Evaluate programmes and policies, and make related recommendations to institutions and organizations
Implementing information technologies.
Analyzing information and conducting safety inspections

pros: Great option for entering into fields like Law, Politics, Government services etc.
Helps in critically analyse and review public policies of the government.
Scoring subject and a good foundation course for government services
cons: Not a professional course
Needs administrative skills to be sharp
Needs Master’s degree for good job opportunities

career-in-railways-in-india.title: Railways
career-in-railways-in-india.summary: Indian Railways hold within itself, a vast plethora of opportunities. One may be absorbed in any of the related fields, depending on the skill-set of the individual. Broadly speaking, the Indian Railways is sub- divided into 9 major zones, each of which comes under the purview of the Railway Board, Ministry of Railways. Along with a fixed salary and a pension after retirement, an employee of the Indian Railways is entitled to a variety of other perks, including free train passes for themselves and their families, accommodation at very minimal prices at railway guesthouses throughout the country, as well as educational and healthcare facilities for their family and children. Owing to these benefits, employees of the railways are successfully able to maintain a good work- life balance.

career-opportunities.indian_railway_personnel_service_irps: As an IRPS officer, one is accountable for all affairs regarding the personnel working in a particular division. The responsibilities of an IRPS officer include recruitment of new staff, training the new employees, and handling the promotions of employees. They also look after the welfare of the staff as well as matters regarding their transfers.
career-opportunities.engineering_sector: The railway is a good career option after a degree in engineering. One can be employed as a locomotive engineer, responsible primarily for inspection of the train as well as its mechanics during the operations, or as a locomotive superintendent, who assesses the overall performance of the train as well as maintains a record of the delays in the services, if any. A third option is railroad engineer or the engine driver.
career-opportunities.revenue_sector: One may be employed as a train ticket examiner (TTE), ticket controller or a revenue protection inspector (RPI), responsible for patrolling the public modes of transport. Also, the RPI maintains decorum by issuing penalties to the passengers who are travelling on the train without a ticket.
career-opportunities.station_master: The station master and the assistant station master are in- charge of the entire daily schedule of the trains arriving at and leaving from a particular station. They coordinate among the various departments such as signals and operations in order to ensure a smooth management and delivery of services. Since this requires a lot of work, big stations may have more than one station master.
career-opportunities.others: Other career options in railways include track inspector, rail navigator, conductor, guard and fireman.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII with PCM
path 1.graduation: Graduation in Physics, Mathematics or Chemistry
path 1.after graduation: Special Class Railway Apprentices' Examination, Civil Services Examination

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII with Science stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.Tech for 4 years (any specialization)
path 2.after graduation: Combined Engineering Services Examination (CES)

career-in-railways-in-india.Important Facts: For SC/ ST candidates: 5 yearsFor OBC candidates: 3 years For PWD candidates: Up to 15 years For Ex- Servicemen: 3 years in addition to the extent of service rendered For candidates with a domicile of Jammu & Kashmir (between 1980 to 1989 only): 5 years The degree must be obtained from a recognized institution, or one which has been approved by the AICTE. Information regarding the vacancies at various levels can be found on the website of the Centre for Railway Information Systems (CRIS).

entrance exam.elements: General Awareness, Mathematics, General Intelligence, Reasoning

work description: Maintain the trains including mechanical working and sanitation of the compartments
Keep a track of the schedule of the trains
Supervise the traffic control, dispatchers and cargo teams
Provide highest level of convenience to passengers while they are travelling
Make sure that all the safety measures are in place
Employ the latest techniques and equipments in railway department for efficiency
Monitor speed, air pressure, battery use, and other instruments to ensure a smooth ride

pros: Respect in the society, job satisfaction & security
Opportunity to serve your nation
High remuneration as well as perks
cons: Frequent transfer and disturbance in children's education.
Can't change your job at your will.
Can be sometimes stressful to work in such environment.

career-in-soil-sciences-india.title: Soil Science
career-in-soil-sciences-india.summary: Soil science involves the in-depth study of soil as an environmental reserve, including the study of soil formation, physical, biological, chemical and fertility properties of soils; and these properties in relation to the use and management of soils. It also includes the classification and mapping of soil properties. Soil scientists are interested in exploring and understanding the nature of earth’s water and land resources. Soil science students learn to identify, interpret, and manage soils for forestry, agriculture, rangeland, urban uses, ecosystems, mining and reclamation in a way that is environmentally conscious.

career-opportunities.plant_scientists: Plant scientists focus on increasing the amount and quality of food produced by the national food supply.
career-opportunities.rural_practice_surveyor: They provide strategic and practical knowledge to a range of clients on rural land and property.
career-opportunities.soil_scientist: A soil scientist gathers, interprets and evaluates information about different typed of soils to inform and influence issues such as agricultural production, biodiversity, climate change; environmental quality, human health, land remediation.
career-opportunities.agricultural_consultant: Support, solutions and advice is offered by agricultural consultants or advisers to their clients to ensure their enterprise or business is running as effectively and efficiently as possible.
career-opportunities.agroindustry_sector_jobs: The agro-industry sector makes jobs available for scientists, engineers, sales, marketing people and technologists.
career-opportunities.services_sector_jobs: This sector provides jobs to agricultural technicians, graders, agricultural consultants, veterinarians, agricultural statisticians, etc. Jobs by Banks, finance and insurance companies are also available for agriculturists.Many job opportunities are available in estates and tea gardens as well.
career-opportunities.corporations: Various corporations viz. National Seed Corporation, the State farm Corporation, Warehousing Corporation and Food Corporation, etc. provide job opportunities to agriculturists.
career-opportunities.agriculture_management: Farm managers tend to work in either dairy, crop or animal production. Their work includes planning tactics/strategies for the maximum yield, organization of farm administration, working machinery, organization of associated businesses and staff management.
career-opportunities.selfemployed: Free lancers can work in agricultural firms, agriculture product shops and agro-base industries.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in Science Stream with PCB/PCMB
path 1.graduation: Pursue B. Sc. Agricultural (Hons.) for 4 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M. Sc. in specialization for 2 years

Since the number of individuals pursuing this course are still limited, with the right type of education and training, you can be in great demand in the job market.
cons: The salaries are average.
It involves work in the fields, which might not be appealing to some people.

career-in-sound-engineering-in-india.title: Sound Engineering
career-in-sound-engineering-in-india.summary: A Sound engineering technician operates, assembles and maintains technical equipment that records, amplifies, enhances, mixes or reproduces sounds. Sound engineers work in pan domains like advertising, music, movies, live performances and broadcasting. They assess the requirement of sound at any given location and then produce the appropriate decibels of sound.

career-opportunities.recording: Sound Engineers in this profile record acoustics/design across field recording, sound libraries, bio acoustic research; nature sounds, live performances, mixing engineering, music composition and music production.
career-opportunities.internet_audio_broadcast: Sound Engineers in this profile work across Internet, Radio, Television, Web Casting.
career-opportunities.mastering_cd__dvd_live_sound: Sound Engineers in this profile, master their hand at recording live sound in CD's and DVD's.
career-opportunities.audio_software__hardware: Sound Engineers in this profile work in quality assurance and technical support.
career-opportunities.quality_assessment: Sound Engineers check the quality of sound and modify it to make it more pleasing.
career-opportunities.music_restorationpreservation: Sound Engineers work here to preserve prerecorded materials, such as vintage LP's and cassettes.
career-opportunities.forensic_audio: Sound engineers specializing in this profile work in courtroom documentation and as experts for speech recognition /restoration.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.Tech for 4 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M.Tech for 2-3 years

Combines passion for music and engineering
Great prospects in the near future
cons: Need additional certification and experience to move ahead
Can be confused with jobs like DJing and Music Composer
May not make enough money at initial stages

career-in-sustainability-management-in-i.title: Sustainability Management
career-in-sustainability-management-in-i.summary: Sustainability Management is a career which involves maintaining a balance of the resources in such a manner that they can be preserved for future generations and can be used by current generations as well with managerial skills. This particular career aims at thriving the economy by balanced use of the resources so that the resources can be preserved for future generations by limiting resource depletion. It is found to working in various domains such as environment, business, agriculture, society etc. with the main aim of reducing resource exhaustion. The job role of sustainable managers involves forming an intersection between the environment, society, economy, culture etc. by creating various equipment which are ecofriendly, educating stakeholders about the practices which are causing harm to the environment and help managers formulate programs that would cause least harm to the environment. Students pursuing sustainability management will study about green economy, sustainable innovation, green marketing, green production etc. All those individuals who would want to do something for the environment and make a change by being involved in the various organizations, this is a career for you.

career-opportunities.agricultural_organizations: A career in sustainability management will open doors to opportunity in agricultural organizations wherein individuals will have to create equipment and products which do not cause harm to the environment such as ecofriendly fertilizers, or innovating ways to save water for irrigation.
career-opportunities.healthcare: Healthcare is also one of the fields where innovative ideas are brought about for the protection of the resources e.g.- coming up with new and innovative ideas for less paper use when giving prescriptions and bills etc.
career-opportunities.trusts__foundations: Various Trusts & Foundations such as Tata trust, Reliance foundation etc. hire people who have done sustainability management.
career-opportunities.manufacturing: Another domain where sustainable managers can be employed are in organizations which deals in manufacturing of goods. The job role in this area would involve evaluating the programs and policies and modifying them with the aim of resource conservation.
career-opportunities.academics: Sustainability management is the most looked after courses taking into consideration the current scenario of the environment. Therefore, after studying sustainability management the education sector jobs such as teachers at school, colleges etc. open up. The main role of teachers is to impart knowledge and give it out to the students so that they can lead the path to better future.
career-opportunities.research: Research can be carried out in various domains of sustainable development with the help of mentors, scientists etc. in areas of culture, society, economy etc. with the aim of discovering new ways to preserve the resources for future generations. Research in this area will help you to do something better for the environment with a lot of innovation and creativity.
career-opportunities.government_sector: Job opportunities in the field of sustainability management also open up in the government sector which are majorly involved in the projects of government such as the Sustainable Land and Ecosystem Management (SLEM) program. The job opportunities can be available in the department of forestry and various other departments related to policy making to come up with new plans to preserve the resources for future generations. Students can also enter into the field of Civil Services to bring about a change by cracking UPSC examination.

path 1.stream: Class XII with science stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue B. Tech in any related field.
path 1.after graduation: Pursue MBA in Sustainability Management

path 2.stream: Class XII with any stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue Bachelors of Business Administration
path 2.after graduation: Pursue MBA in Sustainability Management

path 3.graduation: Pursue Bachelor’s degree in any stream

career-in-sustainability-management-in-i.Important Facts: Must have passed class 12th or Senior Secondary Examination with at least 50% marks including English.To go for MBA, one must crack CAT, MAT or XAT.
work description: Job of sustainable managers is to come up with new and innovative ideas to for their organization to reduce resource depletion.

Research program in sustainability management can be carried out in various domains which involve research on new equipments, policies and cultural influence on environment with the aim of better future.
A career in sustainability management involves analysis of the various policies, programs, understand the waste and come up with solutions that how it can be reduced.
Sustainability Management in academics, may work as college faculties, teaching classes and performing research in a wide range of areas.
Sustainable managers are also responsible for marketing the new and innovative ideas to internal and external stakeholders.

pros: A sense of internal satisfaction as this career involves doing something for the environment through one’s own creative and innovative ideas.
A person with strong agenda and knowledge about environment with good managerial skills will have an edge in this domain.
Research in this field would allow to come up with new and creative ideas to save the environment through conservation of resources and bring about a collective impact on the world.
cons: Becoming a sustainable manager requires years of training and experience in order to gain knowledge.
Professionals might have to work long hours and according to the deadlines.
A lot of effort is required in understanding the environmental needs and accommodating them with the existing policies, which might turn out to be time consuming.

career-in-urban-planning-in-india.title: Urban Planning
career-in-urban-planning-in-india.summary: Urban Planning as a career involves developing buildings, parks, streets, understanding the use of resources, planning permission, use of land and working according to the safety of environment, etc. It guides orderly development in urban and suburban areas and is concerned with planning of the settlements and communities. Urban planners are concerned with strategic thinking, research and analysis, architecture, designing etc. Students pursuing urban planning study about legal basis of urban planning, planning and politics, planning theory and also engage in laboratory work to get hands on experience of it. With the increase in urbanization and increasing immigration in to the urban areas, there has been an increasing demand for the residential buidings, therefore there is an increasing need for students who have studied urban planning.

career-opportunities.public_sector: Urban planners are highly required in the public sector wherein there is an increasing requirement in the government agencies regarding the policy making of the urban areas, developing and designing urban areas and also approving of the designs after evaluating them whether they are in proper accordance with the policies.
career-opportunities.academics: Urban planning also open doors of opportunities in the area of academics which helps the qualified urban planners to teach in schools and colleges.
career-opportunities.research: Research field in urban planning allows an individual to do in- depth study about the use of land and resources in order to design and develop an urbanized area which would not cause harm to the environment and could be used effectively. They are primarily involved in coming with new and innovative ideas for the use of land in accordance with the policies.
career-opportunities.private_sector: Private agencies which are involved in township building hire urban planners in order to make an area which is urbanized in a fashionable manner and in accordance with the demands of the consumer needs. They are also involved in planning parks, streets, buildings and work as a project manager which attend to the policies of it.
career-opportunities.real_estate: Real estate agencies also hire urban planners especially in the field of real estate design and real eststate developer. The real estate developers are concerned with making improvements to the existing buildings and then sell or lease them out for profit. The modification aspect of it requires urban planning as this planning involves using the available resources to their best potential.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII from any stream with Maths and English
path 1.graduation: Pursue B. Plan in Urban planning
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M. Plan in Urban Planning

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII from any stream with Maths and English
path 2.graduation: Pursue Bachelors degree in Geography/Environmental Design/ Political science/ Urban planning
path 2.after graduation: Pursue Masters degree in Urban Planning/ City planning

work description: Job of urban planners involve meeting with public officials and consumers regarding the use of land.
A lot of field visits and work is also required in order to understand the land and the resources around it.
Review the plans and make the necessary changes if required.
Involves staying up to date with the demands of the consumers about their lifestyle and way of living.

pros: This career involves bringing about a change in the settlement and urban area from the front end.
Opportunity to set policies and bring a change in trend of settlement
Urban planning gives a big platform to creative people, hence being creative and innovative will be of an advantage in this career as it involves coming up with new ways for planning an area.
cons: Attending to the demands of consumers might become a little stressful sometimes.
Professionals might have to work long hours and according to the deadlines.
Constant field visits are required which might consume time and effort.

career-in-wildlife-conservation-in-india.title: Wildlife Conservation
career-in-wildlife-conservation-in-india.summary: There is an alarming state in the world with the increasing extinction of animals which would have an adverse impact on the environment. Wildlife conservation is the need of the hour, which is concerned with studying and protection of the animals and their habitat, and those students who are passionate about animals they can pursue with this career and conserve wildlife. This career is tailor-made for the individuals who are passionate about animals, would want to study and protect them. The career opportunities in the field of wildlife conservation are prevalent in the Government agencies, NGOs, academics, wildlife photography, writing journals and so on. The students of wildlife conservation study about survey and research of biodiversity, conservation plans, history, environmental law etc. The job of wildlife conserver involves working to save the environment and animals as well, therefore it involves research work, development of plans for their conservation, spreading awareness etc. Working with an NGO and organizations, gaining experience from there will be advantageous for your profile.

career-opportunities.wildlife_biologist: Wildlife biologists are involved in gathering and analysizing data about the wildlife, their habits, behavior, nutrition, population dynamics of an area, climate etc. to make certain plans and do in depth research for protecting the wildlife and this information reaches out to people and various organizations such as Wildlife Protection Society of India, which in turn increase their knowledge database.
career-opportunities.wildlife_educator: Wildlife educators specializes in teaching the school and college students as part of environmental sciences about the wildlife, the geographic conditions where the wildlife can be located, their habitat. Among college students information about the wildlife, climatic conditions, physiology of the animals, research and survey techniques is dissemented. As there is an alarming state due to increase in the extinction of the animals, hence the educators play a very important role in dissementing information to the youth about how to save the wildlife.
career-opportunities.government_agencies: Various government departments are open such as Ministry of Environment and forest and there are various projects which have been taken up by the Government such as Project Tiger, Project Elephant and so on. These departments hire individuals who have studied wildlife conservation and are involved in policy making, program development and do the research in order to protect the wildlife for a better future.
career-opportunities.public_educator_and_outreach_specialist: Outreach specialists are the people who send out information to public about how to manage wildlife in the public and private farms, they combine economic principles with the conservation aids and help people understand how they can the restore and maintain wildlife in their own lands.
career-opportunities.nongovernmental_organization: Various NGOs are working day and night to protect the wildlife, one such organization is World Wildlife Fund, Wildlife Protection Society of India and so on. They hire individuals from almost every field of wildlife conservation such as policy analyst, wildlife technician, outreach specialist etc. who are highly passionate about saving the wildlife and putting in efforts to protect them. They come up with various plans and awareness campaigns for the population to understand the need of the wildlife and how each and every individual can save it.
career-opportunities.gis_specialists: GIS specialists works with Gographic Information System, in which they interpret data and provide the information to the policy makers or for the purpose of policy evaluation concerning wildlife and their habitats. Proficiency in handling GIS will be an edge for you as it is a technical system and having proficiency in this will help you get a job.
career-opportunities.communication_and_public_relations_speci: Specialists of these sort impart the knowledge about the wildlife to the public through writing journals, articles, photography, creating brochures and websites and so on. This is a job cut out for those individuals who are enthusiastic about multimedia and wildlife, wildlife photography, writing journals, making videos of the wildlife, discussion revolving around wildlife.

path 1.stream: Class XII with science stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue Bachelors of Science in Biological Sciences
path 1.after graduation: Pursue Masters degree in Wildlife Conservation

path 2.stream: Class XII with science stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue Bachelors degree in Veterinary Science/ agriculture/forestry/ Environmental Sciences/Zoology/Botany
path 2.after graduation: Pursue Masters degree in Wildlife conservation

career-in-wildlife-conservation-in-india.Important Facts: Must have passed class 12th or Senior Secondary Examination with at least 50% marks including English.Colleges at undergraduate level admit students based on 10+2 marks.

work description: Wildlife conservationists pay close attention to the habitat of the animals, making sure that the habitat is secure so that the animals are safe.
Wildlife Conservers also attend to imparting information to the public about the ways in which the wildlife can be protected.
Being a wildlife conserver also involves analysing and making policies with the main aim of securing wildlife.

The job role of Wildlife conserver is not only restricted to books and theories but also involves field visits to the areas where animals are located in order to study and provide them with proper aid in terms of the environment.

pros: From mentoring Rhinos to studying squirrels, Wildlife Conservation specialist provides with an opportunity to the individuals to be involved in varied work and different projects at the same time.
You are able to find work in different geographical locations.
The work usually includes both office as well as field work.
cons: Professionals might have to work long hours and stick to the deadlines.
This job also involves field visits which might result into staying away from the family for long durations.
Most of the work involves writing up reports or speaking to others about findings.

career_in_central_labour_service_in_indi.title: Central Labour Service
career_in_central_labour_service_in_indi.summary: Central Labour Service (CLS) was formed in 1987. It was declared under Central Civil Services- as a part of the government of Indian. The main aim of CLS is to ensure better industrial relations, labour law enforcement and labour welfare. This service merges 3 bodies: Labour Officers, Central Industrial Relations Machinery and Welfare Organisation of the Ministry of Labour. The main functions of Central Labour Service are to execute labour and welfare laws, and negotiate in disputes with the goal of preventing strike action.

career-opportunities.chief_labour_commissioner: As the head of the organization of the Chief Labour Commissioner (Central) has an over all control over the functioning of the organization.
career-opportunities.deputy_chief_labour_commissioner: The Deputy CLCs ©, besides, coordinating, monitoring and supervising the activities of the regional offices, also handle important Industrial Disputes reffered to or apprehended in the zone effectively. These are the authority for deciding cases of same or similar nature of work and condition of wages of contract labour under rule 25 (2)(v)(a) and 25(2) (v)(b) of CL(R&A) (Central) Rules respectively.
career-opportunities.regional_labour_commissioner: RLC© is the authority under Minimum Wages Act. They decide cases of payment of wages less than minimum rate of wages fixed, filed before them, as provided under sec. 20 of the M.W.Act. They rae certifying officers, under IE (SO) Act, for the certification of the Draft Standing Orders, submitted under the I.E (SO) Act. Being thehead of the region, RCL is not only in charge of day-to-day administration but also has to discharge many statutory duties relating to enforcement and industrial relations, including those of Conciliation Officer under the I.D. Act.
career-opportunities.assistant_labour_commissioner: ALC intervene and prevent the industrial disputes and maintain harmonious Industrial Relations. They decide the claim cases filed before them under the payment of Gratuity Act (sec. 3) and Authorities under the Equal remuneration Act (section 7). As Registering and Licensing Officers under the Contract Labour (Regulation & Abolition) Act, they grant licenses to the contractors and Registration certificate to the Principal Employers. in addition ALCs have to do verification of Trade Union Membership in the establishment wherever required in respect of industries, which have accepted code of discipline, statutory verification in Banks and ad-hoc verification in major ports.
career-opportunities.labour_enforcement_officer: A Labour Enforcement Officer is responsible for implementation of different laws in the state, inspection of establishments and handling issues related to the labour department. He is responsible for fixing and revision of Minimum Wages under Minimum Wages Act, 1948 (Wages of Labour) every year. In case of ant mishappenings the Labour Enforcement Officer has the control of all officers and staff serving in the Labour Employment and Training Department.

path 1.graduation: Pursue B.A.(H) in Sociology/ Social Work/ Economics/ B.A. LLB
path 1.after graduation: M.A./ PG Diploma in Social Work/ Labour Welfare/ Industrial Relations/ Personnel Management

He is an authority on many labour Acts in Central Sphere and he will be acting as Conciliation Officer in resolving Major Industrial Disputes of Industries which are under the preview of Central Sphere. • This is one of the most respectful and honoured job in Government of India. The job responsibilities are very interesting and the person earn enormous satisfaction by resolving the issues for the labour class who are normally exploited by the employers.
cons: • Many officers are under the CBI radar.

cartography-as-a-career-in-india.title: Cartography
cartography-as-a-career-in-india.summary: A cartographer is an individual who creates maps. Cartography encompasses the art, science, and technology of creating maps, charts, and other graphical representations, as well as their study and application. In order to make maps, one has to combine scientific knowledge with artistic abilities, as well as knowledge of compilation and design principles with product creation techniques. The purpose of maps is to visualize spatial data. Various databases stores spatial data, which is then extracted for various uses. A digital system capable of generating dynamic interactive maps that can be modified digitally has replaced the traditional analogue methods of map-making. Furthermore, they make updates, corrections, and adjustments to existing maps and charts.

career-opportunities.trained_professionals_cartographers: Specialists involved in the map-making process.
career-opportunities.gis_specialists: Specialists in GIS build and maintain GIS databases, and use GIS software to analyze the spatial and non-spatial information they contain. Their job titles range from GIS Analyst to GIS Technician to Cartographer.
career-opportunities.gis_analysts: A Geographic Information Systems Analyst, or GIS Analyst, is a hybrid career of data analysis, cartography (map making) and programming. Using GIS technology, a GIS Analyst creates digital maps and databases that display spatial and geographical information.
career-opportunities.scientists: Geographers, also known as geoscientists, study where things are on Earth and what they mean. The goal of a geographic scientist is to look at places on earth from both the perspective of their physical characteristics and of human interactions with them.
career-opportunities.researchers: There are opportunities for empirical research on interactive maps and visualizations and other such concepts within the field.
career-opportunities.instructors_professors_and_researchers_a: Experienced cartographers can also work as instructors, professors, and researchers at schools, colleges, and universities

cartoonist-as-a-career-in-india.title: Cartoonist
cartoonist-as-a-career-in-india.summary: An artist who creates cartoons using either digital tools or paper and pencil. Their work can be used in comic strips, newspaper, magazines, television, movies, video games, etc. It is a very exciting field for someone who is very imaginative and has a passion for drawing. They can express their thoughts freely through their sketch and comic strips. Cartoons are a great way to spread awareness among public.

career-opportunities.with_news_agencies: Cartoonists work with various news agencies and magazine- creation firms for creating cartoons and comic strips. They create cartoons on various topics, usually covering the latest trends. They may portray the prevalent social and political issues in a humorous and satirical manner.
career-opportunities.magazine_creation_firms: They work with various magazine-creation firms on a full- time basis. They create cartoons according to the genre of the magazine and their requirements. They use their creativity to grab the attention of the audience.
career-opportunities.comic_book_creator: A comic book creator creates a series of cartoons portraying different scenes in the form of a story. It involves thinking of a new seen, interesting plots, etc. for each new comic. Hence, the person should be very imaginative. The work is very interesting.
career-opportunities.editorial_cartoonist: An editorial cartoonist or a political cartoonist illustrates the trending social and political issues in the form of a cartoon. Their?cartoons?are related to daily news, current affairs, etc. in a national or international context.
career-opportunities.storyboard_creators: Storyboard creators work in the television or film industry. They create a sequence of panels/ frames, used in the direction of a film. They help the directors of the show in visualizing the scene before it is actually shot.
career-opportunities.as_a_freelance_cartoonist: Freelance cartoonists create their work and approach various agencies. They can work with multiple agencies at a time. Alternatively, they may start their own, independent agencies and work in a totally autonomous fashion, selling their works in the form of comic books and/ or publishing them on social media platforms.

Be aware of colour schemes and combinations for the cartoons to look attractive
Design cartoons keeping in mind the target audience
Take feedback to make necessary editions in the designs developed

pros: A career as a cartoonist will give you freedom to express your thoughts through your creation.
You can work as a freelance.
The field will allow you to gain popularity over time.
cons: It is a very competitive field and success rate can be low.
The beginning pay can be low.
Working hours can be irregular.

central-armed-police-forces-as-a-career-.title: Central Armed Police Forces
central-armed-police-forces-as-a-career-.summary: Central Armed Police Forces (CAPF) refers to the uniform nomenclature of seven Armed Police Forces of the Union of India under the authority of the Ministry of Home Affairs. Their role is to defend the national interest mainly against internal threats. The Central Armed Police Forces (CAPF) are seven security forces in India that are overseen by the Ministry of Home Affairs: Assam Rifles (AR), Border Security Force (BSF), Central Industrial Security Force (CISF), Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF), Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP), National Security Guard (NSG), Sashastra Seema Bal (SSB). Each of the seven has its own cadre of officers, but they are all led by Indian Police Service officers.

career-opportunities.central_reserve_police_force_crpf: The Central Reserve Police Force's mission is to enable the government to effectively and efficiently maintain Rule of Law, Public Order, and Internal Security, as well as to preserve national integrity and promote social harmony and development by upholding the supremacy of the Constitution.
career-opportunities.border_security_force_bsf: "BSF is a Border Guarding Force, it is a paramilitary force charged with guarding India's land borders with Pakistan and Bangladesh. The BSF has air wing, marine wing, an artillery regiment, and commando units. It currently stands as the world's largest border guarding force. BSF has been termed as the First Line of Defence of Indian Territories"
career-opportunities.central_industrial_security_force_cisf: The Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) is the country's premier multi-skilled security agency, tasked with providing security to the country's major critical infrastructure installations in a variety of areas. CISF currently provides security for nuclear installations, space establishments, airports, seaports, power plants, sensitive government buildings, and heritage monuments.
career-opportunities.sashastra_seema_bal_ssb: The sole goal of achieving 'Total security preparedness' in remote border areas in order to perform a'stay-behind' role in the event of a war." SSB is now spread across Uttarakhand, UP, Bihar, West Bengal, Sikkim, Assam, and Arunachal Pradesh's international border.
career-opportunities.indo_tibetan_border_police_itbp: The ITBP is a specialized mountain force, with the majority of officers and men being professionally trained mountaineers and skiers. ITBP has carried out numerous rescue and relief operations across the country as the first responder to natural disasters.
career-opportunities.national_security_guard_nsg: The National Security Guard (NSG) is an anti-terrorist force. As a Federal Contingency Force, the National Security Guard has been tasked with dealing with all aspects of terrorism in any part of the country. It is a task-oriented force with two complementary elements: the Special Action Group (SAG), which consists of Army personnel, and the Special Ranger Groups (SRG), which consists of personnel drawn from Central Armed Police Forces/State Police Forces.
career-opportunities.railway_protection_force_rpf: Railway Protection Force (RPF) is one of the security forces of India. It is tasked with protecting property and passengers of the Indian Railways. It is the only Central Armed Police Force(CAPF) with powers similar to regular state police forces. They perform many roles including the provision of internal security under the control of the army through the conduct of counterinsurgency and border security operations, provision of aid to the civilians in times of emergency, and the provision of communications, medical assistance and education in remote areas.
career-opportunities.assam_rifles_ar: They perform many roles including the provision of internal security under the control of the army through the conduct of counterinsurgency and border security operations, provision of aid to the civilians in times of emergency, and the provision of communications, medical assistance and education in remote areas.

pros: • Along with good salary they get additional Perks and benefits. • Dearness Allowance• Difficulty Allowance• House Rent Allowance• Medical Allowance• Money for Ration• Transport Allowance• Unique Duty Allowance
cons: • Being CAPF can be dangerous as they risk their lives during the tasks. • Border Security Force (BSF) personnel have to perform duties in snow bound areas, in desert tracts and in jungle terrain, depending on the border they are deployed at. • Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) personnel have to work in snow-bound areas round the year; there are hardly any peace stations for them.• The Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) personnel can be over-stretched and on the move most of the time.

ceramic-engineering.title: Ceramic Engineering
ceramic-engineering.summary: Ceramic engineering is a branch of engineering that deals with the design and production of ceramic items. Ceramics are nonmetallic inorganic materials that are baked at high temperatures to harden them. These materials, which are known for their heat resistance, can be employed for a variety of demanding activities that metals and polymers cannot. Since then, improved ceramics have been developed and are now employed in a variety of applications, including components for aerospace, automotive, defence, environmental, fiber-optic, and medical technology. Ceramic components can also be found in cell phones and laptops. Ceramic engineers work in a range of industries, including mining and mineral processing, pharmaceuticals, food processing, and chemical manufacturing. Ceramics engineering and research, now a multibillion-dollar industry, has established itself as an essential field of science. As researchers develop new types of ceramics for various applications, the number of applications continues to grow. Ceramic engineering products have found their way into almost every aspect of modern life.

career-opportunities.research_and_testing_firms: researchers develop new types of ceramics for various applications, as well as carry out experiments to improve the properties of ceramic products
career-opportunities.construction_services: Construction services includes buildings used for production and assembly activities of industrial establishments.
career-opportunities.medicine: Producing ceramic teeth, bones, and joints as human body replacement parts etc can come under medicine.
career-opportunities.transportation: Ceramics are very helpful in transportation work as they are lightweight, can withstand high temperatures, are capable of insulating thermally and electrically, exhibit excellent wear and corrosion resistance properties, and are safe and reliable.
career-opportunities.design_firms: Opportunity create design in wide range of pottery work, making products and objects with porcelin, clay, stone etc.
career-opportunities.defense_sector: Defense sector uses ceramics in Radars, submarines, space shuttles and aircrafts. Ceramic Engineers contribute to quality control, product testing and manufacturing.

path 1.stream: Class XII with science stream with maths.
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.Tech in Ceramic Engineering
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M.Tech in Ceramic Engineering.

entrance exam.elements: Mathematics, Physics and chemistry

entrance exam.elements: Mathematics, Physics and chemistry

entrance exam.elements: All branches of engineering

pros: • Career Opportunities in various domains from medicine to mining.• Every year, the Indian ceramic sector generates billions of dollars, with the majority of that money going into developing ceramic engineering innovations and scientific research.• Great opportunities in public sectors too.• Recent advances in medicine ( bio ceramics) has also boomed the demand of ceramic engineering.
cons: • It takes a lot of hard work and training crack entrance exams and experience to reach at top.• Monetary Packages are expected to grow with substantial experience.• Never-ending process of learning/certifications as the engineer needs to be updated on newer process.

certified-public-accountant-as-a-career-.title: Certified Public Accountant
certified-public-accountant-as-a-career-.summary: Certified Public Accountant or CPA provides accounting services to the public and organizations. They are primarily involved in auditing and attesting procedures. They are very well versed with the accounting principles, business and financial concepts, law, tax, etc. CPAs are hired by organizations in the role of finance manager, financial analyst, chief financial officer, etc. There is an examination which is conducted by American Institute of Certified Public Accountants (AICPA) and is called as Uniform Certified Public Accountant Examination. In order to practice as a CPA, one need to pass the examination conducted by AICPA. The CPAs are hired by various consulting firms, auditing firms, they can provide service in any area of finance broadly in corporate governance, financial accounting, estate planning etc.

career-opportunities.public_accounting: CPAs are required in the accounting domain and managing the finances of the public. They are hired by private and government organizations for advisory roles. There are various CPA accounting firms and the CPAs obtain the role of staff auditor wherein they are involved in detailed financial work, tax staff wherein they handle the spheres of tax, management services, etc.
career-opportunities.management_accounting: As a CPA, you need to prepare budgets and financial documents, evaluate and refine accounting procedures, and consult with management teams to help them make good business decisions.
career-opportunities.financial_analysts: As a financial analyst, you have to support the growth of the business by analyzing financial data, preparing reports to illustrate technical information, interpreting data affecting investment programs and helping management make informed decisions.
career-opportunities.government_sector: CPAs in Government have responsibilities in the areas of auditing, financial reporting and management accounting. They have the power to work with the policies which are made at various levels of Government. CPAs provide the information as in how the finances can be used in the best possible manner.
career-opportunities.corporate_accounting: CPAs are hired in corporates for handling Accounts wherein they handle the accounting, auditing and the finances. They manage the pay rolls, property and financial statements. They are considered as the strategic business partners of the organization. They also work as Internal Auditors which contribute to company’s operations by examining risk management issues, financial data and operations, and control processes.
career-opportunities.tax_accounting: As CPA, you have to maintain tax records and complete tax returns to guide companies in tax strategies, compliance, and tax laws and regulations.
career-opportunities.nonprofit_organizations: CPAs are also employed in the non profit organizations as they help NPOs to manage their revenue, understand the best practices of managing financial systems and taxes. CPAs are hired by NGOs or they can work as a freelancer wherein they can work with multiple organizations.

path 1.stream: CPAs are also employed in the non profit organizations as they help NPOs to manage their revenue, understand the best practices of managing financial systems and taxes. CPAs are hired by NGOs or they can work as a freelancer wherein they can work with multiple organizations.
path 1.graduation: Pursue Bachelor’s degree in B.Com (H)/ B.Com/ BBA or a Finance Related Field. Along with that pursue Chartered Accountant/ Company Secretory along with your graduation.
path 1.after graduation: Pursue Masters of Commerce (M.Com) or Masters of Business Administration (MBA)

certified-public-accountant-as-a-career-.Important Facts: Must have Passed class 12th board examination with 60% including English.In order to become a CPA three ‘Es’ are taken into consideration which are Education, Examination and Experience. Education- A bachelor’s & master’s degree in a field which is related to finance and accounting along with either Chartered Accountant or Company Secretory. Examination- This includes the CPA examination which consists of 4 components which are Auditing & Attestation, Business Environment & Concept, Financial Accounting and Reporting &Regulation. The passing score is 75 on a 0-99 scale. Experience- In order to appear for CPA exam, there is no work experience required but experience of 1-2 years under a CPA is required in order to obtain the license to practice as a CPA. You need to be a Member of the Institute of Chartered Accountants of India or a Member of the Company Secretaries in India.
work description: The job of CPA involves maintaining and auditing the financial records of the public or organizations.
CPAs also come up with strategic ways for budgeting and using the money in the most efficient way possible.
They act as a consultant in the areas of accounts, finances, budget, etc.
CPAs also attend to tax related work wherein they make sure that the taxes are paid on time by analysing financial information properly.
It is a job of responsibility as they also have to report any form of fraudulent work, tax related issue or any other financial issue to the organization.

pros: CPAs can work in a vast range of industries, because every business needs an accountant in their firm.
Excellent opportunity for CA/ ICWA/ CS/ Law/ MBA (Finance), M.Com and Commerce Graduates who aspire for an International Certification.
A CPA certification would allow you to have a knowledge of US GAAP, GAAS and US federal taxation and business laws.
cons: They undergo an intensive amount of stress as they are handling the legal documents of the organization.
Professionals might have to work for long hours and stick to the deadlines.
At times, the work could become monotonous & dull.

chef-de-cuisine-as-a-career-in-india.title: Chef de Cuisine
chef-de-cuisine-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Chef de cuisine is the head chef of the restaurant or hotel kitchen. They oversee the daily operation of the kitchen and ensure that the food served is of the highest quality. Along with culinary skills, this job also requires managerial, leadership and decision-making skills. Chef de cuisine is in-charge of preparing food and beverage menus, designing and reviewing recipes, as well as managing restaurant personnel. This is the highest rank or position in a kitchen excluding large-scale restaurant or hotel chains which may hire executive chefs for managing operations of multiple outlets.

cons: There are a lot of different responsibilities. Requires long hours of hard, physical work. As chef de cuisine, one may not get to spend a lot of time cooking as there are other managerial responsibilities.

cinematography-as-a-career-in-india.title: Cinematography
cinematography-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Cinematography is the art and craft of making motion pictures by capturing a story visually. The cinematographer's job is to translate the screenwriter's story and the filmmaker's vision onto film. The purpose of cinematography is to stir up emotions such as happiness, sadness, laughter, and fear. The camera and lighting work together with the editing to produce exceptional effects and enhance emotions which is the essence of cinematography.

career-opportunities.camera_production_assistant: Camera Production Assistants are trainees who assist the cinematographer with the film unit while learning the craft.
career-opportunities.motion_control_operator: Motion control operators are those who are tasked with operating the motion control equipment, which essentially produces 'camera robots' for special effects uses that systematically reproduce camera movements. A motion control rig is typically rented with an operator who is knowledgeable about the equipment.
career-opportunities.camera_operator: A Camera Operator is one who operates the camera as per the direction of the Cinematographer. On occasion, the cinematographers take on this task themselves if there isn't enough staff.
career-opportunities.first_camera_assistant: The First Camera Assistant, or 1AC, keeps the camera in focus on the subject. Additionally, they put together the camera equipment and dismantle it once the job is done.
career-opportunities.second_camera_assistant: It is the Second Camera Assistant's responsibility to load the clapper board and load the film stock on the camera at the beginning of each take. Supervisors oversee the transport of equipment as well as the equipment itself.

cons: -Long work hours in a physically demanding environment.

civil-services-as-a-career-in-india.title: Civil Services
civil-services-as-a-career-in-india.summary: A career in civil services gives you the opportunity to participate in governance and making important policy decisions for the country. There is immense prestige and power attached to the services and one travels the lengths and breadths of the country meeting different types of people often listening to their problems and come up with solutions to resolve those problems. Thus, it has immense opportunities to fulfil desire to provide social service to people in need and serving your country. Entry to these are based on one of the toughest exams conducted by the Union Public Service Commission.

career-opportunities.indian_administrative_service: IAS is the crème of the civil services. Only the top 100 or less scorers in UPSC become IAS. These individuals hold positions such as District Collector, District Magistrate and can go on to become secretaries in various ministries.
career-opportunities.indian_police_service: IPS go on to hold important leadership and commanding post in the various state police and all India Central Armed Police Forces.
career-opportunities.indian_foreign_service: IFS officials are entrusted with managing and developing diplomatic contacts with their nations. Typically, positions held by IFS officers are that of the High Commissioner, Ambassador, Foreign Secretary etc.
career-opportunities.indian_p__t_accounts__finance_services: Indian Post & Telecommunication Accounts and Finance Service is a special cadre which specifically serves various financial management services for the Department of Telecommunication and the Department of Posts. For example, officers from this cadre are involved in developing policy for and auctioning spectrum, doing internal audit both departments and can also involve in the management of the human resource of both these departments.
career-opportunities.indian_audit_and_accounts_services: Officers of the IAAS function under the Comptroller and Auditor General of India in audit managerial capacity.
career-opportunities.indian_revenue_services_customs_and_cent: Offices under these services work under the statutory body- Centre board of Excise and Customs. They manage the collection of excise and customs taxes.
career-opportunities.indian_defence_accounts_services: IDAS officers are key players who manage finances during various defence acquisitions, licensing, procurements, service warranties of weapons platforms.
career-opportunities.indian_revenue_service_it: IRS officers work under the aegis of a statutory body called Central Board of Direct Taxes. They are concerned with collection of direct taxes for the nation's development.
career-opportunities.indian_ordnance_factories_service_assist: IOFS officers work under the Ministry of Defence to manage and develop Indian Ordnance Factories.
career-opportunities.indian_postal_service: IPS officers are concerned with developing innovative national schemes for communications especially postal communication.
career-opportunities.indian_civil_accounts_service: ICAS officers work under the Ministry of Finance. They play an active role in financial management of the Union Government by often providing ancillary role to auditing, collection of taxes and creating budgeting estimates for various ministries.
career-opportunities.indian_railway_traffic_service: IRTS officers are given the responsibility of the managing operations and commercial wing of the Indian Railways.
career-opportunities.indian_railway_accounts_service: IRAS officers manage the accounts and finances of Indian Railways.
career-opportunities.indian_railway_personnel_service: IRPS officers are the Human Resource Managers for the Indian railways. They handle all the issues pertaining to personnel selection, training, pay, etc.
career-opportunities.post_of_assistant_security_commissioner_: These officers manage the Railway Police Force, which is entrusted with managing the security of equipment?-?s and customers of the railways.
career-opportunities.indian_defence_estates_service: IDES officers are appointed as Chief Executive Officers in cantonments around the country.
career-opportunities.indian_information_service_junior_grade: IIS services handle the organized media and public relations functions for the government. In addition to this they also provide feedback to government on reactions public has to various policy measures.
career-opportunities.indian_trade_service_group_a_gr_iii: ITS officers manage different aspects of International trade and commerce.
career-opportunities.armed_forces_headquarters_civil_service_: These officers man the headquarters of the Navy, Army and Air force. They are entrusted with performing administrative functions only.
career-opportunities.delhi_andaman__nicobar_islands_lakshadwe: These services expose one to administrative roles in various government bodies in Union Territories which are under the control of the Union Government.
These officers manage the policing in Union Territories.
career-opportunities.pondicherry_civil_service: These officers manage the administrative roles in Pondicherry area.
career-opportunities.pondicherry_police_service: These officers manage policing in the area of Pondicherry.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in any stream
path 1.graduation: Any graduation program
path 1.after graduation: Clear UPSC Examination

civil-services-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: For most services, graduation with a minimum age of 21 is the eligibility criteria. Except IAS and IPS- subject of Bhutan, Nepal and Tibet refugees can apply.Selected candidates are given different posts according to the posts they get in UPSC. Civil services require gradute degree before one goes and writes the examination. Graduation can be personal discipline from anywhere in the country. After this student take time to prepare for UPSC examination independently or through coaching centres.

entrance exam.name: UPSC Civil Service Examination
entrance exam.elements: Prelims exam Paper -1 & Paper 2 (MCQ’) General Knowledge Vocabulary Social Studies, Science (6th -12th class), Indian polity & constitution, logical reasoning, mathematical aptitude. Mains There are 8 papers: Paper 1 – Indian Language Paper 2- English Paper3- Essay Paper4,5,6,7- General Studies Paper 8,9- Optional paper Interview/ Personality Test

work description: Be responsible for the law and order and general administration of the area under your jurisdiction
Advise and support government officials and implement the defined policy decisions
Handle daily affairs of the government, including framing and implementation of policy
Liaison and consult with the Ministers and other government servants
Supervise and ensure proper enforcement of rules and policies
Be part of the process of final policy formulation and decision making along with high level officers and Ministers
Handle enquiries and requests from the public in person, by use of electronic & social media

pros: If you want to touch upon thousand of lives and make significant changes in the society then this is the profession you must opt for. Besides, being the most highly respectable job there are a lot of perks one recives for being part of this organization which continues even though one gets retired. Money and high status is also attached to this field with a sense of satisfaction for contributing to the society.
cons: However this does come with a cost. As you have to work with substancial people therefore there is a lot of pressure on you all the time. Furthermore, it is a transferable job because of which your family life can get interrupted and in many cases you have to stay away from your family thus your personal life may suffer.

climatology-as-a-career-in-india.title: Climatology
climatology-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Climatology is the study of atmosphere, change in weather and climate patterns. This branch of science is concerned with observing and evaluating weather patterns all around the world, as well as the atmospheric factors that cause them. People often mix it up with meteorology, which is the study of weather and predictions. Climatology, on the other hand, is primarily concerned with the natural and man-made forces that influence long-term weather patterns. Climatologists are scientists who specialise in this field. Climate scientists have recently concentrated their efforts on the changes in the Earth's climate that have happened since the industrial revolution. As human activity has expanded and emitted more carbon into the atmosphere, the Earth has become warmer. Climate scientists are particularly interested in this impact, which is known as global warming. Climatologists can better comprehend and forecast the long-term effects of human-caused climate change by analysing global warming. One who is enthusiastic for the positive development of the environment, this field is definitely for them.

career-opportunities.meteorologist: Explaining,understanding and observing earth's atmospheric phenomena.
career-opportunities.atmospheric_scientist: Studies atmospheric components, reactions, techniques to measure.
career-opportunities.weather_forecaster: Work as predicting the weather condition of a particular place/ location at a particular time.

path 1.stream: Class XII with science stream.
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.Sc in Atmospheric science/Climate studies/ meteorology
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M.Sc in Meterologist/ Atmospheric Science

path 2.stream: Class XII with science stream.
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.Tech in Atmospheric science/Climate studies/ meteorology
path 2.after graduation: Pursue M.Tech in Meterologist/ Atmospheric Science
