pros: -Jobs in private as well as public sector. -Has different opportunities under it, like meteriologist, atmospheric scientist etc. - Opportunity to work for the benefit of the environment and society.
cons: -Entrance exams can be difficult to pass. -Pressure gets more high when natural calamities hit.

clinical-psychologist-as-a-career-in-ind.title: Clinical Psychologist
clinical-psychologist-as-a-career-in-ind.summary: Clinical psychology is a specialised branch of Psychology. It uses science, theory, and clinical knowledge to understand, assess, prevent, and treat psychologically-based distress, to enhance subjective well-being and personal development. A clinical psychologist is a specialised mental health professional with extensive training in the diagnosis, assessment and treatment of mental, behavioral and emotional illnesses. They use psychological techniques, like cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT), behaviour modification and psychoanalytic therapy. They work in various settings like hospitals, prisons, rehabilitation centres and universities.

career-opportunities.clinics_and_hospitals: The role is to diagnose, assess and treat mental, emotional and behavioural problems. They may choose to specialise in specific psychological disorders, such as anxiety, schizophrenia or depression
career-opportunities.private_practice: They can open their own clinic and work independently.
career-opportunities.schools_and_universities: They work with school children who have learning disabilities or in college counseling centers to promote wellness and academic success.
career-opportunities.community_and_mental_health_centers: They work with special populations like children, the economically disadvantaged or seniors.
career-opportunities.rehabilitation_facilities: They provide services with the goal of increasing function and quality of life for persons living with disability, activity limitations, and societal participation restrictions.
career-opportunities.military: Responsible for assessing, diagnosing, and treating military personnel with mental or emotional disorders. They offer therapeutic services, such as counseling, training and psychoeducational programs for military personnel, help cope with trauma and harsh working conditions.
career-opportunities.teacherprofessor: They can teach subjects like clinical psychology, abnormal psychology, psychopathology in universities, hospitals, work as a guest or visiting faculty.
career-opportunities.prisons: They provide treatment and psychological support to inmates both for existing mental disorders and to prevent them from committing any additional crimes. They have to testify as expert witnesses inside courtrooms. They facilitate therapy groups and manage their mental fitness.

path 1.stream: Any Stream with Psychology as a subject
path 1.graduation: Bachelor's in Psychology (Hons.), BA/BSc
path 1.after graduation: Master's in Psychology (MA/MSc)

path 2.stream: Any Stream with Psychology as a subject
path 2.graduation: Bachelor's in Psychology (Hons.), BA/BSc
path 2.after graduation: Master's in Psychology (MA/MSc)

path 3.after graduation: Master's in Psychology (MA/MSc)

path 4.after graduation: Master's in Psychology (MA/MSc)

pros: It is a specialised field which is high in demand. It is among the highest paying professions. The job is considered to be of repute and status.
cons: The work can be mentally and emotionally draining. Extensive training, practice and time is required to practice in the field of clinical psychology.

clinical-research-as-a-career-in-india.title: Clinical Research
clinical-research-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Clinical research scientists conduct research and clinical investigations of diseases and conditions to determine accurate diagnoses and effective treatments. They work in a variety of employment settings, including hospitals, universities and pharmaceutical labs. Safety precautions must be followed and protective gear used when dealing with potentially infectious samples.

career-opportunities.treatment: Treatment research (also called "clinical trials") generally involves an intervention such as medication, psychotherapy, new devices, or new approaches to surgery or radiation therapy.
career-opportunities.prevention: Prevention research looks for better ways to prevent disorders from developing or returning. Different kinds of prevention research may study medicines, vitamins, vaccines, minerals, or lifestyle changes.
career-opportunities.diagnostic: This refers to the practice of looking for better ways to identify a particular disorder or condition.
career-opportunities.screening: Screening research aims to find the best ways to detect certain disorders or health conditions.
career-opportunities.quality_of_life: Also known as "supportive care," this research explores ways to improve comfort and the quality of life for individuals with a chronic illness.
career-opportunities.genetic_studies: Genetic studies aim to improve the prediction of disorders by identifying and understanding how genes and illnesses may be related. Research in this area may explore ways in which a person's genes make him or her more or less likely to develop a disorder. This may lead to development of tailor-made treatments based on the patient's genetic make-up
career-opportunities.epidemiological_studies: Epidemiological studies seek to identify the patterns, causes, and control of disorders in groups of people.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Biology
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. in Clinical Research for 3 years/MBBS/BDS/B.Pharm etc.
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M.Sc. in Clinical Research for 2 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Biology
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.tech or B.sc/M.sc in Life sciences
path 2.after graduation: Pursue Post Graduation Diploma in Clinical Research for 1-2 years

clinical-research-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: Most college have eligibility criteria of minimum 50% aggregate marks in Class XII / and some of minimum 60%.Must have passed class 12thor senior secondary examination with at least 50% marks including English. Some colleges/ universities also have an age limit (17 at 31st December of the year of admission).

work description: Conduct research to test various drugs and their uses
Develop a strategy about the possible course of action, objectives, subjects and the procedures
Outline the finances and chalk out a budget through fiscal accounting
Discuss and review the results with medical professionals
Formally prepare the reports which include all the details of the research work
Use the results drawn in formulating appropriate policies
Take care of the safety and other ethical concerns while experimenting with the subjects

pros: You will get the opportunity to explore new methods.
With the development of new methods, you will get the opportunity to help others by applying them.
You will get satisfaction on checking the safety of the medicines.
cons: The job can be frustrating if you are not able to get new methods or techniques.
You can have long working hours
There is less face- to-face interaction with the patients.

cognitive-psychologist-as-a-career-in-in.title: Cognitive Psychologist
cognitive-psychologist-as-a-career-in-in.summary: A cognitive psychologist specializes in the study of the mind as a processing system for information. Cognitive psychologists attempt to develop cognitive models to describe the information processing that occurs in the mind, including perception, attention, language, memory, thinking, and consciousness.

career-opportunities.healthcare: Mental health and healthcare settings are possible work settings for cognitive psychologists. Hospitals and mental health clinics may hire cognitive psychologists to help patients with cognitive difficulties. People with sensory or perception issues, conditions requiring cognitive therapy, etc., might be treated by them.
career-opportunities.research: A cognitive psychologist also conducts research to better understand mental processes. Many researchers also teach at universities. Studying and publishing their research in cognitive psychology allows us to gain a better understanding of a wide range of cognitive psychology subjects.
career-opportunities.business: Psychologists also work for businesses to conduct research, create products, and create marketing campaigns. A psychologist may either be employed directly by a company or provide consulting on a contract basis.

path 1.stream: Clear class XII in any stream (some colleges may require psychology as a subject)
path 1.graduation: an undergraduate degree in psychology or a related field
path 1.after graduation: Masters in Cognitive Psychology

path 2.graduation: an undergraduate degree in psychology or a related field

cons: Teaching and research positions in cognitive psychology typically require a doctorate. It can be exhausting and tedious to conduct research.

commerce-as-a-career-in-india.title: Commerce
commerce-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Commerce related careers are a backbone to all other careers, which take care of the functional processes of an organization in terms of accounting, finance, banking, auditing, taxation, and various other tasks. To pursue this field, an individual requires to have an inclination towards the affairs of corporate finance and/or stock markets as well as inner financing. The growing Indian Economy is opening immense opportunities in the Commerce field particularly in sectors like accountancy, business administration, e-commerce, taxation as well as international economics. Also with the liberalization, Indian economy has opened up capital market for foreign investors along with domestic investors. Many employment opportunities have been generated for individuals in the field due to the heavy flow of capital into the capital markets.

career-opportunities.chartered_acccountancy: Chartered Accountancy is one of the most looked-after and respected career option in India, particularly in the commerce sector, with endless opportunities in the private as well as the public sector. A Chartered Accountant (CA) is concerned to ensure that the financial transactions of an organisation are maintained according to the law. They also keep track of the cost of management of the company and manage tax matters, and are involved in providing the professional opinions to a fiscal decision in a firm. The work-profile of a chartered accountant is enormous, varying from finance management, financial controlling, financial advisory or being a director. Cost accountancy is one of the most flourishing field in this discipline. A person can also explore the career in CFA (Chartered Finance Accounting) and look forward to becoming a Portfolio or a Risk Manager.
career-opportunities.banking: Banking, today, is a calling career for enthusiasts in the field of commerce and accounts. It is a crucial step towards understanding the global economy as well as discovering the challenges of the marketplace. This field has tremendous opportunities in local, national and foreign banks. Moreover, this field is concerned with accepting and safeguarding monetary funds in both private and public banks.
career-opportunities.business_finance: A career in business finance encompasses a concern related to the monetary information in terms of increasing profit and minimizing financial risks. Business finance covers a wide variety of opportunities such as global finance, budget analysis, property management and financial forecasting. Thus, this discipline revolves around the capital funds and other valuable assets.
career-opportunities.management: Management as a career includes a wide variety of options which may stretch across any sector or industry involving planning, organizing, directing or monitoring an organization to achieve their goals. The roles of the management person involve decision making, interpersonal coordination or handling information.
career-opportunities.auditing_and_tax: This discipline is concerned with the review of financial records to determine the tax liability, revenue mobilisation as well as managing resources for National Budgets for effective functioning of the macroeconomic management. In addition, the individuals also aid interventions to support revenue mobilisation for growth and improvement of tax policies.
career-opportunities.marketing_and_advertising: Marketing careers are a link between the organization and customers and the field is best for people who like to strategize and identify patterns and trends. Given India?-?s flourishing corporate growth, a career in marketing is lucrative. The various marketing job profiles include - project managers, marketing managers, market analysts, sales managers, etc., identifying the need and potential markets for products or services, developing products, formulating a pricing and sales strategies for business growth to increase profitability and maintaining public relations.
career-opportunities.capital_markets: The Capital Market is involved with the trading of the financial securities like bonds, stock, etc. The money is being channelled from savers and depository institutions to the borrowers and investees through various modes of securities like bonds, notes and shares.
career-opportunities.company_secretary: Company Secretary (CS) in the industry deals with a wide range of opportunities in terms of finance, accounts, legal, personel and administration of a company acting as an executive adviser, helping the board to mold governance principles and practices in order to fulfil the essential needs for the effective functioning of the organisation. A CS is a specialist professional relating to company laws.
career-opportunities.non_profit_sector: Individuals with the field of commerce can also join Civil Services or, in particular, the Indian Economic Services/Indian Statistical Services. Moreover, they can also pursue Law, design, defense or opt for being professors

work description: Define business goals and determine the most effective course of action needed to reach the goals
Offer financial advice, audit accounts and provide trustworthy information about financial records
Analyze financial statements, sales reports and other performance indicators
Develop marketing strategies and be involved in selling of products to target customers
Identify places to cut costs and to improve performance, policies and programmes
Carry out research and data collection to understand the organization and its customers
Gather requirements from the customer and other stakeholders to prepare project report
Conduct market research and analysis
Solve day to day business problems
Act as change agent

pros: Commerce, in India, is one of the most sought after streams today. With growing economy worldwide, professionals with background in commerce are in great demand in colleges and universities, banks, rating agencies, securities firms etc. Some of them can pay managers, businessmen in 6 figures. They have a high ability to influence the standard of living of an average man on the street.
An experienced & knowledgeable one can talk his way out & gain respect from people from all walks of life.
They are better informed of the complexities in the world.
cons: A career in commerce has a wide scope, however, it’s not everyone’s piece of pie. One has to be in the know-about of all economic events happening in the world, be consistent throughout the graduation and post-graduation period and even after their studies are completed.

construction-engineering.title: Construction Engineering
construction-engineering.summary: Construction Engineers provide strategic oversight to construction projects. They are involved in designing and executing processes to overcome worksite obstacles and improve efficiency. While civil engineers are more involved in the design and planning of the projects, construction engineers may participate in these processes but their responsibilities also involve on-site management aspects such as overseeing budgetary and execution of designs and plans, time-management, and personnel management etc. Construction engineers can work on a broad range of projects including housing construction, electrical system, water waste management systems, drainage and sewage systems highways, bridges, pipelines, airports, railroads, industrial plants, dams and reservoirs etc.

career-opportunities.construction_manager: Construction Manager are involved in a project from beginning to the end and usually supervise all the administrative aspects of the project including personnel management, budgeting, monitoring the progress and ensuring all workers are performing efficiently.
career-opportunities.field_engineer: A field engineers ensures that safety standards on a construction project are met. They conduct routine inspection and monitoring of the equipment to ensure that the workers have a safe environment to work in.
career-opportunities.surveyor: A surveyor provides precise measurements of the site where the construction project is located. He/she conducted detailed research of the land to record accurate measurements and use reference points to provide clarity and meaning to the measurements.
career-opportunities.sustainability_specialist: Sustainability specialist conducts research on a construction project to provide eco-friendly practices and guidelines to ensure sustainability. They take into account the materials used, the pollutants generated, impact on local communities and ecosystems, its eventual energy use, and compliance with environmental legislation.
career-opportunities.facilities_manager: Facilities manager ensures that commercial or residential building is functional and operations run smoothly after the construction is complete. They could be responsible for overseeing that services such as cleaning, security and parking etc. are provided and health and safety standards are maintained.
career-opportunities.cost_estimator: On large projects, a cost estimators are involved in budget development and financial forecasting. They calculate the projected costs associated with labor, materials, equipment, permitting etc., set timeline for the project and may also negotiate with the subcontractors for better deals.

consultancy-as-a-career-in-india.title: Consultancy
consultancy-as-a-career-in-india.summary: The field of international relations falls within both the Social Sciences and the Political Sciences. This discipline focuses on the study of relations between sovereign nations, including those relating to political, economic, and diplomatic matters. In addition, it looks at issues such as the role of international organizations, non-governmental organizations (NGOs) and multilateral corporations in these matters. Consultants in international relations can play a variety of roles, including examining, analyzing, and interpreting international policies, legislation, government policies, and the activities of businesses, organizations, and governments, liaising with government officials, civic bodies, research agencies, the media, and political parties concerned with foreign issues etc.

career-opportunities.consulting_firms: Consulting firms hire international relations consultants. The positions in these firms can be temporary, long-term, or permanent. A consultant typically assists organizations with overcoming current challenges and planning for the future.
career-opportunities.multinational_companies: Businesses such as those in the banking, energy, technology, and construction sectors require business development leaders with both international consulting experience and specialized knowledge.
career-opportunities.government_and_international_development: Organizations like the U.S. Department of State, United Nations, or World Health Organization, work in international relations, dealing with things such as diplomacy, foreign policy, intelligence, and security.
career-opportunities.nongovernment_organizations_ngos: Organizations such as non-governmental organizations deal with a variety of topics including climate change, education, advancing science and technology, maintaining social and cultural heritage, and access to health care.
career-opportunities.niche_industries: Markets in niche industries have a very specialized audience worldwide. Executive recruitment agencies, luxury travel and real estate agencies, meeting and event planning firms, art collections, and relocation consultants can all be examples of such firms.

path 1.stream: Clear class XII in any stream
path 1.graduation: Undergraduate degree in any subject (some colleges prefer if your undergraduate degree is in the social sciences or humanities field)
path 1.after graduation: Masters in International Relations

path 2.stream: Clear class XII in any stream
path 2.graduation: Undergraduate degree in any subject (some colleges prefer if your undergraduate degree is in the social sciences or humanities field)

pros: High Growth Potential Having the opportunity to meet new people, discover new places, and experience new things.
cons: Fluid working hours

content-writing-as-a-career-in-india.title: Content Writer
content-writing-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Content Writing is a skill based career. There is no specialized degree or course in the field of Content Writing. Not all writers have Literature Background. But a bachelor's degrees in Journalism, English or Mass Communication, are the recommended degrees to become a Content Writer. People who have the art of expressing their thoughts in words can become good content writers. To become an effective content writer, you need to write regularly. A content writer write content for websites, blogs, articles, stories, newspaper articles, training modules and so on. A content writer embrace their writing piece. As a writer, vagueness should not be there in your writing pieces. With experience, you know how and where to edit, recognize and correct common mistakes, grammatical errors, and write vivid descriptions.

career-opportunities.web_content_writer: Web Content Writers compose content for online consumption. As a web content writer, you have to write information about the company, how does the company works, product/services, blogs/articles, information about the team members, customer testimonials, email marketing and so on. They are expected to create content that is optimized for the web. As a writer, you must break things down into short paragraphs, with headers if necessary, use bullet points and highlight important words or phrases. Mostly, web content writers are freelancers, however, a lot of companies offer full-time jobs as well.
career-opportunities.freelancers: As a freelancer, your roles and responsibilities depend upon which organization you are working with. Your work ranges from social media engagement to content development to email marketing and collateral development. In Social Media Engagement, you have to create and post informative content on various Social Media platforms and manage them. For Content Development, you have to research, create engaging blogs, promote and share blogs on platforms like Quora, Medium etc. You have to edit and proofread content as well. Email Marketing would include creating and managing various email campaigns, including the template designs, calls-to-action, and content used in our email. Collateral Development include creating marketing collaterals such as Posters, Smart Fliers/Brochures, Videos, White Papers, Customer Case Studies, Student Testimonials etc.
career-opportunities.creative_content_writer_and_editor: Creative Content Writers and Editors are hired by various publishing houses. You have write current news, blogs/articles on trendy topics, reviews and so on. They are also involved in composing statement of purpose, letters of recommendations, resumes, application essays, scholarship letters, motivation letters and so on. You should be able to translate client briefs into creative ideas, able to write and put ideas clearly and must have strong communication & creative writing skills.
career-opportunities.content_writers_for_marketing: They have to write and coordinate content for newsletters, blogs, testimonials, email templates, corporate reports, presentations, etc. and juggles several content projects at the same time. You have to contribute to the companys social channels (with emphasis on Facebook, Instagram, Quora, Twitter & LinkedIn), helps plan and implement social marketing campaigns for specific marketing goals, and stays up-to-date with best practices in writing for the web, social media trends, web usability, web design, search engine optimization, and business/industry trends.
career-opportunities.blogger: Blogging helps you become better in the area of your interest. A blog is a great way to build a network of people who respect you for your ideas. There are three different types of bloggers. First, for them blogging is a hobby. They have the passion for a topic, and would love to share their knowledge over various platforms. Second, Part-time bloggers, they start their own blogging channel from the scratch or they could be a freelancer/employed blogger for an established company or site. Third, Full-time bloggers are the ones who earn through their blogs, have a good audience base and avid readers who trust their blogs.
career-opportunities.script_writer: The Audio/Video script writer is responsible for creating shoot-ready scripts for video, audio and multimedia for training modules. You have to connect with your audience with right tone and should know how and when to modulate your voice. As a Script Writer, you must be adept at working across multiple platforms. You must have strong attention to detail while working. Through your work, you must use new and interesting ideas so as to engage your target audience.

Writing informative Blogs, Articles, Newsletters for Magazines, Newspapers, Company’s Website.
Providing Services like Statement of Purpose, Letters of Recommendation, Resume Writing, Overseas Application Essays, Motivation Letters and so on.
Creating Marketing Collaterals such as Posters, Smart Fliers/Brochures, Videos, White Papers, Customer Case Studies, Testimonials etc.

pros: You get to work as a freelancer or work from home. You can work from any place any time.
They are in great demand especially in Business and Marketing field. Thus, you earn a lot of money.
With time, your writing capabilities, vocabulary and language fluency improves.
cons: There is a lot of competition involved and thus, you have to be best in your own way.
Although, the job is quite flexible, however, you have to stick to your deadlines.
Content writing can sometimes become very dull and monotonous job.

cullinary-arts-as-a-career-in-india.title: Culinary Arts
cullinary-arts-as-a-career-in-india.summary: If having a kitchen, instead of cubicle as your work place as well as not being slaved to a computer excites you and you'd rather create your masterpiece using food, then culinary arts is your field. There are different responsibilities one may have to take up depending on the job role, starting from Preparing food, baking, presentation of food, supervision of kitchen etc. This job may require working across different locations and time-zones, which could be extremely exciting!

career-opportunities.chef: A chef is an experienced and skilled individual who is not only responsible for the cooking of the food, but also for the presentation of food, supervision of the kitchen and staff members.
career-opportunities.culinary_chef: A culinary chef who specializes in catering not only manage the food and drinks, but also to the arrangement of the venue and decor. Catering can be for hotels, private catering or even mobile catering for a station.
career-opportunities.baker: A baker is a skilled individual who specialises in baking ingredients to produce a variety of recipes, breads, and other goods
career-opportunities.pastry_chef: A pastry chef is an individual trained in making pastries and baked goods, such as breads, cookies, etc.
career-opportunities.sommelier: A sommelier creates the wine list at high end restaurants, interacts with customers and staff in order to suggest wines, and how they could be paired with the food

dairy-technology-as-a-career-in-india.title: Dairy Technology
dairy-technology-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Dairy Technology is concerned with the handling and management of milk starting from production and processing right down to consumption. It includes processing, storage, packaging, transport and physical distribution. It aims at preventing spoilage of milk, increase its shelf-life, improve quality and make it safe for human consumption. Other than that, some principles of engineering, physics, chemistry and economics are also used in the field of dairy technology, in order to develop the appropriate milk utilization and their products. The growth and expansion of dairy industries have opened up vast job opportunities as there are more than 400 dairy plants in the country.

career-opportunities.dairy_supervisor: Dairy supervisors manage employees in charge of dairy production and oversee the daily operations. They can work in a dairy plant either in plant design, equipment or project execution.
career-opportunities.dairy_consultant: Dairy consultants provide support to the organizations in the dairy industry looking for investors, help build them strategic alliances, joint ventures, foreign partnerships and help existing dairy units to be more effective and efficient and also improve their profits by being efficient at all functional areas.
career-opportunities.freelancer: Freelancers can start their own creamery units, ice-cream units and milk plants.
career-opportunities.government_organizations: Dairy technologists are recruited by Quality Control departments. There are opportunities available in the dairy products manufacturing companies run by the government.
career-opportunities.private_organizations: Dairy technologists can also pursue their career as marketing personnel or Dairy engineers with private companies. Various companies like HUL, Verka, Nestle, Mother Dairy, Amul offer jobs in their firms.
career-opportunities.teacher: Those who wish to pursue their career in the teaching field can apply for lecturer posts available in various institutions which offer Dairy Technology courses.
career-opportunities.researcher_dairy_scientist: This field has lots of opportunities for those who want to pursue a career as a researcher. They can also work as a dairy scientist in various research institutes.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in Science Stream with PCB/PCM (Maths is recommended)
path 1.graduation: Pursue B. Tech (Dairy Technology) for 4 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M. Tech (Dairy Technology) for 2 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII in Science Stream with PCB/PCM (Maths is recommended)
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. (Dairy Technology) for 3 years
path 2.after graduation: Pursue M.Sc. (Dairy Technology) for 2 years

pros: The dairy industry in India is growing at a fast pace.

The salaries are average.

dentist-as-a-career-in-india.title: Dentist
dentist-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Dentist is skilled and licensed to diagnose,treat and prevent injuries and malformations of the teeth, jaws, and mouth . They advice and instruct on taking care of teeth and gums and on diet choices that affect oral health.They treat diseases and infection of nerve, pulp, and other dental tissues affecting oral hygiene.

career-opportunities.endodontics: It is the branch of the dentistry that deals with the study and treatment of the dental pulp.It is the practice of basic clinical science including the biology of the normal pulp, diagnosis , treatment and prevention of diseases .Their job also includes treating the injuries of the pulp and they carry the root canal procedures.
career-opportunities.oral_and_maxillofacial_surgeon: It is the branch of dentistry that focuses on surgery to treat the diseases of the mouth, jaw and face.They carry out research and diagnose the diseases using clinical, radiographic, microscopic, biochemical or other kind of examinations.
career-opportunities.orthodontics: Orthodontics deals with the diagnosis, prevention and correction of malpositioned teeth , jaws and facial irregularities.
career-opportunities.pedodontics: The branch of Dentistry that deals with the care for teeth, gums and mouth of children.
career-opportunities.periodontics: The branch of dentistry concerned with the diseases related to the gum.They are trained in the latest techniques for diagnosing and treating the periodontal disease. They are also trained to carry cosmetic periodontal procedures.
career-opportunities.prosthodontics: Prosthodontics deals with the design, manufacture, and fitting of artificial replacements of teeth and other parts of the mouth.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in Science with Biology stream
path 1.graduation: Graduation Program 5 years BDS (4 Years of study + 1 Year Internship)
path 1.after graduation: Post Graduation Program 2 years MDS

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII in Science with Biology stream

dentist-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: NEET 2019 to be held on Sunday, 5th May 2019 ( 2 to 5 PM) and the result will be declared in percentile form on the website - 5th June 2019Eligibility is 50% marks in Class XII or equivalent with PCB (physics, chemistry, Biology ) as main subjects. Maths is not essential. Admissions to all seats of MBBS/BDS will be done through NEET (UG). Following are the seats, available under different quotas: - i.All India Quota Seats ii. State Government Quota Seats iii. Central Institutions/Universities/Deemed Universities iv. State/Management/NRI Quota Seats in Private Medical / Dental Colleges or any Private University v. Central Pool Quota Seats 15 % Central quota will be filled through online counseling. Admission to AIIMS and JIPMER will not be through NEET 2019 11 regional languages are also applicable for writing the test The candidate should be min 17 years of age and max 25 years when admitted to first year of college ( UG study, General quota ) Candidates who have passed 10+2 from Open School or as private candidates shall not be eligible to appear for "National Eligibility Cum Entrance Test". Furthermore, study of Biology/Biotechnology as an Additional Subject at 10+2 level also shall not be permissible.( under challenge in Delhi High court ) Internship Is compulsory for BDS of 5 year program.

Setting up your own clinic inloves high cost.
The profession can be physically demanding.

developmental-psychologist-as-a-career-i.title: Developmental Psychologist
developmental-psychologist-as-a-career-i.summary: To comprehend human behaviour, the study of the psychology of development is vital. Human beings go through several stages of growth throughout their lives. While most people follow general growth patterns, developmental psychologists explore how individuals grow and adapt at different stages of life. This research helps us to aid individuals in making the best possible choices, while also helping to identify any potential psychological issues that might need attention. Babies who do not walk by 15 months, for example, may show a delay in developmental life or symptoms of a more serious illness. Development psychologists strive to comprehend the situation and to recognise and treat any new conditions with parents and physicians. This diagnoses and treatment is done for all stages of human life.

path 1.stream: Clear 12th grade in any stream
path 1.graduation: B. A. / B. Sc. Psychology
path 1.after graduation: M. Sc. / M. A. Developmental Psychology

14.name: Chhatrapati Shahu Ji Maharaj University, Kanpur

pros: Developmental psychologists can make beneficial changes in people's lives, whether working in a research environment or in a therapeutic context. They contribute to environmental Wellness Psychologists in the subject of developmental psychology can find jobs in a broad variety of environments, from schools and hospitals to government organisations. This facilitates obtaining jobs and also offers the opportunity to get experience in other areas. The workplace and years of experience determines primarily the income, although there is surely possibility that will earn a decent salary.
cons: Psychologists may work highly demanding in all fields. Long hours and severe deadlines can generate a lot of stress for developmental psychologists working in scientific contexts. Those who work in clinical settings can be highly stressful in interacting with clients who have been subjected to incredibly tough life conditions. As a result of dealing with clients in distress, all psychologists experience emotional exhaustion. Although many developmental psychologists don't interact with customers directly, those who do can hardly be protected against being emotionally drained from their profession. The working time might be extensive and unpredictable especially for developmental psychologists working in clinical settings. Work tasks can often interrupt nights and weekends. Developmental psychologists often also work on vacation days.

digital-marketing-as-a-career-in-india.title: Digital Marketing
digital-marketing-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Digital marketing is a fast-expanding field with excellent opportunities to build a career. Using various media vehicles such as e-commerce, mobile commerce, etc. they promote the organization’s products and brands. Digital marketing has become a critical pillar for an organizations marketing department as it enables the organization to analyze marketing campaigns and understand what is working and what isn’t typically in real time.

career-opportunities.search_engine_optimization_seo: Search engine optimization is a technique, or strategy to increase the number of visitors to a website by obtaining a high-ranking placement in the search result pages of a search engine (SERP) including Google, Yahoo, Bing, Firefox, and others.
career-opportunities.email_marketing: It is also known as direct marketing wherein commercial message is sent to a group of people using email. Unlike spam, direct email marketing reaches those target audience to inform them about company?-?s products and services.
career-opportunities.mobile_marketing: Mobile marketing is marketing on or with a mobile device, such as a cell phone. It is any marketing activity conducted through a ubiquitous network to which consumers are constantly connected using a personal mobile device.
career-opportunities.social_media_marketing: It is a form of Internet marketing which is done so as to increase the brand exposure and broaden customer reach. Various social networking websites are used as a marketing tool, such as Facebook, twitter, Instagram, etc.
career-opportunities.content_marketing: Content marketing is a strategic marketing approach focused on creating and distributing valuable, relevant, and consistent content to attract and retain a clearly-defined audience ?-" and, ultimately, to drive profitable customer action. Content marketing?-?s purpose is to attract and retain customers by consistently creating and curating relevant and valuable content with the intention of changing or enhancing consumer behavior.
career-opportunities.affiliate_marketing: It is a type of performance-based marketing in which a business rewards one or more affiliates for each visitor or customer brought by the affiliate's own marketing efforts.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in any Stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue Graduation in Any Discipline for 3-5 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue Certificate Course in Digital Marketing

work description: Design, build and maintain the presence in the social media to reach the target audience
Develop, plan and execute digital marketing campaigns such as web campaigns, SEO/SEM, database marketing and display advertising campaigns
Sell the organization's products and services using the online or mobile platform to enhance market share
Measure and report performance of all digital marketing campaigns, and assess target goals
Coordinate with internal teams to create landing pages of websites and optimize the overall user experience
Utilize strong analytical ability to evaluate end-to-end customer experience across multiple channels and customer touch points
Use web analytics software to monitor performance of customers on the web or mobile platform and make recommendations for improvement

pros: Its reach is vast so you can impact the lives of mass audience.
Opportunity to earn good money, as one can work in an organization as well as a freelancer.
cons: Lot of competition present in the industry.
Requires a lot of patience, convincing a client about your idea takes a lot of effort, time and money

diplomaticservices.title: Diplomatic Services
diplomaticservices.summary: Diplomatic services comes under the Indian Foreign services in India. It is a highly reputable job. The new entrants undergo a multi-faceted and comprehensive training programme intended to give them a thorough grounding in diplomatic knowledge, diplomatic qualities and diplomatic skills. Diplomats represent the country in it's Embassies, High Commissions, Consulates, and Permanent Missions to multilateral organisations like the Unites nations. They promote friendly relations with other countries and protect national interests of their own country.

career-opportunities.work_for_the_government: They work in close collaboration with the government.
career-opportunities.ambassador: Ambassadors officially represent the Indian government on behalf of the president in treaty negotiations, immigration discussions, foreign aid projects, and humanitarian aid programs. They?supervise and lead all foreign service employees in the country where they work.
career-opportunities.counsellor: Counsellor works as a Secretary-level principal officer and serves the seniors as a special advisor and consultant on major problems of foreign policy
career-opportunities.first_secretary: They monitor and assess the emerging situation in the host country and countries of coexisting authorization. They keep a tab on the political, economic and the socio-cultural factors, and brief the Government to protect our national interests.
career-opportunities.second_secretary: They are required to collect relevant information, learn administrative work and follow up with the Ministry of external affairs in India.?

path 1.stream: Any stream with 50% and above aggregate.
path 1.graduation: Graduation in any field with preferable subjects being international relations, politics and law, public administration
path 1.after graduation: Clear UPSC exam

entrance exam.name: UPSC exam (Prelims, Mains and Interview )
entrance exam.elements: General Knowledge, English Language, Logical Reasoning

pros: > There are ample opportunities for promotions and growth The pay scale is good The job profile is of esteem and repute and they work with high level dignitaries
cons: > In some cases theres is red tapism There is scope for corruption

director-as-a-career-in-india.title: Direction
director-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Directors (film) have a dynamic role - they study a script and create narratives/messages for public entertainment and education. They actively audition actors, select cast, crew members, choose film locations. They also work on the budgetary aspects of filmmaking. Directors create motion pictures, television shows, and video productions. Depending on the demand of script and production houses, directors travel to various locations/countries to shoot the film. The directors explore new issues, topics and causes to write stories and direct movies on. They are well respected and earn well.

career-opportunities.film_editor: They conceptualize, shoot and edit a variety of stories, educational scripts, that drive the organization’s objectives, under deadlines, in an ever-changing production landscape, coordinating pre-production work.
career-opportunities.film_critic: Film critics review a movie's content and plot in depth, analyze the theme and evaluate how engaging the viewing experience was. They interview actors involved in making/ producing a film. They are sometimes required to research a subject or the technical details of a film.
career-opportunities.tape_editor: The tape editors execute the live webcast, on-screen graphics overlay, audio mixing, digital encoding for live and archival streams. They edit video footage to desired length and format, create motion graphics, and complete color corrections.
career-opportunities.cinematographer: A cinematographer, is the head of camera and light crews working on a movie, entertainment television production, news, or sports. They take the artistic and technical decisions related to the image.
career-opportunities.screenwriter: A screenwriter writes screenplays for television, film, and comics. Screenwriters are good at writing, storytelling, and use their imagination.

path 1.stream: Any stream with 50% and above aggregate.
path 1.graduation: Bachelors in Film Direction & Screenplay Course, cinematograpghy, editing BA/BFA/BS

path 2.stream: Any stream with 50% and above aggregate.
path 2.graduation: Bachelors in Film Direction & Screenplay Course, Cinematograpghy, Editing - BA/BFA/BS
path 2.after graduation: Bachelors in Film Direction & Screenplay Course, Cinematograpghy, editing - MA, MFA

A broad sense of knowledge of the areas under Visual Studies, Cinema Studies and Theatre and Performance Studies. Visual Studies- Broad knowledge of the history of world art in general, and of art in South Asia, from Indus Valley Civilization till the present. Cinema Studies- Broad knowledge of World Cinema, Film Movements, Digital Media Cultures and, Film/Media Practice. Theatre and Performance Studies- Broad knowledge of the history of theatre and dance including classical Greek theatre, Elizabethan theatre, classical Indian theatre, music, dance and performance.

entrance exam.name: Satyajit Ray Film & Television Institute Joint Entrance Test
entrance exam.elements: Test followed by orientation and interview

pros: -It gives you the freedom to create, direct stories and use your imagination and creativity. -It gives one the opportunity to think out of the box and reach out to more people. -They have the liberty to be creative, intuitive, sensitive, articulate, and expressive.
cons: -Initial years require long hours of work even in harsh conditions. -In case the films don't do well, they have to face the loss.

doctor-as-a-career-in-india.title: Doctor
doctor-as-a-career-in-india.summary: By far the noblest profession, doctors play a critical role towards maintaining health and fitness by diagnosing & treating illnesses or injuries of patients. As general physician examines patients; record medical histories; prescribe medications; analyze and interpret diagnostic tests. They may also counsel patients on preventive health care. In the field of medicine, one can specialize in across a wide range of domains and gain the relevant expertise to treat and help patients with specific problems. Career as a doctor can be very rewarding and highly satisfying but it involves a lot of hard work and relatively longer education & training period.

career-opportunities.cardiologist: The doctor with special training and skill in treating and preventing cardiovascular diseases.
career-opportunities.dermatologist: A physician who specializes with the diagnosis, treatment and prevention of skin, hair, nails etc.
career-opportunities.epidemiologist: Epidemiologist are the physicians which are also referred to as 'disease detectives'. They carry out studies of diseases and come up with ways of prevention of diseases through vaccinations, etc.
career-opportunities.gynecologist: The doctor who studies and treats diseases of the female reproductive system.
career-opportunities.neurologist: These are doctors who treat the most delicate and important organ of the body i.e. the brain. They treat seizures, strokes, Parkinson's, Alzheimer's etc.
career-opportunities.orthopedic_surgeon: ?Physicians which handles and treats the problems that arise in the skeleton and its attachments i.e. the ligaments and tendons. It also deals with problems of the nervous system such as the ones that arise from spine injury.
career-opportunities.radiologist: The medical use of X-rays or other imaging technologies for diagnoses and treatment of disease is carried out by a radiologist.
career-opportunities.surgeon: A surgeon is a medical specialist who performs?surgery. They perform operations related to different specialties of medicine. Various branches of surgery include general surgery, neurosurgery, cardiovascular, cardiothoracic surgery, ENT, maxillo-facial surgery, plastic surgery, oral surgery, transplant surgery, urology, etc.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in Science with Biology stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue MBBS for 5.5 years (4.5 years study + 1 year internship)
path 1.after graduation: Pursue MD in Select Specialization for 2 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII in Science with Biology stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue MBBS for 5.5 years (4.5 years study + 1 year internship)

work description: Diagnose and treat various illnesses
Specialise in multiple domains such as skin, heart, brain, eyes, bones, etc.
Interpret different tests and reports to reach a logical conclusions
Prescribe medicines and in some cases perform surgeries to cure the disease
Promote health care and hygiene among patients and general public
Remain up to-date with contemporary research to alleviate different diseases and illnesses
Communicate with clients with empathy and care
Keep a check on the staff and guide them appropriately
Manage the case histories and accounts of patients

pros: Being able to provide service to others: Physicians provide a meaningful service using medical science for others. Many individuals are drawn to the profession because they want to help others in a direct and stimulating way. Doctor gives you the power to be able to do help others. By helping others the individual gets the feeling that their knowledge or actions has helped someone and is what makes this job morally rewarding and satisfying.
Job security: This is one profession which would always be in demand and is not affected by any recession. We all will always need doctors.
Money and prestige: Physicians/doctors have a relatively high salary and income. They generally gain community respect.
cons: Long training process: To practice as a doctor it requires at least four years of college with internship and 2-3 years of masters in the specialized area. It makes the whole process too long.
High college fees: The fees of medical colleges are generally very high.
Long work hours and high stress: A physician's job is very demanding. It requires physical, mental and emotional involvement of the doctor and drains his/her energy.

economics-as-a-career-in-india.title: Economics
economics-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Economists study the production and distribution of resources, goods, and services by collecting and analyzing data and researching trends. They provide specialist advice to a range of stakeholders and work across multiple domains. With the rapidly globalizing economic scenario, qualified economists are in huge demand not only in India but also across the world. They analyze all the data they have gathered to assess feasibility, do forecasts of economic trends and make recommendations of ways to improve efficiency. The research and analysis of data is done using a variety of software program, including spreadsheets, statistical analysis, and database management program.

career-opportunities.banking_firms: Economists study interest rates to see their effect on banking systems. They are concerned with advising and providing services for a range of banking clients and consumers.
career-opportunities.multinational_companies: Many corporations require the skills of micro-economists, like projecting customer demand or product sales, both of the client firm and their competitors to maximize profit. These economists also review new legislation, like minimum wage requirements or tariffs, and how it will affect their client.
career-opportunities.financial_consultancy: Consulting firms involve micro & macroeconomic study and make predictions by gathering many different statistics, compiling large databases & analyzing trends. Financial consultants work for multiple clients instead of just one organization. Up-to-date industry knowledge and awareness of corporate finance is essential in these roles.
career-opportunities.public_sector: In the public sector, economists serve to keep governmental finances under control. They look at the government?-?s involvement in the economy, such as taxation, deficits or surpluses in budget, or policies concerning welfare.
career-opportunities.insurance_and_accountancy_firms: In the field of accounting one can work across multiple industries, focusing on monitoring the financial situation of an organization, business or individual. One requires strong analytical skills, mathematical proficiency & computational ability in these roles.
career-opportunities.research_firms_and_think_tanks: They study and analyze a variety of economic issues. Their analysis and forecasts are frequently published in newspapers and journal articles.
career-opportunities.acturial_sciences: Economists prefer going for Acturial Sciences by clearing the actuary papers. They need to have in-depth knowledge of Econometrics, Financial Economics, Enterprise Risk Management

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in Any Stream With/without Economics as a subject (Mathematics is compulsory)
path 1.graduation: Graduation + post graduation Pursue M.Sc Integrated Program in Economics for 5 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII in Any Stream with/without Economics as a Subject (Mathematics is compulsory)
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.A. (H)- Economics/ B.A. (H) in Business Economics/ BBA-FIA/ BMS for 3 years
path 2.after graduation: Pursue Post Graduation in Management/ Any Other Related Discipline for 2-3 years

path 3.stream: Clear Class XII in Any Stream with/ without Economics as a subject (mathematics is compulsory)
path 3.graduation: Pursue B.A.(H) Economics BBA-FIA/ BMS for 3 years
path 3.after graduation: Pursue Masters in field you want to do specialization in (International Eco etc.)

economics-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: Almost every University requires Maths as a mandatory subject in Class XIIMust have passed class 12th or Senior Secondary Examination with at least 50% marks including English

work description: Advise businesses, governments, and individuals on economic issues
Design policies or make recommendations for solving economic problems
Write articles for publication in newsletters and academic journals
Apply theories and trends to benefit different organizations and industries
Review new legislation, like minimum wage requirements or tariffs
Provide economic advice to diverse set of stakeholders
Carry out Research and analysis of past and present economic issues
Analyze data using understanding of economic relationships to uncover trends
Prepare reports, tables, and charts that present research results through exhaustive analysis of data
Interpret and forecast impact of market trends on business/ economy

pros: Economics is one of the most sought after career options. With growing economy worldwide, economists are in great demand in colleges and universities, banks, rating agencies, securities firms etc. Some of them can pay an economist in 6 figures. They have a high ability to influence the standard of living of an average man on the street.
An experienced & knowledgeable Economist can talk his way out & gain respect from people from all walks of life.
An economist is better informed of the complexities in the world.
cons: A career in economics has a wide scope, however, it’s not everyone’s piece of pie. One has to be in the know-about of all economic events happening in the world, be consistent throughout the graduation and post-graduation period and even after his studies are completed.

entomology-as-career.title: Entomology
entomology-as-career.summary: Entomology is a branch of zoology which studies insects and their interaction and relationships with humans, their environment and other organisms. Entomologists specifically contributes to the welfare of humankind by revealing the contribution of insects in the spread of diseases and determining ways of protecting crops and livestock from being damaged. Entomologists make a sizeable contribution in fields such as agriculture, chemistry, biology, human/animal health, molecular science, criminology and forensics. This field serves as the basis for developments in biological and chemical pest control, food and fiber production and storage, pharmaceuticals epidemiology, biological diversity, and a variety of other fields of science.

career-opportunities.medical_or_public_health_entomologists: Medical or Public Health Entomologists are engaged in public health work in different areas of research and in the control of houseflies, mosquitoes, cockroaches, lice, fleas, ticks and many other pests that pose a health hazard or nuisance problem. Veterinary entomology is also included in this category.
career-opportunities.military_entomologists: They work for the various branches of the armed forces. They supervises pest control operations and protect the military personnel against insect-borne diseases and parasites
career-opportunities.forensic_entomologists: Forensic entomologists deal with graphic crime scene evidence as well as competently discuss graphic or disturbing aspects of a criminal investigation. They have the responsibility to use their knowledge of insects to resolve legal investigation.
career-opportunities.agricultural_entomologists: They are responsible to protect valuable crops from insect pests. Their main job is to develop innovative ways to control the harmful insects and pesticides. They educate the public about insect pests, pesticides and pest management.
career-opportunities.forest_entomologists: Forest Entomologists are concerned with the study of all insect species and related arthopods that inhabit and interact in forest ecosystems and the management of insect pests that cause the degrading, defoliation, crown dieback, death of trees or destruction of wood in forests.
career-opportunities.commercial_entomologists: Commercial Entomologists are responsible to control the pest affecting shade trees, lawns, ornamental plants, homes, warehouses, stores, hotels and restaurants. They work for Industry rather than public agencies.
career-opportunities.survey_entomologists: Survey Entomologists are responsible for reviewing all-important crops in a given state or area for possible insect outbreaks and alerts farmers and growers before a major problem arises.
career-opportunities.research_entomologists: Research entomologists are responsible for designing research studies, caring for the insect subjects, supervising laboratory assistants, recording data, analyzing data, preparing reports, and publishing study findings in professional scientific journals for peer review.

path 1.stream: Class XII in Science stream with Biology
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.Sc.(Hons) Entomology for 3 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M.Sc. Entomology for 2 years

path 2.stream: Class XII in Science stream with Biology
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. (Hons) Biology/ Zoology/ Life Science for 3 years
path 2.after graduation: Pursue M.Sc. Zoology/ Life Science/ Entomology For 2 years

cons: • Involvement in field work can be tedious• Job positions can be in remote locations• Risk of health problems if proper safety measures are not taken

entrepreneurship-as-a-career-in-india.title: Entrepreneurship
entrepreneurship-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Entrepreneurship involves designing of business idea followed by launching and running a new business. Typically, it begins as a small business, such as a startup company. The business can involve offering a product, process or service for sale. The owners of such a venture are referred as ‘entrepreneurs’. Given the pace of development in the country, positive political environment and the myriad of opportunities; draw of youth to entrepreneurship has become rather magnetic. Life of an entrepreneur is extremely challenging. One needs to be hard-working, persistent, networked, smart, creative, willing to take risks and extremely good at managing relations. There are no specific educational requirements for becoming an entrepreneur but strong educational background and work experience makes the probability of success slightly higher. While successful entrepreneurs are generally well trained & qualified in their field; specific education qualifications can vary.

career-opportunities.startup: As the name suggests, creating a startup is all about starting from the scratch. As a founder of a startup an individual needs to put an innovative idea to implementation by putting together a cohesive team.
career-opportunities.family_business: Entrepreneurs who have an existing family business, become second/ third generation entrepreneurs and take their existing businesses to greater heights.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in Any stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue Graduation BBA, B.Com, BBE or any commerce related field.
path 1.after graduation: Pursue MBA in entrepreneurship, HR, Finance, etc.

entrepreneurship-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: There is no minimum eligibility to become an entrepreneur.Brilliant idea, execution skill and zeal is all that is needed. A strong educational background can increase the probability of success. Most top business schools in the country offer programs in Entrepreneurship and Family Business.

work description: Research on and recognize upcoming business opportunities
Develop innovative strategies to solve customer problems and create a viable business
Operate the business on a day to day basis overseeing details and making the organization successful
Liaison with investors, mentors, customers and multiple stakeholders to establish the business
Hire the right talent as per the requirements of the business
Define the organization's culture by leading as an example
Create publicity campaigns, social media campaigns and face-to-face events to deliver relevant message to the right audience
Develop value and efficiency by streamlining systems and procedures

pros: Your business gives you flexibility to choose the work you want to do and utilize your strengthens to maximum.
Can schedule your work hours according your convenience.
Seeing your business grow will give you a feeling of satisfaction.
cons: In the initial years it might be required to work for longer hours.
As the work is your responsibility, there can be stressful days as well.
Starting your business involves risk.

environmental-science-as-a-career-in-ind.title: Environmental Science
environmental-science-as-a-career-in-ind.summary: Environmental Science is an interdisciplinary field that integrates physical, biological, and information sciences to study the environment and various environmental problems. Environmental Scientists work on prime subjects such as the understanding of earth processes, evaluating alternative energy systems, pollution control and mitigation, natural resource management, and the effects of global climate change.

career-opportunities.environmental_analyst: Environmental Analysts basically help companies public and government understand the impacts of human activities on the environment. They study and analyze the various aspects of the environment to propose policies and practices to make the interactions between the environment and humans less harmful.
career-opportunities.environmental_lobbyist: Environmental Lobbyists work to petition for environmental issues with politicians and government at various levels to influence them to pass laws, regulations and policies for a cleaner and safer environment. They often organize and conduct campaigns to push agendas to promote safer industrial and environmental practices.
career-opportunities.environmental_management_and_conservatio: Environmental Scientists engaged in the environmental management and conservation sector are interested with the control and resolution of various environmental issues, to conserve the environment. Potential employment opportunities exist with government organizations, private ecological consulting firms, wildlife rehabilitation centers, pollution control board, etc.
career-opportunities.environmental_consultant: Environmental scientists can be employed as consultants to provide expert advice and review to government and private organizations on matters of the environment. They also play a significant role in shaping the policies of the government.
career-opportunities.waste_management_officer: Waste management officers manage and coordinate safe disposal of waste, and conduct recycling activities and related tasks. Opportunities in this domain are available both in the public and private sector.
career-opportunities.natural_resource_manager: A natural resource manager is involved in the handling and general management of plants, lakes, soil, forests, and other natural resources. Jobs for natural resource managers are available in both government and private settings.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Biology
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. (Hons) Environmental Science or B.Sc. (Hons) Biological Sciences or B.Sc. Life Science for 3 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M.Sc. Environmental Science for 2 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Biology
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. (Hons) Environmental Science or B.Sc. (Hons) Biological Sciences or B.Sc. Life Science for 3 years
path 2.after graduation: Pursue PG Diploma in Environmental Science for 1-2 years

environmental-science-as-a-career-in-ind.Important Facts: Some colleges/University have admissions in B.Sc.(Hons) in Environmental Science following their own entrance test or considers the marks in the qualifying exam.
work description: Collecting and examining data from different environments (soil, air and water).
Examining the effects of human activities on the environment.
Preparing and presenting reports of the information gathered.
Developing ways to protect environment from various damages.
Executing environmental inspections, investigating transgress.
Suggest on the development and conduct of regulatory actions.
Estimating and executing environmental plans, strategies and official rules or actions.
Developing programmes to protect earth, its environment and habitats.

pros: Professionals get the opportunities to work on, and lead advanced research projects.
Professionals have the opportunity to contribute to imporving the condition of the planet.
The field is rapidly growing, and there are a number of research opportunities, both in India and overseas.
Professionals can work across various industries such as mines, sewage treatment plants, water treatment plants, fertilizer plants, distilleries etc.
cons: The educational path for the career is long, as a Ph.D is generally preferred.
It can be hard to get into the career, as it requires extensive knowledge, skill and traning.
The work might require one to work in bad weather and difficult conditions, when conducting fieldwork.

ethical-hacking-as-a-career-in-india.title: Ethical Hacking
ethical-hacking-as-a-career-in-india.summary: An ethical hacker is a computer and networking expert who systematically, legitimately and with company's permission, attempts to penetrate a computer system or network to find security vulnerabilities that a malicious hacker could potentially exploit. They use the same methods and techniques to test and bypass a system's defenses as their less-principled counterparts. They are employed by companies and businesses to penetrate their networks either to protect private and sensitive information or to test their network security.

career-opportunities.government_private_firms: With increasing cyber threats, government and private organizations are in search of Ethical Hackers who can help organizations protect themselves from threats or attacks in the cyber space. One can also work as a freelancer and work for multiple organizations.
career-opportunities.network_security_engineers: A Network Security Engineer is responsible for implementation, maintenance, and integration of corporate WAN, LAN and server architecture. They also look after implementation and administration of network security hardware and software and enforcing the network security policy.
career-opportunities.network_security_administrator: In addition to writing network security policies, the Security Administrator does frequent audits and ensures that security policies are up-to-date and are being followed. In addition, he/she takes corrective steps for breaches.
career-opportunities.security_consultant: Security consultants assess existing IT systems and infrastructures for weaknesses and then develop and implement IT security solutions to prevent unauthorized access, data modification or data loss.
career-opportunities.penetration_tester: Penetration testers try to break into or find possible exploits in different computer systems and software. They generally run a number of tests, based around network penetration.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in Science Stream with IT/Computer Science/ Similar
path 1.graduation: Pursue BSc in Computer Science/ BCA / Graduation in Any IT Related Discipline for 3-4 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue Certification Courses in Ethical Hacking (CEH, CCNA, SCNS, CPTE, CISSP)

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII in Science Stream with IT/Computer Science/ Similar
path 2.graduation: Pursue Certification Courses in Ethical Hacking (CEH, CCNA, SCNS, CPTE, CISSP)

ethical-hacking-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: Understanding of operating systems like Firefox, Linux and WindowsKnowledge of programming languages like C, C++, Python, Ruby, etc. No particular qualification is necessary except for the certification in Ethical Hacking Graduation degree in Computer Science will be useful

4.name: Institute of Ethical Hacking and Forensics

entrance exam.name: CEH Exam (EC Council)
entrance exam.elements: Programming Knowledge of Hacking (No Prescribed Syllabus)

work description: Understand the thinking pattern of a "criminal hacker" to work as an "ethical hacker"
Check for vulnerabilities within a computer system of different organisations
Formulate ways of protecting information of an organisation
Communicate with the clients and deliver written reports on the work done
Prepare documents for self on the work that has been done to keep a tab on the loopholes
Be transparent to the clients while going through their computer systems
Simulate breaches to network security of an organization and take steps to detect the potential areas of risk
Conduct advanced evaluations to identify vulnerabilities in computer systems
Have thorough knowledge on computers, tools, programming and networking
Remain up to-date with the latest research work and incorporate them in your system

pros: Helping to prevent cybercrime
High Earning Potential
Un-conventional career path
cons: May have to work Part-time
Needs you to maintain a strong ethical conduct
Very Analytical and focused work, not very interactive

event-management-as-a-career-in-india.title: Event Management
event-management-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Given the number of events that are taking place in today's time, event planning as a career is growing rapidly. As long as human exist events will continue to take place. The event to be organized may be as small as a birthday party or as big as the Presidential Inauguration. Event planners are well trained in supervising all basic arrangements required to make an event successful, such as, caterers, venues, decoration, transportation, themes, dress codes etc. If one seeks for a challenging job, has good networking skills and looking for varied role then event management is the career you should look out for.

career-opportunities.event_management_companies: Event planners are hired in event management companies for organising and coordinating meetings and conferences with different clients and associated companies.
career-opportunities.freelancer: As a freelancer, one may take up assignments from a diverse set of clients ranging from corporate to educational institute to government as well as media agencies.
career-opportunities.hotelsresortsbanquet_halls: Event planners are a significant part various hotels, resorts or banquet halls as it in these places that people want to celebrate their accomplishments with their friends and families in the form of birthday parties, weddings etc.
career-opportunities.non_profit_organisations: In NPO's the event planners organise and coordinate the meetings, conferences, ceremonies and so on and so forth.
career-opportunities.private_schools_universities: There are many private schools and universities that hire professional event planners to organise functions such as annual day, annual fests, educational conferences, assemblies etc.
career-opportunities.professional_associate_bodies: Event Planners work for Professional associations who hold events at regular intervals for their members.
career-opportunities.pr_firms: A lot of Event Planners work for Public Relation Firms.PR Firms and Event Industry are closely related.
career-opportunities.entertainment: Event planners can also indulge in events related to Theme park by organising fun activities for visitors as well as planning events in shopping during festival time.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in Any stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue Diploma in Event Management for 1-2 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue PG Diploma Course for 1-2 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII in Any stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue Graduation in any stream for 3 years
path 2.after graduation: Pursue PG Diploma Course/MBA /MA-PR for 1-2 years

2.name: National Academy of Event Management & Development

5.name: Indian Institute of Learning & Advanced Development

work description: Plan and organise events such as meetings, conferences, parties, weddings, etc.
Make arrangements in accordance with the objective of the event
Discuss and negotiate the plan with the client before implementing it
Coordinate and organize work with different vendors, suppliers or other stakeholders
Monitor the expenses as per the calculated budget
Coordinate between different professionals offering their respective expertise and service
Take charge of the event right from the beginning stage till the end
Ensure highest quality of satisfaction to the client and the visitors
Communicate effectively to build a good network
Manage accounts and tasks in an organised manner

pros: One gets to work starting from small projects to gigantic projects and after the success of the project, enormous satisfaction is felt.
The person becomes more open to different perspective of people and strengthen team work abilities.
The networking increases as there is an opportunity to meet new people.
The person gets to travel around the city as well as outside city and sometimes country.
cons: There is no fixed time of working hours and involves lots of travelling.
Patience and openness to criticism is required.
Events may involve stress due to high expectation of client.
There can be lack of stability. One month can be filled with back to back events while other month you may have nothing in hand.

exhibition_coordinator.title: Exhibition Coordinator
exhibition_coordinator.summary: An Exhibition Coordinator has responsibilities such as conceptualising, funding and executing exhibitions. An Exhibition Coordinator's main purpose is to collect content from clients and consultants and track it in order to help with the design process. They are detail-oriented, well-organized, and skilled communicators. Their work is to learn everything there is to know about the show, including the design and content, such as specific tales, objects, and photos. An Exhibition Coordinator's role includes ensuring that displays and graphic elements are consistent and accurate amongst the client, consultants, and design team. They also have the responsibility of assisting exhibit designers and graphic designers in determining the layout of the show.

career-opportunities.curator: As a Curator, you can procure artifacts, create exhibitions and maintain exhibits. They organize the display of artifacts in museums, organize exhibitions by choosing the display items, labelling them, arranging them, making purchases of rare and new collections for museum enrichment.
career-opportunities.consultant: Their job is to plan and design management strategies, create content,promote exhibitions and other cultural facilities.

path 1.stream: Class XII with subjects like history/ archaeology.
path 1.graduation: Pursue Bachelor?s degree in Museum Studies or in a related field.
path 1.after graduation: Pursue Master?s degree in Museum Studies (or equivalent field) or 2- 3 years of equivalent relevant experience.

path 2.stream: Class XII with any stream.
path 2.graduation: Pursue graduation in any discipline.
path 2.after graduation: M.A/ M.sc in museology for 2 years.

1.name: National Museum Institute of history of art, conservation and museology

2.name: The Maharaja Sayajirao University of Baroda

entrance exam.name: Entrance for University of Calcutta
entrance exam.elements: Related to the understanding of Museology

pros: You can participate in new exhibitions, programs and special events, which frequently happen in museums. Museums would be a great place to work as it involves educating large masses. Opportunity to travel and see precious exhibits all over the world.
cons: lot of competition involved and requires huge time investment. It is not easy to make a lot of money in this area.

exhibition_curator.title: Exhibition Curator
exhibition_curator.summary: An exhibition curator looks over a plethora of tasks that go into the planning and execution of an exhibition/event in an art gallery, museum or institute. They develop, manage, display and list collections of art and artefacts. They may also indulge in fundraising for the event and look after public relations. Hosting and proper execution are key to any succesful event and if required, these may be ensured by an Exhibition Curator.

career-opportunities.exhibition_coordinator: Plan, host and execute events requiring display of art, literary and historical work
career-opportunities.gallery_director: Manage daily operations of an art gallery

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in any stream
path 1.graduation: Bachelor's in any stream (desirable art history/museology/archaeology/applied arts/communications/event management, etc)
path 1.after graduation: Master's in Applied arts/Event management,etc

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII in any stream
path 2.graduation: Bachelor's in any stream (desirable art history/museology/archaeology/applied arts/communications/event management, etc)
path 2.after graduation: Master's in Applied arts/Event management,etc
