pros: variety of environment to work in: art galleries, various museums, institutes, etc allows to develop communication and managerial skills
cons: may get physically exhausting challenging when required to multitask

family-business-as-a-career-in-india.title: Family Business
family-business-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Family Business is a company or enterprise owned by members of the same family. Usually, family businesses involve participation by multiple generations but these enterprises can also be started and owned by spouses, siblings or cousins etc. Members of the family hold important positions in the business and have all control over decision making, strategising and management responsibilities. Different family members may also participate as stockholders, advisors or board members. Some of the most renowned business ventures such as the Tata Group and Aditya Birla Group are family-owned businesses.

career-opportunities.new_family_business: Some people collaborate with their siblings, spouses or cousins to start a new business venture with innovative ideas.
career-opportunities.existing_family_business: People who have an existing family business, become second/third generation entrepreneurs and take their existing family businesses to greater heights.

path 1.stream: Class 12 with any stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue BBA in Family Business and Entrepreneurship
path 1.after graduation: Pursue MBA in Family Business and Entrepreneurship

path 2.stream: Class 12 with any stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue Bachelors degree in any field
path 2.after graduation: Pursue MBA in Family Business and Entrepreneurship

entrance exam.elements: Numerical aptitude, gk, vocabulary, reading comprehension

pros: Working with family members ensures trust and commitment in the workplace. Work schedules may be flexible. It is less stressful for freshers to start a new job when they are working with their family members. The decision making process may be easier because of the shared values and history. Hiring within the family saves time and money from advertising and interviewing candidates.
cons: Personal and family rivalries could be carried into workplace which may hamper the growth of the business. Some family members may be hired or promoted without having the necessary education, experience or skills. Family members may have difficulty in giving negative feedback or performance review to other family members. Non-family employees may find it difficult to work with family members because of limited opportunities of promotion or favouritism. It may be difficult to decide who is in-charge or would be in the future.

fashion-business-management-as-a-career-.title: Fashion Business Management
fashion-business-management-as-a-career-.summary: Fashion Business Management, as the name suggests, deals with increasing and maintaining the brand value and awareness of a given product through media and advertisements. A fashion manager is responsible for creating new and innovative strategies for the marketing of a given product to increase its demand in the market. Fashion management thus involves a thorough research and analysis of the latest trends in the fashion industry in order to predict the success and popularity of the given product among the consumers, based on its price and usability. Therefore, fashion managers must have an eye for detail and must possess exemplary communication skills, along with an in- depth knowledge of the prevailing market trends.

career-opportunities.apparel_brands: A fashion manager in an apparel brand is responsible for a carrying- out a detailed analysis of various campaigns and advertisements, thereby monitoring the brand quality of their firm. Additionally, he/she closely studies the feedback obtained from customers to the new products launched by their firms. This may involve extensive amounts of travel for quality assurance and promotions of the newly launched products.
career-opportunities.boutiques: A fashion manager in a boutique is responsible for a carrying- out a detailed analysis of various campaigns and advertisements, thereby monitoring the brand quality of their firm. Additionally, he/she is also entitles to conduct research on customers' needs and requirements and then brief designers.
career-opportunities.retail_chain_outlets: A fashion manager in a retail chain is responsible for a carrying- out a detailed analysis of various campaigns and advertisements, thereby monitoring the brand quality of the fashion brand their retail chain carries. Additionally, he/she closely study the feedback obtained from customers to the new products launched by their firms. This may involve extensive amounts of travel for quality assurance and promotions of the newly launched products.
career-opportunities.fashion_product_manager: Responsible for developing products using trend analysis and determining whether or not it would appeal to the consumers.
career-opportunities.fashion_brand_manager: Responsible for building new and innovative strategies to promote a product and increase its brand value in the market, after a thorough study of the marketplace.
career-opportunities.fashion_marketing_manager: Responsible for creating strategies to increase the interest of the consumers towards a given product. This may be done through advertisements and campaigns.
career-opportunities.public_relations_pr_manager: A PR manager is responsible for building and maintaining relations with the media and the consumers. They organize public relations events such as press releases and press conferences in order to update the industry about the growth of their firm, as well as to obtain feedback from the consumers.
career-opportunities.teaching_in_an_institute_that_offers_cou: Experienced fashion designers may join as faculty members in institutes that offer courses in Fashion Business Management, so that they can share their expertise and knowledge with the budding fashion managers in order to train them better.

path 1.stream: Pass Class XII in Any Stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue B. A. (Hons.) Fashion & Lifestyle Business Management for 4 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue Master of Fashion Management/ Masters in Fashion Design Management for 2 years

path 2.stream: Pass Class XII in Any Stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue Diploma in Fashion Retail Management for 1 year
path 2.after graduation: Pursue PG Diploma in Retail Management

path 3.stream: Pass Class XII in Any Stream
path 3.graduation: Pursue B. A. (Hons.) Fashion & Lifestyle Business Management for 4 years
path 3.after graduation: Study Abroad and Pursue Master of Fashion Management/ Masters in Fashion Design Management for 1- 2 years

fashion-business-management-as-a-career-.Important Facts: Practical, industrial experience is a must. This can be achieved via internships or upon getting a job.

work description: Enhance the sales of fashion products using sales and marketing techniques
Define the positioning and segmentation strategy for the client or organization
Examine publicity methods to enhance brand awareness
Develop pricing strategy of fashion products to maximize the company’s share of the market and its profits
Observing the response of consumers and retail channels to make changes and innovations in products
Identify the need for new products and services based on customers feedback and oversee product development
Coordinating with other network partners like designers, merchandisers, retailers and manufacturers
Keeping up to date with latest fashion trends considering the consumers base for styling and costing of the products

pros: It is an upcoming field and variety of potential for growth.
You will get the opportunity to travel and interact with individuals.
You will learn the techniques of business and as it is not a hard-core designing field, you are not required to be creative.
cons: It is difficult to establish your name in the area.
You will be required to work at odd hours.
You would be required to be updated with the latest fashion trends, as well as business trends.

fashion-communication-as-a-career-in-ind.title: Fashion Communication
fashion-communication-as-a-career-in-ind.summary: Fashion communication is one of the fastest growing sub- fields in the fashion industry. It combines various facets of the lifestyle industry with the fashion industry, and hence is one of the most exciting and creative career options today. An individual specializing in fashion communication is adept with different aspects of the fashion industry, including designing graphics, displays, fashion photography, along with event planning and management and advertising. In other words, she/he is responsible for creating and maintaining the brand value of the firm in the market. She/he may be seen as the face of the firm which they are representing in the market, thereby operating as the link between their firm and the external world. An individual who possess outstanding communication skills and with in- depth knowledge of the fashion and lifestyle trends is an ideal candidate for a career in fashion communication.

career-opportunities.visual_merchandiser: Visual Merchandisers are the brains behind the glorious displays and decorations in stores of any brand. It is done to attract customers with the use of color, symmetry, presentation as well as interpersonal skills.
career-opportunities.brand_manager: Brand Managers are experts who work to create a positive and lasting impression on the minds of customers, pertaining to their brand. They aim to improve consumer satisfaction by improving service and adding value by monitoring changing trends in the market. Highlighting and creating a brand’s image is their expertise.
career-opportunities.image_consultant: Image consultants are responsible for advising firms and their employees about their personal appearance. They are experts on telling individuals what style, colour, material would best suit their personality and body type, and how to present themselves in front of others.
career-opportunities.fashion_journalist: Generating content for advertisements as well as for the print media to communicate with the consumers to know their demands and accordingly encompass these demands into the existing products of the firm in order to meet the needs of the consumers.
career-opportunities.corporate_communication_at_fashion_house: Fashion communication experts in fashion houses handle all the communication that takes place between the firm and media, or the rest of the industry. They design customized marketing plans and brand building strategies for fashion brands.
career-opportunities.visual_communications_expert: Visual communication experts major in using computer applications and software to design visual graphics for websites and multimedia companies. These designs often represent a company’s marketing goals.
career-opportunities.graphic_designer: Graphic designers are experts at constructing concepts visually, both on paper and by using computer software and applications. This is done to predict the success of a product and formulating strategies to reach out to a maximum number of consumers.
career-opportunities.advertising_firms: Fashion communication experts in advertising firms handle all the communication that takes place between the firm and the media or rest of the industry. They build the brand image of the fashion brand via advertising.
career-opportunities.public_relations_firms: Fashion communication experts in public relations firms handle all the communication that takes place between the firm and the media or rest of the industry. They build the brand image of the fashion brand by creating content for press releases on behalf of the firm, organizing and successfully carrying out press conferences to update the industry about the achievements of the firm, and so on.
career-opportunities.art_director: Art directors are responsible for defining the most apt manner for representing a given concept visually. For this purpose, they are required to choose which designs, art works and other elements such as photographs are to be used in order to improve overall look of a given space.
career-opportunities.fashion_photographer: Fashion photographers, as the name suggests, work with designers and models. They aim to highlight the latest clothing trends and other goods in new and innovative ways, through their photoshoots.
career-opportunities.teaching: Experienced fashion designers may join as faculty members in institutes that offer courses in this field, so that they can share their expertise and knowledge with the budding fashion communication experts, in order to train them better.

path 1.stream: Pass Class XII in Any Stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue B. Des. (Fashion Communication) for 4 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M. A. in Fashion Communication for 2 years

path 2.stream: Pass Class XII in Any Stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue Diploma in Fashion Communication for 1 year
path 2.after graduation: Pursue Post-graduate Diploma in Fashion Communication

path 3.stream: Pass Class XII in Any Stream
path 3.graduation: Pursue B. Des. (Fashion Communication) for 4 years
path 3.after graduation: Study Abroad and Pursue Master in Fashion Communication and Styling for 1- 2 years

pros: It is an emerging field, you will face less competition as compared to other domains of fashion industry.
You will get the opportunity to work and meet new people.
Your articles will be published in famous magazines.
cons: If your communication and networking skills are not up to the mark, you will have a hard time.
You would be required to work for long hours to meet the deadline.
Your written language and vocabulary should be excellent

fashion-design-as-a-career-in-india.title: Fashion Design
fashion-design-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Fashion designing is one of the extremely lucrative and glamorous career option and opens a world of opportunities for anyone with a passion in this field. Today one may choose to specialize in any one of the sub-fields of fashion such as Apparel designing, Jewelers designing, Accessory designing. The options are limitless! The job of a fashion designer is very demanding which involves meeting daily deadlines, traveling dusty roads to reach the local markets for procuring material, dealing with workers and managing a team effectively. Talented people in this domain enjoy glamour, success & high compensation.

career-opportunities.garment_and_textile_export_houses: Fashion designers in garment and textile export houses design and make apparel, including accessories like jewelry and footwear that appeal the buyers and meet their specific design requirements.
career-opportunities.textile_and_fabric_manufacturing_units: Fashion designers in textile and fabric manufacturing units design, make specifications and then oversee manufacturing of fabrics that meet the needs of the client.
career-opportunities.branded_fashion_showrooms: Fashion designers often design collections based on the requirements of high end fashion stores. These collections are then put across the stores, ready for sale.
career-opportunities.television_and_film_industry: Celebrated fashion designer design costumes and apparel to be donned by the who's who of the film and television industry. They often consider the plot of the movies and complexities of the characters in doing so.
career-opportunities.boutiques: Fashion designers design apparel to be displayed across designer boutiques.
career-opportunities.retail_chains: Fashion Designers often tie up with retail chains to make customer pleasing garments that are put at all locations of the retail brand.
career-opportunities.independent_selfemployed_fashion_designe: Fashion designers open their own stores/boutique studios where they design apparel based on the needs and the taste of their customers.
career-opportunities.teaching_in_an_institute_that_offers_cou: Experienced fashion designers may join as faculty members in institutes that offer courses in this field so that they can share their expertise and knowledge with the budding fashion designers in order to train them better.

path 1.stream: Pass Class XII in Any Stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. Fashion Designing/ B. Des. Fashion Design for 3- 4 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M.A. Des. In Fashion Design/ M. Des. in Fashion Design for 2 years

path 2.stream: Pass Class XII in Any Stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. Fashion Designing/ B. Des. Fashion Design for 3- 4 years
path 2.after graduation: Pursue PG-Diploma in Fashion Designing

path 3.after graduation: Study Abroad and Pursue M.A. Des. in Fashion Design/ M. Des. in Fashion Design for 1-2 years

work description: Visualising /creating an idea and producing a design by hand or through computer-aided design
Planning and developing wardrobe
Be up to date on emerging fashion trends along with general trends concerned with colour, fabrics and shapes
Understanding designing from a technical outlook
Coordinating closely with sales, buying and production teams to ensure the item suits the market and price
Source, select and buy fabrics
Supervising production of garments
Adapting prevailing designs for bulk production
Negotiating with customers and suppliers

pros: Watching other people wearing your art and creation will give a sense of satisfaction and achievement
Once you have gained enough knowledge and experience, you can start your own small-scale business.
Fashion designers are paid well and there are lots of opportunities with multiple shows happening daily.
The job will get you opportunity to travel.
cons: You would be required to work for long hours in order to meet deadlines.
The job can lead to distress owing to harsh criticisms from the customers.
You will be required to deal the clients will patience especially in the case of the difficult customers.
It will take a great amount of time, patience and hard work to prove your worth and build your reputation and name in the market.
The fashion industry is competitive, hence one needs to stand out and build a brand.

fashion-technology-as-a-career-in-india.title: Fashion Technology
fashion-technology-as-a-career-in-india.summary: The field of fashion technology involves everything from designing till the manufacturing of the garments. One should be well- versed in handling different types of materials and fabrics as they differ in their delicacy and other intricacies. Fashion Technologists work on the development of garment or fibers, improve production efficiency and ensure quality of the end product. As a fashion technologist one needs to consistently coordinate and manage multiple stakeholders and vendors. One also needs to regularly advise colleagues on the marketing side of the business about the technical aspects of the garments and fibers produced.

career-opportunities.branded_fashion_houses: Fashion technologists accumulate their design and technical aptitude to consult on problems faced by branded fashion houses. They constantly evaluate and tend to innovate processes and mechanisms in the design and manufacture of products.
career-opportunities.event_management_companies: Fashion technologists work in event management companies to assess the specific demand of people engrossed in the vents industry. They consult on various issues that plague the industry, such as changing clothes during performances etc.
career-opportunities.fashion_magazines: Fashion technologists find place in fashion magazines as writers and journalists, editors and photographers. Their attention to detail and technical acumen in fashion comes in handy for analysis.
career-opportunities.television_and_film_industry: Fashion technologists work in film and television industry to understand trends and innovate processes of garment design and production in the industry. Some also specialize in custom and luxury designs, suitable for actors and actresses.
career-opportunities.boutiques: Fashion technologists work in boutiques to evaluate and innovate processes of designing and innovation in design and production.
career-opportunities.retail_chains: Fashion technologists work in the retail sector, to analyses trends and do market research to understand the taste, preferences and needs of the customers for their design requirements
career-opportunities.teaching_in_an_institute_that_offers_cou: Experienced fashion technologists may join as faculty members in institutes that offer courses in this field, so that they can share their expertise and knowledge with the budding fashion technologists, in order to train them better.

path 1.stream: Pass Class XII in Science Stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.FTech. for 4 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M.Tech. in fashion technology. for 2 years

path 2.stream: Pass Class XII in Science Stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.sc in Fashion technology
path 2.after graduation: Pursue Advanced Diploma in Fashion Technology

path 3.stream: Pass Class XII in Science Stream
path 3.graduation: Pursue B.FTech. for 4 years
path 3.after graduation: Pursue Advanced Diploma in Fashion Technology

fashion-technology-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: Practical, industrial experience is a must. This can be achieved via internships or upon getting a job.

5.name: Angel College of Engineering and Technology

entrance exam.name: NIFT Entrance
entrance exam.elements: General Ability Test (GAT), Creative Ability Test (CAT), Situation Test

work description: Collecting and examining samples of different fabrics or clothes and other materials
Identifying the latest trends, development and innovations in fabrics and clothing
Examining clothes to ensure the quality and standard through various tests
Meeting and consulting clients, designers and dealers to adapt designs to suit production methods
Manufacturing clothes as per the requirement or desire of the clients or dealers
Staying abreast of the latest technologies and trends in the fashion world
Developing innovative styles and trends
Discussing and sharing technological understanding of fabrics and material with other technologists

pros: As a fashion technologist, you will learn about the science behind the material as well as the machines used in the fashion industry.
It is an upcoming field with less competition.
You are not expected to work on odd hours.
cons: This field is more technical in nature with less application of creative ideas.
You might need to put in extra work hours in the initial stages

film-making-as-a-career-in-india.title: Film Making
film-making-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Film making is a process of creating a story in motion for cinema or television. Film maker is the visionary of the film being made. A film maker has a varied role to play, starting from conceptualization of idea to scriptwriting, casting, editing, screening etc. They are the backbone of the film and work behind the scene. Often the term filmmaker is used in synonyms with the Director, however all film makers can be directors but not all directors are film makers. Film maker is supposed to be imaginative, multitalented and a skillful individual.

career-opportunities.film_production_companies: A fresher may start as an assistant in film production company and then can progress ahead to handle the whole project.
career-opportunities.advertisement_agencies: If you are spontaneous and can think out of the box then you can certainly be hired in an advertising agency to make advertisements that are appealing to the consumers.
career-opportunities.television_channels: Television is an integral part of household, hence, there is a lot of scope for film makers in the television industries.
career-opportunities.freelancing: One can also work as a freelancer, that is start their own company and take up different projects as per the demands of the business.
career-opportunities.teaching: Having gained good amount of experience and knowledge in the field of film industry you can educate the upcoming talents in this area.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in Any stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. / BA in Film Making/ Cinema or Screenwriting for 3 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue PG Programme or PG Diploma Course in Film Making (Multiple Specializations) for 2 Years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII in Any stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue Graduation in any Discipline for 3 years
path 2.after graduation: Pursue PG Programme or PG Diploma Course in Film Making (Multiple Specializations) for 2 Years

path 3.stream: Clear Class XII in Any stream
path 3.graduation: Pursue Diploma Courses for 1-2 years

film-making-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: Most colleges have eligibility criteria of minimum 50% aggregate marks in Class XIISome Colleges /University also have an age limit.

work description: Direct overall making of the film or documentary and how it is to be presented to the viewers
Select the actors suitable for the selected script
Guide the actor in portrayal of the character through suitable expressions, dialogues, voice modulation, looks and attire
Monitor the technicians for lighting, backdrop, sets, camera and special effects
Oversee the performance in terms of choreography, music composition, singing, etc.
Work with editors for proper sequencing of the scenes
Ensure the progress of the project within the schedule and the planned budget

pros: No two days are same. You learn each day starting from a spot boy to the actors and producers.
This field teaches you to become Jack of All Trades.
You get to travel to different destinations and comes with it is name, fame & growth with your hard work.
You can give life to your imagination.
cons: Making career in film making can be like a rollercoaster. Criticism is part of this work field and one must learn to take things with a pinch of salt.
Film making consumes a lot of time which may affect your personal life.
There is a cut-throat competition in this industry thus you cannot afford to be laid back. One flop movie and a star would think thousand times before associating themselves with you.
Initial salary may not be high, and the struggle period may be longer.

film_editor.title: Film Editing
film_editor.summary: A film editor selects and assembles shots from raw footage and combines them into a sequence to create a seamless motion picture. Film editors manipulate shots, images, sound, dialogues, graphics and special effects using advanced digital technology and computer software to produce the end product. Film Editing is a part of the post-production process and involves various edits and cuts as per the need of the producers and directors. One needs to have excellent communication skills, expertise in digital technology and software and a creative or artistic mindset.

career-opportunities.film_editor: Film editors work with different Film Production Houses, Television series and Web series production companies and Commercial Production companies.
career-opportunities.assistant_editor: Assistant editor supports the main film editor by setting up the media, making proxy files for footage, prepping each individual shot, overseeing the various lists and instructions and collaborate with sound and special effects department.
career-opportunities.live_television_studio_editor: Film Editors also work as television studio editors for live programs such as news or sports producers and networks. They work in a time constrained environment to fit the edited interviews, sports highlights, or news spots in allotted slot on the program.
career-opportunities.broadcast_and_sound_engineering_technici: Some editors may also work in sound engineering, mixing and editing. They help recording sound and video and edit the video with special effects, as well as dub in different sounds from the film.
career-opportunities.multimedia_artist__animator: With the right knowledge and experience, editors also animate and digitise films and video. This job may require a graduate degree in computer graphics/ digital art/ animation.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII with any stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue BSc/ BA in Filmmaking with Specialisation in Editing/Cinema/Film Studies/Mass Communication
path 1.after graduation: Pursue MA in Filmmaking with Specialisation in Editing

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII with any stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue BSc/ BA in Filmmaking with Specialisation in Editing/Cinema/Film Studies/Mass Communication
path 2.after graduation: Pursue PG Diploma/PG Program in Editing

path 3.graduation: Pursue Bachelor's in any field

pros: -Each project can be very different and unique. -You have the opportunity work with many creative professionals. -You can be a freelancer or work for an organisation.
cons: -It is not an entry level job and requires experience as production assistant or runners. -There might be tight deadlines and schedules. -For freelancers, there is less job security.

finance-as-a-career-in-india.title: Finance
finance-as-a-career-in-india.summary: A career in finance can be rewarding, intrinsically and monetarily. Today the role of finance professionals varies from helping corporates and individuals make financial planning decisions to helping businesses raise capital for expansion and running business operations. A degree in finance opens a wide domain for employment in areas such as banks, finance companies & financial institutions, insurance companies, mutual funds, large MNCs, private equity firms, consulting companies and investment companies. Successful financial professionals also earn good salaries, as a reward for solving complex problems.

career-opportunities.financial_plannerfinancial_analystfinanc: Financial planners help individuals develop plans that will ensure their present and future financial stability. Typically, they review a client's financial goals and generate an appropriate plan for saving and investing that fits the client's individual needs. The plan may focus on wealth preservation or investment growth and may even include estate and tax planning.
career-opportunities.relationship_manager_or_agentbroker: If you love meeting people and nurturing strong working relationships, "client-facing" positions like these are often a good fit. Agents, brokers and relationship managers are the lifeblood of the financial services industry, and their work often determines the longevity and success of the organization they work for.
career-opportunities.investment_banking: Some of the most glamorous - and intense - financial careers are jobs in investment banking. Investment-banking jobs deal with facilitating the issuance of corporate securities and making these securities available for investors to purchase, all while trading securities and providing financial advice to both corporations and wealthy individual investors.
career-opportunities.commercial_banking: Commercial Banks from large entities to local institutions, offer a range of financial services, from checking and savings accounts to IRAs and loans. Career options available in this sector include bank tellers, loan officers, operations, and marketing and branch managers.
career-opportunities.corporate_finance: Corporate finance jobs involve working for a company in the capacity of finding and managing the capital necessary to run the enterprise. This is done while maximizing corporate value and reducing financial risk.
career-opportunities.private_equity_and_venture_capital: Private-equity professionals help businesses find capital for both expansion and current operations. They also provide financing for a number of corporate business transactions, such as managed buyouts and restructurings. Venture-capital professionals (VCs) spend most of their time with startups or small, fast-growth companies. Venture-capital firms evaluate pitches by founders and small-company leaders to determine if the firm will make an investment.
career-opportunities.investment_management: The investment management area includes mutual funds, ETFs, hedge funds, and other private investment companies. As the name implies, investment management involves the soliciting of funds from investors with the objective of generating good returns for the investors. Jobs range from very sales oriented, to very quantitative, to very customer service focused.
career-opportunities.retail_banking: Retail bankers assist individuals with their personal financial needs, including auto and home loans, deposit and savings accounts, and insurance and investments (usually as a referral). A retail banker has extensive customer contact each day. Most of this customer contact would occur in their branch, either in person or on the phone.

path 1.stream: Commerce
path 1.graduation: Pursue Bachelors in Finance/ BFIA/ B.Com (H) for 3 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue Certification/ Diploma Program in Finance

path 2.stream: Commerce
path 2.graduation: Pursue Certification Course in Chartered Accountancy/ Cost Accountancy
path 2.after graduation: Pursue Post Graduation Diploma in Finance/ MBA/ Masters in Finance or Certification Program like CFA for 1-2 year

path 4.graduation: Pursue Bachelors in Any Stream for 3-4 years
path 4.after graduation: Pursue Post Graduation Diploma in Finance/ MBA/ Masters in Finance or Certification Program like CFA for 1-2 years

pros: High paying potential
Opportunity to work in different areas, like accounting, auditing, pricing, taxes etc.
Fast growth in job and never-ending demand of professionals
cons: Getting certification is a long process
Work-life balance may get affected due to tediousness of job
Can become boring in the long run

fine-arts-as-a-career-in-india.title: Fine Arts
fine-arts-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Fine arts refer to the usage of art as a form and requires passion for imagining or creating. Its focus is on creating objects using concepts and ideas which bring out the aesthetics of that object. A professional degree in Fine Arts enables the students to gain knowledge and education pertaining to visual and performing arts. A student of fine arts can pursue majors in either design, sculpture, drama, music, pottery, painting and/or any other similar subject. Today, there are immense opportunities in the sector of Fine Arts with high income, popularity and prestige.

career-opportunities.art_studios: These studios refine an artists' technical skills and creative talents which guides them to develop their own artistic style and creating a visually enjoyable art form, such as photographs, paintings, prints, drawings, sculptures or ceramics.
career-opportunities.advertising_companies: Getting hired in advertising companies is a good platform for the upcoming artists to showcase their creative side through designing content catering to their organisations or clients.
career-opportunities.graphic_arts: It is a combination of art and technology. It involves production of designs for magazines, brochures, advertisements etc. that are captivating and inspiring to the consumers.
career-opportunities.fashion_houses: Fine arts in fashion designing has a lot of scope in fashion industries. It reinforces one's ability in fabric textures, styles and techniques. A degree in fine arts is very important right from the initial sketch to the final garment.
career-opportunities.print_making: A job in print making includes art setup, graphic manipulation and colour matching. This would also require an individual to have the familiarity of working with different kinds of printing machines.
career-opportunities.publishing_houses: Having done fine arts can also help in finding a job in various publishing houses for cover designs, layouts and content design. Illustrations may be prepared for advertisements, brochures, galleries, annual reports, medical textbooks, magazines or storybooks.
career-opportunities.freelance_working: One can also make a living through freelancing, which not only involves creating something new but also promoting the work that has been done. It is important to mention here that freelancing does not promise flow of money as it is highly dependent on the kind of work that has been done.
career-opportunities.electronic_industry: This involves the work of creating animation sequences or storyboards for gaming and other software which requires technical competence in computer arts and designing.
career-opportunities.animation: Animation involves creating visual effects, sequences, movies, and or electronic game. Animators usually work in teams and then accumulate their work to produce a larger whole. It is an interesting combination of technology and creativity.
career-opportunities.textile_industry: A degree in fine arts (preferably fashion designing) can help person get a job in textile industry which may include fashion designing, costume designing, wallpaper designing, upholstery designing, craft artists etc.
career-opportunities.films_and_theatre: People skilled in Fine arts are extremely important in films and theatre for the creation and designing of backdrops, sets and also for animation and special effects. Multimedia artists and animators are involved in creating visual special effects for animated television shows and films.
career-opportunities.art_teacher__professor: Person with Fine Arts degree can be employed as the Art teacher's schools and/or colleges or a self-employed setting to guide their students. They impart drawing lessons to their students. They help them develop artistic skills by cultivating creative expression and fostering an understanding of shapes, colours and texture.
career-opportunities.multimedia_artist: Multimedia artists and animators are experts in creating visual special effects for animated television shows, films and video games. They may draw images by hand or use computer software to generate scenes.

work description: Create artwork in the form of sketches, paintings, sculptors or craft
Specialise in the 2D, 3D or 4D forms of art
Apply the knowledge of colours, texture, drawing, design, material, etc, to their creation
Work with editors, authors, art directors, technicians, designers to build and install creations
Sell the created artwork through galleries, exhibitions, shops, craft markets and trade fairs
Modify the products as per the requirements of the client or the organisation
Promote one's artwork to gain popularity
Build or join the network of group of artists

pros: This course will provide you a solid foundation for self-expression.
Provides endless opportunity for creativity.
This course trains you to become skilled visual communicator
cons: One should be ready for criticism as creativity is not always appreciated
Salary and perks are not high in initial stages of career
A lot of time investment is needed, so often family gets neglected

fishery-science-as-a-career-in-india.title: Fishery Science
fishery-science-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Fishery Science is a field concerned with the study, understanding and management of fisheries. Fishery science is rapidly expanding in India, with the growing demands on the fishing industry. Professionals in this field also aim to develop sustainable solutions to prevent disease, and preserve fish populations. Career opportunities are available in government and private organizations, fisheries, consulting, business, environmental law, etc.

career-opportunities.aqua_culturist: Aquaculture is concerned with the farming of fishes and seaweeds. A thriving area, aquaculture is gaining importance worldwide as consumer demands for fish are increasingly becoming greater than can be met by traditional commercial fishing.
career-opportunities.fisheries_biologist: In general, this field includes the study of how the environment and other external forces affect fish life cycle. Its major application is to remedy problems associated with fish habitats. This option is becoming increasingly popular with the increase in the market demands of the fisheries industry.
career-opportunities.environmental_consultant: Fisheries and marine biologists can be employed as environmental consultants and advisors, to help design laws, regulations, and cleanup measures to protect the environment
career-opportunities.inspector_of_fisheries: Such roles can be found in various government departments associated with fisheries. Their main work involves carrying out investigative surveys, granting licenses, and other official work.
career-opportunities.selfemployment: Self Employment is another popular and viable option, which includes practices of fish breeding, fish farming, export business, trading, fish food production, etc.
career-opportunities.educational_institutes: Jobs for fishery science graduates are widely available at various educational institutes in both government and private sectors. They can find work as research assistants, instructor/trainers, assistant professors, etc.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Biology
path 1.graduation: Pursue Bachelors in Fishery Sciences (B.F.Sc.) for 4 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue Master's in Fishery Sciences (M.F.Sc.) for 2 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Biology
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. (Hons) in Aquaculture or B.Sc. Life Science for 3 years
path 2.after graduation: Pursue MBA for 2 years

path 3.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Biology
path 3.graduation: Pursue Bachelors in Fishery Sciences (B.F.Sc.) for 4 years/ Pursue B.Sc. (Hons) in Aquaculture for 3 years
path 3.after graduation: Pursue PG Diploma in Fishery Sciences for 1 year

fishery-science-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: Must have passed class 12th from CBSE or any other equivalent board with at least 50% marks including Biology/Mathematics/Agriculture/Home Science.Must be Indian Nationals of at least 17 years of age and not more than 23 years. Admissions to B.F.Sc. are done through state level entrance test. All India level entrance test is also conducted by ICAR (Indian Council of Agricultural Research). Some colleges/University also conducts their own entrance test or considers the direct admission on the basis of previous degree marks.

work description: Collecting, examining and analysing fish samples
Developing measures and techniques to increase the population of endangered species of fishes
Developing measures and techniques to decrease the overpopulated species of fishes
Examining the symptoms and causes of diseases in fish and how they respond to fight that disease
Observing the environmental conditions that support lives of fish in a particular surrounding
Identifying with and developing ways to solve the environment of fish and related problems
Developing and suggesting ways to protect environment of fish and decrease water pollution

pros: The work is practical and hands-on, with plenty of outdoor work.
The demand for the field is on the rise.
Professionals get to explore a number of opptunities, such as fish export, fish breeding, aquaculture, fish food production manager, etc.
cons: The work might require one to work in marine bodies and deal with fishes, which not be suitable for all.
The remuneration might not be very high initially.
Work is associated with irregular and long hours.

fitness-trainer-as-a-career-in-india.title: Fitness Trainer
fitness-trainer-as-a-career-in-india.summary: "Physical fitness is not only one of the most important keys to a healthy body; it is the basis of dynamic and creative intellectual activity". - John F. Kennedy. Fitness trainers work with individuals to meet their fitness goals by designing individualized plans or them. They demonstrate the exercises, different for different purposes as well as provide information regarding the nutrition, and healthy lifestyle to their clients. They also monitor their client's progress. They also work with large groups in gyms, aerobic sessions, clubs, hospitals etc.

career-opportunities.fitness_instructor: They work with individual as well as groups to help them achieve their fitness goals. They use combination of various exercise such as aerobics, weightlifting, karate, spin cycling, kickboxing, yoga, etc. They are specialized in one form, and they work in big hotels, gyms, health clubs, spas, fitness centres, cruise liners, tourist resorts etc.
career-opportunities.personal_trainer: Personal trainers train and work with individuals on one-to-one basis. They generally work at gym, though some clients might prefer training at their place. The workout is specifically tailored to suit the specific health and fitness requirements of the client.
career-opportunities.aerobics_instructor: They generally conduct group sessions that involve aerobics, muscle conditioning and stretching exercises. These classes are conducted in a gym, club or at your own studio.
career-opportunities.sports_instructor: Sports instructor coach and train professional and non-professional athletes on a one-to-one basis or in a group in an academy. They instruct, organize, train and lead athletes specialized in outdoor and indoor sports. Their job also includes monitoring their progress, and instructing them to follow the right diet. They also provide them self-defense training such as karate, judo or taekwondo.
career-opportunities.yoga_and_naturopathy_expert: Yoga and naturopathy experts are trained in yoga techniques and they work in yoga/fitness institutes. Now a days hospitals also employ them as consultants or instructors.
career-opportunities.teacher: Fitness instructors after completing their post-graduation/ higher education are eligible for teaching jobs in various colleges and educational institutions.
career-opportunities.clinical_exercise_specialist: They work with patients, and assists them to recover from injuries and physical ailments. They generally work in hospitals and rehabilitation centers, and Ngo's.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in any Stream (Sports participation is recommended)
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.P.E or B.P.Ed integrated course 1-3 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue certificate courses in fitness

path 2.graduation: Pursue Graduation in field of human anatomy -health education/sports etc.
path 2.after graduation: Pursue M.Ph.Ed. for 2 years

path 3.stream: Clear Class XII in any stream (Sports participation is recommended)
path 3.graduation: Pursue B.P.E or B.P.Ed integrated course for 3-4 years
path 3.after graduation: M.P.Ed. for 1-2 years

Understand the body structure and functioning of the client to ensure right workout plan
Maintain the fitness of the clients
Make use of different techniques such as workout machines, tools or postures
Demonstrate exercises and the correct way to carry them out
Monitor the clients to avoid accidents and injuries
Work with different organisations such as schools, hospitals, gyms etc.
Promote fitness and good physique techniques

pros: One of the biggest positive point of being a fitness trainer is that you will get the knowledge of the healthy lifestyle, exercises, nutrition, etc.
You will meet people on daily basis.
Gym trainers have flexible timings, with less working hours.
cons: It is a field which would not bring much money in the initial years, especially if you don't have the required qualification.
Satisfying each and every client requires lot of determination and energy.
The work of a trainer is not that respected in India.

food-stylist-as-a-career-in-india.title: Food Stylist
food-stylist-as-a-career-in-india.summary: A food stylist is in charge of styling or presenting food in photos, videos, or films. In order to make food look appealing and aesthetically pleasing, food stylists use many different tools and techniques. With food styling, the purpose is to showcase the food in an appealing, tasty, and fresh way. Opting for a higher degree in this career might lead to better salary prospects.

career-opportunities.editorial_food_stylist: Editorial food stylists take photographs of food for cookbooks, recipe books, newspapers, magazines, and other editorials. This comprises photography that demonstrates the recipe, raw ingredients, and other kitchen products.
career-opportunities.advertising_food_stylist: Marketing agencies and advertising agencies hire advertising food stylists. Clients provide them with briefs outlining their requirements. According to the storyboard, one must use the recommended colours, props, and visuals.
career-opportunities.web_food_stylist: Web food stylists style food items so they can be used on websites, blogs, and e-books. The majority of the time, they don't require a lot of props or lighting. Their preference is for natural light because of its simple setup.

food-technology-as-a-career-in-india.title: Food Science and Technology
food-technology-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Food science derives from various disciplines such as chemical engineering, biochemistry and biology in an attempt to better understand the food processes and improve food products for the general public. Food scientists study the microbiological, chemical and physical makeup of food. Food Scientists & Technologists use principles of chemistry, engineering, microbiology and other sciences to ensure food safety and agricultural productivity. The technologist discovers new food sources, analyses nutrition content and finds different ways to process, package and preserve food. Thus, food scientists play an important role in improving the quality of the food that we eat everyday.

career-opportunities.nutritional_therapist: Nutritional therapists work with individuals to reduce and prevent ailments by making recommendations to their diet to restore balance, which includes guidance on avoiding certain allergens and toxins, detoxification and the use of supplementary nutrients such as high-dose vitamins.
career-opportunities.food_technologist: Food technologists make sure that the food products available in the market are produced legally, safely and are up to the quality claimed. They are involved in the development of the manufacturing processes and recipes of food and drink products. They work on existing and newly discovered ingredients for the invention of new recipes and concepts.
career-opportunities.product_development_scientists: Product development scientists are hired by companies which manufacture products to control and optimize the processes used to make the final product. They work across the manufacturing industry on products as diverse as medicines, cosmetics paints and food.
career-opportunities.toxicologist: Toxicologists focus on the impact that radiation and toxic materials have on the environment and human and animal health. They plan and carry out field and laboratory studies that help to classify, monitor and assess this impact. They also consider how future technology can be utilized.
career-opportunities.technical_brewer: The whole process of brewing and packaging beer is administered by technical brewers. Their main aim is to ensure the quality and consistency of the product.
career-opportunities.animal_nutritionist: The aim of animal nutritionists is to increase and promote the understanding of the effect of diet on the health, well-being and productivity of animals.
career-opportunities.process_development_scientists: Their aim is to optimize the performance of manufacturing systems. They are in charge of the identification and development of new processes for product manufacturing. They are also involved in the implementation of process controls to ensure the quality of the products and that they are manufactured in a reproducible manner.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in Science Stream with PCB/PCM (English is mandatory)
path 1.graduation: Pursue B. Tech. (Food Science) for 4 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M. Tech. (Food Science) for 2 years

work description: Use scientific knowledge to develop recipes and formulae for new food products and beverages
Research on and identify different ways to keep food fresh for longer periods
Work in laboratories to combine different flavours to produce product samples
Make sure that products have the right shape, colour and consistency when manufactured on a mass scale
Assure the quality, safety and legitimacy of the manufactured product
Keep up to date with the emerging consumer market and modern technologies to create innovative products
Work with dealers on quality matters and new products
Manage dealers and external suppliers to get cost effective deals when purchasing ingredients, raw materials and chemicals

pros: It can open up a lot of different career avenues and opportunities for you as a food science degree is applicable to many different industries.
Since the number of individuals pursuing this course are still limited, with the right type of education and training, you can be in high demand in the job market.
cons: Many careers in food science require you to have a high level of education, sometimes even a doctorate level. Thus, it requires a major investment of time and money on your part.
A job in the food science domain might require you to work in unpleasant, and sometimes even hazardous conditions.

forensic-accounting-as-a-career-in-india.title: Forensic Accounting
forensic-accounting-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Forensic accountants, also referred to as forensic auditors or investigative auditors, utilize their accounting, auditing and investigative skills in various litigation support and investigative accounting settings. A forensic accountant has the responsibility to communicate financial information clearly and concisely in a courtroom setting. They provide an accounting analysis that is suitable to the court which will form the basis for discussion, debate and ultimately dispute resolution. They are trained to look beyond the numbers and deal with the business reality of the situation.

career-opportunities.private_corporations__firms: As part of the corporate governance committee, a forensic accountant can make significant contribution in: formulating and establishing a comprehensive governance policy; prevention of fraud; monitoring not only compliance at the top levels of the corporate power, but also management procedures and employee activity. They ensure the integrity of financial statements by actively investigating for potential frauds.
career-opportunities.insurance_companies: Insurance companies recruit forensic accountants to have a precise assessment of claims to be settled. Similarly, policy holders seek the help of a forensic accountant when they need to challenge the claim settlement as worked out by the insurance companies. A forensic accountant handles the claims relating to substantial loss policy, property loss due to different risks, loyalty insurance and other types of insurance claims.
career-opportunities.government_organizations: Forensic Accountants can also work in a number of government organizations where they conduct the financial investigative portion of complex cases.
career-opportunities.public_accounting_firms: Forensic accountants are employed here to inquire, identify, investigate, test, examine, analyze and interpret financial documents and data
career-opportunities.law_firms: Forensic Accountants with broad business backgrounds and forensic experience are a vital resource to the litigation team and provide valuable insight into financial issues. Litigation often involves multiple, complex accounting and legal issues that overlap and intertwine.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in Commerce Stream (Recommended)
path 1.graduation: Pursue Bachelor???s degree in any field for 3-4 years/ Pursue professional certification for CA/CS/CWA or CPA
path 1.after graduation: Get a diploma/ certificate in Forensic Accounting

forensic-accounting-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: Forensic accounting courses are usually offered in the master's degree level.In order to be a Certified Forensic Accountant in India you must be a Graduate from a recognized University. Besides, you should have a professional experience of at-least three years and clear the CFAP examination with at least 75% marks. In India, CFAP Examinations are conducted by India Forensic and moderated under the bylaws of Forensic Accounting Research Foundation.

2.name: Institute of Chartered Accountants of India

3.name: Institute of Cost Accountants of India

work description: Perform forensic research to trace funds and identify assets for recovery
Conduct forensic analysis of financial data
Prepare forensic accounting reports from financial findings
Prepare analytical data for litigation and testify the same as needed
Analyze and investigate financial statements and reports for signs of irregularities
Reconstruct the events and activities involved in financial wrongdoing
Create presentations in support of legal cases, and may be called upon to testify in court regarding their findings
Audit records, investigate into inconsistencies, trace assets, and interview individuals who created, contributed to, or reviewed records under analysis

pros: Professionals in this field are high in demand
Decent remuneration and perks
Is an interesting combination of law and accountancy
cons: It is an added skill and not a whole career domain in itself
Long and tedious work hours
Requires utmost honesty and dedication

forensic-psychologist-as-a-career-in-ind.title: Forensic Psychologist
forensic-psychologist-as-a-career-in-ind.summary: Relatively a new branch of psychology, forensic psychology, is applying clinical specialities to the legal and judicial systems. It is an area of specialization which intersects law, legal procedures and theory with clinical practice, disorders, and ethics. A forensic psychologist requires advanced knowledge and skills in both these realms i.e. law and psychology. These professionals inform legal and judicial decision-making by creating relevant and accurate data and conclusions. This field has been gaining a great deal of interest among young psychology aspirants. The practice of forensic psychology primarily entails psychological assessment of individuals who are involved in some way with the legal system. Key skills expected out of a forensic psychologist are clinical assessment, strong communication skills, interview and report writing skills, case presentation, and problem solving skills. The professional who practice as a forensic psychologist is involved in investigations, research, assessment, consultation, expert testimony in a courtroom and in planning, designing and implementation of treatment programs.

path 1.graduation: Pursue B.A./B.Sc in Psychology
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M.A./M.Sc in Forensic Psychology/Criminology

path 4.stream: Clear Class XII Science
path 4.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. in Forensic Science
path 4.after graduation: Pursue M.Sc in Forensic Science

pros: One gets to work in a multidisciplinary field The work is quite heterogenous, no two days are the same and it can hardly get monotonous The psychologist can work as a full-time or even as a consultant in the field of forensic psychology The professional will get rich exposure, experience and a lot to learn
cons: It can sometimes get dangerous and one mistake can be legally problematic Forensic Psychology is still not a huge field in India and awareness about it is still growing. Hence it can be difficult to develop one's niche here as a forensic psychologist Working in close contacts with crimes and criminals can become unsafe There can be a great deal of work as the forensic professional has a lot of varied duties They have to research the evidence thorougly. If there is a lack of evidence regarding any crimes, then the professional has to go above and beyond to make sure justice is provided

game-development-as-a-career-in-india.title: Game Development
game-development-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Game development as a career is about developing and designing games which everyone plays on their laptop, mobile phones etc. It is a profession which involves hard work, dedication and passion for games. Making games is technical and creative work, and in this career, you will understand the technicality involved in the creation of a game. There is an increasing demand of games as there is an increasing development of gadgets, hence Game Development is a promising career option. Game developers can work as individuals or in an organization which is involved in developing games for various gadgets. The students of game development study about the technical steps, policies, developing creative games etc. Proficiency in C++, JAVA will be of an advantage in this career. Game developers make the core features of the video games which include conducting design reviews, designing role play mechanics, coding and programing etc. Various paths are available for an individual to become a game developer that involve studying computer science engineering, animation and graphic designing etc.

career-opportunities.game_designer: Designing of the game which involves attending to the characters, storylines, role play. They primarily attend to the theme of the game.
career-opportunities.audio_and_sound_engineer: Engineers add the sound to the games which will go very well with the theme and need to have understanding of the sound and music.
career-opportunities.game_programmers: Programmers convert the design to a computerized coding and they are at the technical level of game development. Proficiency in C++ and JAVA will be an advantage for the programmer.
career-opportunities.game_testers: Before the game goes online, the game testers test the game, evaluating it and providing with the information about loopholes and any modifications which are required.

path 1.stream: Class XII with any stream (Preferably Science)
path 1.graduation: Pursue Bachelors in Graphic Designing/ Animation
path 1.after graduation: Pursue Masters in Graphic Designing/ Animation/Diploma in Game Design

path 2.stream: Class XII with science stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
path 2.after graduation: Pursue M. Tech in Computer Science Engineering/Diploma in Game Deign

path 3.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. Computer Science
path 3.after graduation: Pursue M.Sc. Computer Science/Diploma in Game Design

path 4.stream: Class XII with any stream
path 4.graduation: Pursue Bachelors of Computer Applications
path 4.after graduation: Pursue Masters of Computer Application/Diploma in Game Design

Transforming the design to the codes which will turn the design to the game which can be played on various gadgets such as computers, mobile phones etc.
Producing the audio features of the game such as character voices, background music etc.
Attending to the technical issues and evaluating them to overcome the problems while playing games.
This career also involves making 2D and 3D graphics, testing the quality of the game before its launch and resolving the issues in it.

pros: Game development allows an individual to convert their passion of games into a career.
This career brings about a combination of animation, sound, graphics, programing and management which allows for obtaining information in various fields.
It is a creative outlet and helps you gain a satisfaction that you created something for enjoyment of the people.
cons: Professionals might have to work long hours and according to the deadlines.
It might take years to get a project approved and launched, so it is a slow process.
Since, there is a lot of competition in Gaming Industry, there is no room of mistakes.

genetic-engineering-as-a-career-in-india.title: Genetic Engineering
genetic-engineering-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Genetic Engineering additionally called genetic modification or genetic manipulation is modifying a living being's genes using biotechnology. It is an arrangement of innovations used to change the hereditary forms of cells(. chemical splicing pf DNA to generate enhanced or novel living beings.

career-opportunities.genetic_engineer: A Genetic Engineer is responsible for using their field knowledge and innovating new health systems or products essential from the commercial and scientific perspective. They play a major role in creating new genetic variants of plants that produce food or they might do research on for humans with rare genetic diseases
career-opportunities.geneticist: The role of a Geneticist is to examine patients with hereditary genetic disorders and provide them with suitable and relatively safe treatment procedures.
career-opportunities.lecturerprofessor: A Lecturer/Professor of Genetic Engineering teaches graduates at the university level regarding their respective specialisation.
career-opportunities.research_scientist: Research scientists contribute to knowledge in the fields of the natural sciences, medical science, computer science, environmental science and the social sciences. They make hypotheses, collect data and interpret results in order to answer questions about humans and the natural world.
career-opportunities.scientificmedical_writer: A Research Writer, as the name suggests, is involved in proofreading, editing, and publishing various scientific research papers that contain data from clinical studies to statistical reports.
career-opportunities.junior_research_fellow: The JRF or Junior Research Fellow is?a letter awarded by the University Grants Commission?(UGC) to the candidates who qualify in the National Eligibility Test securing marks equal/higher than the set cut off for JRF in the particular subject in which the candidate has given UGC NET Exam.
career-opportunities.technical_writer: They are involved in preparing documentation including product enhancement plans, protocols, evaluation summaries and performance evaluation reports that extend the best and appropriate communication to their target audience.
career-opportunities.biophysicist: A Biophysicist carries out experiments to identify the effect of various substances like preservatives, hormones, or other commercial products onto living organisms and the environment.
career-opportunities.information_security_engineer: An Information Security Engineer creates and monitors security protocols to secure any type of research data and systems from security breaches.
career-opportunities.genomics: A Genomicist's job is to identify the presence of manipulative genes in a genomic sequence to predict the possibility of acquiring or transferring genetic disorders in the future.

path 1.stream: Class XII in Science Stream with science and biology
path 1.graduation: B. Tech. in Genetic Engineering
path 1.after graduation: M. Tech. in Genetic Engineering

pros: Production of nutrient-rich foods. Increased resistance of plants to rotting and pests. Increased Meat Production. Production of novel drugs and vaccines. Development of new and favorable organisms. Creation of humans with desirable features.
cons: The fear for unintended selection and any unwanted transfer of genes. Health issues like allergic reactions. Development of antibiotic resistance of disease causing organisms. Loss of biodiversity. The fear for the rise of ?invasive species?. Economic consequences. (7.) Social and Ethical Concerns.

genetics-as-a-career-in-india.title: Genetics
genetics-as-a-career-in-india.summary: It is the study of genes, heredity and genetic variations in living organisms. The field aims to understand the process and function of trait inheritance, including topics such as gene distribution, gene behavior, and molecular structure of genes. Professionals in the field are involved with the investigation of the genetic causes behind various genetic anomalies, hereditary conditions and genetic variations of living organisms.

career-opportunities.cytogeneticist: Cytogeneticists or Cytogenetic Technologists prepare and maintain biological samples such as blood, amniotic fluids, bone marrow and tumors for chromosome analysis.
career-opportunities.forensic_dna_analyst: Geneticists get employed by the crime-investigation branches of various government and private organizations. Their work involves the analysis of biological samples to detect the presence or absence of certain DNA.
career-opportunities.medical_technologist: Also referred to as Clinical Laboratory scientists, Medical technologists conduct a number of biological, hematological, chemical, immunologic, bacteriological, and microscopic tests. Additionally, they also work on developing method and tests in their research.
career-opportunities.clinical_geneticist: Clinical Geneticists are physicians who specialize in the treatment and diagnosis of different genetic diseases. They may also engage in various laboratory-based tasks related to these diseases.
career-opportunities.genetic_counselor: A genetic counselors' work involves providing support and information, to create awareness about a variety of genetic diseases. Their duties include managing treatment of people with hereditary disorders, as well as, counseling patients with such inherited problems.
career-opportunities.research_geneticist: Research Geneticists are mainly employed in the research and development departments of various government agencies, private laboratories, and other health-care institutions. Their research is mainly focused towards advancing knowledge and treatment of various inherited characteristics of humans, animals, and plants.
career-opportunities.education: Geneticists can work as full-time or guest lecturers at universities and colleges.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Biology
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. (Hons) in Genetics or B.Sc. (Hons) Biological Sciences or B.Sc. (Hons) Life Sciences for 3 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M.Sc. Genetics or M.Sc. Bio-sciences for 2 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.Tech. Genetic Engineering for 4 years
path 2.after graduation: Pursue M.Tech. Genetic Engineering for 2 years
