work description: Detecting genotypes and employing diagnostic procedures to detect genetic disorders
Explaining the results of tests performed by genetic technologists
Keeping records of genetic ailments and the clinical relevance of both, inherited or acquired genetic disorders
Handling enquiries of clinical staff /healthcare professionals
Supervising and training interns, colleagues and healthcare professionals
Assuring the quality and authenticity of the data developed
Employing laboratory techniques such as Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) or Mutation Detection Techniques
Employing linkage analysis to detect the faulty/misfired genes which cause specific disorders
Preparing reports for clinicians and clients (patients)
Keeping up to date with the new developments and research work

pros: Professionals get the opportunities to work on, and lead advanced research projects.
The field is rapidly growing, and there are a number of research opportunities, both in India and overseas.
Jobs are available in various industries, such as pharmaceuticals, manufacturing, health-care, etc.
cons: The educational path for the career is long, as a Ph.D is generally preferred.
It involves spending most of the time indoors, in the laboratory.
It can be hard to get into the career, as it requires extensive knowledge, skill and traning.
The work may expose individuals to harmful and toxic substances.

geography-as-a-career-in-india.title: Geography
geography-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Geography as a subject is devoted to the study of the earth, the distribution and location of its physical and cultural features, inter-relationship of these features and human life as well as the various phenomenon of Earth. This discipline seeks to examine the relationship and influences between people and the environment. A degree in geography trains and educates an individual to gain success in careers ranging from cartography, business, administration to tourism and planning besides many others depending on the interests of the individual.

career-opportunities.cartographer: A cartographer is involved with the scientific, technological and artistic aspects of developing and producing maps. They present complex information as diagrams, charts and spreadsheets, as well as in the form of conventional maps. Geographical information systems (GIS) and digital-mapping techniques now dominate the role. They work within a variety of areas including publishing, the military, the government, surveying and conservation.
career-opportunities.surveyor: Surveyors measure and collect data on specific areas of land, including information about boundaries, buildings and features, both natural and man-made. They can join the Survey of India or State Survey Departments or Private organizations.
career-opportunities.drafter: Drafters work with surveyors, engineers and architects to develop maps used by construction companies, government planning entities or environmental organizations.
career-opportunities.government_employee: A few central government organizations that look for postgraduates in Geography are Oil & Natural Gas Corporation, National Council for Cement and Building Materials, Central Mine Planning & Design Institute Limited, Society of Integrated Coastal Management, etc. The post-graduate students in Geography can get placed in different departments under State Government through various exams organized by the Public Service Commission. One can also apply for the Probationary Officer post in various public-sector banks. For this, one needs to qualify the entrance test carried out by the banks. The Railway department also selects candidates to the various posts through the entrance test carried out by the Railway Recruitment Board or RRB. Postgraduates in geography can also apply for the posts in Indian Railway Traffic Service.
career-opportunities.urban_and_regional_planner: Urban and Regional planners make long and short-term plans/goals about the use of land in cities or villages. They keep in mind the future needs of the city's population and recommend placement of various infrastructures such as schools or roads.
career-opportunities.gis_specialist: GIS technicians make maps and customized geographic information systems (GIS) applications and manipulate data to serve a variety of purposes. They read and interpret maps, manipulate and understand digital land data, and manage data entered into a GIS database. GIS technicians typically earn a Bachelor of Science degree in geography. A master's degree in geography can increase opportunities for career advancement and salary potential.
career-opportunities.climatologist: Climatologists are atmospheric scientists who study the Earth's climate. They collect and analyze data from sources such as ice cores, soil, water, air, and even plant life to find patterns in weather and learn how those patterns affect the Earth and its inhabitants
career-opportunities.meteorologist: Meteorologists study the relationships between atmospheric characteristics and the environment. They predict future weather conditions, study climate trends over time, track ozone levels, study rainfall and monitor global temperature. Meteorologists are needed in both urban and rural regions.
career-opportunities.transportation_manager: A transportation manager ensures that shipments into or out of an organization are handled quickly, safely, and within budget constraints. This might include oversight of transportation equipment and personnel operated by an organization.
career-opportunities.environmental_manager: Environmental managers are responsible for making sure an organization is compliant with environmental regulations in areas such as air quality, waste, clean water, and pollution. Environmental managers play a scientific and administrative role in an organization.
career-opportunities.researcher: Many Government and non-government institutes along with research centres offer several career options for people holding geography degrees.
career-opportunities.education: One can also work in the educational sector as a teacher/ professor in the school level or the college level respectively.
career-opportunities.demographer: A demographer conducts statistical examinations of the composition, distribution and transition of the human population.

path 1.stream: Class XII with any Stream (Geography as one of the Subject)
path 1.graduation: Pursue BA/B.Sc. in Geography for 3 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue Post Graduate Diploma in Geography or any other related field.

path 2.stream: Class XII with Science
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.Sc Geography /B.Tech in any related field for 3 years
path 2.after graduation: Pursue Post Graduation in Geography (M.Sc/ M.Tech) for 2 years

path 3.stream: Class XII with Humanities (Geography as one of the subject)
path 3.graduation: Pursue B.A.(H) Geography for 3 years
path 3.after graduation: Pursue Masters in Geography for 2 years in India or Abroad

geography-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: Graduates in Geography are highly valued in the government sector. One can appear for UPSC examination after completing graduation for a career in government sector. A lot of jobs are available for post graduates as well.For Lecturership in Geography, National Educational Test (NET) or Ph.D. is mandatory Most Colleges/Institutes provide admission on the basis of Class 12th Percentage. Some institutes also conduct interviews. Most colleges have eligibility criteria of minimum 60% aggregate marks in Class XII There are various other colleges in Delhi University who offer this course.

7.name: Centre for Environment Planning and Technology

work description: Gather geographic data through field observations, maps, photographs, satellite imagery, and census data
Create and modify maps, graphs, diagrams, or other visual representations of geographic data
Analyze geographic distributions of physical and cultural phenomena on local, regional, continental, or global scales
Use geographic information system (GIS) technology to collect, analyze, and display data
Combine geographic data with data on a particular specialty, such as economics, the environment, health, or politics

Provide consulting services in fields such as resource development and management, business location and market area analysis, environmental hazards, regional cultural history, and urban social planning
Study the economic, political, and cultural characteristics of a specific region population

pros: Is a practical and application oriented subject
Flexible degree in terms of higher education
Competition for government jobs is less in this field.
cons: Must have a Ph.D. or Master’s degree to pursue it further
Less number of jobs directly related to this field
Pay package is low initially

graphic-designing-as-a-career-in-india.title: Graphic Design
graphic-designing-as-a-career-in-india.summary: A designer who creates visual impact using computer-software are graphic designers. They understand the needs and requirements of their clients before making design decisions. They work for various products and activities, such as websites, advertising, books, magazines, posters, computer games, product packaging, exhibitions, etc. The key skills required include creative flair, up-to-date knowledge of industry software and a professional approach to time, costs and deadlines.

career-opportunities.online_and_print_publishing_companies: Graphic designers play an important role in Online & Print Publishing Companies.
career-opportunities.graphic_design_studios: Most of the graphic designers work in Graphic Design Studios.
career-opportunities.corporates__marketing_corporate_communic: Graphic Designers are in huge demand in the corporate sector. They are employed by top MNC's.
career-opportunities.advertising_companies: Advertising companies hire graphic designers and they are responsible for the visual style and images in magazines, newspapers, product packaging, and movie, etc. They create the overall design of a project.
career-opportunities.freelancers: After gaining some experience in the field, graphic designers can start their work as freelancers.
career-opportunities.uiux_designers: Graphic designers work as UI/UX designers in various IT firms.
career-opportunities.web_game_designing_studios: Graphic designers design games and form the core part of the operations.

path 1.stream: Class XII with Any Stream (Science for some)
path 1.graduation: Pursue Bachelors in Design (Graphics) for 3-4 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue Masters in Design (Graphics) for 2 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII with any stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue Diploma in Graphic Design for 6 months to 2 years.
path 2.after graduation: Pursue PG Diploma in Graphic Design for 1-2 years.

path 3.stream: Clear Class XII Any Stream
path 3.graduation: Pursue graduation in any field.
path 3.after graduation: Pursue Post Graduate Diploma in Design/Graphic Design for 1-2 years

graphic-designing-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: The candidate must have secured minimum 50% in class XII.For Design courses at IIT's one must have Science with Maths in Class XII. Most colleges have an age limit of 20 years.

6.name: Indian School of Design and Innovation

entrance exam.elements: Design Aptitude Test, Studio Test, Personal Interview

work description: Combine art and technology to create images, logos, websites, advertisements, etc.
Understand the needs of the client and then create designs accordingly
Discuss the planned layout with art directors and the clients before implementing it
Work with different software programmes
Take decisions regarding the font, colour combination and other animations to make the product look attractive to the viewers
Review the designs with the client and make the necessary amendments
Promote an organisation's agenda by reaching out to the masses
Use one's creativity and innovation to produce unique illustrations

pros: Graphic Designers are employed in multiple industries like web designing, print industry, etc.
There is a huge demand.
You can work as a freelancer with multiple companies.
cons: It is important to learn various programs for success in the industry.
The competition is high in the industry.
You should be very creative.

graphology-as-a-career-in-india.title: Graphology
graphology-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Graphology is an art and science of analyzing handwriting to identify, evaluate and understand a person’s personality traits, thought patterns, and behavior. Graphology discipline is based on the scientific method of conclusions drawn on common sense, universal concepts, psychological interpretations and empirical research. Graphologists get a glimpse into person subconscious mind through handwriting analysis and provide insight into one’s character, temperament, the present state of mind, likes and dislikes, strengths, weakenesses, fears and future potential, even if only a few words are scribbled hurriedly on a piece of paper. They are also skilled at analysing one’s signatures and interpretating personality.

path 1.stream: Pursue XII with any stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue Graduation in any discipline for 3 years. (Meanwhile, pursue basic and advance level courses in Graphology)
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M.Sc./M.A. in any discipline for 2 years. (Meanwhile, pursue basic and advance level of courses in Graphology).

graphology-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: Must have passed class 12th or Senior Secondary Examination with at least 50% marks including English.

4.name: M J Rajore Institute of Graphology and Personal Success

work description: Solve problems of clients by analyzing their handwriting and signature.

Analyzing handwriting including the components of general style of writing, formation of letters, the alignment and space between words and lines, patterns, caligraphy, the loops in alphabets, slants of writing, size of letters etc.
Analyzing signatures of people to understand their personality, temperament, character, strengths, weakness, abilities etc.
Analyzing handwriting samples of criminal offenders and try to solve cases.
Help people to take right career choices and give additional inputs for their betterment.
Provide inputs on characterstics, habits, personality traits while choosing someone as your life partner.

pros: The job profile gives you an opportunity to work in diverse environment such as schools, companies, forensic department, courts, police department, career guidance centres etc.
Experienced and skilled graphologists earn good income every month.
Basic psychological sense can be an edge for a Graphologist.
cons: You need to keep enough patience as the study of graphology comes with time and experience.
At times, the sessions can be emotionally draining due to problematic cases.
Teenagers’ writing trends tend to be inconsistent from moment to moment.

health-administration-as-a-career-in-ind.title: Public Health Administration
health-administration-as-a-career-in-ind.summary: Public Health Administrators is an area of administration which emphasis on health promotions and disease prevention. The job profile relates to management, leadership and administration of hospitals, health care & public health systems. They work with hospitals, government organizations and even not-for-profit organizations. There is an increase in the health awareness which has resulted extending medical support to every section of the society. This has led to the increase in opportunities in this career.

career-opportunities.health_insurance_specialist: These specialists work with medical records, coding and billing professionals, and insurance companies. They ensure that benefits are properly applied. They also work with insurance companies in order to develop new plans.
career-opportunities.social_and_community_service_managers: They work with other healthcare professionals, social workers, community organizers etc. They coordinate and create programs for the betterment of communities, families and individuals.
career-opportunities.practice_manager: They manage healthcare practices, including large medical groups and physician organizations.
career-opportunities.human_resource_manager: They manage plan and also direct and coordinate the administrative functions of an organization. Some of the work includes recruiting, interviewing, and hiring of new staff. They also consult with top executives on strategic planning. They serve as an important link between the management and various employees.
career-opportunities.training_and_development_managers: They plan, direct, and coordinate programs in order to enhance the knowledge and skills of the organization's employees.
career-opportunities.administrative_services_managers: They help organizations and companies to operate successfully. They plan a variety of services which may include coordinating and centralizing the operations of several departments. Their job profile includes combining distribution, information and mail services.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Biology
path 1.graduation: Pursue Bachelor's degree such as Bachelors in Public Health, MBBS, BDS, BHMS, BAMS, BUMS, BPT, B.Pharm, B.Sc. in any allied health sciences for 3-4 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue Masters in Public Health (MPH

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Biology
path 2.graduation: Pursue Bachelor's degree such as Bachelors in Public Health, MBBS, BDS, BHMS, BAMS, BUMS, BPT, B.Pharm, B.Sc. in any allied health sciences for 3-4 years
path 2.after graduation: Pursue Diploma/Post Graduation Diploma in Public Health Management (PGDPHM) for 1-2 years

health-administration-as-a-career-in-ind.Important Facts: Most college have eligibility criteria of minimum 50% aggregate marks in Class XII / and some of minimum 60%.Must have passed class 12th or senior secondary examination with at least 50% marks including English. Some colleges/ universities also have an age limit (17 at 31st December of the year of admission). In some universities, you can also apply after a post-graduation in Social Science.

5.name: National Institute of Health and Family Welfare

6.name: Indian Institute of Health Management Research

8.name: All India Institute of Hygiene and Public Health

work description: Promote good health care and hygiene among general public
Develop policies to help people gain health facilities
Reach out to people, even to those who are in the most remote areas
Supervise the structure of the coursework
Work in accordance with suggestions of various doctors, hospitals and healthcare centers
Hire and train people to implement the programmes
Correspond with people with effective language and personality
Manage the finances and the organisation
Perform keeping in mind the ethical code of conduct

pros: Choice of working area: They have plenty of choices. They can choose to work according to their preference e.g. Medical settings, and public health departments etc.
Upcoming area: It is an upcoming area with growing demand.
Rewarding and Important Role. They manage the public health settings which are important to the future of the practice and are often made with the patients' needs in mind.
cons: Many Responsibilities: They are expected to manage and handle multiple areas such as administration, budgeting, research, medical practitioners, etc.
High Education Requirement: Most employees prefer at least masters' due to the complex nature of the job.
High Pressure: It is a very challenging job. As they manage the important task of the health care setting, any mistakes decisions could impact the organisation.

homeopathy-as-a-career-in-india.title: Homeopathy
homeopathy-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Homeopathy is the branch of medicine that involves a system of practice that treats disease by the administration of minute doses of a remedy. It was developed by Dr. Samuel Hahnemann, a German physician. It is based on the principle that "like cures like". It implies that any substance, which can produce symptoms in a healthy person, can cure similar symptoms in a person who is sick. It prepares individuals for the independent professional practice of homeopathic medicine, a holistic therapeutic system.

career-opportunities.homeopathic_doctor: Homeopathic Doctors use remedies, including essential oils, herbs and compounds, tinctures, massage, aromatherapy, or even acupuncture. They are often self-employed. Many doctors are able to command higher salaries, though hours may be long and irregular.
career-opportunities.homeopathic_medical_consultant: The homeopathic medical consultant gives consultation by taking into consideration the patient's symptoms, personality traits, physical and psychological state and also the life history.
career-opportunities.homeopathic_professorlecturerreader: Homeopathic Professor/Lecturer/Reader teach in government and private homeopathic colleges.
career-opportunities.hospital_manager: They work with all the individuals involved in the administration to plan, strategize and coordinate the health services of a hospital. They supervise all the areas of a hospital which includes the physicians, health information technicians, nursing, medical records etc.
career-opportunities.chief_medical_officer: The workday of the Chief Medical officer includes treating patients as well as administrative work. They cooperate with the executive team and initiate procedures. Their work also includes training, motivating and supporting of the staff.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in Science with Biology stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.H.M.S (4 .5 Years of study + 1 Year Internship).
path 1.after graduation: Pursue Post-Graduation Program 2-3 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII in Science with Biology stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.H.M.S (4 .5 Years of study + 1 Year Internship).
path 2.after graduation: Diploma/PG Diploma 1-2 years

entrance exam.name: NEET
entrance exam.elements: Physics, Chemistry and Biology

work description: Built on the "like for like" philosophy to treat diseases and illnesses
Record case histories with reference to physical, emotional and psychological symptoms
Acqiore thorough knowledge on diverse symptoms and how they can be treated
Combine medication with appropriate food and healthy habits
Communicate with clients with empathy and care
Keep a check on the staff and guide them appropriately
Manage the case histories and accounts of patients
Perform duties in line with the ethical standards

pros: Being able to help others: Homeopathic doctors provide a meaningful service using medical science for others. Many individuals are drawn to the profession because they want to help others.Homeopathy mediciences are safe to consume with less side effects
Job security: This is one profession which would always be in demand and is not affected by any recession. We all will always need doctors.
Money and security:
Prestige: They generally gain community respect.
cons: Long training route: To practice as a doctor it requires at least four years of college with internship and 2-3 years of masters in the specialized area. It makes the whole process too long before the person actually starts to practice.
High college fees: The fees of medical colleges is generally very high.

Long work hours, high stress and patience: The job is very demanding. It requires physical, mental and emotional involvement and drains his/her energy. The homeopathic doctor should be very patient and understanding.

horticulture-as-a-career-in-india.title: Horticulture
horticulture-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Horticulture is most conventional field of agriculture. It is an applied science which deals with vegetables, ornamental flowers and fruits. Horticulturists are involved in the cultivation and propagation of plants with the aim of improving their quality, yield, growth, nutritional value, and resistance to diseases and insects . Nowadays, horticulture is considered as one of the the most rapidly growing sectors in agriculture and is a focus area to stimulate agricultural growth, due to the fast changing food habits of the domestic population towards more nutritious food, and increasing overseas demand.

career-opportunities.horticultural_therapist: Horticultural therapists utilize their knowledge of plants to help their patients with cognitive and physical disabilities.
career-opportunities.researcher__horticultural_scientist: Researchers in this field study plant genetics and develop plants that have natural immunity to diseases and resistance to environmental damage.
career-opportunities.nurseries: People in this profession grow plants from seedlings and make sure they make it through their entire lifecycle.
career-opportunities.landscaping: This involves designing and maintaining commercial and residential grounds by utilizing one's knowledge of plants, flowers, irrigation, and trees. An eye for design is also important.
career-opportunities.floriculturist: Floriculturists deals with the study of growing foliage flowers and plants and then marketing them. Their specialization is in planning and designing of interior/exterior landscapes for recreational areas, parks, industrial sites, shopping malls or other projects.
career-opportunities.olericulturist: The study of vegetable culture is called as 'Olericulture'. Olericulturists work in industries, universities, research institutes, and other organizations at different levels. Vegetable growers are in great demand presently in the private sector as the seed industry is growing.
career-opportunities.pomologist: Pomologists focus on the cultivation, production, post-harvest, processing, storage, and value addition of fruit plants which have been identified as the major sources of vitamins, protein, antioxidants and carbohydrates. Pomologists work in industries, ICAR, state agricultural universities and in various other organizations.
career-opportunities.viticulturist: Viticulture is a branch of horticulture. Viticulturists are involved in the study and production of grapes for the production of wine in vineyards. They develop new varieties, modify existing varieties, control pests and nutients to improve quality and yield of grapes.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in Science Stream with PCB/PCM (English is mandatory)
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. Horticulture (Hons.) for 3 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M.Sc. Horticulture (Hons.) for 2 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII in Science Stream with PCB/PCM (English is mandatory)
path 2.graduation: Pursue B. Sc. Agriculture (Hons.) for 3 years
path 2.after graduation: Pursue M.Sc. Horticulture (Hons.) for 2 years

horticulture-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: Some colleges have Maths as mandatory subjects in Class XII.Must have passed class 12th or senior secondary examination with at least 50% marks including English. The minimum age limit is 17 years for B. Sc. Courses.

work description: Supervising pest, disease and weed control programmes, equally with health and hygienic principles
Planning, managing and operating transplanting lines in green house as products vary throughout the year
Examining produce, costs and profits of horticultural operations
Formulating innovative or improved working and business strategies
Developing innovative products and bargaining with customers and suppliers
Managing trading system and assisting in operating structure, storage and transportation of products
Ensuring that the quality, health, safety and hygienic standards and principles of the products are fulfilled
Managing financial budgets, records and accounts
Staying abreast with the new developments in the horticulture field

pros: There are a number of work opportunities available as the field of horticulture is a growing one.
Professionals get to work in a variety of environments such as laboratories, offices, field and greenhouses.
cons: Salaries are low to average.
There is the danger of exposure to hazardous chemicals.

hospital-management-as-a-career-in-india.title: Hospital Management
hospital-management-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Hospital Management primarily focuses on understanding and training the students in the administrative procedures of the hospital which involves processes such as human resources, maintaining crucial information etc. Increasing complexity has resulted into various departments in the hospital which has its own functioning yet they need to be coordinated, hospital management helps in understanding the functioning of various domanins. A student of hospital management studies about accounting, healthcare regulations, patient privacy rights etc. Coursework also covers topic related to organizational leadership, healthcare, startegies, planning etc. Hospital administrators helps in increasing or maintaining the efficiency and success of the hospital in a cost effective manner and ensures that their patients get best healthcare. Generally, students from MBBS/BDS/BPT background consider the field of Hospital Management because they wish to switch from a clinical side to administrative side.

career-opportunities.managing_manpower_in_hospitals: Hospital Management students can be hired in the hospitals as HR managers wherein they will be hiring doctors and other working staff. They are also hired as Nursing directors, medical directors, head of the departments etc. wherein the main job is to maintain the functioning of the hospital, managing outpatients, managing treatment centres and ensuring patient as well as staff healthcare.
career-opportunities.sales__marketing: As a Hospital Manager, you will be handling all the administrative work such as finances, accounting, marketing etc. They will work more towards the functioning side of it.
career-opportunities.hospital_operations: You will be involved in managing hospital operations and also day to day running of hospital. From managing single department to hospital chains all over the country, one has to keep a check of all.
career-opportunities.academics: Hospital Management also provides with the career opportunities in the field of academics wherein you can become dean, director, lecturer in various colleges and universities of hospital management wherein you will be imparting your knowledge to budding hospital managers.

path 1.stream: Class XII with Science (PCB) with English as main subject
path 1.graduation: Pursue MBBS or BDS
path 1.after graduation: Pursue Masters in Hospital Management/ Administration

path 2.stream: Class XII with any stream with English as main subject
path 2.graduation: Pursue Bachelors in any discipline (at least 50% marks)
path 2.after graduation: Pursue Masters in Hospital Management/ Administration

path 3.stream: Class XII with any stream with English as main subject
path 3.graduation: Pursue Bachelors in any discipline (at least 50% marks)
path 3.after graduation: Pursue Diploma (post graduate) in Hospital management

hospital-management-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: Must have passed class 12th or Senior Secondary Examination with at least 50% marks including EnglishMust be graduate in any discipline with at least 50% marks It is open for both non medical and medical students. Admission is based on percentage and/or entrance exam depending on the college.

1.name: All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS)

4.name: Indian Institute of Health Management Research

6.name: All India Institute of Hygiene and Public Health

11.name: Birla Institute of Technology and Sciences

work description: Job of Hospital managers involve planning and coordination of various deprtaments in the hospital.
Healthcare Managers can be found in a variety of settings within a hospital ranging from human resources to specialized clinical areas to general oversight.
A person can be involved in the hiring, finance, accounts etc. in the hospital according to their specialisation and area of interest.
Healthcare managers establish policies and frameworks, manage human resources, allocate budgets and other financial resources, submit reports, and maintain and manage IT systems and databases.

Managers of all levels need to coordinate with doctors, physicians, nurses, surgeons, health information technicians, pharmacists, and other professionals to ensure patient quality care, treatment, and rehabilitation.
Managers have to draw up schedules and address specific needs for the entire staff with the overall focus being patient care.

pros: The job role of hospital manager involves people interaction as you will be connecting with a large number of people on daily basis.
A sense of internal satisfaction will be there as you are involved in an organization where people come to regain their health.
It allows you to do varied work such as dealing with patients, managing staff, handling finance etc. as the main aim is to ensure smooth functioning of the hospital
cons: It’s a difficult job as it requires immense amount of effort and energy throught the day and at night also.
As it involves handling various jobs at one particular point of time, internse work pressure comes along with it.
The personnel management side of hospital administrator is often the most challenging one.

hotel-management-as-a-career-in-india.title: Hotel Management
hotel-management-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Hotel Management is an upcoming global industry & has multifocussed approach. It is flourishing in big as well as small cities. It prepares students to work at hotels, resorts, cruise liners, in aviation and casinos. At hotels, hotel management graduates may engage in managing functions such as housekeeping, front office, food production and administration. Hotel Management aspirants can specialize in fields like Hospitality Marketing Strategy, Culinary Theory and Practice, Hotel Operations, Hospitality Franchising, Hospitality Technology & Financial Analysis in Hospitality Industry.

career-opportunities.hotel_restaurant_industry: Be part of the leading 5 star hotels/ restaurants chains in the country and be responsible for managing multiple departments such as Operations, Conference/ Banquets, Culinary Arts, Front Office, Food & Production, Spa, Housekeeping etc.
career-opportunities.cruise_liners: Cruise Liners are emerging to be the most sought after destination amongst Hotel Management Graduates. Opportunities in Cruise Lines are characterized by high pay packages and exotic destinations.
career-opportunities.airline_industry: One can join the airline industry and be part of the cabin crew or ground staff. Lucrative opportunities exist in both domestic airlines & international airlines.
career-opportunities.retail_industry: Be part of the team, which manages the leading malls & cineplexes in the country.
career-opportunities.corporate_roles: Be part of the leading corporate firms and be responsible for functions such as Guest Relations, Customer Service & Public Relations

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in any stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue BSC/BA in Hotel Management for 3-4 years or BBA hospitality (3year)
path 1.after graduation: Pursue MSC/MBA/MA in Hotel Management for 2 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII in any stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue Diploma in Hotel Management for 6 months to 1 year
path 2.after graduation: Pursue Diploma/Post Graduation Diploma in Hotel Management for 1-2 years

path 3.stream: Clear Class XII in any stream
path 3.graduation: Study abroad for 6 months - 1 year
path 3.after graduation: Study abroad for 6 months - 1 year

work description: Coordinate with and manage different departments for the smooth running of the hotel
Handle the financial matters and look after the expenditure of the hotel
Look after the maintenance of the hotel
Work towards providing highest quality of services to the clients
Recruit, train and monitor the staff
Do periodic assessment of the hotel and its departments
Come up with quick solutions to problems to avoid the inconvenience to the clients
Maintain the harmony among staff members
Set a good example to the staff members which will motivate them to work efficiently
Take care of the ethical concerns while governing a hotel
Work on the feedbacks provided by the customers as well as other staff members

pros: Working in the hotel industry gives us an advantage of meeting new people.
It helps you in developing your over all personality
With a hotel management degree you are not just restricted to work in hotels, but also in event management, airlines, travel and tourism, etc.
cons: There are no fixed working hours.
Starting salary can be low

hrm-as-a-career-in-india.title: Human Resource Management
hrm-as-a-career-in-india.summary: "Human Resource Management (HRM) involves managing, motivating, and developing employees for the betterment of the organisation. It features a variety of functions like hiring, training, managing, and ensuring the growth of the employees. It focuses on achieving organisational goals by recruiting appropriate people that fit the culture, vision, values and reuirements of the company. They also ensure that the work environment is safe, healthy and stress-free so as to help individual achieve their maximum potential at work. To pursue a career in HRM, it is essential to have good communication skills, interpersonal skills, problem-solving skills, planning, time-management and excellent organisational skills and also a few technical skills. Most people who re hired as HR have graduated from business schools. These professionals plan and execute employee benefit programs, supervise the work of the staff, take charge of the recruitment process, recommend new policies and approaches, orient new employees to the organisation, and contribute to the development of the organisation. The job can be challenging but rewarding at the same time. These experts ensure that the organisation and its people are working smoothly without any obstacles. They are the link between the organisation and its employees"

career-opportunities.training_and_development_manager: These professionals aid employees in developing and ameliorating their skill sets and careers.
career-opportunities.hr_entrepreneur: These individuals start their own HR firm and lend services to other companies.
career-opportunities.international_human_resource_professiona: These people travel around the world and perform HR tasks at global level.
career-opportunities.labor_relations_specialists: They interpret and administer labor contracts for issues like salaries, healthcare, pensions, etc.
career-opportunities.administrative_services_managers: These individuals are responsible for planning, directing and coordinating supportive services for their organisations.
career-opportunities.compensation_and_benefits_managers: Their job involves oversseing, planning and executing programs for compensating the employees.
career-opportunities.top_executives: These professionals devise strategies and policies to ensure that the organization meet its goals.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in Any Stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue Graduation in Any Discipline for 3-5 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue PG Diploma in Human Resource Management/ MBA HRM for 2 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII in Science Stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.Tech/BE for 4 years
path 2.after graduation: Pursue PG Diploma in Human Resource Management or MBA in HRM/Personnel Management/Industrial and Labor Relations/ Public Relations /Labor Law for 2 years

path 3.stream: Clear Class XII in Commerce Stream

path 4.after graduation: Pursue MA/MSc in Industrial Psychology or PG Diploma in Human Resource Management or MBA in HRM/Personnel Management/Industrial and Labor Relations/ Public Relations /Labor Law for 2 years

pros: This career requires skills and trains the person in a variety of area and this can help the individual to take on a career in any direction - like administrative service, labor relations, or even executive level positions. The level of exposure and experience in this field is high and one gets to learn a lot of things The level of growth is great The remuneration is good
cons: They may have to encounter a great deal of conflicts and complications that require immediate solutions The competition is very high in this field The work can be challenging and overwhelming

hypnotherapy-as-a-career-in-india.title: Hypnotherapy
hypnotherapy-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Hypnotherapy is the treatment of a variety of health conditions by hypnotism or by inducing prolonged sleep. It is used in a number of fields including psychotherapy, surgery, dentistry, research, and medicine. Hypnotherapy is commonlyused as an alternative treatment for a wide range of health conditions. It is also useful in helping patients overcome phobias. In more general areas, hypnotherapy has been found to be beneficial for problems such as motivation, procrastination, decision making, personal achievement and development, job performance, buried or repressed memories, relaxation, and stress management. It is a mind-based treatment that uses hypnotic states to access your subconscious and generate change both in the psyche as well as the physical. The accuracy depends on your intention and concentration at the time of selection. Thus, it is very important to concentrate hard to achieve the most significant outcome.

path 1.stream: Clear class XII with any stream
path 1.graduation: Bachelor's degree programs in this or related field, such as, Social Work, Psychology, Nursing, Sociology, Behavioral medicine, Dentistry, Traditional medicine, Psychotherapy
path 1.after graduation: Pursue a diploma degree in Hypnotherapy

hypnotherapy-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: Gain Clinical Experience in hospitals or mental health organisations and fellowships which will help in obtaining state licensure or certificationLICENSURE: Gain clinical experience in hospitals or mental health internships and fellowships which may assist with gaining relevant experience. These programs are intended to assist practitioners with their chosen specialties, including therapeutic applications for hypnosis and hypnotherapy. In addition, clinical experience is usually required to obtain state licensure or certification.

3.name: Institute of Clinical Hypnosis and Related Sciences

work description: You work with patients to heal and treat their medical conditions, problems, or dependencies. These are trained medical professionals who work with their patients to help them cope with and get rid of any pain they may be suffering from, either mentally or physically.

A hypnotherapist usually has a background in psychology or therapy, and is therefore adept at working with patients on a one-on-one basis. Their responsibilities range from attracting new clients, handling general paperwork and office duties, and taking them through every step of the patient consultation and treatment.

A hypnotherapist understands the power of the human brain and is carefully trained to administer hypnosis to bring healing to the patient. This helps them cope with their problems or stop the behaviors that limit or hurt them.
Speaking to a variety of people and handle them accordingly.
Maintaining a positive outlook
Conducting workshops/seminars/short-term courses on hypnotherapy.
Maintaining client database, appointments, records of sessions etc.
Promoting client’s confidentiality and not revealing details.

pros: If you like to talk to people, hypnotherapy is a great way to go ahead with.
A thoughtful and sincere understanding of people can give you an edge to explain information to the clients.
There is a great range of flexibility and comfortable work timings, as you only work when you want to.
The job profile gives you an opportunity to travel and meet new people.
As a therapist and a healer, you derive satisfaction from helping people solve their everyday problems
cons: Initial struggle can take some time sacrifice of personal time.
You might have to deal with social stigmas attached to the profession.
It can be a little stressful and emotionally draining at times.
Initially, it can take a bit of time to build up your business and reputation.

image-consulting-as-a-career-in-india.title: Image Consultant
image-consulting-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Image Consulting is a field wherein people consult an expert who can help them enhance, improve and upgrade their appearance. They make sure that their image is consistent with their personal and professional roles. An Image Consultant helps you look better so they feel better, more confident and capable. They guide you in presenting yourself to your best advantage and in expressing to your highest potential. They help individuals present the best possible image to the world by advising them on their clothes, wardrobe, hair, makeup, body language, etiquettes, and communication skills. Someone who is a people’s person and have an eye for fashion and style, a job of an Image Consultant can be a good choice for you. Attend training programs for communication skills, choosing right clothes colors, styling, fashion, make up, etc. can be useful for you in becoming an image consultant.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in any Stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.A in any Discipline
path 1.after graduation: Pursue certification programs in Image Consultancy.

image-consulting-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: No specific education is required to get into a career in this field.

1.name: Image Consulting Business Institute
1.location: Mumbai, Delhi, Bangalore, Kolkata, Pune, Ahmedabad, Vadodara and Nagpur

2.name: First Impression (a unit of Frankfinn group)

3.name: Sterling Style Academy
3.location: International institute conducting short courses in Mumbai

work description: As an Image Consultant, you must have knowledge about various dresses and fabric materials that would suit to oneâs body.
Image consultants can conduct seminars and workshops teaching people regarding appearance, color coordination, etiquettes, effective communication skills and body language.
Choose garments appropriate for the personâs personality, occasion, or an event.
Choose hairstyles that complement individualâs facial features as well as skin tones.
They help individuals with their appearance, dressing, grooming and behavior to redefine the person.
Provides professional enhancement program for individuals.

pros: Image consultants get to work with famous public figures, bloggers, fashion experts etc.
Another important advantage is that, the consultant gets to do what he or she loves that is make people look good for major events.
They are also given handsome compensation payments for doing the work that they love.
cons: The only disadvantage of working as an image consulting expert are that the consultant has to work under pressure and ensure that the job is done as per the client's requirements.
You will need to exhibit a gentle tact when it comes time to analyze your clients' images.
You may need to bring in other experts if you don't have experience in all areas of image consulting.

income-tax-as-a-career-in-india.title: Income Tax
income-tax-as-a-career-in-india.summary: A career with Income Tax Department (Government of India) gives an opportunity to work in one of the most important function of the government revenue generation setup. A knack for people as well as for numbers is very important to succeed in this department. The various services in the department provide a wonderful opportunity for a stable career along with the chance in contributing to the nation's development.

career-opportunities.prosecutor: A Prosecutor is a lawyer specializing in economic offenses, he/she is hired to represent the department in court cases involving the department and any other party.
career-opportunities.tax_assistant: A Tax Assistant calculates and assess individuals total liable tax incurred on their income and the groups they are catogrized in. He/ She needs to be good with number with an attitude to help others to be able to do their job successfully.
career-opportunities.inspector: An Income Tax Inspector handles and manages various subordinates under him/her. They have the power to search and seize a person/ goods if found suspicious.
career-opportunities.assistant_commissioner_of_income_tax: An Assistant Commissioner also known as area manager. He/ she supervises inspectors and other subordinates in the task of collection and vigilance.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII with any stream
path 1.graduation: Graduation in any stream with minimum 55% marks
path 1.after graduation: Clear Civil services examination and fill preferences for IRS

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII with any stream
path 2.graduation: Graduation in any stream with minimum 55% marks
path 2.after graduation: Clear Income Tax Department Test

income-tax-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: Graduation in any streamIncome Tax department conducts a separate selection test for all posts except those to be filled by the IRS. A good command over number and various Taxation laws and policies is a must to pass the test.

entrance exam.name: UPSE CSE
entrance exam.elements: Preliems exam Paper -1 & Paper 2 (MCQ) General Knowledge Vocabulary Social Studies, Science (6th -12th class), Indian polity & constitution, logical reasoning, mathematical aptitude. Mains There are 8 papers: Paper 1 Indian Language Paper 2- English Paper3- Essay Paper4,5,6,7- General Studies Paper 8,9- Optional paper Interview/ Personality Test

entrance exam.name: Income Tax Department Selection Test
entrance exam.elements: General Intelligence Arithmetic Ability General English General Intelligence Consists of 5 Paper (Objective papers) Paper 1 to Paper 4 are objective and consists of Tax Law & Taxes, Advance Accountancy, Allied Laws, Office Procedure. Paper 5 is subjective

work description: Ensure that the government receives tax from businesses and citizens
Maintain accounts of tax from different departments
Send notice and conduct periodic checks for frauds and other illegal activities
Assist people in tax related problems and queries
Investigate into claims of inability to pay taxes by researching court information for the status of liens, mortgages, or financial statements, or by locating assets through third parties
Examine and analyze tax assets and liabilities to determine resolution of delinquent tax problems.
Communicate with companies, lawyers, colleagues and accountants

pros: Job security and a stable income.
Assured pension, medical and other benefits.
Less amount of work load.
Better pay at low and middle levels (as a result of the 7thpay commission).
cons: Transferrable nature of jobs
Technologically backward.
Retirement age is fixed.
Working hours can be irregular with uncertain duration.

indian-air-force-as-a-career-in-india.title: Indian Air Force
indian-air-force-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Indian Air Force established in the year 1932. Since then it has become an indispensable part of the Indian defense services. Currently, it has seven commands, five of which are functional and two are non-functional. It has shown tremendous progress and advancements over the years and has served the country at the times of need be it during wartime or during disasters. An evidence of its strength and commend ability comes from the fact that it was named Royal Indian Air Force in 1945 as a result of the recognition of its services and achievements in World War II. India has a credible air power which is counted as one amongst the best in the world. It is considered to be the seventh powerful air force of the world. Currently, it is served by 1.8 lakh personnel, more than 500 transport aircrafts and helicopters, and more than 600 combat aircrafts. This strength makes it the fourth largest Air Force of the world.

career-opportunities.flying_branch: This branch deals with pilots, be it fighter pilots, transport pilots or helicopter pilots. They work not just during wartime, but during peace as well. These are the ones who are involved in raiding enemy bunkers, troops, air force stations, artillery sites, do surveillance, provide support to the infantry, help in disaster relief programs.
career-opportunities.technical_branch: This branch of Indian Air Force handles the technical and mechanical needs and requirements of the Air Force, which are an important asset of the nation. From maintenance to performing to replacing the faulty parts as well as giving suggestions and designing efficient machines also comes under this section of the Air Force.
career-opportunities.ground_duty_branch: This is the branch of the Air Force, which looks into the logistics, administration, accounting, education as well as meteorology departments. They are the ones who manage human as well as financial resources allotted to the Air Force. One can work as an internal auditor, fighter controller, air traffic controller, handling the latest satellite imagery, supervision of inventories, etc.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in Science Stream (Mathematics and Physics)
path 1.graduation: Pursue graduation in B.Tech/ BE for 4 years and apply in Pre - Final Year
path 1.after graduation: Give the UES Exam to get enrolled in Indian Airforce

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII in Science Stream (Mathematics and Physics)
path 2.graduation: Pursue graduation in B.Tech/BE for 4 years
path 2.after graduation: Give the EKT Exam to get enrolled into Indian Air force

path 3.stream: Clear Class XII in Science Stream (Mathematics and Physics)
path 3.graduation: Pursue graduation in Any Discipline (Open to pre-final year students if they have the required Certificate)
path 3.after graduation: Pass the CDS/AFCAT Exam and UPSC Eligible to join through NCC Special Scheme Entry provided you have "C" Certificate

path 4.stream: Clear Class XII in Science Stream (Mathematics and Physics)
path 4.graduation: Pass the National Defense Academy (NDA) Exam to join the Indian Air Force

indian-air-force-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: One can appear for CDS while in final year of graduation as well.Most of these exams are conducted twice a year. Not all these exams are open for females. For NDA age range is 16.5 years to 19 years. NDA is open only to male unmarried candidates. One needs to be a citizen of India or Nepal/Bhutan/Tibet refugee to apply. Age range for entrances after graduation is 20-26 years. Minimum 60% aggregate in graduation is needed. Apart from educational criteria, physical as well as medical standards as set by Indian Air Force should also be met to be eligible.

entrance exam.name: NDA
entrance exam.elements: Written – Objective & MCQ (negative marking) Part 1 is a Math based paper Part 2 is a General Ability Test (English, Physics, Chemistry, Math, General Knowledge, History, Geography and Current Events). The duration of both the papers is 2 and half hours each. Interview- SSB Pilot Aptitude Battery Test (PABT) (appear once in lifetime)- Include written and machine tests to evaluate you on the basis of your ability to read instruments, control of your actions and mental strength 3.Medical Examination

entrance exam.name: Combined Defence Service Examination (CDSE) (Enginners/ only for graduates, male only)
entrance exam.elements: Written- English, Math and General Knowledge(Objective/ MCQ) – Negative marking SSB interview Stage 1 includes an Officer Intelligence Test and a Picture perception Test Stage 2 which will comprise of a psychological tests, group tasks and a personal interview. Pilot Aptitude Battery Test (PABT)

entrance exam.name: National Cadet Corpe (NCC) Special Entry (men)
entrance exam.elements: Obtain Air Wing Senior Division ‘C’ Certificate of the NCC to be eligible to enter the Air Force Flying Branch In “A” & “B” certificate in NCC “C” Certificate then one can come directly for SSB, otherwise Written test, SSB interview and PABT

entrance exam.name: Short Service Commission (SSC) Men & Women
entrance exam.elements: AFCAT (Airforce commission admission test Written Exam First stage:verbal ability, numerical ability, reasoning, general awareness and military aptitude. Second Stage: 1) Intelligence Test 2) psychological test conducted by a psychologist, group tests and a personal interview. Pilot Aptitude Battery Test (PABT) Medical Examination

entrance exam.name: University Entry Scheme (UES) (Pre- final year engg)
entrance exam.elements: -AFCAT Written exam -Interview (SSB) -GD -Personal Interview -Medical

entrance exam.name: Administration Branch Logistics Branch Accounts Branch Education Branch (PG student) Meteorology Branch (PG student)
entrance exam.elements: AFCAT written SSB Interview Personal Interview Medical exam

work description: Fly combat or fighter planes carrying ammunition and missiles
Transport pilots fly planes which carry men and materials
Provide air support to a moving army, or for para-dropping men and supplies
Fly along with the pilot and guide the aircraft by using the latest avionic equipment
Ensure proper maintenance of aircrafts and handle the electronic and communication equipment
Deliver logistical, meteorological, educational and administrative support to the flying and technical branches
Provide control and advisory services to enable the pilot to conduct flights in total safety
Monitor the skies for any potential threat and select the appropriate air defense system
Be Responsible for provisioning the aircraft with spares, fuel, armaments, etc

pros: Provide personal and professional growth.
One gains knowledge about various managing and administrative skills.
Makes a person a disciplined being
Both the individual and his/her family member enjoy the perks of belonging to a defence background starting from Free healthcare, education and retirement benefits.
cons: No end to your working hours.
One has to follow an intense routine.
You have to be efficient even though you are under pressure.
Family life takes a back seat.

indian-army-as-a-career-in-india.title: Indian Army
indian-army-as-a-career-in-india.summary: People who are passionate about serving the nation and wish to contribute towards maintaining national peace can opt for a career in the Indian Army. The main objective of the Indian army is to maintain national peace and security by defending the country from external threats and attacks. It has seven commands: Eastern, Wester, Northern, Central, Southern, South-Western, Training command. It holds a GFP rank of 4 and is thus, one of the largest armed forces of the world. The Indian Army has more than 1.2 million active personnel. It is empowered with latest armament which includes tanks, self-propelled guns, armored fighting vehicles, artillery, and multiple rocket launch systems. The zeal, enthusiasm, and desire to serve the nation can be fulfilled by joining Indian army.

career-opportunities.combat_unit: This section of the Indian Army is responsible for going on warfare and fight the enemy forces. These are the ones who are involved in confronting the enemy troops in the battlefield. These combat forces are trained in artillery, infantry, mechanized infantry, armor, operating weapons, territorial corps, defense security corps, pioneer corps. Divisions like Army Armored Corps, Infantry, Mechanized Infantry, and the Regiment of Artillery, Territorial Corps, come under this category of Indian Army. This is a demanding career with a lot of physical as well as mental stamina.
career-opportunities.air_defense: This division of the Indian Army includes the air observation units and protect the country's Air Space from external attacks like enemy bombings, missiles, etc. In this way, they support other forces as well as other divisions of the Indian Army by guarding the weapons from foreign attacks and provide support to disaster relief, support ground units and work in different terrains, under diverse weather conditions.
career-opportunities.engineering_and_it_unit: Corps of Engineer is one of the oldest arms of the Indian Army, which consists of three divisions: Combat Engineers, MES, and Border Roads. These are the ones who, during wartime, are engaged in the work of constructing bridges, helipads, laying land-mine fields, etc. They are also involved in constructing national highways, airfields, and buildings all over the country. The Electrical and Mechanical Engineers (EME) provide technical assistance and are responsible for the infusion of high and latest technology equipment's into the army. Corps of signal are responsible for ensuring that there is electronic and information superiority so that our army can function in the most effective manner. They take care of the IT and Communication system of the Indian army.
career-opportunities.army_service_corps: This division of the Indian Army provides support and service to its other divisions. They do so by being involved in taking care of their health (Army Medical Corps, Army Dental Corps), taking care of logistics (Army Ordnance Corps), taking care of specialized and technical mandate of the animals used by army for various purposes (Remount and Vetenary Corps). They are also involved in training the future officers and soldiers so that they bring valor and laurels to the country (Army Education Corps), processing mails (Army Postal Corps), and providing them with fresh dairy products on a daily basis (Military Farm Services). They are the backbone of the Indian Army.
career-opportunities.education: The work of this department incompases training the new recruited young officers to serve the nation in near future. Every department has education officer who specialize in particular field so as to train officers and give them career advise. Their work is to assess the education need of military staff and then design, develop and implement the modules accordingly.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in Science Stream (Mathematics and Physics)
path 1.graduation: Pursue Graduation in L.L.B for 5-6 years
path 1.after graduation: Give exam for JAG (Lawyer) to get enrolled in Indian Army

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII in Science Stream (Mathematics and Physics)
path 2.graduation: Pursue Graduation in B.Tech/B.E / B.Tech (pre-final year)
path 2.after graduation: Give the Technical graduate commission Exam to get enrolled in Indian Army Give the University entry scheme Exam to get enrolled in Indian Army if in Pre-final year of B.Tech/B.E

path 3.stream: Clear Class XII in any field, and be part of your NCC Society in school fr NCC entry
path 3.graduation: Graduation in Any Discipline (Open to pre-final year students if they have the required Certificate), also be a part of your NCC society and hold ???C??? certitificate
path 3.after graduation: Pass the CDS Exam Note: Eligible to join through NCC Special Scheme Entry provided you have "C" Certificate

path 4.stream: Clear Class XII in any field
path 4.graduation: Graduation in Any Discipline (Open to pre-final year students if they have the required Certificate)
path 4.after graduation: Pass the CDS Exam

path 5.stream: Clear Class XII in Science Stream (Biology mandatory)
path 5.after graduation: Apply for Army Medical Corps - Short Service Commission

indian-corporate-law-service-as-a-career.title: Indian Corporate Law Service (ICLS)
indian-corporate-law-service-as-a-career.summary: It is the regulatory service for the corporate sector in India. It is a Central Civil Service (Group A) and functions under the Ministry of Corporate Affairs, Government of India. The main role is to regulate the corporate sector and protect the rights of the investors, particularly small investors. It is responsible for the implementation of Companies Act,1956, Companies Act, 2013 and The Limited liability Partnership Act, 2008.

career-opportunities.junior_time_scale: Entry level (Probationer), Registrar of Companies In-charge, Assistant Registrar of Companies, Assistant Official Liquidator, Assistant Director, Senior Assistant Director, Serious Fraud Investigation office (SFIO), Assistant General Manager, IEPF Authority
career-opportunities.senior_time_scale: Registrar of Companies, Official Liquidator, Deputy Registrar of Companies, Deputy Official Liquidator, Deputy Director, Deputy Director, Serious Fraud Investigation office (SFIO), Deputy Director, Indian Corporate Law Service Academy, Indian Institute of Corporate Affairs, Manesar, Deputy General Manager, IEPF Authority
career-opportunities.junior_administrative_grade: Registrar of Companies, Official Liquidator, Joint Director, Secretary, Company Law Board, Joint Director/ Additional Director, Serious Fraud Investigation office (SFIO), Additional General Manager/ General Manager, IEPF Authority, Deputy Secretary to the Government of India on Deputation
career-opportunities.senior_administrative_grade: Regional Director, Director of Inspection and Investigation, Director of Prosecution, Joint Secretary to the Government of India on Deputation, Member- National Company Law Tribunal, National Company Law Appellate Tribunal
career-opportunities.higher_administrative_grade: Director General of Corporate Affairs, Additional Secretary to the Government of India on Deputation through the Central Staffing Scheme, Technical Members in Tribunals like NCLT & NCLAT, Member in Insolvency & Bankruptcy Board

indian-foreign-service-as-a-career-in-in.title: Indian Foreign Service
indian-foreign-service-as-a-career-in-in.summary: Indian Foreign Service is a central civil service, which marks India's Presence abroad and comes under Group A of the Central Services of the Government of India. As a career diplomat, the Foreign Service Officer is required to project India?s interests, both at home and abroad on a wide variety of issues. These include bilateral political and economic cooperation, trade and investment promotion, cultural interaction, press and media liaison as well as a whole host of multilateral issues. Recruitment is based on civil services examination conducted by UPSC every year. Candidates must clear each round of the exam and acquire a recommendation from UPSC to get appointed as an IFS officer. Then new entrants undergo a multi-faceted and comprehensive training programme.

career-opportunities.third_secretaryentry_level: - Representing India in its Embassies, High Commissions, Consulates, and Permanent Missions to multilateral organisations like UN; - Protecting India?s national interests in the country of his/her posting; - Promoting friendly relations with the receiving state as also its people, including NRI / PIOs; - Reporting accurately on developments in the country of posting which are likely to influence the formulation of India?s policies; - Negotiating agreements on various issues with the authorities of the receiving state; and - Extending consular facilities to foreigners and Indian nationals abroad.
career-opportunities.viceconsul_consulgeneral_consul: Indian consulates abroad- the Foreign Service Officer is required to project India?s interests, both at home and abroad on a wide variety of issues. These include bilateral political and economic cooperation, trade and investment promotion, cultural interaction, press and media liaison as well as a whole host of multilateral issues.

indian-legal-service-as-a-career-in-indi.title: Indian Legal Service
indian-legal-service-as-a-career-in-indi.summary: The Indian Legal Service was founded by the Government of India's Ministry of Law and Justice under the Indian Legal Service Rules, 1957, which took effect on October 1, 1957. This comes under State Service Group A. Since its formation, personnel of the Indian Legal Service have provided dedicated service to the nation by providing legal advice to various Ministries/Departments of the Government of India on significant subjects.The Department of Legal Affairs has a two tier set up, namely, the Main Secretariat at New Delhi and the Branch Secretariats at Mumbai, Kolkata, Chennai and Bengaluru. The nature of duties discharged can be broadly classified into two areas - advisory duties and litigation.The digital revolution has altered the mechanics of information sharing, and the economy has given rise to new sources of income. This involves ILS officers updating their legal knowledge and skills in order to meet growing legal needs. They, as the Government's Principal Legal Advisers, have responded efficiently and quickly to the demands imposed on them by the various government organs.

career-opportunities.indian_legal_service_cadre_of_legal_advi: The Department advice the Ministries on legal matters including interpretation of the Constitution and the laws, conveyancing and engagement of counsel to appear on behalf of the Union of India in the High Courts and subordinate courts where the Union of India is a party. Conduct of cases in the Supreme Court and the High Courts on behalf of the Central Government and on behalf of the Governments of States participating in the Central Agency Scheme. The Department is also administratively in-charge of the Income Tax Appellate Tribunal and the Law Commission of India. The Department is also administratively concerned with all the matters relating to the Indian Legal Service. It is further connected with the appointment of Law Officers namely the Attorney General of India, the Solicitor General of India and the Additional Solicitor Generals of India.
career-opportunities.indian_legal_service_cadre_of_law_office: Law Commission of India it is an executive body established by an order of the Government of India. Its major function is to work for legal reforms. The Commission is established for a fixed tenure and works as an advisory body to the Ministry of Law and Justice. It is required to undertake extensive research and study deeply the various matters related to the law given to it either by Central Government or suo-motu. Review the existing laws in the country for their improvement and suggest Government reforms on those matters for their productive results. Study and research various matters related to the country and problems faced by it and put forward the results before the Government for enacting new legislation. To continuously make reform for reducing the high cost of litigation incurred by people and state, eliminating long time taken delivering justice and to make procedures easier to shorten the time taken.
career-opportunities.indian_legal_service_cadre_of_government: A government attorney is an attorney that works in the different branches of the government. Depending on where they work, government attorneys handle a range of legal issues that affect the city, the state, or the federal government. The work of government advocate include: Representing the government in court; Providing legal services that are in the interest of the public; Enforcing local and city ordinances; Providing assistance to other governmental agencies; Preparing legal opinions for matters pending before the court.

indian-navy-as-a-career-in-india.title: Indian Navy
indian-navy-as-a-career-in-india.summary: The Indian Navy is the 7th most powerful navy of the world. It has over 300,000 tons of seafaring vessels. The role of the Indian Navy is very vast, ranging from providing assistance at times of natural disasters to fighting in the war in order to safeguard the country and destroy the enemies. Broadly the role of Indian navy is categorized into four categories: the Military role, the Diplomatic role, Constabulary role, and the Benign Role. They are responsible for deterrence against war as well as foreign interventions, maintaining the country's territorial integrity, safeguarding the shores, surveillance.

career-opportunities.executive: These include General Service Officer, Hydrographic Officer, Naval Armament Inspection Officer, Provost Officer, Pilot Officer, Observer Officer, Submarine Officer, Diver Officer, Law Officer, Logistic Officer, and Information Technology branch. This division of Indian Navy is responsible for working as well as fighting the ship, using it during wartime, prepare nautical charts for providing directions as well as planning attacks, be a part of naval onboard operations. Providing training for war in an effective manner, doing an underwater inspection of the ships to check for defects or repairs, legal needs, keep a track of what all is needed, development and maintenance of IT infrastructure in applications also come under the work designated to this branch of the Indian Navy.
career-opportunities.engineering: This branch of Indian Navy opens gates for students interested in Engineering, General Services, Submarine Engineering, Naval Construction. They work with the submarines and are responsible for ensuring that they are in proper working state and are serviceable. They are also involved in the designing, construction, quality control, as well as repair of the naval vessels. Thus, this division deals majorly with ensuring that we have serviceable naval vessels in our dockyards which can defend the country as and when needed as well as are engrossed in ship building and making constant improvements in their design as well as performance and making them more efficient.
career-opportunities.education: If a person is interested in training the youngsters of the nation and make them good Officers and Navy personnels, this is the division that helps in realizing this dream. By being a part of this division of Indian Navy, the person will be holding the responsibility of training the future Officers and sailors for the naval defense of the nation. They specialize in different fields and then train the students in their area of specialization.
career-opportunities.electrical: Warships are just like mini cities which needs everything like people living on land require be that food, water, and even electricity. So this division of Indian Navy takes care of the electrical requirements of the warships. Underwater weapons, radar and radio communication, missile systems are also controlled by them along with computer controlled machinery. They are the ones who make sure that all these systems are performing at the peak level.
career-opportunities.medical: As a part of this division of Indian Navy, the professionals are responsible for taking care of the health of the servicemen and their families along with learning and practicing military medicines.

indian-statistical-service-as-a-career-i.title: Indian Statistical Service
indian-statistical-service-as-a-career-i.summary: The Indian Statistical Service is part of the executive branch of the Indian government's Group-A Central Civil Services. It is a governmental service with a high level of statistical knowledge and application. With the primary goal of creating high-quality official statistics using improved methodologies and procedures, as well as providing solutions to data and information demands, as well as interpretation and analysis. A majority portion of the probationary training programme is to be devoted to acquiring of technical knowledge in the field of official statistics, economics, financial statistics, survey methodology etc.Recruitment in Indian statistical Service is done through UPSC examination.

career-opportunities.subordinate_statistical_service_division: Junior Statistical Officer(JSO)- are engaged in data collection from selected households/enterprises etc. both from Urban and Rural areas by personally visiting them through well designed schedules. Senior Statistical Officer(SS0)- posted in Ministries/Departments/Organizations other than NSO (FOD) are carrying out day-to-day statistical functions of the Ministries/Department/Organisation as per work assigned to them.
career-opportunities.statistical_investigator: Statistical Investigators are required to carry out data collection drives and numerous surveys in regards to price indexes, urban surveys, socio-economic factors, governmental schemes, and programs.A Statistical Investigator officer posted in a Ministry has to work in a clerical profile, draft documents, prepare survey report requirements, data entry, tabulation, edit and compile existing data into reports, and other similar responsibilities.

industrial-and-production-engineering.title: Industrial and production engineering
industrial-and-production-engineering.summary: Industrial and production engineering is responsible for manufacturing technology, engineering sciences, and optimization of complex processes, and systems. They conduct research and see the operation and maintenance of various installations. They plan and develop processes to create and test supreme quality products.The main aim of work of this field is to increase efficiency, effectiveness of manufacturing, ensure quality, and decrease the cost while making the products more alluring, profitable and salable.

career-opportunities.multinational_companies: They are hired by MNC's to work with a handsome salary and freedom to create and design products.
career-opportunities.industrial_designer: They are responsible for planning and designing everything inside a building. They are responsible for planning such as vehicles to cell phones and life-saving medical gear.
career-opportunities.industrial_engineer: The work is to oversee the workers and ensuring that equipment in the factory works efficiently.
career-opportunities.quality_control_engineer: The responsibility of a control engineer is to design and oversee the production of various types of complex systems and equipment.
career-opportunities.manufacturing_engineer: They are responsible for designing new equipment, processes, and systems and to make improvements to current operations to enhance efficiency.
career-opportunities.process_engineer: They develop and implement process strategies, optimize and maintain process documents.
career-opportunities.project_engineer: Project engineers are responsible for schedule planning, preparation, resource forecasting and other technical activities relating to the project.
career-opportunities.field_engineer: They are on-site technicians who troubleshoot issues and problems with the help of equipment and systems.
