instrumentation-engineering.title: Instrumentation engineering
instrumentation-engineering.summary: Instrumentation engineering is a fast growing field. It is a branch of engineering that studies the measurement and control of process variables, and the design and implementation of systems. They design control systems, manage operations and modify existing systems. The aim is to make systems more efficient and effective. The work involves designing, installing, managing equipment that are used to monitor and control machinery. The instruments have to be in accordance with the health and safety regulations. They work for industries like manufacturing or chemical plants. They manage control systems in manufacturing facilities, power plants, oil refineries, steel plants, drug manufacture, and hardware companies. They work in collaboration with design and operation engineers.

career-opportunities.instrumentation_specialist: Planning and design, installation, repair and maintenance of equipment. Play a role in leadership and support.
career-opportunities.principle_engineer: Participate in project analysis, design, implementation and commissioning phases. They evaluate existing engineering processes and recommend improvements.
career-opportunities.senior_engineer: They design, research, build, test and improve mechanical and electrical devices, equipment and systems.
career-opportunities.senior_instrumentation_engineer: They evaluate alternatives including cost and risk, supportability and analyses for the total device.
career-opportunities.consultant: It includes studying project reports, including their financial reliability and cost estimates. Advising on repair, alteration and maintenance of an existing structure, ensure complete safety and economy.
career-opportunities.chartered_engineer: Work in getting clearance for the machinery. Proper certification for the import and export of instruments.
career-opportunities.industries: Defence Research and production units, Aeronautical and space science sector, Steel manufacturing industry, Oil and gas and petrochemical industries, Power installations, Manufacturing industry, Biomedical, chemical industry

pros: -There is scope for growth and the pay is good.-Ample number of opportunities in both public and private sector.-It requires the person to use their creativity, ability to think different and problem solving skills-It is a specialized field
cons: -They may have to work for extended hours-They face pressure and time constraints to fix malfunctions in machinery-They have to work with potentially dangerous equipment

interior-design-as-a-career-in-india.title: Interior Design
interior-design-as-a-career-in-india.summary: People are becoming interested in customizing their homes as per their needs and choice in the urban as well as rural areas. This is where the interior designer steps in. The task of the Interior designer is to help clients in designing and decorating their homes & offices. They ensure that available space is utilized to the optimum level. Aesthetic and technical skills are applied to achieve the result. High levels of creativity and good spatial intelligence are required to have an enriching career as an interior designer.

career-opportunities.architectural_firms: They work in architectural firms to design the interiors of the project the firm is working on. They work on the color scheme, decoration material, styling of the room and furniture design.
career-opportunities.construction_firms: They work in construction firms in order to evaluate, design, and recommend the best interior design aspects for the project. This includes choosing the right color scheme, decorations items, room styling material and furniture design.
career-opportunities.town_and_city_planning_bureaus: They work in both town and city planning departments. This way they help to make the city/town more organized and in a same patterned.
career-opportunities.hotels_and_health_resorts: The hotel and resort industry consume a large number Interior designers. They help to bring in luxury interiors, theme interiors, wellness interiors, emotion stimulating interiors to the hotels and wellness resorts.
career-opportunities.design_studios: They work in design studios to work the projects taken up by the studio. They are also required to work in teams to design elements and they also work on complex projects.
career-opportunities.real_estate_companies: Real estate companies are another domain where the Interior designers are required. Their job is to evaluate, design, recommend and implement interior design. This includes color scheme, decorations, room styling and furniture design.
career-opportunities.independent_self_employed_interior_desig: They open up their own firms or take up projects independently to consult on design problems of their customers.
career-opportunities.teaching_in_an_institute_that_offers_cou: If you are inclined towards teaching, then as an experienced interior designer you may join as a faculty members in colleges. You will get an opportunity to share your expertise and knowledge with the budding interior designers.

path 1.stream: Pass Class XII in Any Stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue B. Des. Interior Design for 3- 4 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M.A. Des. in Interior Design for 2 years

path 2.stream: Pass Class XII in Any Stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue Diploma in Interior Designing for 1 year
path 2.after graduation: Pursue Post Graduate Diploma in Interior Designing

work description: Draw out preliminary designing plans, including electrical layouts
Present design and ideas to clients as per their needs and budgets
Design final plans and layouts using designing software
Define timelines for the interior design project and estimate associated project costs
Work closely with architects, structural & mechanical engineers to determine how interior spaces will look and be furnished
Coordinate and oversee the progress of the entire project
Source relevant materials and oversee the installation of the design elements
Stay abreast of recent progress in the design industry

pros: Being an interior designer is a creative process. You will get immense pleasure when your customers will appreciate your designs.
The field will give you opportunities to meet different people.
You get paid well if your skills are on point.
cons: If an interior designer is new in the market, they have to set their cost at a lower level.
You may be required to work for longer hours to meet the deadlines.
You are required to read every individual's taste and customize accordingly.

jewellery-design-as-a-career-in-india.title: Jewellery Design
jewellery-design-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Jewellery Designing is a very rewarding career option for anyone entering the world of designing. An individual who has a good sense of fashion and accessories, as well as pays great attention to detail is an ideal candidate for a career in jewellery designing. Jewelry is a type of accessory that individuals have used to adorn their bodies for decades. Jewellery designers may work with boutiques, retail chains, or jewellery manufacturers, where they put their expertise to practice and create new and unique designs. Having gained ample experience in this field, many jewellery designers go on to work independently, either freelancing or launching their own brands and collections of designer jewellery.

career-opportunities.boutiques: Jewellery designers work in designer boutiques to design, and create luxury pieces that are customer pleasing and go with their style and taste.
career-opportunities.retail_chains: Jewellery designers often tie up with retail chains to design and create pieces that appeal to the mass audience and are put for sale at all locations of the retail brand.
career-opportunities.television_and_film_industry: Jewelry Designers work in the film and television industry to design and create custom pieces for actors and actresses playing various roles. They often study the plot of the film and understand the characters.
career-opportunities.accessory_designing_houses: Jewellery designers work in accessory designing houses to design and create jewellery that resonates with the ideology and style of the firm.
career-opportunities.jewellery_designing_firms: They work in Jewelry Designing Firms to design and create jewellery that resonates with the ideology and style of the firm.
career-opportunities.goldsmiths: Jewellery designers in this role work exclusively with gold and often go past ornaments to design and create other objects, like gold pots and plates.
career-opportunities.gemmologists: Jewellery designers specializing in gemology, design jewellery with gemstones often for luxury and therapeutic purposes.
career-opportunities.independent_jewellery_designers: Independent designers create their own brand of jewellery to cater to a niche market of their own.
career-opportunities.freelance_jewellery_designing: Freelancers in jewellery designing either create their own brand of accessories or take up projects independently with other designers to design and create pieces that complement the apparel to be worn with it.

path 1.stream: Pass Class XII in Any Stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. Fashion Designing/ B. Des. Accessory Design/ B. Des. Jewellery Retail and Export Management for 3- 4 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue Masters in Fashion Design/ M. Des. Accessory Design for 2 years

path 2.stream: Pass Class XII in Any Stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue Diploma in Fashion Designing/ Diploma in Jewellery Designing for 1 year
path 2.after graduation: Pursue Advanced Diploma in Fashion Designing/ Advanced Diploma in Jewellery Designing

path 3.stream: Pass Class XII in Any Stream
path 3.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. Fashion Designing/ B. Des. Accessory Design/ B. Des. Jewellery Retail and Export Management for 3- 4 years
path 3.after graduation: Study Abroad and Pursue Masters in Fine Jewellery Design/ MA Design (Jewellery) for 1 -2 years

jewellery-design-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: Practical, industrial experience is a must. This can be achieved via internships or upon getting a job.

Create custom designed jewellery for individual

pros: The job profile allows you to express yourself creatively.
You get the opportunity to design for the top brands.
With experience and time, you can start your own business.
It is a very lucrative field.
cons: There is a lot of competition in the area, especially for the self-employed designers.
The demand for jewellery generally fluctuates with the state of the economy of the country.
You have to work in accordance with the demands of the clients, which may restrict your creativity.

journalisam-as-a-career-in-india.title: Journalism
journalisam-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Journalists investigate, analyze and report local, national and international events, happenings, trends, current affairs, etc. Journalists have a vital social role, they report news and convey informed opinions on a plethora of topics, ranging from politics to celebrities. They work in different settings, from comfortable offices to potentially dangerous field locations, such as war zones.

career-opportunities.broadcast_journalism: Broadcast journalist are those who present information to the mass audience through electronic medium - Radio or Television and not in the print form. Their job is to present accurate, interesting and eye-catching information to gather attention of the public. They work in the field of politics, war, and environment.
career-opportunities.public_relations: Public relations managers work is to gather attention of the public with an intent to pursue them regarding their product, idea or company. Their job is to influence opinion and behaviour of the audience. Their job is to bring accomplishment to their client by using all forms of media channels.
career-opportunities.social_media: Journalism has changed with the emergence of social media. Websites such as Facebook, Twitter, and Linked-In now serve as news sources for many of their followers. Degree in Journalism will help you secure the most sought-after jobs in social media.
career-opportunities.investigative_journalist: Investigative journalist does an in-depth investigation of an event or situation. Their main focus is to present a part of information that someone is trying to hide. Investigative reporters are behind many of the reforms that we see today.
career-opportunities.sports_journalism: With sports arena growing in recent years, sports journalist has a major role in the news media organisation. As a sports journalist, you can handle various job duties such as reporting game statistics, interviewing players & coaches. A sports journalism career is sure to be an exhilarating one.
career-opportunities.freelance_writer: Unlike earlier scenario where a journalist would become part of a particular publication, now more and more writers are opting for freelancing. They are self-employed and thus their own boss. They work for different publications for short period of time. The more diverse a writer is, he/she is paid better in the industry.
career-opportunities.newspaper_reporter: News reporter or a Correspondent, they gather news worthy information to inform people about the important events taking place around them. They gather information from various resources and may work in a specific beat according to their writing style.
career-opportunities.foreign_correspondent: Foreign correspondents report primarily from a foreign location. They provide their own perspective of the event taking place. They are supposed to be up to date about regions history, current events and culture.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in Any stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue Bachelors in Journalism/Mass Communication /BA Hons. (English/Mass Communication) for 3 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue Masters in Journalism for 2 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII in Any stream
path 2.graduation: Graduation in Any Stream
path 2.after graduation: Pursue Diploma/ Masters in Mass communication/Journalism for 1- 2 years

work description: Investigate, collect, verify and present information in an organised and objective manner
Present/ develop or read news on television, radio, magazines or newspapers
Be attentive to happenings in the society
Build a network of reliable sources for authentic information
Work in a team of reporters, writers, editors, photographers, technicians, etc.
Take part in interviews, conferences, discussions on different perspectives
Observe and evaluate things critically
Communicate with people through fluency in speaking as well as writing

pros: Journalist get to meet wide range of public figures and often spend quality time getting to know those individuals during an interview.
If you have a knack of knowing everything, then this field is best suited for you. From doing extensive research to getting goons out of the dark can be few of the jobs to mention.
This field makes you challenge yourself every day and make sure that your talent is put to use.
Journalism as a profession is a highly respected job, they are viewed as the most credible people.
cons: There is always a risk to life when covering events of riots or war.
Journalist have long and hectic working hours which can affect one's social life.

law-as-a-career-in-india.title: Law
law-as-a-career-in-india.summary: A law degree is aimed to inculcate serious advocacy skills, empowering one to argue in favor of any cause. Lawyers advice clients and provide solutions to legal issues at both, private and public level.They interpret laws, rules and regulations and prepare legal documents. They argue and debate at the courts and take decisions on legal matters.People in the field of law work in various corporate houses, law agencies, law firms, litigation, administrative services amongst others.Options in the field of law include civil law, corporate law, patent law, corporate management, legal services and administrative services.

career-opportunities.law_firms: Leading law firms are the most sought after destination for Law Graduates. As part of a law firm, one advises clients about their legal rights and recourses as well as other legal matters. Careers in the leading law firms are characterized by high pay packages and fast career progression. Graduates can work across multiple domains of law or choose to specialize in specific fast growing domains like IPR, Cyber Law etc.
career-opportunities.corporate_counsel: Law graduates work with a company/corporate entity as an in-house legal counsel, advising on legal matters related to its business. An in-house counsel plays an important role in drafting, vetting and negotiating contracts; ensuring and monitoring compliance with rules and laws; and handling legal disputes.
career-opportunities.litigation: Litigation provides a wide range of employment options in both private and public spheres. Here, focus is on appellate work, trial-level practice, civil litigation or criminal cases. Litigators may start with lower entry level salaries than their counterparts in the corporate sector, but can grow at a much faster pace.
career-opportunities.judicial_servicescivil_services: Law Graduates who are looking to be part of the prestigious civil services, can prepare for the Civil Services Examination conducted by the Union Public Service Commission. Exciting opportunities exists for graduates who wish to contribute towards shaping the future of the country.
career-opportunities.social_work: If social-legal issues excite you, a promising career in Law exists with NGOs and Civil Society Organizations. Law school graduates may get opportunities to work with international organizations such as the United Nations and with international tribunals like International Court of Justice, International Criminal Court etc.
career-opportunities.legal_processing_outsourcing: Legal Processing outsourcing (LPO) is the delegation of core legal functions like making first drafts of cases, compliance work, legal research, etc. to an external counsel. The assigned task is completed on the basis of set parameters and fixed timelines. In this field one can work at a reputed MNCs by pursuing a career in LPO.
career-opportunities.judicial_clerkship: A judicial clerkship is an extremely valuable experience for students interested in either litigation or transactional work; it provides invaluable insights into the workings of the legal system. Law clerks act as legal assistants whose duties vary from court to court and judge to judge.
career-opportunities.media_and_law: As professionals, both journalism and law are intertwined as they require superior research and writing skills as well as a critical knowledge of the government and the legal system. Legal journalism covers legal proceedings in courts, arbitration events, criminal matters, etc., which are disseminated to the public. It includes legal publishing and law reporting.

B.Sc. LLB, BBA.LLB. and B.Com. LLB. are available as courses only in selected colleges. No mandatory subject in Class XII. Entry to top level colleges requires a high score in entrance tests like CLAT/AILET amongst others.

work description: Meet and consult clients to understand and manage their legal transactions
Draft official papers, letters and agreements personalized to the client's specific requirements

Gather evidence to formulate defense strategy, by means of interviewing clients and witnesses to ascertain the facts
Interpret laws, rulings and regulations for individuals and businesses
Analyze probable scenarios in cases, using knowledge of legal theory and precedents
Negotiate and bargain with clients and other related network partners to achieve the given objective
Manage and supervise the execution and drafting of contracts
Correspond with clients and conflicting advocates
Represent clients in Court during disputes

pros: It is a high paying job once you are thorough with the subject.
Provides opportunities to help people.
Lawyers are always in demand.
cons: Need to learn a lot of information.
Hard decisions to be made during most trials, hence it can be stressful.
Ethical and moral issues.

leather-design-as-a-career-in-india.title: Leather Design
leather-design-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Leather Designing is one of the most rapidly growing fields within the umbrella field of Fashion Designing in India. Leather goods manufactured in India, such as bags, shoes and belts are in high demand in India as well as in the international market. These are, hence, extensively exported. Designing products using leather is a challenging task, and hence an individual aiming to make this their career must take care of their health and also be high on stamina, as their job requires a lot of physical work.

career-opportunities.apparel_manufacturers: Leather designers work in apparel manufacturing industry to amalgamate accessories like leather belts, shoes and bags that best suit the garment and complete the look.
career-opportunities.apparel_wholesalers: Leather designers tie up with wholesalers to mass produce/ mass retail their products. They design a variety of accessories that pair up with garments to complete the look.
career-opportunities.television_and_film_industry: Celebrated leather designers work in the film and television industry to design and create custom pieces for actors and actresses playing various roles. They study the plot of the film and understand the characters.
career-opportunities.leather_accessory_designing: Accessory designers specializing in leather accessories make use of leather to design and then create designs that complement garments. This is a relatively new take in accessory designing and often encompass belts and bands.
career-opportunities.chemical_industry: Leather designers work in the chemical industry in research and development to understand and innovate leather products.
career-opportunities.engineering_industry: Leather designers work in engineering sector to design components that find use in engineering and manufacturing context.
career-opportunities.freelance_leather_designing: Freelancers in leather designing either create their own brand of accessories or take up projects independently with other designers to design and create pieces that complement the apparel to be worn with it.

path 1.stream: Pass Class XII in Science Stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. Fashion Designing/ B. Des. Leather Design/ B. Tech in Leather Technology for 3- 4 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M. Des. (Master of Design)/ M. Tech in Leather Technology for 2 years

path 2.stream: Pass Class XII in Science Stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue Diploma in Leather Designing/ Diploma in Leather Goods and Accessories Design for 1 year
path 2.after graduation: Pursue PG Diploma in Leather Goods & Accessories Design

path 3.stream: Pass Class XII in Science Stream
path 3.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. Fashion Designing/ B. Des. Leather Design/ B. Tech in Leather Technology for 3- 4 years
path 3.after graduation: Study Abroad and Pursue Footwear Pattern Making and Prototyping Course/ Footwear Collection Design and Development Course/ Masters in Fashion Design/ PG Diploma in footwear science for 1- 2 years

work description: Designing leather products or cloth either on paper or computer
Manufacturing of the final product as designed through various steps like cutting, colouring, stitching, polishing, etc
Collecting and examining leather samples
Managing and coordinating with the production of designs/ products
Staying abreast of the latest trends or fashion, product and techniques
Meeting and consulting clients and dealers to discuss orders
Working within the budget defined by client/ organization
Supervise workers and staff in the team

pros: Being a designer is a creative process. You will get immense satisfaction once your product is complete and used by others.
The field will give you opportunities to meet different people.
You can take help of the designing software and reduce your work load.
cons: If you are new in the market, they have to set their cost at a lower level.
You may be required to work for longer hours to meet the deadlines.
You are required to read the requirement of the market and individuals and design accordingly.

legislative-assistant-as-a-career-in-ind.title: Legislative Assistant
legislative-assistant-as-a-career-in-ind.summary: Legislative assistants closely work with representatives involved in the formulation and execution of schemes and policy. They are responsible for all the backend work from indulging in pre-existing projects to researching and coming up with new ones. Ground work, legal drafting, scheduling, and assisting stakeholders are also looked after. Projects can also be narrowed down as per expertise and professionals can work in the development of areas such as education, tax reforms, etc. A career in this field allows to gather insight related to the functioning of an elective member and also gain adequate experience to pursue a career in politics.

career-opportunities.legislative_assistant: Works closely with a memeber of parliament and does the backend research in law-making and developing schemes while also assisting
career-opportunities.policy_making: Gaining experience as a legislative assistant helps lay foundation and aids a career in policy making
career-opportunities.politician: Gaining experience as a legislative assistant allows to closely observe how legislatives work and aids in developing a political career

path 1.stream: Any stream
path 1.graduation: Bachelor's in Political Science/Sociology/Public Administration/Business,etc
path 1.after graduation: MA Political Science (+LAMP Fellowship)

path 2.stream: Any stream
path 2.graduation: Bachelor's in any subject

cons: -is laborious in nature.-no fix hours of working.-requires multitasking between numerous projects at once.-may require frequent travelling

lobbyist-as-a-career-in-india.title: Lobbyist
lobbyist-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Lobbying involves influencing or advocating for certain government decisions and policies based on the needs and requirement of the clients. These clients can be different organisations, individuals, charities, foundations and local governments. Lobbying can happen in different areas including political decisions, local community movements and corporate mergers etc. Lobbyists research and monitor legislative and executive decisions and propose amendments to existing polices and law, new legislative policies and ideas based on behalf of the interest groups or clients. Some of the important skills needed for this job are communication, interpersonal and persuasion skills as it requires one to convince politicians/government officials to vote in favor of or against a legislation or law.

career-opportunities.political_lobbyist: Political Lobbyist work to influence political decisions, legislations and laws in the interest of their clients.
career-opportunities.government_affairs_specialist: Government Affairs Specialists are lobbyist who work with government officers, politicians, elected leaders and lobbying community to aid legislative effort at local, state and national level.
career-opportunities.healthcare_lobbyist: Healthcare Lobbyists work with pharmaceutical companies, insurance agencies, healthcare providers, non-profit organizations to make significant adjustments to the healthcare system of a country.
career-opportunities.political_consultant: Political consultants provide PR strategies and marketing ideas for political campaigns. They communicate and advertise the agendas and goals of a political party.
career-opportunities.environmental_lobby: Environment Lobbyists work with different environmental groups or cause to persuade the government officials and create awareness among the public to vote for meaningful environmental policies.

cons: It involves long work hours. It is often misinterpreted as a corrupt profession. It involves a lot of social networking which can be exhausting.

luxury-brand-management-as-a-career-in-i.title: Luxury Brand Management
luxury-brand-management-as-a-career-in-i.summary: The fashion industry is growing at a fast rate and hence there is a huge demand for the luxury products. People in this field are passionate about the fashion industry and keep themselves updated with the latest fashion trends. It is a specialized area of management where you work with big brands. During the program, you will learn about competitive strategy, managing multi-brands, anthropology of luxury consumption, branding experience, understanding markets and consumers, pricing for brand building, etc.

career-opportunities.luxury_brand_manager: They coordinate with different departments of the brand, and ensure smooth functioning. They also research for the products and supervise marketing, production and manufacturing units.
career-opportunities.fashion_good_product_manager: Their work is to plan product and its execution through various stages whether they are working with footwear, fashion accessories, clothing, etc.
career-opportunities.fashion_retail_manager: Their work is to ensure that the right kind of product is displayed in the show room according to the latest trends, and what quantity of various products would be kept in the showroom.
career-opportunities.fashion_pr_specialist: They work closely with models, actors, singers, etc. and attend fashion shows, red carpets, etc. Their main role is to maintain a good image of their brand.
career-opportunities.marketing: They plan various strategies to attract the high-end clients. They also make budgets for various programs and coordinate with various promotional agencies.
career-opportunities.visual_merchandising_manager: They create design themes and plans for the showroom including window and in-store displays, and the pricing concepts. They also use AutoCAD, Mockshop or Adobe Creative Suite, etc. to create their plan.

path 1.stream: Pass Class XII in Any Stream (Preferably Commerce)
path 1.graduation: Pursue BBA/BMS for 3 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue Masters in Luxury Brand Management

path 2.stream: Pass Class XII in Any Stream (Preferably Commerce)
path 2.graduation: Pursue Graduation in any stream

path 3.graduation: Pursue graduation in any stream

This can be achieved via internships or upon getting a job.It is not compulsory to take commerce in your class xii, but as it is a management field it is highly recommended. You would require Mathematics if you wish to pursue BMS from Delhi University at undergraduate level.

cons: They have to work for long hours.

management-as-a-career-in-india.title: Management
management-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Management is one the most varied profession in the global economy with numerous opportunities ranging from consulting, entrepreneurship, human resource, general management, operation management to strategic planning. A person involved in the field looks in forecasting, planning, organizing, commanding, coordinating and controlling the processes of the organization for the effective internal as well as external functioning by managing people as well as resources.

career-opportunities.sales: Sales could be defined as "the holistic business system required to effectively develop, manage, enable, and execute a mutually beneficial, interpersonal exchange of goods, and/or services for equitable value". The main role involved in this profession is showcasing products and services, negotiating sales and providing after sale services through face to face interaction or telephonic communication.
career-opportunities.marketing: Marketing as a career is the best field for people who like to strategize and identify patterns and trends. The various marketing job profiles include - project managers, marketing managers, market analysts, sales managers, etc. Identifying the target market for products or services, developing products, formulating pricing and sales strategies for business growth to increase profitability and to maintain public relations are some of the key roles in this domain.
career-opportunities.supply_chain_management: Supply Chain Management as a career includes planning, procuring, handling, managing and enabling supply of goods and services. Supply chain managers are the purchasers and transportation planners. Careers in SCM are extremely diverse and the sector is continuously shifting, evolving and moving with changing technology & needs of people.
career-opportunities.finance: Finance as an arena is concerned with the management and circulation of money. Role in finance varies from helping corporates and individuals make finance planning decisions to helping businesses raise capital for expansion and running business operations.
career-opportunities.operation_management: Operations management is an intermix of business, finance and technology which is chiefly concerned with planning, organizing and supervising in production, manufacturing or the provision of services. This field is concerned with the physical or technical functions of a firm.
career-opportunities.human_resources: Human resource management is all about management of employees within the organization and maximizing their performance. It involves designing the policies for the effective functioning of organization, managing compensation and benefits, training of employees, maintaining proper labor relations and evaluating employee performance.
career-opportunities.health_care_management: Owing to the rapid growth in the health care sector, health care management is emerging to be one of the most rewarding career paths. A degree in management arms one to play a significant role in hospital management involving activities like ensuring hospitals operations, Efficient supervision in making them financially sound and independent and in creating a patient-centric organization.
career-opportunities.management_consulting: Management consulting is to assist a client to obtain information and advice leading to a realistic and lasting solution of a problem. Consultants think, analyze, brainstorm, cajole and challenge good organizations to become even better by adopting innovative ideas.
career-opportunities.entrepreneurship: A Management degree empowers an individual to embark on an entrepreneurial route. An entrepreneur looks to solve problems through innovative solutions and products. Given the present economic scenario in the country, entrepreneurship is an extremely challenging path. It is emerging as an extremely sought after career path.

You can create a niche for yourself in any one area
cons: Work life balance is difficult to achieve

marine-biology-as-a-career-in-india.title: Marine Biology
marine-biology-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Marine biology is the study of all marine organisms, right from planktons and microbes, to plants and animals. Marine biologists investigate the behaviors and interactions of marine life with their surroundings. With the increase in environmental degradation, Marine Biologists try to understand how these challenges are affecting marine organisms, and come up with solutions to control and treat them. Methods and techniques employed in this field include trawlers, sonars, and satellites.

career-opportunities.fisheries_biologist: In general, this field includes the study of how the environment and other external forces affect fish life cycle. Its major application is to remedy problems associated with fish habitats. This option is becoming increasingly popular with the increase in the market demands of the fisheries industry.
career-opportunities.aqua_culturist: Aquaculture is concerned with the farming of fishes and seaweeds. Another thriving area for marine biologists, aquaculture is gaining importance worldwide as consumer demands for fish are increasingly becoming greater than can be met by traditional commercial fishing.
career-opportunities.natural_resource_manager: A natural resource manager is involved in the handling and general management of plants, lakes, soil, forests, and other natural resources. Jobs for natural resource managers are available in both government and private settings.
career-opportunities.environmental_consultant: Marine biologists can be employed as environmental consultants and advisors to help design measures, laws, and regulations to protect the environment.
career-opportunities.researcher: In addition to classic marine experiments, marine researchers also test and come up with ways to administer drugs to diseased fish populations. There are various diseases that can wipe out entire crops of farm-raised fish, and researchers help to prevent that outcome.
career-opportunities.teaching: Teachers and educators are actively employed at both the secondary school level as well as at the college level, as a teacher or lecturer. There also various opportunities for training workshops and educational programs.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. (Hons) in Aquaculture or B.Sc. (Hons) in Biological Sciences or B.Sc. (Hons) in Life Sciences for 3 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M.Sc. in Marine Biology or M.Sc. in Oceanography for 2 years

marine-biology-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: Some colleges/University have admissions in B.Sc. (Hons) in Aquaculture/Biological Sciences/Life Sciences following their own entrance test or considers marks obtained in the qualifying examination.

6.name: Cochin University of Science and Technology

work description: Conducting research to study the various forms of life that exist within the sea
Identifying and classifying the forms of organisms in oceans.
Conducting experiments to study the elements that effect the environment
Examining and interpreting the discoveries and preparing reports
Keeping up to date with the latest technologies and studies in the field and related professions
Preparing reports on the findings and presenting them to other scientists.

pros: Professionals get the opportunities to work on, and lead advanced research projects.
The field is rapidly growing, and there are a number of research opportunities, both in India and overseas.
The work can be adventurous, if the professional is involved with field research.
cons: The educational path for the career is long, as a Ph.D is generally preferred.
It can be hard to get into the career, as it requires extensive knowledge, skill and traning.
The work might require one to work in marine bodies, and even be underwater.

market-research-as-a-career-in-india.title: Market Research
market-research-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Market Research involves collection of data in a systematic and objective manner through primary research or secondary research, in order to analyse the target market, competition or environment. It can be carried in two ways: Quantitave research, which is gathered through survey and questionnaires. Here the researcher focuses on coming up with numbers, example- what percentage of the population buys a particular product. Qualitative research, gets behind the facts and figure to find how people feel about a particular product. Researchers take interview, use questionnaires and interpret the result.

career-opportunities.product_research: Product research is done to gather information about the individual product. It studies the product from its initital stage to marketing of the product. It studies the size, shape, colour, quality, packaging, brand name and price of the product. It also looks into the product modification, product innovation, product life cycle, etc. As per the need and want of the consumer, the product is modified (changed) as per the needs and wants of the consumers.
career-opportunities.consumer_research: Consumer research is done to understand consumer behaviour. It studies the consumer needs, their buying motives, atitutde, age, sex, income, demographic location, etc. This data is used to take decisions about the product, its price, place and promotion.
career-opportunities.packaging_research: Packaging research is important part of product research, which is done to attract attention of the target audience towards their product. It looks into the the quality of the product, makes packaging interesting, reduces cost of the packaging by selecting suitable packaging material, etc.
career-opportunities.pricing_research: Pricing Research studies the pricing of the product. It fixes the price for the product by comparing the companies price with the competitor's price. It also fixes the discount and commission and predicts the future price trends by studying the market price trends.
career-opportunities.advertising_research: As the shelf life of advertisement is low, so the main objective of the advertising research is to decide on the advertising message, layout, copy, slogan, headline, etc. which is catchy and sets them apart from their competetiors and make the advertisement memorable for the audience. Apart from this it also sets the advertising budget and selects a suitable media for advertising. It also evaluates the effectiveness of advertising and other sales promotion techniques.
career-opportunities.sales_research: Sales research studies the selling activities of the company. It studies the sales outlets, sales territories, sales forecasting, sales trends, sales methods, effectiveness of the sales force, etc.
career-opportunities.distribution_research: Distribution research studies the channels of distribution. It selects a suitable channel for the product. It fixes the channel objectives. It identifies the channel functions like storage, grading, etc. It evaluates the competitor's channel.
career-opportunities.policy_research: It studies the company's policies and evaluates the effectiveness of the marketing policies, distribution policies, sales policies, pricing policies, inventory policies, etc. and thus makes the necessary changes in it, if required.
career-opportunities.international_marketing_research: Data of international market is collected to help their product entre and sustain in the international market. It collects data about the consumers behaviour, their economy, political sitiation, etc. as well as the data about the foreign competitors which is useful for the exporters.
career-opportunities.motivation_research: Motivation research studies consumers' buying motives. It studies those factors that motivate consumers to buy a product. It mainly finds out, Why the consumers buy the product? It also finds out the causes of consumer behaviour in the market.
career-opportunities.market_research: In order to increase the sale, market research is conducted which studies the market competition, market trends, buying habbits, etc. It fixes the sales territories and sales quotas as well as estimates the demand for new products and does the sales forecast.
career-opportunities.media_research: Media research studies various advertising media. The different advertising media are television (TV), radio, newspapers, magazines, the internet, etc. Media research studies the merits and demerits of each media. It selects a suitable medium for advertising. It does media planning. It also studies, media cost. It helps in sales promotion and to avoid wastage in advertising.

path 1.graduation: Pursue B.Sc Marketing (Hons) or BBA (Marketing Specialization), BA Economics, Statistics, B.com, BBA, (Marketing Specialization) (Preffered)

marketing-as-a-career-in-india.title: Marketing
marketing-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Given Indias—is booming corporate growth, a career in marketing is lucrative. This career is best fit for individuals who like to strategize and identify patterns and trends. The various marketing job profiles include - project managers, marketing managers, market analysts,digital marketing experts, etc. Identifying the need and potential markets for products or services, developing products, formulating a pricing and sales strategies for business growth to increase profitability and maintaining public relations are some of the key roles marketing professionals take up. Though most marketing jobs are specialized, a core skill would be the ability to match the perception with achievable action plans. Best for creative people, self-starters and people who can juggle multiple tasks.

career-opportunities.digital_marketing: The hectic life schedule that people follow these days has led to the growth of e- commerce. There is a huge demand for digital marketing which involves the promotion of products or brand via electronic media like internet, mobile apps, mobile messaging, etc. The marketers work involves monitoring things such as what is to be viewed, the content, the visual graphics, and for what time duration.
career-opportunities.marketing_research: This is the most important stage before any product is launched in the market. It is essential for any company to understand the market. Market research enables the company to understand their consumers, their needs, their purchasing habits and how they view the product.
career-opportunities.advertising: When a company plans to launch their product in the market, advertising becomes an essential part of brand promotion. It is paid announcement which is done so as to gain customer?-?s attention. Various forms of media is used for promotion of product such as Electronic media (Radio/TV), Print media (Newspaper/Magazine), direct mail, etc. Advertising is done to create brand reinforcement and brand identity.
career-opportunities.marketing_strategist: In order to achieve the maximum profit and sustain the business, marketing strategy is used at various levels of product. This involves both short term as well as long term strategies based on the market research and taking company?-?s goal and objectives into account.
career-opportunities.brand_management: Brand management is crucial for an organization in order to create a reputation of their brand in the marketplace. It consists of various important factors such as brand positioning, cost, customer satisfaction and being aware of the competitors. A good brand management not only increase the sale of the product being advertised, but other products which are associated with the brand.
career-opportunities.integrated_market_communication: Integrated marketing communication (IMC), as the name says, it integrated various forms of marketing methods in order to maximize the communication impact on the target consumer, thus increasing the sale of the product.
career-opportunities.public_relations_corporate_communication: Public relations department act as a bridge between the customers and the organization. They are the spokesperson for the company and are involved in creating a favorable brand image. They work with press releases to promote new products or to keep the investment community informed of business partnerships, financial results, or other company news.
career-opportunities.direct_marketing: Direct marketing or Database marketing is used to reach customers directly using their phone numbers, email ids, purchase histories, etc. and communicate about new product or services.

Formulate, direct, or coordinate marketing activities or policies to promote products or services

Negotiate contracts with vendors or distributors to manage product distribution

pros: Develop a niche in the area that aligns with your passion
Is good for people who like to travelling and persuading people.
This field is best suited for people who are naturally creative and quick to solve problems.
cons: They have multiple responsibilities, and work life balance may be affected.
If you are not from a top college, the initial salary is not that high.

mass-communication-as-a-career-in-india.title: Mass Communication
mass-communication-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Mass communication involves transmission of information to large numbers of people through the use of mass media. With an increase in the number of television sets, news channels, radio stations, advertising, this field seems to be transcending into an unmatched growth and opens up the door towards a dynamic career. A degree in mass communication opens up opportunities in Journalism, Public relations and advertising, as a career. Mass communication course encompasses various streams.

career-opportunities.journalism: This field encompasses work at print and online publication. As a journalist, one can work in media outlets such as newspapers, magazines, blogs etc. as reporters, columnist, editors, etc.
career-opportunities.public_relations: They are the people who represent their organization in front of the public. They can work within an organization or work as a freelancer, representing various firms/ clients. Their task is to bring the organization's accomplishment before the public through newspapers and television.
career-opportunities.advertising: Careers in advertising includes working on both the creative side as well as the business side. Professionals on the creative side focus on the development and production of advertising campaigns for print, online and broadcast distribution. On the business side, career opportunities exist with agencies and media outlets.
career-opportunities.media_planner: The advertising firm prepares the advertisement but the task of putting it in the different kind of Media (print, radio, television) is handled by Media Planner. Media planner has to understand the target audience the advertiser is trying to reach. Media Planner books advertising space with the media owners and also decides the timings of advertisements.
career-opportunities.broadcasting_and_production: A Mass Communication Graduate can also get into production line. Film making/TV Producer/Editor/Camera Person/Screen writer/Art Director are jobs which are also performed by students of Mass Communication. Offbeat careers like Radio Jockey & Video Jockey are also open to Mass Communication degree holders.
career-opportunities.event_manager: Event Management firms are growing day by day. A Mass Communication Graduate can work for an Event Management Company as an Event Manager or set up his own firm handling events. It's a high paying Industry and is growing day by day.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in Any stream Pursue Bachelors in Journalism/Mass Communication /BA Hons.(English/Mass Communication) for 3 years Pursue Masters in Mass communication/Journalism for 1- 2 years
path 1.graduation: Pursue Bachelors in Journalism/Mass Communication /BA Hons.(English/Mass Communication) for 3 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue Masters in Mass communication/Journalism for 1- 2 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII in Any stream
path 2.graduation: Graduation in Any Stream
path 2.after graduation: Pursue Diploma/ Masters in Mass communication/Journalism for 1- 2 years

mass-communication-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: Journalism and Mass Communication are two different degrees.Journalism is a part of Mass Communication but Mass Communication isn't a part of Journalism. While deciding the course do keep this thing in mind. Mass communication involves disseminating information to the masses whereas Journalism has an intent to persuade people. Most colleges have eligibility criteria of minimum 50% aggregate marks in Class XII (few colleges have 40% minimum aggregate criteria) Some colleges/ universities also have an age limit.

work description: Take up the role of journalists, writers, editors, public relations among others
Provide information of current happenings in the society
Spread awareness about various issues among the general public
Entertain people through films, music, books, television, etc.
Present oneself with fluency in speaking, confidence and in a creative manner
Remain up to-date with trending events and happenings
One should be able to observe and evaluate things critically

pros: Opportunity to work under/ with creative, well-educated people who inspire you ti do well.
Scope of mass media as a field is increasing and there is never a dearth of job opportunity.
One gets the taste of recognition, fame & money
The person gets to travel while working
cons: Involves hectic schedule and uncertain work timing
The field may affect Personal life

maths-as-a-career-in-india.title: Mathematics
maths-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Mathematics is a field of study concerned with topics such as numbers, space, time, equations, fractions, geometrical shapes, and their relationships. Mathematicians utilize their extensive knowledge of mathematics to observe the relationships between mathematical principles and create mathematical models, to solve real world problems.

career-opportunities.private_sector: Mathematics professionals can be employed by MNCs and private organizations to apply their mathematical knowledge in several roles. They can work in data analysis, project development, reserch operations, numerical analysis and commercial surveys for share markets, etc. Banking, insurance, and finance sectors are some of the leading recruiters.
career-opportunities.public_sector: Mathematicians are also hired in government organizations and PSUs for roles such as research operations, commercial surveys and numerical analysis.
career-opportunities.education: A prime avenue for mathematics graduates is the education sector. They can work as full-time or guest lecturers at universities and colleges. They may also teach in schools to higher secondary class students.
career-opportunities.defence: Mathematicians are also actively employed in defence research organizations, such as the Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO), as well as other military and para-military organizations, to help in the development of a wide range of weapons, missiles, nuclear stations,etc
career-opportunities.research: A large number of mathematicians end up in research roles. The indispensability of mathematics demands the employment of mathematicians in various research organizations to solve complex problems. They are even engaged by aeronautical research agencies such as Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) and National Aeronautic Limited (NAL).

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in Science stream with Maths
path 1.graduation: Pursue B. A./B. Sc in Mathematics for 3 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M. A./ M. Sc/MS in Mathematics for 2 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII in Science stream with Maths
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.E. / B.Tech. in Mathematics/ B.Math for 4 years
path 2.after graduation: Pursue M. A./ M. Sc in Mathematics for 2 years

path 3.stream: Clear Class XII in Science stream with Maths
path 3.graduation: Pursue Integrated Program in M.Sc. Mathematics for 5 years

work description: Using professional mathematical software in order to create programmes to carry out mathematical tasks
Staying abreast of the new mathematical advancement and developing innovative mathematical study
Creating innovative principles and mathematical principles to improve mathematical study
Creating customized solutions to business matters using advanced and subsist techniques as well as recommending innovative ways to evaluate data.
Sharing the results of new research through writing reports on the work progress
Learning and using new methods to find answers
Finding more refined perceptions into existing data
Requesting applications for financing
Presenting outcome to senior members at seminars/conferences
Get together with clients during the projects to share ideas and outcomes

pros: Professionals get the opportunities to work on, and lead advanced research projects.
The field is rapidly growing, and there are a number of research opportunities, both in India and overseas.
Professionals can find emploment in several other fields, such as finance, market research, software development, etc.
The field has high earning and growth potential.
cons: The educational path for the career is long, and a Ph.D is generally preferred for research roles.
It involves spending most of the time indoors, with numbers.
It can be hard to get into the career, as it requires extensive knowledge, skill and traning.
The field is highly competitive and difficult to get into.

mechatronics.title: Mechatronics
mechatronics.summary: Mechatronics, also known as mechatronics engineering, is an interdisciplinary engineering discipline that focuses on the integration of mechanical, electronic, and electrical engineering systems, as well as robotics, electronics, computer science, telecommunications, systems, control, and product engineering. As technology advances, numerous engineering subfields have been successful in adapting and expanding. The intention of mechatronics is to produce a design solution that unifies each of these various subfields. A mechatronics specialist is a problem solver who can work well in a group setting. The ability to think creatively is the first stage; communicating good ideas to coworkers requires sensitivity. For modelling, simulating, and evaluating complicated mechanical, electrical, or other engineering systems, many mechatronic engineers employ computer-aided design (CAD) and other engineering tools.

career-opportunities.telecommunications_and_information_servi: High-voltage engineer, field or cable technician, networking technician, and more positions are available. Installing, maintaining, and repairing mobile phones, computer networks, videoconferencing equipment, fiber-optic cables, electrical systems, and other items are all possible job tasks.
career-opportunities.robotics: To get practical experience that will prepare you for a rewarding future in robotics in the medical and healthcare fields, the military, or advanced manufacturing. You'll work in these positions to develop robotic solutions that boost production quality, quantity, and productivity.
career-opportunities.automation_engineer: To develop automated machinery processes like design, programming, simulation and testing to execute highly precise tasks. You can work in car manufacturing to food processing industries dealing with material handling, pneumatic systems, industrial robots and PLC automation.
career-opportunities.computer_science: Comprises scientific and engineering aspects of computing.
career-opportunities.academics_and_research: Engineers in this field can go for teaching and research positions related to mechatronics and its domain.
career-opportunities.nanotechnology: Assisting in the significant improvement, if not revolutionization, of a variety of technology and economic areas, including information technology, homeland security, medicine, transportation, and energy.
career-opportunities.career_in_renewable_energy: Solar power, wind energy, biofuel, hydropower, and geothermal technologies all have high-impact occupations. Renewable energy is a burgeoning industry, and mechatronics graduates will have plenty of opportunity to put their multi-disciplinary technical abilities to work on interesting new products, as well as test and enhance existing ones.
career-opportunities.transportation_and_logistics: Working with custom-built machines, sophisticated computing infrastructures, complex transportation processes and equipment, and more are all part of the job. In short, you'll use your extensive mechatronics knowledge to keep huge enterprises functioning smoothly and provide excellent customer service.

path 1.stream: Class XII with science stream with maths
path 1.graduation: Pursue B. Tech in Mechatronics engineering for 4 years

path 2.stream: Class XII with science stream with maths
path 2.graduation: Pursue B. Tech in Mechatronics engineering for 4 years
path 2.after graduation: Masters in mechatronics or specialisation in its sub fields

path 3.stream: Class XII with science stream with maths
path 3.graduation: Pursue B. Tech in Mechanical / Electrical / Electronics & communication / or related branches engineering for 4 years
path 3.after graduation: Masters in mechatronics or specialisation in its sub fields

mechatronics.Important Facts: Most colleges have eligibility criteria of minimum 50% aggregate marks in Class XII / and some of minimum 60%Must have passed class 12thor senior secondary examination with at least 50% marks including English. Some exams require JEE score as minimum eligibility. Some colleges/ universities also have an age limit. Must have studied Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics are the subjects in 12th.

work description: Works in almost all aspects of the development of products, from design and testing right through to manufacture.
Developing solutions to industrial problems.
Establishing automation to factory production lines to improve existing process.
Application of control systems which are normally computer oriented.
Carry out studies into the feasibility, cost implications, and performance benefits of new mechatronic equipment.

pros: The field in itself has variety of scope from nanotechnology to robotic to computer science.
It is still a new concept in engineering and stands out for having multidisciplinary aspects.
This is a great advantage for Indian students who want to work in a foreign country developed countries are investing heavily in fields like robotics, nanotechnology, and biomechatronic.
cons: Never-ending process of learning/certifications as the engineer needs to be updated on newer process.
Monetary Packages are expected to grow with substantial experience.
Stress from management and budgetary control responsibilities is a possibility.

medical-laboratory-technologist-as-a-car.title: Medical Laboratory Technologist
medical-laboratory-technologist-as-a-car.summary: Medical laboratory scientist are healthcare professionals who perform chemical, hematological, immunologic, histopathological, cytopathological, microscopic, and bacteriological diagnostic analyses. The analysis is conducted on body fluids such as blood, urine, sputum, stool etc. Medical laboratory scientists work in clinical laboratories at hospitals, physician's offices, reference labs, biotechnology labs and non-clinical industrial labs.

career-opportunities.blood_bank_technologists_or_immunohemato: They collect blood, classify it by type, and prepare blood and its components for transfusions.
career-opportunities.clinical_chemistry_technologists: They prepare specimens and analyze the chemical and hormonal contents of body fluids.
career-opportunities.cytotechnologists: They prepare slides of body cells and examine these cells with a microscope for abnormalities that may signal the beginning of a cancerous growth.
career-opportunities.immunology_technologists: They examine elements of the human immune system and its response to foreign bodies.
career-opportunities.microbiology_technologists: They examine and identify bacteria and other microorganisms.
career-opportunities.molecular_biology_technologists: They perform complex protein and nucleic acid tests on cell samples.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Biology
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. in Medical Lab Technology for 3 Years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M.Sc. in Medical Lab Technology for 2 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Biology
path 2.graduation: Pursue Bachelor of Medical Laboratory Technology (BMLT) in Medical Lab Technology for 3 years
path 2.after graduation: Pursue (MMLT) Masters in Medical Lab Technology for 2 years

path 3.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Biology
path 3.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. in Medical Lab Technology for 3 years
path 3.after graduation: Pursue Post Graduate Diploma in Medical Lab Technology for 1-2 years

medical-laboratory-technologist-as-a-car.Important Facts: Most college have eligibility criteria of minimum 50% aggregate marks in Class XII / and some of minimum 60%.Must have passed class 12th or senior secondary examination with at least 50% marks including English. Some colleges/ universities also have an age limit (17 at 31st December of the year of admission).

work description: Assist the doctor by testing body fluids of the patients
Evaluate samples of blood, urine, tissue culture, etc., for infections
Operate different equipments and machines to obtain accurate data
Calibrate and analyse reports of the patients
Discuss the results drawn with the doctor to help the patient with right treatment
Handle the large amount of diverse samples with precision and care
Explain the procedure of testing to the staff members
Supervise the maintenance of the laboratory with proper sanitation
Perform duties in line with the ethical standards

pros: Job opportunity: Job opportunities are stable and on the rise. With higher education and knowledge, you will get the opportunity to get into supervisory roles or more advanced medical lab positions.

Make a Difference: You can make a difference in people's lives. The work that a lab technician does, leads to someone's life being saved. You know that your job is important, and it gives a sense of satisfaction.
cons: Hectic work: The work can be difficult and hectic. The majority of your day will be spent on your feet walking around in the lab. You might not get time to relax because your lab is filled with work that needs to be done.
Monotonous Work: You might feel bored with your job, as the nature of the work would be same.

merchant-navy-as-a-career-in-india.title: Merchant Navy
merchant-navy-as-a-career-in-india.summary: This is the most lucrative career for those who love ships and travelling, and don't wish to hold a 9 to 5 desk job. A career in the merchant navy involves trading in commercial items like live stocks, liquid cargo, general cargo, oil tankers, chemical tankers and the like all over the world via sea-routes. As a result of this, it is considered as the backbone of international trade. This also serves as the difference between Merchant Navy and Indian Navy where the latter is engaged in defending the nation with its naval power. Those in the Merchant Navy get the opportunity to explore and get themselves acquainted with different locations, people and their culture. Though the career offers high remunerations, it is a tough job as one has to stay at sea for months at a time. In spite of this, a career in the Merchant Navy is considered to be a highly satisfying one, especially if one is interested in travelling all around the world.

career-opportunities.deck_department: As a deck cadet one is involved in the maintenance of the ship and responsibility of lifesaving appliances like boats and jackets, firefighting appliances and structural integrity of the deck. Other activities include monitoring the cargo, pilotage paperwork, communication, monitoring the entry as well as exit points of the ship for security reasons. The work of navigation also forms an important aspect of a deck cadet's working contract.
career-opportunities.engine_department: As a part of the engine department, one is involved in maintaining the mechanical as well as electrical instruments and machinery of the ship. One would be operating as well as upholding the support system present on the ship above as well as below the deck.Working with engines, navigation and communication equipments, ventilation system, etc. constitute some areas of work as an engineer in the Merchant Navy.
career-opportunities.architecture_department: The professionals in the architecture department hold the responsibility of designing, constructing as well as repairing ships and other marine vessels and offshore structures. They usually work in collaboration with a team of engineers and integrate their activities for the successful accomplishment of ship construction. They are the ones who ensure that a safe, economic as well as seaworthy design is created.
career-opportunities.catering_department: This department is the one responsible for preparing and serving the meals to the passengers as well as the crew. They are also the ones involved in housekeeping. These include chief cook, trainee cooks, and stewards. They are in charge of the food stores and keeping the ship clean and uncontaminated. The strength of this department varies according to the size of the ship and number of passengers.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in Science Stream (with Physics, Chemistry, Mathematics)
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.Sc in Nautical Science/ Marine Catering
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M.Sc in Nautical Science/ Marine Catering

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII in Science Stream (with Physics, Chemistry, Mathematics)
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.Tech in Marine Engineering
path 2.after graduation: Pursue M.Tech(Marine Engineering) or M.B.A (Shipping and Logistics)

merchant-navy-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: Physics, Chemistry, Mathematics with 60% aggregate.50% in English are mandatory. There are medical standards to be met as well.

work description: Sailing the ship with the help of variety of satellites and radar networks and apparatus
Scanning weather and sailing information
Synchronizing the secure lading, depot and dispatching of freight
Surveying the ship to ensoure that the health and security measures are in place
Checking and regulating security, firefighting and life-saving apparatus
Watching and sustaining all the electrical apparatus on board to ensure the security and efficacy of the ship.
Dealing with the job of marking and giving training and assisting trainee officers
Staying abreast of advancements in nautical methods, commercial and governmental matters

pros: It is a highly respectable career that is guaranteed to earn you the admiration of other people.
The compensations for this career are sizeable thus it is a lucrative career.
It allows one to travel all across the world and gain a variety of wonderful experiences.
One gets substantial leaves when not on duty (4-6 months every year), so it allows one to compensate for the time spent away from family.
cons: A career in the Merchant Navy requires one to spend long periods of time at sea, and away from the family. Since this kind of work is strenuous for both the body and the mind, it is not meant for everyone.
The conditions at sea are not always favourable so it can be a somewhat dangerous job.

meteorology-as-a-career-in-india.title: Meteorology
meteorology-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Meteorologists are researchers who investigate phenomena such as weather patterns and the climate. They are active in government agencies, commercial consultancy and research services, industrial companies, public utilities, radio, television and education. Not to be confused with weather presenters who mostly report on the media's weather prediction, with just limited meteorological expertise.

career-opportunities.industrial_meteorologist: The industrial meteorologist's primary job is to examine and resolve industrial pollution and emission-related concerns.
career-opportunities.physical_meteorologist: The major responsibility of the physical meteorologist is to study the physical nature of the atmosphere, its chemical composition and optical, acoustical and electrical properties. They also study environmental problems and figure out solutions for the same.
career-opportunities.research_meteorologist: These meteorologists study the patterns of climate and weather. They analyse and interpret the data relating to precipitation, humidity, wind, temperature etc. They also study phenomena such as the greenhouse effect.
career-opportunities.professor_or_lecturer: After qualifying UGC NET, the eligible candidates can up teaching jobs in Meteorology at colleges that offer a course in Meteorology.

path 1.stream: Class 12 with PCM stream and computer science as main subjects
path 1.graduation: Pursue B. Sc. Meteorology / Atmospheric science
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M. Sc. Meteorology / Atmospheric science

path 2.stream: Class 12 with PCM stream and computer science as main subjects
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.Tech in Atmospheric Science
path 2.after graduation: Pursue M.Tech in Meteorology

5.name: National Institute of Technology - NIT Rourkela

8.name: SRM Institute of Science and Technology

11.name: Centre for Atmospheric and Oceanic Sciences, Indian Institute of Science

13.name: Aryabhatta Research Institute of Observational Sciences

15.name: Department of Atmospheric and Space Sciences, Savitribai Phule Pune University

entrance exam.name: JEE Main
entrance exam.elements: Mathematics, Physics, Chemistry. For admission in Btech at IIT's, PEC. Engineering Entrance Exam for B.Tech/B.E.( 3 hrs objective test on PCM of Class XII level). The test has negative marking.

entrance exam.name: JEE Advanced
entrance exam.elements: Computer based exam. It will have 2 compulsory paper. Paper 1- Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry(Type of question-Single correct option, One or more options are correct, Numerical value answer). Paper 2- Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry(Types of question-MCQ, Numerical value answer type question, Single digit integer answer).

pros: -Weather is a conversation starter because it's a universal, neutral topic. a meteorologist can amaze strangers and acquaintances with their extensive knowledge. -Job security with fixed working hours and salary.-They will get opportunity to protect other's lives.
cons: -There will be working pressure in natural disasters.-Meteorologists must make sure that climate and weather conditions are expected or predicted.-It is a very challenging job.

microbiology-as-a-career-in-india.title: Microbiology
microbiology-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Microbiology is the scientific study of microscopic organisms and how they interact with other organisms in their environment, including humans, animals, and plants. A key role of microbiology is to investigate and discover how microorganisms affect our lives. For this, it incorporates knowledge and concepts from various subfields of study in biology such as virology, mycology, parasitology, and bacteriology, etc. Microbiologists work in research and clinical settings in various fields including biomedicine, pharmacology, food production and technology, genetics, forensic science, health care, environmental protection, and other domains.

career-opportunities.hospitalclinical_laboratories: Microbiologists in this field typically investigate and research on microorganisms to identify the disease-causing microbes that result in various diseases affecting, or with the potential to affect, the human body. Their work can assist in the prevention of the spread of various diseases by containing and treating them.
career-opportunities.food_industries: Microbiologists try to ensure that the supply of food and food products is free of pathogenic organisms that may be harmful to the health of those who consume it. Food microbiologists thus provide a way to guarantee the food is safe to distribute to the public.
career-opportunities.sales_and_technical_representative: Microbiologists also work in sales positions or as technical representatives for pharmaceuticals, where they impart information about various pharmaceuticals drugs and other medical products to prospective customers, such as doctors, clinics, etc.
career-opportunities.research_laboratories: A primary field of work for microbiologists is the domain of research. Microbiologists as researcher's study and test various microorganisms in controlled environments. Such scientific discoveries play a great role in the production and distribution of medicines, treatment of illnesses, and management of health care systems.
career-opportunities.teaching: Microbiologists can work as full-time or guest lecturers at universities and colleges. They may also teach in schools to higher secondary class students.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Biology
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. (Hons) Microbiology or B.Sc. (Hons) Molecular Biology or B.Sc. (Hons) Biological Sciences or B. Sc. (Hons) in Life Sciences for 3 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M.Sc. Microbiology or M.Sc. In Life Sciences for 2 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Biology
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. (Hons) Microbiology or B.Sc. (Hons) Molecular Biology or B.Sc. (Hons) Biological Sciences or B.Sc. (Hons) in Life Sciences for 3 years
path 2.after graduation: Pursue PG Diploma Microbiology for 1- 2 years

microbiology-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: Some colleges/university have admissions in B.Sc. (Hons) in Microbiology following their own entrance test or consider the marks in the qualifying exam.
work description: Employing a variety of identification methods such as molecular techniques to test samples
Tracking of microbes in a variety of environments
Developing and planning methods to prevent the spread of diseases
Developing and registering new diagnostic tests, medicines, vaccines, enzymes, vitamins, hormones, antimicrobials and pharmaceutical products
Scheduling, implementing and evaluating new products in clinical trials
Growing microbial cultures for use in the food and drink industry or in agriculture

pros: Professionals in this field have an opportunity to specialize in various disciplines, such as bacteriology, immunology, etc.
Microbiologists can work in a variety of work settings, including agriculture, research, clinics, education, etc.
cons: There are possible risks involved due to the danger of being exposed to harmful microorganisms.
The educational path for a research role is long.
It involves spending most of the time indoors, in the laboratory.

modelling-as-a-career-in-india.title: Modelling
modelling-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Modeling is one of the most glamourous professions in the world. With so many products being launched everyday, it has become indespensible part of companies to promote their products and hence use models to promotion. Fashion models work in various fields, including photographic modeling, television commercials, live or runway modeling, and product modeling. In short, Models pose for artists, photographers, or customers to help advertise a variety of products, including clothing, cosmetics, food, and appliances

career-opportunities.fashion_shows: In the fashion show models walk on a ramp to display clothes in front of an audience.
career-opportunities.photographic_modelling: In photographic, advertising and commercial modelling models work in a studio or various locations. They take direction from a director, photographers in order to pose, act or deliver lines in TV commercials.
career-opportunities.in_house_live_model: In an in-house live modeling, the designer fits garments onto the model during the ongoing workshop and showcase the finished clothing to fashion buyers and private customers.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in any stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue a Bachelors in any discipline

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII in any stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue Diploma / Short Term Courses In Modelling

modelling-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: No formal education is required and training is limitedSpecific requirements depend on the client However, most models must be within certain ranges for height, weight, and clothing size to meet the needs of fashion designers, photographers, and advertisers Dedication Discipline Interpersonal skills Confidence Physical stamina Promotional skills

2.name: Frankfinn Institute of Modelling and Acting

10.name: Northeast Institute of Fashion Technology Guwahati
