work description: Promote different products through advertisements and commercials
Display fashion through designer clothing in fashion shows
Pose for photographers and artists
Put on view accessories such as handbags, jewellery, shoes, clothing, make up, hair styles, etc.
Maintain appearance by remaining fit and in shape
Maintain one's portfolio of the work that has been done so far
Indulge in social networking to meet and build with the clients

pros: You get fame and recognition
Get to travel around the world
There is opportunity to earn a lot of money
cons: You have to impose restrictions on your eating habits
You don't get paid well in the beginning
Work duration is not fixed and can be hectic

molecular_biology.title: Molecular Biology
molecular_biology.summary: Molecular Biology is a multi-disciplinary field which studies and analyses the molecular basis of biological activity. Molecular biologists carry out research and experiments on nucleic acid such as DNA and RNA and proteins, lipids and carbohydrates to understand the complex interaction of these molecules and how they contribute to life processes. Their work is related to DNA sequencing, cloning, RNA functioning, and studying other cellular behavior in humans, plants, animals and other organisms. They attempt to find specific patterns in some biological materials and replicate the findings of their research in other experiments to frame hypotheses or theories. The understanding of molecular function can then be applied to other fields such as pharmaceutical, agriculture, wildlife, medicine, food industry and other industrial fields.

career-opportunities.molecular_biologist: Molecular biologists examine the structure, functions and processes of molecules. They define the biological processes that cause genes to become defective, identify the classifications and types of molecules within a specific genre and also use gene manipulation to their advantage. They are involved in research and study of plants, animals, humans and marine life at a molecular level.
career-opportunities.cellular_biologist: Cellular biologists study the cell development process, interaction of different living cells and their uses and functions. They focus on health-related functions in animals, plants or human beings and life-related activities in a variety of living organisms.
career-opportunities.teaching: Molecular biologists may also choose to become full-time or guest lecturers at universities and colleges. They may also teach in schools to higher secondary class students.
career-opportunities.research_associate: Research associates design and conduct experiments and interpret the results in molecular biology areas. Most research associates are recruited in agricultural companies, botanical surveys, hospitals, medical research, medical labs, genomic labs, etc. R&D departments of pharmaceutical, forensic and industrial companies hire research associates with PHD or advanced degrees.
career-opportunities.genetic_counsellor: Genetic Counsellors work in hospitals, clinics, hospitals and with other scientists to provide information on the inheritance of certain illnesses and the risks involved. They may also be involved in dissemination of information and policymaking in the healthcare industry.
career-opportunities.molecular_laboratory_technologist: Molecular laboratory technologists collect samples, test specimens, analyse results, record data in digital system, and maintain equipment and data analysis records.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Biology
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. (Hons) Molecular Biology/Molecular and Cellular Biology/ Life Sciences/Biological Sciences/Chemistry/Physics for 3 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M.Sc. (Hons) Molecular Biology/Molecular and Cellular Biology/ Life Sciences/Biological Sciences/Chemistry/Physics for 3 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Biology
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. (Hons) Molecular Biology/Molecular and Cellular Biology/ Life Sciences/Biological Sciences/Chemistry/Physics for 3 years
path 2.after graduation: Pursue M.Sc. (Hons) Molecular Biology/Molecular and Cellular Biology/ Life Sciences/Biological Sciences/Chemistry/Physics for 3 years

path 3.after graduation: Pursue M.Tech in Phamaceutical engineering/genetic engineering/nanotechnology/biotechnology

path 4.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. (Hons) Molecular Biology/Molecular and Cellular Biology/ Life Sciences/Biological Sciences/Chemistry/Physics for 3 years
path 4.after graduation: Pursue Integrated MSc-PhD in Chemical and Molecular Biology (IIT Kharagpur)

cons: • It requires advanced knowledge and expertise in using complex lab equipment.• There is high competition for research funding.• There is possible exposure to biological hazard.

music-as-a-career-in-india.title: Music
music-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Musicians create music. They compose, conduct, sing, perform music in different styles. They are skilled artists who dedicate their life to music and its composition by playing a variety of instruments. They may work on thier own, as freelancers or in collaboration with others. Competition in the field of music is high and musicians need to dedicate hours of practice to maintain and develop their skill, whatever their preferred style.

career-opportunities.musician_or_singer: Musicians compose music and play various musical instruments. A musician can be a composer, singer, lyricist while Singers on the other hand gives voice to the lyrics. Both singers and musicians perform in a live performance (concerts) or in the recordings for films, theatre, etc.
career-opportunities.music_teacher: Music teachers has an adequate knowledge in the field of music. He/she teachers students how to play various intruments as well as gives singing lessons. Music teachers must have a bachelor's degree in music education.
career-opportunities.musical_director_or_composer: Musical directors selects and plans music for groups such as orchestras, bands, or choirs during live group performances. A music composer creates composition for movies, albums, etc as per the vision communicated by the music director.
career-opportunities.arranger: An Arranger works closely with the writer. He does the creative mixing and aims at bringing out what the writer was trying to convey when he wrote the composition
career-opportunities.lyricist: A lyricist gives words to the music composed.
career-opportunities.music_editor: Music Editor makes sure that the music is in tempo with the scenes and enchances the feel of the video being watched.
career-opportunities.music_therapist: Using many methods, from singing and composing to rhythmic movement or playing instruments,music therapists incorporate melody and rhythm into their patients' treatment.
career-opportunities.freelancer: Working as a freelancer is the latest trend in Musician Industry. Freelancers don't work for a particular company and aren't bounded by any contracts of any recording studio or production house.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in any stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue Bachleors in Music (Hons.)/ any Discipline for 3 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII in any stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue Diploma in Music for 1-2 years

work description: Compose music for recording in a studio or perform in front of live audience
Practice and rehearse regularly to maintain the melody in the voice
Gain expertise in different genres of music as well as in playing instrument(s)
Promote one's music through internet or by performing at different venues
Work as a single or in a band, chorus or orchestra
Guide the upcoming talents with one's own knowledge and experience
Produce music for the film industry
Be self-confident and highly motivated to overcome the struggling period

pros: It fulfils your passion for music. Music as a therapy is also used on people, so you can also serve the society.
Being good at your work allows you to do play back singing for famous personalities.
You get fame and money.
cons: This industry being unpredictable, musicians have to deal with part-time work.
There is a cut throat competition in this industry thus you have to work very hard.

nanotechnology-as-a-career-in-india.title: Nanotechnology
nanotechnology-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Nanotechnology Engineering is the manipulation of nanomaterials to convert it into useful and effective materials, structures, devices. 'Nano' in Greek means dwarf. The foundation of nanotechnology lies on the fact that when any matter is reduced to its Nano dimension, it starts showing very strong changes in its properties, this includes changes in Physical, Chemical, magnetic, optical, mechanical and electrical properties. Through extensive research in nanotechnology, now scientists are able to claim that if atoms in coal are reassembled, then diamonds can also be produced. The scope and application of nanotechnology is far-reaching and quite amazing too. It is being said now that 21st century would be the century of nanotechnology as it would revolutionize every field. From medicine to aerospace and from engineering to many industrial and technological areas, Nanotechnology would be the ideal platform to address all issues."

career-opportunities.nanotechnologist: As a Nanotechnologist you'll manipulate matter on the nanoscale (one billionth of a metre), and could develop new materials, equipment, drugs or diagnostic tools.
career-opportunities.forensic_science: Nano-forensics is a new area of forensic science which is highly advanced and associated with the development of nano-sensors for crime investigations and inspection of terrorist activity by determining the presence of explosive gases, biological agents and residues. Nano-analysis is commonly used in the detection of crimes.
career-opportunities.project_assistant: Project assistants are responsible for providing support and creating balance at the time and scope of executing projects under the direct supervision of the project director in an establishment. They are also responsible for supervising projects in progress and ensure that all issues related to the projects are clarified and completed to avoid confusion and interruption during execution of projects.
career-opportunities.project_engineer: Project engineers are responsible for developing project objectives by reviewing project proposals and plans, conferring with management. They determine project responsibilities by identifying project phases and elements, assigning personnel to phases and elements, reviewing bids from contractors.
career-opportunities.business_development_manager: Business development managers are responsible for taking decisions and processing an organization. They are responsible right from planning business goals, setting targets, acquiring clients, appointing agents, recruiting staff and delivering presentations.
career-opportunities.service_engineer: Service engineers are responsible for reviewing each machine after a specific period of time, so they can find fault and rectify it so as to avoid any major problems in the future. They have to be well versed with user manual.
career-opportunities.lecturerprofessor: Lecturer/Professor is responsible for interviewing course applicants, lecture planning, preparation and research, contact and teaching time with students, checking an accessing students work, invigilating examinations, attending staff meetings, and general administration.

path 1.stream: Class XII in Science Stream with science and maths compulsory

path 2.stream: B.Tech. in Nanotechnology Engineering

path 3.stream: M.Tech./M.Sc. In Nanotechnology Engineering

path 4.stream: Ph.D. in Nanotechnology Engineering

entrance exam.elements: Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics

entrance exam.name: SOE - UPES
entrance exam.elements: Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics

entrance exam.name: Mahindra University
entrance exam.elements: Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics

pros: Suitable for people who like practical and hands-on work Suitable for people who value achievements and are results-oriented Some previous work-related skill, knowledge, or experience is required to get started. Very good salary
cons: Nanotechnology may pose a potential risk to the environment, health and other safety issues This branch is still at its evolving stage

naval-architecture-and-ocean-engineering.title: Naval Architecture and Ocean Engineering
naval-architecture-and-ocean-engineering.summary: Naval architects are professional engineers who conceive, design, construct and maintain ships, offshore structures and other large floating systems. Ocean engineers design and build floating and underwater equipment, such as wave-measuring buoys, underwater vehicles, sonar systems and supporting platforms

career-opportunities.naval_architect__designer: Naval architects and designers play an important role in the shipbuilding industry. In shipyards, they are primarily responsible for ship design, which includes concept design, stability calculations, resistance estimations, and the preparation of 3D production models and 2D production drawings.
career-opportunities.marine_surveyor: A marine surveyor is someone who conducts inspections, surveys, or examinations of marine vessels in order to assess, monitor, and report on their condition and the products on board, as well as inspecting damage to both vessels and cargo. Marine surveyors also inspect equipment intended for new or existing vessels to ensure compliance with various standards or specifications.
career-opportunities.marine_consultant: Maritime consultants are people who have the expertise to advise and suggest better trade routes, as well as address other necessary shipping concerns to individuals and corporations involved in the marine business, in order to help them boost, advance, and further their business positively.
career-opportunities.production_managerin_shipyards: They are in charge of directing and coordinating shipyard operations in accordance with company policies and procedures. Responsible and accountable for the safety, quality, cost, and scheduling performance of craft supervisors, technicians, and line staff. Responsible for providing a sufficient number and quality of workers to meet the schedule and budget.
career-opportunities.offshore_structures_engineer: The Offshore Structural Engineer will be in charge of carrying out and verifying all engineering activities and documentation for offshore platform structures. Choose and design the best technical solution for offshore platforms. Subcontractors designed the follow-up platform.

path 1.stream: Clear class 12th/ Higher Secondary qualification with Biology, Maths, and Chemistry as main subjects.
path 1.graduation: B. Tech Naval Architecture and Ocean Engineering

path 2.stream: Clear class 12th/ Higher Secondary qualification with Biology, Maths, and Chemistry as main subjects.
path 2.graduation: B. Tech Naval Architecture and Ocean Engineering
path 2.after graduation: M. Tech Naval Architecture and Ocean Engineering

naval-architecture-and-ocean-engineering.Important Facts: Marine engineers and naval architects also design and build cruise ships, yachts, and autonomous sailing vessels.One of the top-paying employers for marine engineers is the federal government. Careers in naval engineering are in demand. The design and build of ships is considered crucial to national security and global commerce.

work description: Naval Architecture deals with the design of ships and ship systems.

Ocean Engineering deals with other structures and systems in or adjacent to the ocean, including offshore platforms, underwater submersibles, coastal structures and other ocean systems and ocean environmental engineering systems.

pros: Naval Architecture deals with the design of ships and ship systems.

Ocean Engineering deals with other structures and systems in or adjacent to the ocean, including offshore platforms, underwater submersibles, coastal structures and other ocean systems and ocean environmental engineering systems.
A career in this field is likely to earn you a high wage abroad one of the greatest benefits of this career is a chance to see the world aboard.
There are various employers and industries that hire engineers in this field.
cons: High competition for positions
Might need to relocate for the job
Long working hours
Pay in India is not generous

nuclear-engineering.title: Nuclear engineering
nuclear-engineering.summary: Nuclear engineering is a branch of engineering that studies and applies nuclear and radiation processes. These processes include the generation and use of radiation and radioactive materials for study, industry, medicine, and national security, as well as the release, control, and exploitation of nuclear energy. Nuclear engineering is based on physics and mathematics fundamentals that describe nuclear interactions and neutron and gamma ray transport.

career-opportunities.atomic_process_engineers: They conduct research on nuclear engineering projects or apply nuclear science principles and theory to problems involving the release, control, and use of nuclear energy, as well as nuclear waste disposal.
career-opportunities.nuclear_radiation_engineers_radiation_en: A nuclear radiation engineer's responsibilities include conducting experiments to test and evaluate radiation effects in a variety of settings. Professionals in this field frequently focus on the performance of systems, equipment, or networks during and after radiation exposure.
career-opportunities.nuclear_steam_supply_system_engineers: They oversee the operation and maintenance of operational nuclear power plants to ensure efficiency and safety compliance. They keep an eye out for any design, construction, or operation practices that violate safety regulations and laws or may jeopardize operational safety at nuclear facilities. They develop operational instructions for nuclear power plant operations, nuclear fuel handling, and waste disposal.
career-opportunities.reactor_engineersreactor_projects_engine: They monitor and ensure that the reactor core (fuel) is burning properly. Make plans for power maneuvers for operations (this is basically creating a recipe for operations to get the plant to a desired power level).

path 1.stream: Clear 12th grade grade with PCM stream
path 1.graduation: B. Sc Physics/ B. E Electronics engineering/ Mechanical engineering /Chemical engineering /electrical engineering
path 1.after graduation: Master’s degree in Nuclear engineering

path 2.stream: Clear 12th grade grade with PCM stream
path 2.graduation: B. Sc Physics/ B. E. Electronics engineering/ Mechanical engineering /Chemical engineering /electrical engineering
path 2.after graduation: Master’s degree in Nuclear engineering

Keep an eye on the progress of engineering projects.
Find new ways to utilize nuclear energy.
Keep an eye on nuclear waste generation and disposal.
Investigate and test nuclear processes and procedures.
Supervise the operation of power plants.
Implement radioactive material safety protocols.
Attend trainings to stay up to date on the latest trends and technology.
Troubleshoot and respond to problems and emergencies on the spot.

pros: Ability to take part in state-of-the-art energy and medical technologies and opportunities to employ national defense scientific training and expertise
Job growth on the ground (9 percent between 2012 and 2022)
High potential income
cons: -High educational level needed
Work with hazardous materials
Extensive travel may be necessary
Deadline pressure

numerology-as-a-career-in-india.title: Numerology
numerology-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Numerology is the belief in the symbolic relationship between a number and one or more coinciding events. The term numerologist can be used for those who place faith in numerical patterns and draw inferences from them. People who believe in numerology claim that numbers govern much of what happens in relationships, health, finances, and life in general. As a numerologist, you need to be empathic and be compassionate towards your clients, as they may be vulnerable and sensitive regarding their future events such as marriage, job, health etc. As a numerologist, you should be able to communicate well with your clients.

path 1.stream: Clear class XII with any stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue Graduation in any discipline for 3 years. (Meanwhile, pursue a certificate/Diploma in numerology)
path 1.after graduation: Pursue Post- Graduation in any discipline for 2 years. (Meanwhile, pursue a Certificate/Diploma in numerology)

numerology-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: Must have passed class 12th or Senior Secondary Examination with at least 50% marks including English.

1.name: All India Institute of Occult science

4.name: Shree Maharshi college of Vedic astrology

work description: Studying the significance of numbers in order to make predictions on future outcomes or interpret the meaning of past or current events or circumstances.
Studying and researching about the numbers thoroughly.
Interpret numbers and make the clients understand what their numbers say about their concern.
Speaking to a variety of people and handle them accordingly.
Conducting workshops/seminars/short-term courses.
Maintaining client database, appointments, record of sessions etc.
Ensure confidentiality and develop trust in relationships with clients.

pros: A thoughtful and sincere understanding of numbers can give you an edge to explain information to the clients.
There is a great range of flexibility and comfortable work timings.
The job profile gives you an opportunity to travel and meet new people.
The demand for the profession is on a rise, and is not affected by time of the month.
cons: You might have to deal with social stigmas attached to the profession.
It can be a little stressful and emotionally draining at times.
Initially, it can take time to build up your business and reputation.

nursing-as-a-career-in-india.title: Nursing
nursing-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Nursing is an allied medicine profession within the healthcare sector that is focused on the care of patients. The patients suffer from different medical conditions that range from minor injuries and ailments to chronic long term illnesses. Nurses support recuperation through care plans and often evaluate and focus on the needs of the patient. Nurses are the primary point of contact for the patient and their next of kin.

career-opportunities.cardiovascular_nursing: It is a nursing specialty and the nurse works with patients who suffer from various conditions of the cardiovascular system.
career-opportunities.critical_care_pediatric_nursing: It is a branch nursing concerned with the care of infants and children. It requires knowledge of normal psychomotor, psychosocial, and cognitive growth and development, as well as of the health problems and needs of people in this age group. Preventive care and anticipatory guidance are integral to the practice of pediatric nursing.
career-opportunities.emergency_nursing: It is a nursing specialty that is concerned with the care of patients who are critically ill or injured. Emergency nurses contact patients in the emergency department, before the physicians treat the patients.
career-opportunities.gastroenterology_nursing: They provide essential care to patients undergoing procedures for screening, diagnosis, and/or treatment of gastrointestinal disorder. They may specialize in endoscopy.
career-opportunities.gerontological_nursing: They work in collaboration with older adults and their families. They also work with communities to support healthy aging, promoting maximum functioning, and also improving the quality of life.
career-opportunities.medicalsurgical_nursing: It is one of the most demanding nursing specialties. A surgical nurse specializes in providing care to patients before, during and after the surgery. It is the largest group of practicing professionals.
career-opportunities.neuroscience_nursing: They assist the patients with brain and nervous system disorders. They monitor neurological exams, administer medication, and consult physicians on patient's progress.
career-opportunities.oncology_nursing: An Oncology Nurse provides care for cancer patients and those at risk for getting the disease. They monitor physical conditions, prescribe medication, and administer chemotherapy and other treatments.
career-opportunities.orthopedic_nursing: Orthopedic nursing is a nursing specialty focused on the prevention and treatment of musculoskeletal disorders i.e. the disorders affect the human body's movement.
career-opportunities.psychiatric_and_mental_health_nursing: Psychiatric nursing is the specialty of nursing that cares for people of all ages suffering from mental illness or mental distress, such as schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, psychosis, etc. They receive more training in psychological therapies, building a therapeutic alliance, and the administration of psychiatric medication.
career-opportunities.rehabilitation_nursing: They help patients recover from the long-term physical disabilities, or chronic illnesses. They create a recovery plan, and set short and long-term goals. They help the patient achieve as independent a lifestyle as possible.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Biology
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. Nursing for 4 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M.Sc. in Nursing for 2 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Biology
path 2.graduation: Pursue General Nursing and Midwifery (GNM) for 3.5 years

path 3.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Biology
path 3.graduation: Pursue Auxiliary Nursing Midwifery (ANM) for 1.5 years

nursing-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: Most college have eligibility criteria of minimum 50% aggregate marks in Class XII / and some of minimum 60%.Must have passed class 12th or senior secondary examination with at least 50% marks including English. Some colleges/ universities also have an age limit (17 at 31st December of the year of admission).

2.name: All India Institue of Medical Sciences

4.name: West Bengal University of Health Science

6.name: Rajiv Gandhi University of Health Sciences

8.name: Jawaharlal Institute of Post Graduate Medical Education & Research

work description: Be Associated with the doctor, patient and the patient's family
Look after the needs of the patient who is incapable of doing so
Keep an eye on the vital signs of the patient such as his blood pressure, heart rate, food intake, medications, etc.
Facilitate the physical examinations and other tests required for the patients
Assist the doctors during surgeries and emergencies
Take immediate action in the absence of the doctor during emergencies
Deal with patient with empathy and care
Help the patient and his family to maintain proper health and hygiene

pros: Making a difference: Nursing is a good choice if you want to be in the helping profession. The fact that you helped someone can be a gratifying aspect of the job.

Different opportunities: Nurses have many opportunities outside of direct patient care. They work in many different areas, such as discharge planning, case management and education. Insurance companies, law firms, schools, etc. also hire nurses
Good returns: The salary that they receive is quite high, especially compared to the amount of investment during the education years.
cons: Exposure to germs: You will be exposed to all types of germs and viruses. If you are squeamish, nursing is probably not your best career choice. They deal with blood and other bodily fluids.

Odd working hours: In certain cases you will be assigned to work on rotating shifts, covering a 24-hour cycle. You will be required to work at varied schedules, including night, holiday, and weekend shifts.
Stressful working environment: There are times that the hospital is short staffed or there is a sudden increase in new patients to treat. In these cases, you will be required to work more.

nutrition-dietetics-as-a-career-in-india.title: Nutrition and Dietetics
nutrition-dietetics-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Nutrition and Dietetics is the science of management of nutrition and food for the promotion of health among people by instilling healthy eating habits. With an increasing concern about lifestyle, health and eating habits, the field of Nutrition and Dietetics is getting popular. Dietitians can work in both the community, and the hospital. They evaluate, improve and educate patients, nurses, doctors, community groups and health professionals about the dietary needs, and the healthy style of life. They also work with patients suffering from diseases, such as kidney problems, food allergies, cancer, diabetes etc.

career-opportunities.sports_and_health_clubs: They work with sports teams, athlete camps, clubs etc. They take care of their nutritional requirements, and also monitor their progress from time to time.
career-opportunities.teaching_research_and_development: The nutritionist under the Research and development section conducts research on various food items. They ensure the quality of the products, as well as to study their effects on the body chemistry in laboratories. They also conduct research on nutritive value of food, which helps to understand various components of food we eat. Teaching the science of nutrition of dietetics in colleges and universities is also a good option, after completing your higher education.
career-opportunities.community_dietitians: They counsel and advice people on food choices, and conduct programs in nutrition awareness and disease prevention from time to time. Community Dietitians work in public health agency, health and fitness clubs, and day care centers. They work with large groups.
career-opportunities.management_dietitians: Management Dietitians specialize in food service systems or clinical management. They manage personnel, plan and conduct employee training programs, design food systems, and plan budgets.
career-opportunities.consultant_dietitians: Consultant Dietitians work independently with individual clients. They work as nursing home consultants, book authors, and patient counselors in medical centers and fitness programs. They serve as independent advisors to industry, and they also develop and evaluate food service systems.
career-opportunities.mass_media: Mass media also employs nutritionist, for disseminating vital information on healthy living.
career-opportunities.nutrition_educators: Nutrition educators work in health care, community, corporate, elementary and secondary schools, or academic agencies and institutions to educate people on the nutrition.
career-opportunities.private_nutrition_consultants: Private nutrition consultants to the public, government and private agencies, and the food industry. Experienced dietitians may become assistant, associate, or director of a dietetic department, or become self-employed. Some dietitians specialize in areas such as renal or pediatric dietetics. Besides all these they can also work as private consultant or private practitioner.
career-opportunities.government_sector_jobs: They can work with government hospitals, government's health department, schools, colleges, factories and office cafeterias for planning nutritional plans.
career-opportunities.clinical_dieticians: Clinical dieticians monitor, analyses, and prescribe nutritional and dietary plans for patients in private practices, hospitals, nursing homes, schools and prisons. They also work with patients with chronic conditions, such as diabetes, obesity, and, hypertension, etc.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in Science Stream (H.Sc. is recommended)
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. Nutrition and dietetics for 3 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M.Sc. Nutrition and dietetics for 2 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII in Science Stream (Home Sc. is recommended)
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. Home Science for 3 years
path 2.after graduation: Pursue M.Sc. Home Science for 2 years

path 3.stream: Clear Class XII in Science Stream
path 3.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. Nutrition and dietetics for 3 years
path 3.after graduation: Pursue Post-graduate Diploma in Nutrition and dietetics

nutrition-dietetics-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: Some colleges have English as mandatory subjects in Class XIIMust have passed class 12th or senior secondary examination with at least 50% marks including English The minimum age limit is 17 years for B. Tech course

work description: Guide people on developing healthy eating habits
Provide treatment to illnesses through different kinds of food
Assess the condition of the patients to help them with suitable diet
Plan diet charts keeping in mind the needs and the environment of the patients
Work with different organisations such as schools, hospitals, restaurants, etc., to maintain nutrition needs of the people
Spread awareness on the advantages of a healthy and balanced diet
Indulge in research on different food ingredients and their benefits
Maintain the records of the patients through periodic updates

pros: As a nutritionist, you will have the opportunity to set-up your own firm, and enjoy flexible timings.
The jobs growth rate is on a rise.
The knowledge of food and nutrition will allow you to help others
cons: It will take time to establish yourself as a professional nutritionist.
You should be very patient with your clients, as understanding individual requirements can be very time consuming.
It is a highly competitive field.

occupational-therapist-as-a-career-in-in.title: Occupational Therapist
occupational-therapist-as-a-career-in-in.summary: Occupational therapist helps the clients to achieve satisfied state in life. They design some purposeful activity or interventions to promote health, prevent injury or disability. They work with clients on a one-to-one basis and they design treatment programmers to suit each person's needs and lifestyle. The work could include programs like teaching an older patient recovering from a stroke how to dress themselves, encouraging someone suffering with depression to take up a hobby or activity which they enjoyed earlier, helping clients adjust to permanent disabilities etc.

career-opportunities.hospital__clinic: In the hospital setting they observe patients doing tasks, ask them questions to understand them better, review their medical history and design programs to improve their conditions.
career-opportunities.charities_or_voluntary_organizations: The job profile of an occupational therapist in an NGO include helping the clients to manage their daily activities. They make them independent. Clients in the NGO may have mental, physical or social difficulties.
career-opportunities.prisons: Occupational therapists in prisons plan various activities for the prisoners in order to teach them job skills to maximum inmates inside a correctional facility. They assist with the release planning of inmates through a re-entry program. This assures success in living and working environment after being incarcerated.
career-opportunities.companies_and_businesses: They analyze and study the working environment in the organizations. They develop better working conditions and methodologies for the employees.
career-opportunities.social_services_departments: They help to regain skills that patients have lost because of illness or disability. They identify equipment and home adaptations to help the patients with everyday activities.
career-opportunities.special_schools: They work in special schools and work with the students to improve their performance. They are concerned with understanding student's skills and abilities and the expectations placed on him/her in the school setting.
career-opportunities.private_practice: They practicing privately within their own clinic.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Biology
path 1.graduation: Pursue Bachelor in Occupational Therapy for 4.5 years (4 years study + 6 months internship)
path 1.after graduation: Pursue Masters in Occupational Therapy for 2-3 years

occupational-therapist-as-a-career-in-in.Important Facts: Most college have eligibility criteria of minimum 50% aggregate marks in Class XII / and some of minimum 60%.Must have passed class 12thor senior secondary examination with at least 50% marks including English. Some colleges/ universities also have an age limit (17 at 31st December of the year of admission).

work description: Advise on special equipment which can be used to assist in day to day activities
Create recovery and rehabilitation programme to help in rebuilding skills and capabilities
Train and mentor people with learning disabilities
Liaison with doctors, patients family & medical support staff
Train patient on soft skills such as anger & anxiety management
Build strong relationship and trust with patients and concerned stakeholders

pros: It is satisfying to bring a change in someone's life and bring a change.
You can work in different areas according to your preference.
You can work independently and set up your clinic.
cons: You should be very patient with the patients.
It can be very frustrating if the clients don't respond.
The field requires critical thinking and good problem solving skills.

optometry-as-a-career-in-india.title: Optometry
optometry-as-a-career-in-india.summary: More than 75% of the vision/eye problems in humans are curable or even avoidable. Optometry is a fast growing healthcare profession that is concerned with the eyes as well as vision & visual systems processing in humans. An optometrist measures vision, prescribes lenses according to the requirements and fit lenses to improve vision. With increasing usage of technology and visual media, the demand for optometrists is expected to increase manifold in the coming years, making it a lucrative career option.

career-opportunities.shops__organizations: A trained optometrist is most likely be work in small independent optometrists or for a large national organization. They may also open their own shops. They use their knowledge of the workings of the eye, eye diseases and conditions to carry out eye examinations. They give advice on visual problems and prescribe spectacles, contact lenses and low vision aids. They are also be trained to detect eye disease and underlying health conditions such as diabetes or high blood pressure.
career-opportunities.working_in_a_hospital: Optometrists may also work in hospitals or clinics where they treat those cases which require urgent attention. It's a busy, fast paced environment and they work alongside ophthalmologists (medical doctors specializing in the eye) as part of a large team of eye-specialists.
career-opportunities.research: Optometrists may start their career in research with a PhD (Doctorate) or even after masters, and carry out a program of research on chosen topic. They may undertake independent research with funding from an organization like the College of Optometrists, or work in the research department of a university or hospital
career-opportunities.teaching: Optometrists can also work as teachers in post-secondary education.
career-opportunities.consultant: Optometrists can also work various companies manufacturing optical goods as consultants.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Biology
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.Optom ( Bachelors in Optometry) for 4 years (3 years study + 1 year internship)
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M.Optom for 2 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Biology
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. Optometry for 3 years
path 2.after graduation: Pursue M.Sc. for 2 years

path 3.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Biology
path 3.graduation: Pursue Diploma in Ophthalmic Assistance / Ophthalmic Technology for 2 years
path 3.after graduation: Pursue Post Graduate Diploma for 2 years OR B.Optom for 2 years (direct admission in 3rd year)

optometry-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: Most college have eligibility criteria of minimum 50% aggregate marks in Class XII / and some of minimum 60%.Must have passed class 12th or senior secondary examination with at least 50% marks including English. Some colleges/ universities also have an age limit (17 at 31st December of the year of admission). English is also a requirement for enrolling in optometry education.

work description: Examine the vision of the patients of all ages
Check for near/far sightedness, eye coordination, colour differentiation or diseases like glaucoma, cataract, diabetes, etc.
Prescribe spectacles, contact lenses or medication when required
Recommend tests for accurate treatment
Remain updated on the recent research and discoveries
Communicate with empathy and care
Manage case histories and accounts of the patients
Coordinate properly with the staff members
Perform duties in line with the ethical standards

pros: The working hours are generally for 8-9 hours and over time is not required.
The work is not hectic and you are not required to write detailed reports.
You will work with the physicians in the hospitals.
cons: The work is repetitive and after few years one can feel bored.
The growth opportunities are not much.

organisational-psychologist-as-a-career-.title: Organisational Psychologist
organisational-psychologist-as-a-career-.summary: Industrial-organisational psychology is the study of mental capacities and behaviour of individuals in organisational settings. It focuses on individual, group and organisational dynamics in work settings and how each influences the other. The field not only aims to study organisational behavior but also research, assess and develop interventions that aid in organisation's as well as individual's development professionally.

career-opportunities.organisation_development_manager: Build effective programs that shape an organisation holistically in ways that are both employee friendly and profitable to the organisation
career-opportunities.talent_management_analyst: Assess skills and abilituies required to carry out certain work effectively and develop training and upskilling programs for employees
career-opportunities.research_analyst: Collect and analyse data in different departments and develop measures based on the findings that help improve the functionings and operations of the organisation

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in any stream with Psychology as a subject
path 1.graduation: B.A/ B.Sc in Psychology/Applied Psychology (or some universities accept any UG degree for higher studies)
path 1.after graduation: M.A/ M.Sc in Psychology with specialisation in Industrial-Organisational Psychology

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII in any stream with Psychology as a subject
path 2.graduation: B.A/ B.Sc in Psychology/Applied Psychology (or some universities accept any UG degree for higher studies)
path 2.after graduation: M.A/ M.Sc in Psychology with specialisation in Industrial-Organisational Psychology

path 3.stream: Clear Class XII in any stream
path 3.graduation: B.A/ B.Sc in Psychology/Applied Psychology (or some universities accept any UG degree for higher studies)
path 3.after graduation: M.A/ M.Sc in Psychology with specialisation in Industrial-Organisational Psychology

path 4.stream: Clear Class XII in any stream
path 4.graduation: B.A/ B.Sc in Psychology/Applied Psychology (or some universities accept any UG degree for higher studies)
path 4.after graduation: M.A/ M.Sc in Psychology with specialisation in Industrial-Organisational Psychology

pros: Increasing future demand Diverse career paths (working in organisations from different fields) Is not monotonous and requires creativity Allows to develop and implement interventions Keeps one updated as work requires research and social interaction
cons: Initially may be challenging to set up career Requires much study Work may get extensive and stressful at times

palmistry-as-a-career-in-india.title: Palmistry
palmistry-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Palmistry is art of Hand Reading where the person interprets a person’s character or predict their future. The practice is found all over the world, and the people who practice this are generally called palmists, palm readers, hand readers or hand analysts. As a palmist, you need to be empathic and be compassionate towards your clients, as they may be vulnerable and sensitive regarding their future events such as marriage, job, health etc. As a palmist, you should be able to communicate well with your clients.

path 1.stream: Clear class XII with any stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue Graduation in any Discipline for 3 years. (Meanwhile, pursue a Diploma/Certification in Palmistry)
path 1.after graduation: Pursue Post- Graduation in any Discipline for 2 years. (Meanwhile, pursue a Diploma/ Certification in Palmistry)

palmistry-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: Must have passed class 12th or Senior Secondary Examination with at least 50% marks including English.

2.name: All India Federation of Astrologer’s societies

3.name: All India Institute of Occult Science

6.name: Association of Holistic, Spiritual & Astrological sciences

8.name: Shree Maharshi College of Vedic Astrology

work description: Interpret people’s hands to help them see the future. They base their predictions on the study of the hands.
Speaking to a variety of people and handle them accordingly.
Conducting workshops/seminars/short-term courses on hand reading.
Maintaining client database, appointments, record of sessions etc.
Ensure confidentiality and develop trust in relationships with clients.

pros: There is flexibility in the working timings.
The job profile gives you an opportunity to travel and meet new people.
The demand is on rise.
cons: It can be a little stressful and emotionally draining at times as you are dealing with the personal issues.
It can take a bit of time to build up your business and reputation.
There are social stigmas attached to the profession.

pastry-chef-as-a-career-in-india.title: Pastry Chef
pastry-chef-as-a-career-in-india.summary: A pastry chef works in a professional kitchen and helms the bakery/pastry kitchen. They are master in making pastries, desserts, breads, cookies, and other bakery products. Other chefs assist the pastry chef in their department. To make tempting bakery products, they need to order ingredients, keep inventories, deal with wholesalers and develop new recipes.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII with any stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue Bachelors in Culinary arts/Hotel Management/ Hospitality Management/ Catering Technology and Culinary Arts
path 1.after graduation: Pursue Diploma/Certificate Course in Culinary arts/Hotel Management/ Hospitality Management

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII with any stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue Bachelors in any field
path 2.after graduation: Pursue Diploma/Certificate Course in Culinary arts/Hotel Management/ Hospitality Management

path 3.graduation: Pursue Bachelors in Culinary arts/Catering Technology and Culinary Arts
path 3.after graduation: Work as an intern/ Trainee and gain Experience

path 4.stream: Clear Class XII with any stream
path 4.graduation: Pursue Diploma/Certificate Course in Culinary arts/Hotel Management/ Hospitality Management
path 4.after graduation: Work as an intern/ Trainee and gain Experience

pros: Being a pastry chef demands a lot ofresearch and development, which can be rewarding and delicious. People who are open to new things or enjoy experimenting with recipes can become a successful pastry chef.
cons: Pastry chefs are required to work for long hours standing in the kitchen and do repetitive tasks. They need to start work early in the morning around 3 - 4 AM. Sometimes day-to-day responsibilities can become overwhelming.

pathologist.title: Pathologist
pathologist.summary: The branch of pathology deals with the origin, causes and nature of diseases. A pathologist is a medical healthcare professional who examines bodies, body fluids and body tissues. They work in labs to perform tests which help determine the presence/absence of any illness. They conduct lab tests. A pathologist is an integral part of the treatment team and work closely with doctors to reach diagnoses. They investigate the causes and effects of various diseases and illnesses in patients. They are expert in laboratory techniques used to study disease.

career-opportunities.biotechnological_industries: Cytopathology: The process and study of human cells that have been obtained either in bodily fluids or by scrapping. They extensively study the extracted cells, learn about the causes and effects of different illnesses and diseases.
career-opportunities.work_with_private_labs: Histopathology: They take a sample of skin, tissue, or even bone to understand the causes and effects of certain diseases, usually through a process known as a biopsy.
career-opportunities.work_with_government_hospitals_labs_and_: Forensic Pathology: They determine the causes of death in a living being among others through tests. They are responsible for providing information regarding causes and time of death, usually pertaining to cases where the patient is either a victim or suspect of malpractice.
career-opportunities.pharmaceutical_industry: Chemical Pathology: They conduct biomedical investigations of various different bodily fluids such as urine, blood and cerebrospinal fluids. Through the field, professionals would be able to monitor and diagnose various diseases through such tests and reports.

path 1.stream: study Physics, Chemistry and Biology/ Biotechnology as main subjects
path 1.graduation: MBBS degree at the undergraduate level
path 1.after graduation: Diploma or MD in Pathology or equivalent course recognised by the MCI.

path 2.stream: study Physics, Chemistry and Biology/ Biotechnology as main subjects
path 2.graduation: MBBS degree at the undergraduate level
path 2.after graduation: MSc or PG Diploma in Pathology courses

path 3.stream: study Physics, Chemistry and Biology/ Biotechnology as main subjects
path 3.graduation: MBBS degree at the undergraduate level
path 3.after graduation: MD

pros: • Pathologists tend to be methodical, step-wise thinkers with an eye for recognizing patterns• Pay scale improves with experience• There are opportunities for career growth
cons: • Requires a lot of patience, skill and qualification• Requires long and strenuous working-hours

photography-as-a-career-in-india.title: Photography
photography-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Traveling the world with a camera in hand seems to be the "in" thing these days. Photography is an exceptional medium of self-expression; more and more people are converting their hobby into profession. Some are born with a vision but some learn to create a vision. Photography as a career has endless opportunities and endless specialization. Starting from wildlife photography going up to war photography. Photography as a field gives you a lot of flexibility. Earlier there were self-learned photographers, now the time has changed and institutes have come up that train people, and where you can gain knowledge and polish your skills in Photography. Although this field takes time to be recognized, but if you are talented then be sure to be paid heftily.

career-opportunities.newspaper: Photographers can be appointed in various newspaper agencies for the coverage of the daily events.
career-opportunities.media_and_press: The Role of photographers are important in media and press to provide the viewers with first- hand information.
career-opportunities.magazines: Pictures says a thousand word. Photographers are heftily paid to work for Magazines. A simple article may not attract much attention, as much as article with catchy photograph would, thus making it attracting and engaging for the audience.
career-opportunities.advertising_agencies: An advertising agencies, is a lot dependent on a photographer. No matter how good a product is, but if it is unable to create a impact, then it's of no use. The sole purpose of a photographer in an advertising agency is to provide photographs that are high quality, attractive that illustrates and tells a story about product.
career-opportunities.government_agencies: Photographers in government agencies are recruited on a regular pay scale. They are required to capture the daily event and also for making photo captioning and photo featuring. These may include different departments such as environment, education, wildlife, weather etc.
career-opportunities.industrial_houses: An industrial photographer plays a major role in creating a pleasant image of a company. captures the interiors, exteriors, merchandise, machines, workers, events etc of the firm or the company for its brochures and annual reports. Hence, a photographer plays an important role in making the firm or the company look good and efficient.
career-opportunities.fashion_houses: People who want to make career in a glamour industry can opt for fashion photography. Their work involves taking picture of models, clothing, style which may further be featured in fashion journals, magazines, newspapers etc.
career-opportunities.stock_photography_companies: Photographers often have collection of promising photographs, which can be used by other companies. Such a company helps in selling and marketing of their photographs in return for a percentage of sales.
career-opportunities.websites: Photographers can work for various websites which not only enhances the outlook of the website but also helps in communication with its users.
career-opportunities.law_enforcement_agencies: A very crucial role is played by photographers in this sector. Photographers provide visual evidences to various cases and crime scenes. For this a photographer will have to be an active part difficult and dangerous events. Such agencies include police, investigation bureau, detective agencies etc,
career-opportunities.scientific_photographers: In this type of photography, person specialise in areas like astronomic photography, astrophysics photography, photography of chemical and biological materials, specimen, etc. You will photograph laboratory experiments, etc.
career-opportunities.commercial_photographers: This type of photography involves taking pictures of merchandise, buildings, machinery, fashion, livestock, and groups of people to be used in advertisements, marketing reports, brochures, catalogues and postcards etc.
career-opportunities.nature_wildlife_and_war_photographer: If the persons specialised in photography are green at heart, this is it. Here, they can capture animals in their natural habitat. Sub-marine or underwater photography is another branch of this stream. War Photography is another domain where talented photographers are required.
career-opportunities.film_photographers: Photographers will shoot feature films, advertising films, documentaries, etc.
career-opportunities.video_photographers: Photographers will shoot moving films with a video camera. Their subjects can be anything from a marriage ceremony to a 16-mm film.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in Any stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. in Photography / BFA for 3 years
path 1.after graduation: PG Diploma / M.Sc. in Photography for 1-2 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII in Any stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue Diploma/ Certification for 1-2 Years

path 3.stream: Clear Class XII in Any stream
path 3.graduation: Pursue Graduation in any discipline for 3 years
path 3.after graduation: PG Diploma / M.Sc. in Photography for 1-2 years

work description: Capture precious and crucial moments in the camera for professional purposes
Use different cameras and related equipments to click pictures of best quality
Develop concept and ideas through skilled photography
Make portfolios for actors, models, celebrities and or even for the self
Work as professional photographer in events like weddings, parties and other gatherings
Click pictures of evidences, crime scenes, areas of accidents and investigation to provide an important input to legal cases
Provide attractive images to magazines and books to captivate the readers
Work in studios to click and develop photographs of different kinds

pros: Although Photography as a field gives you a lot of flexibility. It is one of the best professions to be a freelancer, wherein through creative innovation you can convert your imagination into a masterpiece.
cons: With fierce competition, bringing out the best in a simple phenomenon is not that easy. It requires a lot of perseverance. This field is not for everyone. You have to be passionate. There are times when a photographer sits for hours and hours taking "n" number of same shots just to get that one perfect shot.

physiology-as-a-career-in-india.title: Physiology
physiology-as-a-career-in-india.summary: It is the study of functions and mechanisms of living organisms. It investigates how organisms, organs, cells and bio-molecules carry out their chemical and physical functions. Human physiology, a specific branch of physiology, studies how our cells, muscles and organs work together and interact. Physiologists use this knowledge to study the methods for treating diseases and coping with the stresses our bodies are exposed to in different environments.

career-opportunities.clinical_exercise_physiologists: Clinical exercise physiologists work in coordination with allied health professionals and clinicians. Their work involves providing expert advice on exercise and physical fitness, to people with chronic diseases such as diabetes, coronary heart disease, or chronic pulmonary disease, etc.
career-opportunities.biomedical_scientists: Biomedical scientists are employed in healthcare settings to execute varied laboratory tests and techniques on fluids and tissue samples to aid doctors and clinicians in the diagnosis of diseases. They also evaluate treatment effectiveness.
career-opportunities.sports_physiologists: Sports Physiologists are involved in assisting athlete and sports teams in optimizing their fitness and physical functions. They provide such support at various levels, by monitoring their training, assessing their fitness levels, and developing fitness-training programs.
career-opportunities.physiotherapists: Physiotherapists assist and treat patients suffering from physical injuries, difficulties or disabilities. They are involved in the rehabilitation of patients, to help them improve their mobility and physical function.
career-opportunities.research: Research Physiologists aim to understand the mechanisms of the human body to develop solutions to various physiological problems. To this end, they utilize the latest scientific tools and techniques to study various functions, in the laboratory as well as the natural environment.
career-opportunities.teaching: Teachers and educators are actively employed at both the secondary school level as well as at the college level, as a teacher or lecturer.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Biology
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. (Hons) in Physiology or B.Sc. (Hons) in Life Sciences for 3 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M.Sc. in Physiology or M.Sc. in Life Sciences for 2 years

physiology-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: Some colleges/ university have admissions in B.Sc. (Hons) in Physiology/ Life Sciences/ Applied Health Sciences following their own entrance test or consider the marks in the qualifying exam.

15.name: Baba Farid University of Health Sciences

work description: Providing systematic monitoring and reassessment of an athlete's work out plans
Coordinating with training staff to maximize the results of training
Enlightening and advising athletes and coaches on heart rate monitoring, recovery techniques, hydration strategies, overtraining, etc.
Fitness testing of athletes to create an accurate physiological profile of the individuals
Raising awareness of health and fitness issues
Promoting the benefits of sports and exercise & providing benchmark physiological information;
Chalking out of fitness training programmes and ensuring adherence to them
Functioning in collaboration with health professionals such as physiotherapists, dietitians, strength and conditioning coaches and sport psychologists
Handling specialist resources and equipments such as aqua-pacers, osmometers and electronic timing systems

pros: Professionals in this field have an opportunity to aid individuals in their recovery from injury, and help them improve their overall health.
Professionals have flexibility in terms of their work-setting, as they can work in hospitals, athletic teams, fitness centres, corporations, laboratories, etc.
There are a variety of specializations available in this field.
cons: Professionals might have to work at odd hours.
There may be a requirement to attain additional certifications.
The educational path may be long, with several years of training required.

physiotherapy-as-a-career-in-india.title: Physiotherapist
physiotherapy-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Physiotherapy is a medical profession where a physiotherapist helps patient with physical problems caused by illness, injury or aging. They work at different locations from a hospital ward to the pitch of a major sports team. Whatever your specialization is, your job is to rehabilitate ill and injured patients. Patients include children, the elderly, stroke patients and people with sports injuries.

career-opportunities.geriatric_medicine: They provide people with a variety of services and work with people individually, evaluating their physical capabilities. They design specific programs of exercise, education and wellness for them. They also work with other health care providers to coordinate the person's care.
career-opportunities.intensive_care: Respiratory and rehabilitation are the two key areas in the ICU. Respiratory Physiotherapists help patients to clear this excess sputum. Rehabilitation Physiotherapists' on the other hand play a vital role in maintaining and improving muscle strength and joint movement.
career-opportunities.mental_health: They provide skilled, accessible and equitable rehabilitation services for in-patients suffering from mental illness.
career-opportunities.outpatients_department: Physiotherapists working in Specialist Clinic (outpatient clinic), treat patients with varied conditions following injury or surgery. The problem faced by such patients is not very severe, and they come for regular sittings.
career-opportunities.orthopedics: They specialize in the treatment of patients undergoing planned surgery. They also treat patients who are admitted to hospital due to a traumatic accident or incident.
career-opportunities.pediatrics: They work with children and they have the right skills and specific knowledge to deliver appropriate care and education to encourage family involvement.
career-opportunities.womens_health: They help in the therapeutic treatment of all disorders affecting the pelvis and pelvic floor.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Biology
path 1.graduation: Pursue Bachelors in Physiotherapy for 4.5 years (4 years study + 6 months internship)
path 1.after graduation: Pursue Masters in Physiotherapy for 2 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Biology
path 2.graduation: Pursue Diploma in Physiotherapy for 3.5 years Pursue Bachelors in Physiotherapy for 4.5 years (4 years study + 6 months internship)
path 2.after graduation: Pursue Masters in Physiotherapy for 2 years

physiotherapy-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: Most college have eligibility criteria of minimum 50% aggregate marks in Class XII / and some of minimum 60%.Must have passed class 12thor senior secondary examination with at least 50% marks including English. Some colleges/ universities also have an age limit (17 at 31st December of the year of admission). Diploma Courses only make you eligible for assistance in physiotherapy. To practice physiotherapy, a Bachelor's Degree in Physiotherapy (BPT) is required.

1.name: Pt. Deen Dayal Upadhyaya Institute for Physically Handicapped

5.name: Indian Institute of Health Education and Research

8.name: School of physiotherapy, Orthopedic Centre, K E.M. Hospital

10.name: Dept. of Physiotherapy, MS Ramiah Medical College

work description: Help in the physical movement of the patients suffering from physical disabilities
Understand the history of the ailment and its severity
Perform examinations on the patient to ensure right treatment
Use variety of treatments such as massage, exercise, heat therapy, cold therapy, etc.
Record the history of treatment of the patient with periodic updates
Be empathetic, caring and assertive with the patients
Advise the client and the family for maintaining the progress
Manage during emergent situations with basic safety measures
Remain up to-date with the contemporary research on new techniques and technologies

pros: Job Satisfaction: Tremendous personal satisfaction when you know your efforts have helped someone return to their normal life. Three out of four physical therapists says that they are "very satisfied" with their profession.

Highly Respected Professional: They are highly educated and trained expert in how the human body moves and functions. They are an essential part of the health care team that is caring for the patient.
Proficiency in a Variety of Techniques: They learn variety of techniques, including ultrasound, electrotherapy, massage, etc.
cons: Physically Demanding: It is a very demanding career, and it is important to maintain a great diet and get enough sleep to achieve well-being.

Burn Out: You can feel emotionally stressful to deal with injured patients all day, most of them who are in pain. Not all of them will be pleasant to work with. It can be frustrating when clients refuse to follow the plan established for them all together.
Long working hours: In certain cases, you might be required to work for longer hours.

podiatrist.title: Podiatrist
podiatrist.summary: A podiatrist is a foot doctor. A podiatrist is also known as a DPM, which stands for doctor of podiatric medicine. Their primary focus is on the feet, ankles, and connecting parts of the leg.

career-opportunities.podiatric_orthopedics: Foot and leg problems are treated through the use of orthotic and prosthetic devices and physical therapy.
career-opportunities.podiatric_primary_care: Prevention, diagnosis, and treatment for podiatric conditions within the context of family health care.
career-opportunities.podiatric_sports_medicine: The prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of lower extremity disorders in athletes.
career-opportunities.podiatric_surgery: In order to treat a wide range of foot and ankle problems, modern operative procedures are utilized.
career-opportunities.podopediatrics: Foot and leg problems in children are diagnosed, treated, and prevented.
career-opportunities.wound_care_and_management: The prevention and treatment of wounds, ulcers, and injuries of the lower extremities, especially those caused by diabetes and other chronic systemic diseases.
career-opportunities.forensic_podiatry: Involves the study of footprints and shoe prints for crime scene investigations
career-opportunities.gerontological_podiatrist: Requires dealing with geriatric foot conditions
career-opportunities.podiatric_rheumatology: Involves dealing with rheumatoid arthritis and other autoimmune diseases
career-opportunities.reconstructive_foot_and_ankle_surgery: This speciality is also known as consultant podiatric surgery

path 1.stream: Must have pursued Physics, Chemistry, Biology at the 10+2 level.
path 1.graduation: Pursue a MBBS.
path 1.after graduation: Pursue Doctor of Podiatric Medicine. (DPM)

1.name: All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS)

4.name: Jawaharlal Nehru Medical College, Aligarh Muslim University

entrance exam.elements: Physics, chemistry and biology (class xi and xii)

entrance exam.name: University Clinical Aptitude Test (UCAT)

entrance exam.name: Biomedical Admission Test (BMAT)
entrance exam.elements: Thinking skills, Critical reasoning

entrance exam.name: Medical College Admission Test (MCAT)
entrance exam.elements: Biological and Biochemical Foundations of Living Systems Chemical and Physical Foundations of Biological Systems Psychological, Social, and Biological Foundations of Behavior Critical Analysis and Reasoning Skills

pros: • One of the fastest growing careers.• People who like to solve problems mentally are suitable for this career.• People who value achievements and are results-oriented should are suited for this career.
cons: • It is hard to get into this field. The skills and knowledge required for this career are extensive

political-analyst-as-a-career-in-india.title: Political Analyst
political-analyst-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Political analysts are like Political Scientists who research about political systems of their country, the relationship with foreign countries, advise the leaders about the foreign policies to be followed with different foreign governments. They analyse political situations, forecast political trends, develop and critically analyze the government?s policies and provide expert advice to the government and its ministries about various political and social issues. A political analyst may also be associated with roles in the media.

career-opportunities.work_with_the_government: Advise the ministers on the pros and cons of various policies, evaluate and analyse the laws
career-opportunities.media_organisations: Discuss and debate about the various policies, laws and findings
career-opportunities.teacherprofessor: Teach political science, international relations, public administration and related subjects to students in schools and colleges
career-opportunities.work_with_political_parties: They are hired by political leaders during their political campaigns to help them analyze various factors, help them form effective political strategies for winning elections.
career-opportunities.work_with_lobbying_firms: They work to influence political decisions on behalf of individuals and organizations. It includes proposal of new legislation, or the amendment of existing laws and regulations.
career-opportunities.labour_unions: They help political parties in enrolling members, collecting donations, seeking the help of political parties during the periods of strikes and lockouts.
career-opportunities.intelligence_agency: After a few years of experience, they can work with the Intelligence agencies, to reduce corruption, monitor internal politics and political developments of neighbouring countries.
career-opportunities.political_management__consultancy: They advise and assist in political campaigns. They work on development and production of mass media, voter polling, opposition research and strategy.
career-opportunities.legislative_assistant: They ?support legislators in legislative drafting, legal services,?conduct policy and legal research.
career-opportunities.public_relations_specialist: They?create and maintain a favorable public image for the organization they represent like the politicians/ political parties. They create social media programs to shape public perception and increase awareness of the parties work and goals.

path 1.stream: Any stream, preferably having subjects like Political science and Public Administration
path 1.graduation: Bachelor's degree in political science, foreign affairs, history, international relations, or other related major

path 2.stream: Any stream, preferably having subjects like Political science and Public Administration
path 2.graduation: Bachelor's degree in political science, foreign affairs, history, international relations, or other related major
path 2.after graduation: Masters in Political Science, international relations, public administration or public policy

path 3.stream: Any stream, preferably having subjects like Political science and Public Administration
path 3.graduation: Bachelor's degree in political science, foreign affairs, history, international relations, or other related major
path 3.after graduation: Masters in Political Science, international relations, public administration

path 4.stream: Any stream, preferably having subjects like Political science and Public Administration
path 4.graduation: Bachelor's degree in political science, foreign affairs, history, international relations, or other related major
path 4.after graduation: Post graduate Diploma in Political Affairs

path 5.stream: Any stream, preferably having subjects like Political science and Public Administration

entrance exam.name: Ashoka University will be based on online writing test (AAT), personal interview
entrance exam.elements: Problem-solving skills (includes numerical and spatial reasoning),Critical thinking skills (includes understanding arguments and reasoning using everyday language)

entrance exam.name: Chirst University Entrance Test,Personal Interview
entrance exam.elements: English,GK,Current Affairs, Maths, Reasoning, Data Analysis/Interpretation, Economics/Computer Science

entrance exam.name: JNUEE will be based on Multiple Choice Questions (MCQs) through Computer Based Test
entrance exam.elements: Social and Political Thought of Modern India, Western Political Thought, Concepts and Approaches in Political Theory, Constitution and Political Institutions of India, State and Politics in India, Political Processes and Public Policies in India, Comparative Government and Politics, International Relations

pros: They travel both nationally and internationally One of the highest paid careers in the world Opportunity to interact with high ranking officials Suitable for people who like to solve problems, analyse and manage difficult situations
cons: It is a challenging job Often requires dealing with and managing extreme crisis situations

political-science-as-a-career-in-india.title: Political Science
political-science-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Political Science necessitate understanding political ideologies, policies, institutions, processes and behavior, along with groups, classes, diplomacy, law, government, strategy and war. Students of political science grab an advanced understanding of the functioning of the government, development of policies along with conducting research and analyzing data related to political affairs. A background in political science is valuable for future careers in government, law, business, media, or public service.

career-opportunities.government_and_advocacy_jobs: A wide range of government occupations, from urban planning to legislature to intelligence bodies, are available for those with a majors in political science. Many political scientists in Central, State and Local Government are engaged in research and evaluation of functions of the Government. Some are administrators and many others are engaged in policy analysis or problem solving for the intelligence agencies.
career-opportunities.lobbyist_professions: One can find jobs lobbying the government on behalf of interest groups and other non-government organizations. These individuals work closely with various stages of government, negotiating with elected officials and influencing policy to advance the goals of their employers or clients.
career-opportunities.teaching_professions: Employment opportunities for individuals with political science majors are available at the school level and at the college level.
career-opportunities.media: An individual with political science degree and an experience of 3-5 years in journalism can find jobs in the media as a Political Correspondent whose job is to prepare political reports, articles and interviews for print and online publications, as well as television and radio broadcasts.
career-opportunities.research: Public Opinion Research and analysis is of interest to those in politics, and communication. One might also be employed in a university, business organisation, non-profit organisation or an advocacy sector. One might also head one's own research and consulting firm.
career-opportunities.business_organisations: In industries, they are often employed as industrial political scientists. Their main duties are to evaluate the effects of laws and policies on business and forecast political, economic and social trends.
career-opportunities.politicians: Politicians represent the political, financial, administrative, economic, educational and other interests of their communities, and attempt to become elected to represent those interests on a legislative level. Politicians may perform their duties at a municipal, regional or national level.
career-opportunities.law_careers: There are several aspects of law that might appeal to students with an undergraduate political science degree. Such jobs incorporate the understanding and enforcement of government rules, the interpretation of political ideas and the use of analytical skills. In addition to private practice, lawyers can work at the corporate level or for public sector institutions. They might also work as consumer advocates, judges or district attorneys.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in any Stream with Political science as a subject.
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.A.(H) Political Science for 3 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue Masters in Political Science for 1-2 years in India or Abroad

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII in any Stream With Political Science as a Subject
path 2.graduation: Pursue Bachelors in Political Science/ Public Administration for 3 years
path 2.after graduation: Pursue LLB for 5 years To become a Human Rights Advocate

path 3.stream: Clear Class XII in any Stream With Political Science as a Subject
path 3.graduation: Pursue Bachelors in Political Science/ Public Administration for 3 years
path 3.after graduation: Pursue Masters in Journalism for 1-2 years in India or Abroad to become a political correspondent.

political-science-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: Most colleges have eligibility criteria of minimum 50% aggregate marks in Class XII.No mandatory subject in Class XII. Most of the institutes for post-graduation require bachelors in Political Science or/and related subjects. For Lectureship in Political Science, National Educational Test (NET) or Ph.D. is mandatory. Most Colleges/Institutes provide admission on the basis of Class 12th percentage/merit. Some institutes also conduct interviews. There are various other colleges in Delhi University who offer this course.
