work description: Publish research results through academic publications, written reports, or public presentations
Develop and test theories, using information from interviews, newspapers, periodicals, case law, historical papers, polls, or statistical sources
Collect, analyze, and interpret data such as election results and public opinion surveys, reporting on findings, recommendations, and conclusions
Evaluate programmes and policies, and make related recommendations to institutions and organizations
Write drafts of legislative proposals, and prepare speeches, correspondence, and policy papers for governmental use
Forecast political, economic, and social trends
Consult and advise government officials, civic bodies, research agencies, media, political parties, and others concerned with political issues
Provide media commentary or criticism related to public policy and political issues and events

pros: Great option for entering into fields like Law, Politics etc.
Dynamic subject and helpful in understanding the world around.
Scoring subject and a good foundation course for government services
cons: Not a professional course
Needs writing skills to be sharp
Needs Master’s degree for good job opportunities

product-design-as-a-career-in-india.title: Product Design
product-design-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Product design is a subset of Industrial design. They use their designing skills and technical knowledge to design new products or improve the way that existing product look or work. Product designer designs product keeping in mind the consumer market and are involved in the whole product design life cycle, from concept to its design delivery.

career-opportunities.exhibition_designer: They work in large exhibitions, trade shows, conferences, museum, (public and private organization) and create display and fixtures during show. They are responsible for overseeing the supplies.
career-opportunities.furniture_designer: They are responsible for producing design for items of furniture and related items. They study, and design various style of furniture design.
career-opportunities.product_industrial_design_researcher: They work closely with the marketing department and are involved in understanding the needs of the user and come up with solutions and suggestions for the product being used at the user’s end.
career-opportunities.consulting_firms: They work with firms and help choose all the elements of design as per the need of approaching clients.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in Science Stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue B. Des in Industrial design/ Product designing

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream (Recommended)
path 2.graduation: Pursue B. Tech in Mechanical/ Automobile/ Electrical engineering
path 2.after graduation: Pursue Diploma/M. Des in Product designing/ Industrial Designing

working on ideas as part of a team or developing design concepts using CAD (computer-aided design)
Arrange meetings and liaison with engineers and marketing department to discuss and negotiate appropriate production processes, costs and commercial issues
Evaluate the safety of the product, and functionality of products

pros: It is a field for people who want to work creatively
It is a high paying and high demand career
cons: It can be a stressful job since it needs perfection
It requires a high level of study and skill

product-management-as-a-career-in-india.title: Product Management
product-management-as-a-career-in-india.summary: The product managers set the vision for the product and integrate their knowledge of technologies, various marketing techniques to enhance user experience, and thus maximizes the bussiness value of the product. Their main focus is on healthy functioning of three vehicles namely, the technology, designing and the users.

career-opportunities.businesstobusiness: In B2B setup a product manager plays a technical role. They are responsible for leading the design and development of a company's products and execute product strategies in coordination with other departments like IT, R&D, marketing and sales.
career-opportunities.businesstocustomer: The role of product managers in B2C setup is to develop, manage and strengthen the product brand. They look to maximize the user experience by understanding the consumer's mindset and incorporating customer expectations into the product/ service.

path 1.graduation: Pursue Graduation in Any Discipline for 3-4 years

path 2.graduation: Pursue Graduation in Any Discipline for 3-4 years
path 2.after graduation: Pursue M.B.A in Marketing for 2 years

Generate new ideas for the product to grow market share
Create new products or strategies based on market and consumer research
Determining a product's pricing based on exhaustive reach of competition and target customers
Convert product strategy into detailed requirements and prototypes for development
Work closely with multiple stakeholders like management team, engineering team and marketing team

Be Responsible for the creative, innovative side of business as well the analysis and strategy end sides
Lead product launches by coordinating with public relations team, analysts, executives and other marketing team members.

pros: Get to explore various fields such as technology, designing, marketing, etc.
Remunneration is good
cons: They are the stratergy leader, therefore if a product doesn’t do well, they are accountable for that.
Should be good at influencing, in order to align work to others.
Have to come up with new ideas, which can be tedious.

psychiatry-as-a-career-in-india.title: Psychiatry
psychiatry-as-a-career-in-india.summary: The field of psychiatry is concerned with the diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of mental, emotional, and behavioural disorders. A psychiatrist is a doctor who specializes in mental health. Psychiatrists are qualified to assess psychological problems on both a mental and physical level.

career-opportunities.child_and_adolescent_psychiatry: A child and adolescent psychiatrist specializes in mental and behavioural health issues in children and adolescents. As a result, you will have to deal with developmental disorders, attention deficit hyperactivity disorder, and learning disabilities.
career-opportunities.forensic_psychiatry: Forensic psychiatrists care for patients with mental health issues in prisons and secure hospitals. They also consult with correctional officials and give testimony regarding the mental health of accused parties when they testify at trials.
career-opportunities.substance_abuse_psychiatry: These Psychiatrists are specialists in treating patients who abuse alcohol, drugs, or other intoxicants. Treatment and counselling are provided, interventions are managed, families of abusers are consulted, and recovery plans, including medications, may be prescribed. Academics involved in this field have significant opportunities because it has a strong and active research base.
career-opportunities.general_adult_psychiatrist: Patients treated by general adult psychiatrists are mostly of working age, suffering from disorders such as "organic" brain diseases, psychoses, depression, and personality disorders.
career-opportunities.old_age_psychiatrist: This involves the treatment of mental illness in elderly people. As a specialty, it is characterized by the unique needs and vulnerabilities of older people, the variety of work settings and the variety of medical, psychiatric, and social dilemmas they face.
career-opportunities.intellectual_disability_psychiatrist: Psychiatry of intellectual disabilities, or learning disability psychiatry, treats people with learning disabilities who are more likely to suffer from mental health issues than the general population
career-opportunities.academic_psychiatrist: Academic psychiatrists belong to any psychiatric subspecialty and divide their time between education, research, and clinical practice.
career-opportunities.eating_disorders_psychiatrist: A psychiatric specialist in eating disorders can work with children and adolescents, as well as adults. Eating disorders are often accompanied by psychological difficulties or disorders such as anxiety, depression, obsessive-compulsive disorder, or personality disorders.
career-opportunities.liaison_psychiatrist: Psychological and physical health are intertwined in the work of liaison psychiatrists. In addition to providing mental health assessments and treatment for patients in general hospitals, they also address a variety of problems, from self-harm to coping with illness and comorbid conditions to physical pain.
career-opportunities.neuropsychiatrist: Psychiatrists frequently treat patients with mental disorders that occur because of brain malfunction. Psychological and organic components of illness are integrated in the field of neuropsychiatry.
career-opportunities.perinatal_psychiatrist: The perinatal mental health field treats women and children during a very sensitive time, when they are pregnant and right after labor and delivery. During this time, an episode of illness has a profound effect on the patient, their relationships, family, and child. Preventing such a disease or managing it can be a rewarding experience.
career-opportunities.rehabilitation_and_social_psychiatrist: Rehabilitation psychiatry is geared towards meeting the needs of people with long-term and complex mental health problems. Rather than just relieving symptoms, rehabilitation emphasizes improving a person's quality of life.
career-opportunities.medical_psychotherapy: Psychiatrists who specialize in psychotherapy are medical psychotherapists. There are a variety of therapies available, such as cognitive behavior therapy, psychodynamic psychotherapy, and systemic therapy.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in Science stream with Biology, Chemistry, and Physics
path 1.graduation: MBBS
path 1.after graduation: MD in Psychiatry

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII in Science stream with Biology, Chemistry, and Physics as one of the compulsory subjects
path 2.graduation: MBBS
path 2.after graduation: Diploma of National Board Exam (DNB) in Psychiatry

path 3.stream: Clear Class XII in Science stream with Biology, Chemistry, Math and Physics as one of the compulsory subjects
path 3.graduation: MBBS
path 3.after graduation: Diploma in Psychiatry / Psychological Medicine

cons: -Lengthy, competitive educational process.-Irregular hours and overtime are common.- Costly educational process.

psychology-as-a-career-in-india.title: Psychology
psychology-as-a-career-in-india.summary: The science of psychology plays the role of benefitting the society along with enhancing our lives. Psychologists examine the relationships between brain function and behavior, and the environment and behavior, applying what they learn to illuminate our understanding as well as enhance the world around us. As a psychologist you could contribute to a wide range of work including helping businesses, helping people improve their lives, promoting health, protecting the planet, serving communities, understanding the world around us and also working in schools.

career-opportunities.brain_science_and_cognitive_psychologist: Cognitive Psychologists study how the human brain works- how we think, remember and learn. They apply psychological science to understand how we perceive events and make decisions. This work can range from exploring how we learn language to understanding the interplay between cognition and emotion.
career-opportunities.clinical_psychologists: These are psychologists who provide clinical or counseling services, to address a breadth of mental, emotional and behavioral disorders, integrating the science of psychology with the prevention, assessment, diagnosis and treatment of a wide variety of complicated human problems. They also promote change, resilience and help people discover their strengths.
career-opportunities.counselling_psychologists: Counselling psychologists help people recognize their strengths and cope with everyday problems. Counselling psychologists focus on interactions between people and their environment, and on educational and career development.
career-opportunities.developmental_psychologists: Developmental psychologists focus on understanding how humans learn, mature and adapt. Developmental psychologists study how people grow, develop and adapt at different life stages.
career-opportunities.forensic_and_public_service_psychologist: Forensic and public service psychologists play important roles within the public safety and judicial systems. They conduct evaluations that inform and guide legal proceedings - from decisions regarding child custody to the competency of a defendant to stand trial.
career-opportunities.industrial_and_organizational_psychologi: Industrial and Organizational psychology is the scientific study of human behavior in the workplace. It focuses on assessing individual, group and organizational dynamics and using that research to identify solutions to problems that improve the well-being and performance of an organization and its employees.
career-opportunities.quantitative_psychologists: Psychologists use a number of research methods and comb through vast amounts of data to test hypotheses and study complex issues in the real world. Quantitative psychologists are expert in designing methodologies and studies that reveal answers to research questions on topics as diverse as human performance, child development, and memory and language retention.
career-opportunities.rehabilitation_psychologists: Rehabilitation psychologists study and work with individuals with disabilities and chronic health conditions to help them overcome challenges and improve their quality of life.
career-opportunities.sport_and_performance_psychology: Sport and performance psychologists focus on identifying and applying psychological principles that facilitate peak sport performance, enhance people's participation in physical activities and help athletes achieve optimal human performance.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in any Stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue B. A.(H) Psychology/Applied Psychology for 3 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue Masters in Psychology/Applied Psychology for 1-2 years in India or Abroad

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII in any Stream With Psychology as a Subject
path 2.graduation: Pursue B. A.(H) Psychology/Applied Psychology for 3 years
path 2.after graduation: Pursue Masters in Psychology for 1-2 years in India or Abroad

psychology-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: No mandatory subject in Class XII.Most of the institutes for post-graduation require bachelors in any field or Psychology/Applied Psychology or/and related subjects. For Lectureship in Psychology/Applied Psychology, National Educational Test (NET) or Ph.D. is mandatory. Most colleges have eligibility criteria of minimum 60% aggregate marks in Class XII. Most Colleges/Institutes provide admission on the basis of Class 12th percentage/merit. Some institutes also conduct interviews. There are various other colleges in Delhi University who offer this course.

work description: Design and implement behaviour modification programmes
Identify psychological, emotional, or behavioural issues and diagnose disorders, using information obtained from interviews, tests, records, and reference materials
Counsel individuals, groups, or families to help them understand problems, deal with crisis situations, define goals, and develop realistic action plans
Develop therapeutic and treatment plans based on clients' interests, abilities, and needs
Provide educational programmes on topics such as classroom management, teaching strategies, or parenting skills
Conduct research studies of physical work environments, organizational structures, communication systems and group interactions to assess organizational functioning
Formulate interview techniques, rating scales, and psychological tests used to assess skills, abilities, and interests

pros: Upcoming field in terms of present and future demand
Work involves social interaction and is not routine
Involves mostly helping people
cons: Can be stressful at times
Takes time to get settled, requires much study
Initial salary is not very high

public-prosecution-as-a-career-in-india.title: Public Prosecution
public-prosecution-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Public prosecutors are advocates appointed by the central or state government to represent cases on behalf of the state against the suspected criminal in criminal trials. The main responsibility of a public prosecutor is to serve justice in the interest of the public. A public prosecutor remains impartial and neutral. They ensure that the case is clearly presented before the court with all the pertinent facts, documents and evidence so that the court can arrive at the correct judgement. A public prosecutor also helps the police during the pre-trial investigation by obtaining warrants and preparing the chargesheet.

career-opportunities.assistant_public_prosecutor: Assistant Public Prosecutors examine the charges filed by the police or the investigative agencies and submit the acquittal or discharge. They also examine the evidence and file revisions petitions. They conduct cases in Courts of Metropolitan Magistrate.
career-opportunities.additional_public_prosecutor: Additional Public Prosecutors conduct cases in session courts (criminal courts).
career-opportunities.public_prosecutor: Public Prosecutors conduct cases in high courts and session courts along with Additional Public Prosecutor.
career-opportunities.chief_prosecutor: Chief Prosecutors supervise the functions exercised by Assistant Public Prosecutor in Metropolitan Magistrate Court.
career-opportunities.director_of_prosecution: Director of prosecution is appointed by some states to supervise the Department of Public Prosecution.

path 1.stream: Class 12 with any stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue 5 year intergrated law course (BA.LLB/ BBA.LLB/ B.Com. LLB)
path 1.after graduation: Practice as an advocate for 7 years

path 2.graduation: Pursue 5 year intergrated law course (BSC.LLB)

pros: • It involves helping others and serving justice.• It is a highly respected and recognized job.• Public prosecutors can become top paid professionals with experience.
cons: • It can be stressful in the beginning.• It requires long working hours.• There is tough competition in this field.

public-relations-pr-as-a-career-in-india.title: Public Relations
public-relations-pr-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Public relations are a strategy that bridges gap between the organization and the public. Public relation manager's work is to gather attention of media channel with an intent to pursue them regarding their product, idea or company. They main motive is to influence the opinion and behavior of the audience. Their job is to bring accomplishment to their client by using all forms of media channels. The information that reaches the masses is conveyed by the journalist hence it is viewed as credible. In this competitive market, a small firm wanting to make it big is done with the help of a PR personnel who helps them reach the pinnacle. Most entry-level PR professional jobs require a bachelor's degree.

career-opportunities.account_coordinator_or_pr_coordinator: PR coordinator or Account Coordinator make use of various media channels to publicise their organisation to the public. The work involves projects such as clipping newspapers, assisting in research, maintaining a list of media contacts, and coordinating mailings of press packets to the media.
career-opportunities.account_supervisor: An account supervisor often does similar work handled by the account executive, but they'll oversee other staff members assigned to the account as well. The account supervisor oversees PR accounts, often managing the account executives and account coordinators.
career-opportunities.media_relations_manager: In media relations, the person who represents a particular brand and has to pitch information to the reporters in such a manner to get them interested in their idea and have it publicised. Media relation manager should know what the journalist are looking for and hook them to their ideas.
career-opportunities.director_vp: Director, VP are responsible for managing the firm and look after the communication strategies. He/she also has to be active in thinking up new communication services which he/she can sell to the existing clients. Within agencies, a director or vice president works closely with younger staff to train and mentor them.
career-opportunities.government_pr_departments: The person involved in this department plays a role of a mediator between the government and the public. Government agencies call their public relations departments "public affairs" offices. In these roles, a person translates government policy for the public and help communicate the public's concerns back to the government.
career-opportunities.selfemployment: After gaining knowledge of the concerned field one can become self- employed in this field. Many organisations often outsource the PR function, relying on outsiders to handle their needs-either an agency or a PR consultant.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in Any stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue Bachelors in Journalism/Mass Communication /BA Hons.(English/Mass Comunication) for 3 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue Masters in Journalism and Mass Communication for 2 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII in Any stream
path 2.graduation: Graduation in Any Stream
path 2.after graduation: Pursue Diploma/ Masters in Mass communication/Journalism for 1- 2 years

work description: Same as a link between a client/ organisation and the audience
Promote a client/ organisation among general public through media, press releases, logos, images, websites, social networking, etc.
Conduct/ organize sponsor meetings, conferences, speech and interviews to gain popularity
Remain up to-date with latest social, economic and political trends and work accordingly
Reflect the brand's image and identity through one's personality
Develop strategies for the client/ organisation to reach out to the masses
Highlight the benefits of an organisation and its products and offerings
Deal with different kinds of people and their queries
Work with patience, intellect and tact while dealing with large scale audience

pros: Develop good networking skill and knowledge of various media outlets.
Career with high demand in future
cons: Stressful job as it requires good networking connection with good convincing skills.
It is a broad field and needs people to be adept for multi-taking
People who are introvert would find this job strenuous.

quantitative-psychologist-as-a-career-in.title: Quantitative Psychologist
quantitative-psychologist-as-a-career-in.summary: It is a field of scientific study that focus on the mathematical modeling, research design and methodology, statistical analysis of human or animal psychological processes. They measure human behaviour and other attributes by developing different statistical methods and quantitative techniques. This branch of psychology is mostly called as mathematical psychology since it is associatedwith the evaluation, measurement and research design of studies related to psychological data. Quantitative methods play vital role in developing new and assess prevailing methodologies to assist the works of almost every area within psychology. Quantitative psychologists are required to be highly trained in mathematical and statistical methods to aid between theoretical psychometrics and educational research. They conduct full range of data analysis. They collect data through designing tests, questionnaires, surveys and other measurements.

career-opportunities.psychometrician: Psychometrician evaluates the validity and reliability of testing measures, like personality or intelligence tests. They also play a critical role in the development of various types of tests, from writing test items to defing the knowledge required to successfully complete the test to evaluating the test's implementation.
career-opportunities.researcher: Researchers work in a host of fields, examining everything from topics in education to consumer behaviour. Psychological researchers can be employed in multiple settings as well, from colleges and universities to government or private entities.
career-opportunities.program_analyst: Program analyst assess public programs, from the development phase to implementation. They use this information to determine how effective or ineffective a program is in delivering services.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in any stream with Psychology as a subject
path 1.graduation: B.A/ B.Sc in Psychology/Applied Psychology (or some universities accept any UG degree for higher studies)
path 1.after graduation: M.A/ M.Sc in Psychology with specialisation in Industrial-Organisational Psychology

pros: There is a huge demand for these types of specialists. It earns a person an instatnt respect as he/ she is able to assist in all fields of psychological research.
cons: Face very heavy workloads. A lengthy and costly educational process.

radio-jockey-video-jockey-as-a-career-in.title: Video/Radio Jockey
radio-jockey-video-jockey-as-a-career-in.summary: With the unprecedented growth in the music and television industry, careers such as Video Jockey or Radio Jockey are emerging out to be some of the trending new age careers. This is a talent based field but requires one to hone his skills to achieve perfection. VJ's (Video Jockey's) today not only host music shows, but are also seen anchoring reality shows and hosting award functions. With the growth in the radio industry and variety of channels emerging, talented Radio Jockeys are also in high demand. VJ's and RJ's require high level of creativity and spontaneity while keeping their style and swagger intact

career-opportunities.video_jockey: VJs should have an in-depth knowledge about the latest trends in music. Along with introducing music video on Television, they also give some background information about the music being played. They bridge the gap between the audience and musician. Some of them specialize in a particular area or genre of music.
career-opportunities.radio_jockey: A Radio Jockey (or RJ) similar to video jockeys entertains listeners through the medium of radio. Each have their own style. It is a medium where there is no face to face interaction therefore it is important for Radio jockeys to engage audience by being witty, spontaneous and creative. They usually write their own scripts. RJ's may have odd hours of duty.
career-opportunities.disc_jockey: A Disc Jockey is someone who plays recorded song. The making of a Club Disc Jockey requires the knowledge of the mood of the intended audience, the performance setting, the preferred medium, and the development of sound manipulation.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in Any stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue Bachelors in Journalism/Mass Communication /BA Hons.(English/Mass Communication) for 3 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue Diploma in Radio Jockey

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII in Any stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue Diploma or Certification in Radio/Video Jockeying / Anchoring Training/Radio Management for 1-2 years

radio-jockey-video-jockey-as-a-career-in.Important Facts: Video Jockeying/Radio Jockeying isn't a degree specific course.A Bachelor's Degree Holder (especially in Mass Communication or Journalism) is considered good enough to work as VJ/RJ. People who wish to get into the field of RJ/VJ, right after schooling can go for a short term/diploma course to hone their skills and work as a VJ/RJ. For short term courses in VJ, a minimum qualification is 10th standard Clear diction, pronunciation, flare and fluency in the language, pleasing personality, good sense of Humor, creative bent of mind and spontaneity are desired.

Present latest music and related information via radio or video
Indulge in making important announcements or in anchoring various shows
Organise the content through writing of the scripts
Be talkative, lively, fluent, tactful and captivating to the audience
Operate different software programmes and equipments
Work on feedback given by seniors and the audience

pros: Able to create positive impact on masses
Ample amount of opportunities lies ahead of you. It can be your stepping stone to fame.
cons: Highly competitive field
Hectic Schedule is followed
Initial salary is less

radiology-as-a-career-in-india.title: Radio Technician
radiology-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Radio technicians are a group of allied medicine professionals who are trained to use medical imaging techniques, such as x-rays, computed tomography (CT), magnetic resonance imaging (MRI), nuclear medicine, positron emission tomography (PET) and ultrasound for creating images of a patient’s internal anatomy to diagnose injury or disease. Imaging techniques involve the use of radiation, hence it is very important to have adequate training and understanding of radiation safety and protection.

career-opportunities.nuclear_medicine_technologist: They are a type of radiology technician that performs imaging tests using special scanners and cameras, along with compounded radioactive substances called radiopharmaceuticals. They assist physicians in diagnosing and treating disease in patients.
career-opportunities.mammographer: It is an advanced radiologic imaging technique that utilizes low-energy X-rays to produce images of breast tissue for screening and diagnostic purposes. Mammographer play a very important role in early detection of breast cancer and finding other breast abnormalities.
career-opportunities.ct_technologist: A CT scan technologist, specialize in the particular modality of computed tomography (CT). It utilizes computer processed X-rays to produce three-dimensional images of different areas of the body such as the head, or abdomen.
career-opportunities.mri_technician: An MRI technician or technologist is a category of radiology technician that specializes in the modality of magnetic resonance imaging. MRI helps physicians diagnose abnormalities in patients using a powerful magnetic field. It produces detailed images of organs, soft tissue, and bones.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Biology
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. Radiology for 3 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M.sc Radiotherapy / Radio-diagnosis for 2-3 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Biology
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. Radiology for 3 years
path 2.after graduation: Pursue Diploma/PG Diploma in Radiotherapy / Radio-diagnosis for 2 years

radiology-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: Most college have eligibility criteria of minimum 50% aggregate marks in Class XII / and some of minimum 60%.Must have passed class 12th or senior secondary examination with at least 50% marks including English. Some colleges/ universities also have an age limit (17 at 31st December of the year of admission).

work description: Diagnose and treat patients through medical imaging techniques
Create images using CT scans, MRI, X-rays, ultrasounds, etc.
Be aware of the body parts that are to be evaluated
Monitor the safety measure before and during the imaging
Be able to interpret the reports correctly
Brief and console the patient about the procedure
Communicate with the patient with empathy and care
Organise the accounts and reports of the patients in a proper manner
Remain well versed with different machines and their technology
Perform duties in line with the ethical standards

pros: By working with physicians, they help in monitoring disease progression or they help in diagnosing a particularly dangerous ailment to prevent it from spreading or causing further harm to a patient.
The demand for radiologist is on high as many interventional radiological procedures are replacing surgical procedures.
You will get the opportunity to work with technology.
cons: The work is less challenging as other field of allied medicine.
The patient contact is very less. Interaction is only during the procedure.
You would be required to read and be updated with the technology.

retail-management-as-a-career-in-india.title: Retail Management
retail-management-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Retail Management is a career which involves endorsing final goods to increase customer satisfaction and increasing sales by understanding the needs and demands of the customers. The customers come and buy the products they need from the retail stores and the retail manager is the one who manages all the demands of the customers. It opens up doors of opportunities in various fields such as administrative, marketing, sales, merchandise shipment, etc. Retail managers view everything as to how a store works, from all the back end functions such as buying merachandise, etc to sales such as customer service etc. A student of retail management would study about retailing, marketing, advertisement, administration, international retailing, etc. Retail management is the perfect job for those who are interested in marketing, marketing research, merchandising, advertising etc.

career-opportunities.healthcare: Retail managers are required in the healthcare as there are various products which are involved in it such as skin care cream, medicines, skin care face wash, etc. The job role of retail managers is to understand the needs of the customers and make products according to their demand such as making creams which protects individuals against pollution.
career-opportunities.fashion: Retail managers are hired in this domain with the aim of handling the merchandise and placing it in such a manner that they attract customers, this is where your fashion sense comes in play. Retail managers also have to take into consideration that which type of good is required in what amount.
career-opportunities.departmental_stores: There are various departmental stores some of them are operating at a very small level and some at big level, retail managers are required to manage sales, organization of the goods, attending to the customer needs, etc.
career-opportunities.academics: Career in retail management can also open up careers in the field of academics or education sector wherein they are appointed as a teacher in a college and communicate their knowledge about the retail management to the students.
career-opportunities.sports: There are various sports equipments which are liked and bought by the customers. Management of those equipments is done by retail managers. They are also involved in evaluating the quality of equipments required, sport gear manufacturing and advertising of them.

path 1.stream: Class XII with any stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue BBA
path 1.after graduation: Pursue MBA in retail management

path 2.stream: Class XII with any stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue Bachelors in any discipline (at least 50% marks)
path 2.after graduation: Pursue MBA in retail management

path 3.stream: Class XII with any stream
path 3.graduation: Pursue Bachelor in any discipline (at least 50% marks)
path 3.after graduation: Pursue Diploma (post graduate) in retail management

retail-management-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: A candidate must have passed class 12th or equivalent with at least 50% marks including English as one of the subjects.An aspirant needs to be a graduate in any discipline with at least 50% marks An aspirant needs to crack exams like CAT, MAT, XAT, etc in order to get into a management course at Masters level. An offline/online certification course in retail management would be an advantage for your profile.

3.name: Advance Institue of Mangament and Technology (AIMT)

work description: Job of retail managers involve attenting to customer needs, finance, accounting, sales, etc of the retail stores.
Managing the finished products in accordance with the demands of the customers.
Directly involved in managing of the retail outlet or the store from back end functioning to the front sales.
After the completion of the MBA in retail management one can also get into the education sector wherein they can become teacher at a college.
Work of retail managers is spread across various domains where in they are majorly involved in managing of the outlet or the store.
Retail managers have to ensure that the staff gives excellent service and that the customers are happy.

pros: The job role of retail manager involves people interaction as you will be in interaction with a wide range of people.

Retail management involves working at different levels such as in selling, floor head, store management, etc. which allows you to remove stagnation from the job as there is greater capacity for promotion if you do your job with full dedication.
It allows you to do varied work such as dealing with customers, handling finance and accounts, marketing, merchandising etc.
cons: It’s a difficult job as it requires immense amount of effort and energy throught the day.
As it involves handling various jobs at one point of time, internse work pressure comes with it.
It also involves long working hours.

risk_analyst.title: Risk Analyst
risk_analyst.summary: A person whose job is to minimize the risk of an individual, business or company. The job involves assessment of financial documents, economic conditions and potential clients to help companies acertain the level of risk involved in making a particular business decision. The key skills of a risk analyst are analytical skills and a deep knowledge of the current business market to reduce the losses that can occur in future. Risk analysts are mostly required in investment firms, banks, insurance companies, accounting firms etc.

career-opportunities.market_risk_analysts: These professionals work closely with financial firms to assess risks and return. They make use of an anlytical approach to analyze the market risks and guide the team to monitor and control the risks.
career-opportunities.regulatory_risk_analysts: They take into account how laws impact the organization's operations. A risk analyst needs to get prepared and respond on the company's behalf in any debate.
career-opportunities.operational_risk_analysts: Operational risk analysts recognize the category of risks and report it to the seniors within the organization.

path 1.after graduation: Pursue MBA/ Master's/ PGD in Risk Management for 2 years

entrance exam.elements: Reading Comprehension, Verbal Reasoning, Verbal Ability, Quantitive Ability, Data Interpretation & Data Sufficiency, Analytical & Logical Reasoning

entrance exam.name: MAT
entrance exam.elements: Language Comprehension, Intelligence & Critical Reasoning, Data Analysis & Sufficiency, Mathematical Skills, Indian & Global Environment

pros: Handling of confidential information Access to senior management of the company High compensation and salary
cons: High level of responsibilty Extreme attention to detail required Long working hours

robotics-as-a-career-in-india.title: Robotics
robotics-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Robotics is a branch of engineering which deals with the making of robots. Robots are programmed machines which are able to carry out tasks autonomously or semi- autonomously for the better working of the company. It involves designing, building and programming of phsycial robots, to troubleshoot the problems in various domains of operations and manufacturing. This is very useful in fields including transporation, manufacturing, production, medical, army, etc. It is an interdisciplinary branch of mechanical and electrical engineering.

career-opportunities.space_research: Robotics Engineer can work in space research organizations like ISRO, NASA, etc, which makes uses of robotic technology and Artificial Intelligence.
career-opportunities.medical: Robots are majorly used in surgery and rehabilation sector of medicine. They also specialize in human treatment through therapeutic robotic devices.
career-opportunities.private_organizations: Robotics engineers build, design and test robotic systems and software for private companies for the automization of the activities of a company.
career-opportunities.entertainment: Robotics specialists are sought after in the gaming industry, making video games enthralling the audience with artificial intelligence embedded with robotics.
career-opportunities.investigation: Robots are widely used in investigation agencies and police departments. They use artificial intelligence and robots to detect hazardous material like bombs and even defuse them.
career-opportunities.banking: Robots are also used in banking sector for managing operations, stocks, etc.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII with Science with Maths stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.Tech/B.E in Robotics/Mechatronics Engineering
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M.Tech in specialized branch of robotics

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII with Science with Maths stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.Tech /B.E in Electronics /Mechanical /Electrical /Computer Science and Engineering/ Instrumentation & Control Engineering/ Electrical and Electronics Engineering
path 2.after graduation: Pursue M.Tech in Robotics/Mechatronics/ or any other specialized field

robotics-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: Robotics engineering is rarely taught and sought in India , be it a NIT or IIT. Mechatronics is the most related and sort field for people interested in robotics.You can also work in the field of robotics, with a associate degree(2 year) in robot technology or similar field, and work as an assistant to robotics engineer. Most college have eligibility criteria of minimum 50% aggregate marks in Class XII / and some of minimum 60%. Some colleges/universities also have an age limit. Most colleges require JEE score as minimum eligibility for Undergraduation degree.

work description: They perform engineering activities in planning and designing tools, engines, to create / programmed machines and robots.
Develop, co-ordinate, or monitor all aspects of production or operation of product designs.
They do extensive research in various mechanical and robotic technologies to update their robot with upcoming technology.
They modify computer controlled motion of robots and automated machines.
Develop, test and evaluate robot designs.
Install and test robots for defects after assembly.

pros: Job security: Since this career has less entrants, the demand of robotic professionals is high. Innovation has no stop in the technology journey, making the job opportunities highly rewarding, and satisfying.

Prestige: They generally innovate and improve the existing process, working on various models, with like-minded educated people, creating a name in the world of technology. This makes the profession highly demanded and unique, where the work is attached with prestige.

Diverse: The application of this industry is spread across various areas being production, manufacturing, power maintenance, mining, nuclear power, medical, automobile industry and many more. This gives the added benefit to switch fields, and accelerate growth.
cons: Geographical Restraint: Robotics job are specific and professional opportunities would not be in abudance in small cities.
Long work hours, high stress and patience : The job is very demanding. It requires physical, mental and emotional involvement and drains his/her energy.

Continuing Education: A master’s degree is required for better job opportunities in this field. Also, continuing upgradation of your knowledge and skills for the job, requires you to look for short term/long term certification to gain expertise.

sales-as-a-career-in-india.title: Sales
sales-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Sales is a core function of every business across industries. People involved in this profession reach out to their target customers to show their products or services. This profession involves a lot travelling, meeting new people, planning stratergies and close the deals to achieve the company target. Career in sales allows one to work across almost any industry or domain.

career-opportunities.pharmaceutical_industry: Sales people employed by pharmaceutical companies informs doctors about the drugs avaialable in their company and pursue them to use their companies medicine. Their work is to generate sale revenue by providing right product to the right doctors.
career-opportunities.automobile_industry: A salesperson in the automobile industry work with the manufacturers who deals with cars, commercial vehicles and other product related to automobile industry. Their task involves understanding the customer needs and specific requirements and guide them towards the most appropriate product.
career-opportunities.fmcg_industry: Retail industry where same or similar products are offered to the customers, a good sales person can make all the difference. A success or failure of a product is dependent on how well prepared a sales person is, and can gain maximum benefit from the product featured.
career-opportunities.retail_industry: People who pursue careers in retail are required to engage with the customers and explain the benefit of the merchandise in order to help them make an informed decision. Their objective is to improve sales figures and boost revenue.
career-opportunities.information_technology_industry: This industry is particularly suitable for people with a background of IT. Sales professionals in this industry liaison with technical and purchasing staff to understand clients IT related requirements.
career-opportunities.finance__banking_industry: Sales professionals in this sector would be selling a range of products such as pensions, life insurance, mortgages and saving schemes, as either an independent financial advisor or as a representative of a financial institution.
career-opportunities.real_state_industry: They are engaged in work such as like renting, buying, or selling property for clients. Perform duties such as interviewing prospective clients, studying property listings, accompanying clients to property site, discussing conditions of sale, and drawing up real estate contracts.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in any Stream (Maths is prefered)
path 1.graduation: Pursue Graduation in any Discipline for 3-4 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue Post-Gradute Diploma for 2 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII in any Stream (Maths is prefered)
path 2.graduation: Pursue Graduation in any Discipline for 3-4 years
path 2.after graduation: Diploma in Sales and Marketing

path 3.stream: Clear Class XII in any Stream (Maths is prefered)
path 3.graduation: Pursue Graduation in any Discipline for 3-4 years
path 3.after graduation: MBA (Specialization in Sales and Marketing, optional

work description: Act as a contact between a company and its existing and potential markets
Pitch for products and offerings of a company to customers
Travel extensively to meet and interact with customers
Monitor competition by gathering current marketplace information on pricing, products, new products, delivery schedules, merchandising techniques, etc.
Create detailed proposal documents, often as part of a formal bidding process dictated by the prospective customer
Recommend changes in products, services, and policy by evaluating results and competitive developments.
Resolve customers complaints by investigating into problems, developing solutions, preparing reports, making recommendations to management.
Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending to educational workshops and participating in professional societies.
Negotiate the terms of an agreement and closing sales

pros: You get to interact with a lot of people, that helps you widen your network.
There are good travel oppurtunities
There are lot of perks such as gift cards, invites, etc.
cons: There is high pressure.
You are required to deal with difficult customers.

script_writing.title: Script Writing
script_writing.summary: Script writing is the process of writing the dialogues, movements, gestures, etc., of a character in a particular scene. They need to write stories in the screenplay medium in order to express themselves for the screen. Scriptwriters write for TV shows, movies, video games and even for web series now.

career-opportunities.story_writer: A person who writes stories, tales, novels, fables, etc. A story writer writes news items for radiao, television, or newspaper.
career-opportunities.screenwriter: A screenwriter writes content for visual medium. They write screenplays for films, short films, television, commercials, and video games. They create the dialogue, the characters and the storyline of a script.
career-opportunities.content_writer: A content writer plans, writes, and edits web content, typically for digital marketing purposes. It includes writing blog posts and articles, scripts for videos and podcasts, as well as content for specific platforms.

path 1.stream: Any stream in class XII
path 1.graduation: Pursue a Bachelor's degree in Script writing/ Screenwriting for 3 years or A Diploma in script writing/ Screen Writing for 1 year
path 1.after graduation: Pursue a Master's Degree in Script Writing/ Screen Writing for 2 years

path 2.stream: Any stream in class XII
path 2.graduation: Pursue Bachelor's Degree in any subject for 3 years
path 2.after graduation: Pursue PG Diploma in Script Writing/ Screen Writing for 1-2 years

pros: -Able to turn ideas into a full fledged screenplay. -Hired by producers for your ideas.
cons: -Need to make several drafts that leads to a perfect script.-Script writing can be gruelling and tedious.

social-services-as-a-career-in-india.title: Social Work
social-services-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Do you look at the people around you and have this desire to reach out and help them? Do you wish to bring about change and the betterment of society? If the answer to anyone of the above is yes, then you should consider the career of a social worker. Social workers work with different subsets of populations and provide advice, support and help to individuals who are vulnerable sections of the society or who need assistance in various situations, such as adoption, dealing with abuse, etc. Further, the job of a social worker also requires the individual to be up to date with laws and policies in order to effectively help their clients.

career-opportunities.child_welfare_social_workers: Child welfare social workers work with children who have been neglected, abandoned or abused. They may specialize in one field within child welfare as well, such as adoption. The main aim of their job is to protect the child. They could be working individually or be employed by schools or NGOs. Individuals should be well versed with the laws pertaining to children in order
career-opportunities.public_social_worker: The focus of public social worker is on the general wellbeing, development and health of the community members and the community in general. Their work starts with assessing the community and its' needs, then understanding those problems and finally finding appropriate plans to address those problems. This could involve addressing issues within the community, seeking help for the same or working on policies that would benefit the community and the effective implementation of these policies
career-opportunities.corporate_social_responsibility: Corporate Social Responsibility is an area where professionals with a background in social work are appointed to work in the corporate sector. In this department of the company, social workers are actively being hired to guide and assist the company in making CSR related decisions.
career-opportunities.substance_abuse_social_workers: Substance abuse social workers work with the target population of individuals who have certain addictions which are interfering with their daily functioning and social life. These specialized social workers assess the problems of substance abusers and assist them in their path to overcome the addiction and make a full recovery by providing support and devising treatment plans best suited to the individual.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in any stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue Bachelors in Social Work for 3 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M.S.W for 2 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII with Any Stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue Bachelors in any stream
path 2.after graduation: Pursue M.S.W for 2 years

social-services-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: Must have passed class 12thor senior secondary examination with at least 50% marks

work description: Work with people to support them through difficult times and ensure that vulnerable people are safeguarded from any harm
Develop and maintain professional relationships with people acting as advocates & guides for them
Assess clients' needs, situations, strengths, and support networks to determine their goals
Organize and manage packages of support to enable people to lead fullest lives as far as possible
Recommend and make decisions about the best course of action for a particular person or family
Participate in multi-disciplinary teams and meetings regarding child protection, mental health, etc.
Develop plans to improve clients' well-being
Help clients to adjust to changes and challenges in their lives, such as illness, divorce, or unemployment
Respond to emergent situations, such as natural disasters

pros: Flexibility of work and workplace
Highly satisfying and provides chance to help people
Demand for social workers is high
cons: Is an emotionally taxing job
Requires following strict ethical guidelines
Work environment may not be pleasant

sociology-as-a-career-in-india.title: Sociology
sociology-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Sociology is a branch of social science that involves the study of human social relationships, social behavior and the society, including its origins, development, organization, networks, and institutions. Students who gain an expertise in sociology know how to think critically about human social life, and how to ask important questions. They develop the skill of designing good social research projects, meticulously collecting and analyzing empirical data along with formulating and presenting their research findings. They also become adept at helping others understand the way the social world works and how it could be changed for the better.

career-opportunities.research_arena: Sociologists do research on the problems and development of societies and the ways that humans interact. The research topics may include class, gender, race, social movement or any other related topic.
career-opportunities.social_and_community_services: Community agencies value employees with backgrounds in fields like sociology to address problems facing certain populations within society. Examples of jobs in this area might include: working in community development agencies, or environmental groups, and social service and nonprofit organizations benefiting juveniles, the elderly, and other special populations. Fund-raising or administration within these areas is also possible.
career-opportunities.criminal_justice_system: Criminology is the field where criminal justice and sociology meet. A degree in sociology may open opportunities for a person to get employed as a corrections officer, criminal investigator, parole officer, or also as court paralegal.
career-opportunities.education: One with, a sociology degree may also choose to teach at the school level or at the college level after earning a PhD in sociology.
career-opportunities.governance_and_public_administration: Generally, sociologists make good public administrators as they can easily relate to issues involving caste, gender, power, race, language, race, ethnicity, organizational power and identity.
career-opportunities.media: Sociologists, who have an expertise in understanding social relationships, social behavior and the society are in demand in this field because media reflects and influences the society and culture. One could work with advertising companies, publishing houses or as a public relations specialist. One can also consider becoming a journalist.
career-opportunities.corporate_sector: In the Corporate Social Responsibility Sector (CSR), sociologists are in demand to encourage activities relating to the protection of environment, welfare of the consumers, employees, communities, and other stakeholders. Pursuing a career in human resource manager is also a viable option. One may also be interested to work with marketing research agencies.

path 1.stream: Class XII wih Humanities Stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue bachelors in sociology for 3 years
path 1.after graduation: Masters in Journalism

path 2.stream: Class XII with Any Stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue Bachelors in Sociology for 3 years
path 2.after graduation: Appear for UPSC Examination

path 3.stream: Class XII with Science Stream
path 3.graduation: Pursue B.Sc Medical Sociology for 3 years
path 3.after graduation: Pursue M.Sc Sociology for 2 years

path 4.stream: Class XII with Humanities stream (can take sociology as one of the subjects)
path 4.graduation: Pursue BA(H) Sociology for 3 years
path 4.after graduation: Pursue Masters in sociology for 1-2 years in India or Abroad

sociology-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: No mandatory subject in Class XII.Most of the institutes for post-graduation require bachelors in any field or Sociology or/and related subjects. For Lectureship in Sociology, National Educational Test (NET) or Ph.D. is mandatory Most Colleges/Institutes provide admission on the basis of Class 12th Percentage. Some institutes also conduct interviews. Most colleges have eligibility criteria of minimum 60% aggregate marks in Class XII.
work description: Formulate publications and reports containing research findings
Analyze and interpret data to understand human social behaviour
Plan and conduct research to develop and test theories about societal issues
Collect data on the attitudes, values, and behavior of people in groups, using observation, interviews, and review of documents
Consult and advise individuals such as administrators, social workers, and legislators regarding social issues and policies
Design approaches to the solution of groups' problems, based on research findings in sociology and related disciplines
Observe group interactions and role affiliations to collect data, identify problems, evaluate progress, and determine the need for additional change
Develop problem intervention procedures, using techniques such as interviews, consultations, role playing, and participant observation of group interactions

pros: Is a good subject for government examinations
Solid base for careers such as law, civil services, psychology, etc.
Can advocate social change and reform
cons: Need to pursue masters
Highly competitive to get into a job
Initial pay package is low

sonography-as-a-career-in-india.title: Sonography
sonography-as-a-career-in-india.summary: A career or a job in sonography in the field of health sciences involves the use of medical image technology. High frequency sound waves are used to image human tissues, organs, cysts, etc. A professional in this field typically performs the tests and is equipped with skills that enable them to read, analyse and send the obtained images for further process.

career-opportunities.sonographerultrasound_technician: Involves medical imaging in laboratory or clinical settings using ultrasound

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in Science with Biology stream
path 1.graduation: B.Sc Medical Imaging Technology/Radiography

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII in Science with Biology stream
path 2.graduation: B.Sc Medical Imaging Technology/Radiography
path 2.after graduation: PGD in Ultrasonography

cons: • Can only administer and analyse but not make use of the information in medical diagnosis and treatment• Work may seem monotonous as no new challenges may come up

spa-management-as-a-career-in-india.title: Spa Management
spa-management-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Spa management is the concept of gaining expertise in spa treatments and knowing how to run a spa. Those who become spa managers are typically passionate about the spa industry. They enjoy working with people, and they are comfortable directing the work of others. Spa managers must have strong leadership skills, and must be willing to take responsibility for the success or failure of the business they operate. They manage the entire activities of a spa ranging from managing the finances to checking the operations.

career-opportunities.general_spa_manager: A spa manager takes care of the day-to-day operations of a health or beauty spa. They handle the accounts, maintain the books, manage the employs and the services that are offered by the spa. Depending on the size of the facility, they may be more into the business side of things, or they may play more of a customer service role.
career-opportunities.spa_designer: Spa Design is not just about colors, materials, beauty, accessories, etc. It is about creating a structure and an environment which will support the business in all its aspects, including retail sales. Design is an essential tool in generating business and revenues. The most important element in selling retail products in a spa is not the product real value, but its “perceived value
career-opportunities.spa_marketing_manager: Spa Marketing Coordinator needs to manage marketing needs and front desk duties, maintain professional and impeccable spa environment.

path 1.stream: Clear class XII with any stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue UG or diploma program in spa management
path 1.after graduation: Pursue any specialization/certificate program in spa/Hotel management

spa-management-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: Most colleges have eligibility criteria of minimum 10th or 12th pass.Some may even ask for successful completion of Graduation or equivalent with Minimum 2 years of relevant work experience. Some colleges/ universities also have an age limit Specializations are also available in select colleges. Every Institute may admit on the basis of its own examination or merit.

7.name: IISRM (Indian Institute of Spa Research and Management)

work description: A spa manager is responsible for the operations of a health or beauty spa.
They have to manage employee schedules, staff numbers, customer service, and spa operations.
They conduct all of the hiring, firing, and training of employees.
They conduct disciplinary actions and performance reviews for employees and sometimes even monitor employees for correct work performance.
They have to conduct training workshops for employees, so as to keep their employees up to date with new skills in the spa industry.
They may also have to keep a check on inventory sometimes.

pros: A lot of responsibility is attached as you need to coordinate all the work.
It involves good remuneration.
The job profile gives you an opportunity to travel and meet new people.
cons: It can be a little stressful and emotionally draining at times.
It can take a bit of time to build up your business and reputation.
You are required to work for long hours.

special-educator-as-a-career-in-india.title: Special Educator
special-educator-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Special Education is a domain dealing with specially designed methods for instruction, training and support for children with special needs due to disabilities. Such disabilities may include learning disabilities, physical disabilities, developmental disorders and behavioral problems. The aim of special education is to empower children with special needs to successfully cope with their disabilities and develop their skills to the fullest potential.

career-opportunities.special_education_teacher: Special Education Teachers are educators specifically trained to deal with students with a broad range of physical, emotional, learning and motor disabilities. They work to educate such children by teaching them reading, writing, communication and various subjects. They also impart specific skills that help the children to adapt to their surroundings and live happy, adjusted lives. They can find work in public and private schools, NGOs and rehabilitation centres.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in any stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue Bachelors in any discipline for 3 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue Post Graduate Diploma Programme in Early Childhood Special Education/Special Education for 1 year

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII in any stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue Bachelors in any discipline for 3 years
path 2.after graduation: Pursue Bachelors in Education/Special Education for 2 years

path 3.stream: Clear Class XII in Any stream
path 3.graduation: Pursue Bachelors in any discipline for 3 years/
path 3.after graduation: Pursue Bachelors in Education/Special Education for 2 years

work description: Administer tests to help determine children's developmental levels, needs, or potential
Arrange indoor or outdoor space to facilitate creative play, motor-skill activities, or safety
Collaborate with other teachers or administrators to develop, evaluate, or revise pre-school programmes
Confer with parents, guardians, teachers, counselors, or administrators to resolve students' behavioural or academic problems
Develop individual educational plans (IEPs) designed to promote students' educational, physical, or social development
Employ special educational strategies or techniques
Modify the general education curriculum for special-needs of students, based upon a variety of instructional techniques and technologies

pros: It is a highly rewarding career, with the opportunity to make a difference to a child’s life.
There is a dearth of highly qualified and trained special educators in India, so jobs are readily available for those who are skilled.
cons: The work can be physically and emotionally demanding.
Special education teachers do not always get the appreciation and respect they deserve.
A lot of time has to be spent in planning and developing educational charts and plans.

speech_pathologist.title: Speech Pathalogist
speech_pathologist.summary: A degree in speech pathology is generally offered in combination with audiology. Both are interlinked, however, speech pathology largely focuses on speech production, language processing, its cognition and disorders related to the same. A speech pathologist typically strives to distinguish between normal and abnormal functioning speech mechanism, prevent, diagnose and treat it. The field takes a closer look at those with disabilities and seeks to rehabilitate those who developed issues due to accidents and other medical conditions. Education in speech pathology is multidisciplinary in nature and requires equipping oneself with the knowledge of anatomy, physiology, linguistics, education and interventions.

career-opportunities.speech_pathologist: Concerned with preventing, diagnosing, and treating communication/speech related disorderss as well as related issues such as swallowing in clinical settings. May work privately or in healthcare organisations
career-opportunities.professor_in_special_schools: Assists children with language and speech related problems one-on-one or in groups
career-opportunities.research_and_teaching: Carry out research in language and speech related issues and teach in higher institutions
career-opportunities.disability_sector_working_with_deaf: Collaboratively work with teachers and help individuals with disabilities to use techniques to communicate effectively

sports-management-as-a-career-in-india.title: Sports Management
sports-management-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Students who pursue sports management learn how business principles are related to the sports industry. The business and promotional concerns of athletes or athletic organizations are seen by sports management professionals. Job duties of sports management professionals may include monitoring the finances, negotiating contracts of athletes and teams. As there is increasing demand of these professionals due to rise in league competitions such as ISL, IPL, PBL, Pro-Kabaddi League etc., this profession has got a lot more opportunities and employment.

career-opportunities.sports_agents: Sports Agent look after their athlete's public relations, business promotion,career progression etc. Sports agent manages the business oppurtunities for the player and acts as a bridge between the player and the club. He/She should have knowledge about financial analysis, business management and investments.
career-opportunities.sports_managers: Sport managers is the spoke person for the athlete They keep in touch with the media to maintain a good image of their client.
career-opportunities.sports_medicine_professional: The responsibility of sports medicine professional is to maintain atheletes mental and physical health. The knowledge of kinesiology, physiology, anatomy and nutrition is applied to sports by them. They often undertake regulatory and legal issues that are associated with professional sports.
career-opportunities.sports_information_director: Sports information director work is similar to that of a public relation personnel. They work encompasses working on press release, organisating conference for atheletes and coaches, updating information about the team on the website etc. The athletic director is the person responsible for administration and oversight of all athletic programs. They also work in colleges and universities.
career-opportunities.sports_marketing_specialist: Sports Marketing specialist coordiantes activities during sports event. Marketing techniques are utilized by the specialist to increase ticket sale during such events. They often work with sponsors for the promotion of their product.
career-opportunities.event_or_facility_managers: Settings and fields where sport event takes place on a regular basis require people to manage them and ensure proper maintainance of the facility and this is undertaken by the facility manager. Their work involves managing the staff that operates and maintains the venue and also works to book events and negotiate event contracts with sports teams or other organizations.
career-opportunities.sports_journalist__commentator: With good communication skills and knack for sports one can find avenues to practice the art as commentators, journalists etc. The emergence of League competitions such as IPL, ISL, IBL, etc. has created abundant career opportunities.
career-opportunities.sports_federations: There are 52 approved National Sports Federations and hundreds of state level and district level federations. These are the organizing and governing bodies of sports in India at various levels. Their responsibility is to promote sports as an industry and help in growth of various aspects.
career-opportunities.sports_celebrity_manager: All the sports personalities need a Manager who will help them manage their portfolio of contracts, associations, endorsements and renewals.

path 1.graduation: Pursue BA with any stream
path 1.after graduation: Pursue PGDSM for 1-2 years/Job

pros: With an ever increasing enthusiasm in sports, sports management as a field is growing heights.
Sports management is a diverse field and not just limited to professional leagues but one can work in schools, colleges, non profit oransiations etc.
It allows you independent thinking and creativity
Allows you to work with big company brands
cons: It is not a 9 to 5pm job. One has to work even on holidays.
You will be the first person to reach the venue and set up things and last person to leave.
With so many people wanting to make a career in sports, there is a lot of competition and one of the toughest job market currently.

sports-psychologist-as-a-career-in-india.title: Sports Psychologist
sports-psychologist-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Sports psychology is a field that uses psychological theories and principles to improve the mental well-being and overall performance of athletes, understand social and developmental issues of sports participation and address systemic aspects of sports organisations and setting. Sports psychologist aim to understand how psychological factors such as motivation, personality, anxiety, anger and self-confidence etc. affect an athlete?s physical performance and use that information and knowledge to create training programmes, deliver feedbacks or conduct one on one sessions with athletes. Sports psychologists work with athletes and performers to build a sustainable lifestyle, reduce burnout and improve performance. They may also help non-athletes with incorporating sports and exercise into their lifestyle to improve their physical and mental health.

career-opportunities.clinical_sports_psychology: Clinical sport psychologists identify and treat sportspersons with emotional disorders and other mental health problems such as depression, anxiety, substance abuse etc.
career-opportunities.educational_sports_psychologist: Educational sports psychologists use their extensive training and knowledge to help coaches, sports administrators and family members to create an optimal environment for enhanced performance of the athletes. They address areas such as anxiety management, confidence development, and improved communication.
career-opportunities.certified_mental_performance_consultant: Consultants in this field assess the strengths and weaknesses of the players, identify mental challenges or roadblocks, create action plans and strategies of these players. They are recruited by college and school sports team, professional sports teams and Olympic-level staffs.
career-opportunities.personal_trainer: Personal trainers use psychological strategies and skills to develop realistic action plans and motivate athletes and non-athletes to achieve their physical fitness goals.
career-opportunities.military: Sports psychologists also help people in armed forces to reduce stress, deal with physical demands, improve concentration and improve performance.
career-opportunities.performance_psychologist: People with sports psychology degrees may also work with corporate employees, artists, musicians and actors to improve their performance.
career-opportunities.research: Some sports psychologist conduct research on aspects of psychology of sports including both theoretical and applied aspects.
career-opportunities.teaching: Many sports psychologists teach university courses such as applied sports psychology and social sports psychology.

cons: One will need a master?s degree or PG diploma to pursue this career. There are very limited Indian colleges and universities which provide this course. The working hours may be irregular.

sports_medicine.title: Sports Medicine
sports_medicine.summary: Sports medicine is a specialty of medicine that focuses on preventing and treating sports and exercise-related injuries. The practice of Sports Medicine is becoming a potential career option nowadays and comes with great opportunities, especially for individuals interested in the spheres of fitness and medicine, as the culture of sports and fitness continues to spread throughout India. Doctors and other paramedical practitioners who practice in a broader setting also have roles under this field. Various sports medicine professionals frequently collaborate as a team to ensure that the appropriate rehabilitation strategy is implemented. Orthopedic surgeons, licensed athletic trainers, physical therapists, physical medicine and rehabilitation experts, and specialty SEM physicians are also possible team members. Sports medicine is a budding career, with several areas of opportunity.

career-opportunities.kinosiotherapist: Creating specialised exercise programs, heping people achieve optimal health and fitness.
career-opportunities.dietician: Help you with losing or gaining weight, dietry advice to improve functioning of the body.

path 1.graduation: Pursue MBBS in a recognised institution.

pros: • Enjoy the opportunity of working for professional or college sports teams. • Opens doors for career in a variety of fields, including physical therapy, massage therapy or working as a trainer. • Physicians are even able to travel with the teams between venues.• The career has no end, there will always be the need of a sports physician.
cons: • Clearing NEET and other entrance exams is a challenging task• It needs a lot of hard work and persistent to reach here.• No fixed working hours.

stage_lighting.title: Stage Lighting
stage_lighting.summary: The Stage Lighting Tech operates the lights board, which controls the lighting and graphics onstage. He or she is also in charge of rigging lights, hanging lights, unloading and relocating lighting equipment, and ensuring that everything is in working order. Tour managers, production managers, booking agents, road crew, artists, lighting directors, and club DJs all work with lighting techs. Lighting technicians may accompany a performer on tour or work in-house at a venue. Lighting technicians have a diverse educational background. Many technicians have studied theatrical production design, audio engineering, audio/visual technology, or lighting technology. Every educational background contributes to the team's success. Many Lighting Techs freelance, especially at the start of their careers, they spend a significant portion of their time looking for work–at least until they make a reputation for themselves in the industry.

career-opportunities.creative_venue_technician_apprentice_or_: Their work includes covering sound and lighting along with other roles, such as stage crew.
career-opportunities.production_arts: It involves working closely with the activities associated with backstage roles in performing arts.
career-opportunities.stage_manager: Their primary job is ensuring that performances go smoothly. They are also responsible for the lighting and technical aspects of a production.
