statistics-as-a-career-in-india.title: Statistics
statistics-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Statistics is a field concerned with the collection, analysis, interpretation and presention of numerical data. Statisticians use data to solve problems for different organisations. A student who pursues statistics learns about both pure statistics like probability theory, statistical methodology, stochastic processes, statistical inference, operational research, bio statistics, etc., and also the application of these statistical concepts. Statisticians are uniquely qualified to help both the public and private in order to prepare, organize and analyse their respective data.

career-opportunities.public_sector: Government organizations actively hire statisticians for various functions, such as assessing population demographics and characteristics, economic measurements and policy formulation. These organizations mostly include statistical and economic bureaus, and those related to socio-economic research. Other than this, banks, environmental, scientific and agricultural agencies also employ statisticians for similar type of work in their respective fields.
career-opportunities.private_sector: In the private sector a statistician can become part of large multi-national companies. Banks and insurance companies need statisticans who have the knowledge of blending both maths and stats to create different financial models /products (eg. loans, investments etc.). Statisticians are also hired for varied roles, such as project development, reserch operations, commercial surveys and numerical analysis in share markets, stock markets etc.
career-opportunities.healthcare_sector: Statisticians also known as biostatisticians/biometricians are employed in hospitals, pharmaceutical companies or public health agencies. Their work includes designing studies to test whether drugs successfully treat diseases or conditions. They may also assist hospitals or public health agencies in identifying the origins of outbreaks of illnesses in humans and animals.
career-opportunities.education: A prime avenue for statistics graduates is the education sector. They can work as full-time or guest lecturers at universities and colleges. They may also teach in schools to higher secondary class students.
career-opportunities.research: A large number of mathematicians end up in research roles. The indispensability of mathematics demands the employment of mathematicians in various research organizations to solve complex problems. They are even engaged by aeronautical research agencies such as Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) and National Aeronautic Limited (NAL).

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in Any Stream with Maths
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.A./B.Sc in Statistics/ B.Stats/ Applied Statistics for 3-4 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M. A./ M.Sc in Statistics /MStats for 2 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII in Science with Maths
path 2.graduation: Pursue Integrated Program in M.Sc. Statistics for 5 years

Designing experiments, inspections to develop the needed data

pros: Professionals get the opportunities to work on, and lead advanced research projects.
The field is rapidly growing, and there are a number of opportunities, both in India and overseas.
Professionals can find emploment in several roles and sectors such as finance, banks, market research, product testing, etc.
The field has high earning and growth potential.
cons: The educational path for the career is long, and a Ph.D is generally preferred for research roles.
It involves spending most of the time indoors, with numbers.
It can be hard to get into the career, as it requires extensive knowledge, skill and traning.
The field is highly competitive and difficult to get into.

structural-engineering.title: Structural Engineering
structural-engineering.summary: A branch of civil engineering - structural engineering, as the name suggests, gives importance to the structures and designing those structures. The main aim of this field is safety, stability, and security i.e. to ensure that these structures can withstand the pressure and stresses from various environmental factors. These professionals must safeguard buildings, bridges, and other infrastructure. Structural engineers work in teams of civil engineers, architects, contractors and construction workers to provide technical advice. This field requires the person to have in-depth knowledge about physics, mathematics, and the properties of the various materials used to construct the infrastructures. They must be able to calculate how varied materials function under the stress of different environmental conditions like pressure, temperature, corrosive liquids and gases, and also radiation. These professional also require strong computer skills as they are reuired to build models using computer-aided design technology. Skills like creativity, team working, communication, mathematical, analytical, IT, and attention to detail are important in this profession. It is a crucial field of work that is growing in scope and opportunity each day as the world is seeing a sharp spike in urban expansion and the rise of megacities.

career-opportunities.consultant_engineers: These structural engineers work in engineering consultancies. These include large international companies or small firms run by one person
career-opportunities.selfemployed_contract_engineer: They work on contractual basis with some project. This is possible as building of a structure involves putting the projects out to tender.
career-opportunities.setting_up_own_consultancy: When the person has enough experience and funds, they can start their own consultancy firm for structural engineering
career-opportunities.teaching_or_research_work: One can also indulge in teaching or research work at the side after becoming a strctural engineer

supply-chain-management-as-a-career-in-i.title: Supply Chain Management
supply-chain-management-as-a-career-in-i.summary: Supply Chain Management is all about planning, procuring, handling, managing, engineering and enabling the goods and services that are essential for the nation. They are purchasers and transportation planners and bring warehouses and distributors settings to live. They conceive, design and deliver all the items like food, water, goods to customers on time, and in perfect condition. During the job, they face different challenges every day. The sector is countinously shifting and evolving with changing needs of people and technology. Hence, there is diverse in the careers in supply change management.

career-opportunities.ecommerce_sector: E- commerce is growing very fast like Flipkart, Jabong, Ebay, Snapdeal, etc. Supply chain management plays a very important role from placing the order to customer satisfaction.
career-opportunities.auto_motive_sector_and_manufacturing_sec: Cost can be reduced and prices can be lowerd by efficient supply chain management.
career-opportunities.aerospace_and_defence_sector: They design innovative manufacturing process. Good supply chain management technology can help in reducing costs and optimizing production
career-opportunities.consumer_product_and_retail_sector: They help in retail by strategizing which can help companies in dealing with the high cost, slow growth, changing technology and achieving sustainability.
career-opportunities.healthcare_sector: They help in reducing health care costs & enhancing customer reach. Pharmaceutical, Biotechnology, healthcare services, etc. are few industries which employ supply chain managers.

work description: Plan, develop, organize, direct, manage and evaluate the personnel, operations and budget of an organization's supply chain
Consult supply chain planners to forecast demand or create supply plans that ensure availability of materials or products.
Monitor forecast to identify changes or to determine their effect on supply chain activities.
Define performance metrics for measurement, comparison, or evaluation of supply chain factors, such as product cost or quality.
Evaluate inventories to determine how to increase inventory reduce waste, or optimize customer service.
Develop procedures for coordination of supply chain management with other functional areas, such as sales, marketing, finance, production, or quality assurance.
Develop a delivery system to ensure maximum product creation and optimal shipments to customers

pros: You will get the opportunity to work with multiple departments.
The field has high salary.
You will have an important role in the organization.
cons: The work can be streesful.
You will be required to work for longer hours.
It will take years of experience to reach at higher position.

surveyor-as-a-career-in-india.title: Surveying
surveyor-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Surveyors provide significant data relevant to the shape, location, gravitation and contour of the Earth's surface for engineering, mapmaking, building and construction projects. They take precise measurements for property boundaries, update boundary lines and prepare sites for construction. They prepare sketches, notes, and perform electronic data collection. Surveyors work in close collaboration with civil engineers, landscape architects, cartographers, and urban planners. They help establish legal property boundaries which helps prevent and settle disputes related to land usage and property ownership.

career-opportunities.construction_surveying: It involves planning of roads, highways and buildings as the slope and grade of the land can affect the level of difficulty?in commute and settlements.
career-opportunities.forensic_surveyors: They work with the legal system and can help reconstruct a crime, accident scene. They provide information about storm damage, and evaluate the potential threat of environmental factors. These professionals provide reports to law enforcement, insurance companies, and government agencies.
career-opportunities.hydrographic_surveyor: It includes mapping coastlines, riverbeds, and sea floors. This is helpful for the Navy and other seamen, developers planning waterfront projects, building bridges.They measure water depth, patterns of erosion and assess navigational risks as well.
career-opportunities.environmental_surveyors: They map undeveloped land, like areas populated by an endangered species. They survey areas contaminated with hazardous materials or those affected by storm, flood or fire damage.
career-opportunities.mine_surveyors: They survey and map the tunnels in an underground mine. They survey surface mines to determine the volume of materials mined.
career-opportunities.private_government_companies: They work with private and government companies to provide analysis for construction projects, real estate, building roads and in legal and insurance matters.

path 1.stream: Pursue Physics, Chemistry, Maths in +2 (preferably have geography)

tarot-card-reader-as-a-career-in-india.title: Tarot Card Reading
tarot-card-reader-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Tarot card readers are professionals who use the mystical cards of tarot to predict the future of clients. They are not astrologers, who use sun signs and horoscopes. Becoming a professional tarot reader involves many things to learn such as certain level of professional etiquettes, communication skills and promote a professional appearance. A Tarot card reading involves holistic healing where a client can ask questions related to work, career, relationship, business, education, health etc. The accuracy depends on your intention and concentration at the time of selection. Thus, it is very important to concentrate hard to achieve the most significant outcome.

path 1.stream: Pursue XII with any stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue Graduation in any discipline for 3 years. (Alongside, pursue tarot card reading courses)
path 1.after graduation: Pursue Post-Graduation in any discipline for 2 years. (Alongside, pursue tarot card reading courses)

Interpret tarot cards and make the clients understand what card says about their concern.
Speaking to a variety of people and handle them accordingly.
Maintaining a positive outlook, even if negative cards are displayed.
Conducting workshops/seminars/short-term courses in tarot card reading.
Developing contacts with other tarot card readers for future reference.
Maintaining client database, appointments, record of sessions etc.
Promoting client’s confidentiality and not revealing details.

pros: If you are more of people’s person and have a desire to help others, Tarot is a great way to go ahead with.
A thoughtful and sincere understanding of cards can give you an edge to explain to the point information to the clients.
There is a great range of flexibility in this type of work, as you only work when you want to.
The job profile gives you an opportunity to travel as you can put your stalls all over the country.
An understanding of human psychology can be an advantage for you in this type of work.
cons: Initial struggle can take some time sacrifice of personal time.
You might have to deal with social stigmas attached to tarot card readings.
At times, the session can be emotionally draining because of challenging clients.
Intially, you might struggle with finances as you have to build up your business and reputation.

textile-apparel-design-as-a-career-in-in.title: Textile and Apparel Design
textile-apparel-design-as-a-career-in-in.summary: Textile and Apparel designing is one of the fields within the field of fashion designing. One needs to use their creativity and imagination to design unique apparels while keeping in mind the current fashion trends. An apparel designer needs to be up- to-date with the ongoing developments in the fashion industry as well as keep a close eye on the market and wants of the consumer. Another important skill that designers must possess is the ability to design different types of clothes and dresses using both paper- pencil as well as computer- aided designing (CAD). Textile and apparel designers may work with export houses, fabric manufacturing units, and related businesses.

career-opportunities.garment_and_textile_export_houses: They design, draw and make apparel, including accessories like jewelry and footwear that appeal to the buyers and meet their specific design requirements.
career-opportunities.textile_and_fabric_manufacturing_units: Textile apparel designer in textile and fabric manufacturing units, design, make specifications and then oversee manufacturing of fabrics that meet the needs of the client.
career-opportunities.branded_fashion_showrooms: Textile apparel designers often design collections based on the requirements of high end fashion stores. These collections are then put across the stores, ready for sale.
career-opportunities.television_and_film_industry: The celebrity textile apparel designers design costumes and apparels to be donned by the who's who of the film and television industry. They consider the plot of the movies and complexities of the characters.
career-opportunities.stylist: Textile apparel designers also work as personal stylists for celebrities and for mega events.
career-opportunities.boutiques: Textile apparel designers design apparel to be displayed across designer boutiques.
career-opportunities.retail_chains: They tie up with retail chains to make customer pleasing garments that are put at all locations of the retail brand.
career-opportunities.knitwear_designers: Textile apparel designers work extensively on drapes, knits, hems and patterns. Designers specializing in knit wears strive to include innovation in winter wear, creating knit patterns that are aesthetically pleasing.
career-opportunities.color_specialists: Textile apparel designers work in the industry as color specialists, who pay extreme attention to differentiation of colors, and dyes used in designing.

tourism-as-a-career-in-india.title: Tourism
tourism-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Now-a-days tourism is a flourishing industry, and, with globalization people are travelling outside their place of residence, be it for work or for pleasure purposes. Working in a travel industry requires you to have an indepth knowledge of various regions. Travel industry gives you an oppurtunity to either travel to various destination or consult clients make efficient decisions regarding their tour and travel. If you are passionate about travelling and exploring places and are a peoples person then you can look forward to working in this industry.

career-opportunities.travel_consultants: Travel consultants are the first point of contact to gather information about any destination. They assist in booking aspects of travelling and also guide people for making budgets, keeping in mind their personal requirements
career-opportunities.tour_managers: Tour managers accompanies the clients or the group who have come for the tour. They should be backed up with all the important information about the region. They make sure the clients experience is comfortable and hassle free.
career-opportunities.tourism_officer: Tourism officers or destination managers help in generating economic benefits for the region they work by promoting the region's tourism and attracting tourists.
career-opportunities.travel_agency_managers: Travel agency managers manage staff and sales. They are concerned with the retail outlets, they promote and sell travel related packages and products.
career-opportunities.incentive_travel_specialists: Incentive travel specialists are specialized kind of travel agents who, along with corporate clients plan vacations as an incentive or reward for deserving employees and customers.
career-opportunities.outdoor_adventure_guides: Outdoor adventure guides cater to specific adventure enthusiasts, sport enthusiasts, and other tourists who prefer outdoors. They could either work independently or in collaboration with tourism companies or camps.

ui-designing-as-a-career-in-india.title: UI Design
ui-designing-as-a-career-in-india.summary: The User Interface (UI) designer's responsibility is to take care of the overall experience that visitors to a site will have. This will include layout, presentation, and navigation. Being a UI designer involves a great deal of interaction with marketing and other departments. UI designer works to present right corporate image. Your aesthetic skills and knowledge should be high. Your major role as a UI designer is to make sure that the site is clear, concise, and easy to use.

They strive to give as much detail as possible in order to enhance an individual's experience while interacting with a software.

veterinary-doctor-as-a-career-in-india.title: Veterinarian
veterinary-doctor-as-a-career-in-india.summary: A veterinarian is a medical professional, who provides animals with medical treatment. There are different types of veterinarians , where some work with small animals and some with large farm animals, or wild animals. Veterinarians learn to treat all kinds of animals but sometimes they choose to work with a specific type e.g Dogs. They diagnose animal diseases and treat sick and injured animals. They advise owners on proper care of their pets and livestock. They diagnose, treat, and research medical conditions and diseases of pets, livestock, and other animals. Although most veterinarians work in private clinics and hospitals, others travel to farms, work in laboratories or classrooms, or work for the government. Veterinarians must have a Doctor of Veterinary Medicine degree from an accredited veterinary college and a state license.

career-opportunities.corporate_veterinary_medicine: Corporations that provide veterinary care, test human drugs for safety, or produce animal-related products.
career-opportunities.food_supply_medicine: Veterinarians in this profile work in animal food and animal medicine industry.
career-opportunities.shelter_medicine: Veterinarians work with communities and private or public agencies to ensure the health and well being of animal populations housed in shelters.
career-opportunities.research: Working in a university setting or with companies that produce animal-related products or pharmaceuticals.

work description: Diagnose and treat animals suffering from sickness
Provide animals with suitable medications and perform surgeries when necessary
Provide vaccinations to avoid infections
Perform various laboratory tests with specialised equipments to ensure right treatment
Spread awareness to promote animal healthcare
Carry out research to discover more about animals and their physiology
Euthanize animals who are in critical conditions
Perform duties in line with the ethical standards

pros: Pay: While a veterinary doctor may not have a very high pay at the start but the possibility of increasing pay is good and is dependent on factors like the location of the practise and the experience in the field. There is lot of room to grow in the field.
Flexibility: Vet Doctors have flexibility to work in a diverse set of environments. This position is perfect for the doctors who crave a continuously changing place of work.

Saving lives: Some puppies come in the clinic have life-threatening illnesses and sometimes with liver failure and other issues.Saving a life with your efforts and bringing the four-legged family members back gives a satisfactory feeling.
cons: Stressful situations: The vet docs are required to work for long hours which might be demanding on the body. They have to deal with the death of pets and distraught owners . This may have an effect on them. They may be exposed to allergens like pet dander, fur along with radiation.

Unpredictable Animals: During the treatment time the animal might feel threatened or alarmed and would try to defend . The situation could turn odd and dangerous especially when the animal is sick or in pain. In such a situation the animals might scratch or bite.
Odd Hours: Depending on the emergency cases and odd times, vet doctors may be expected to work on nights or on weekends.

virology_as_career.title: Virology
virology_as_career.summary: Virology is the study of viruses and virus-like entities, which are submicroscopic parasitic creatures with genetic material enclosed in a protein coat. The main study focuses on the structure, classification, and evolution of viruses, also the methods of infecting and exploiting host cells for reproduction, interactions with host organism physiology and immunity is also included, isolation and culture techniques, and their use in research and therapy. Virology is specialisation, therefore there are only few colleges offer Virology as a special course. Virology's early years were reliant on breakthroughs in the chemical and physical sciences. Viruses have long been thought of as disease-causing entities that need to be controlled or eradicated. They do however, have some favourable features that can be harnessed for good ends, as seen in gene therapy and vaccinology.

career-opportunities.environmental_scientist: Environmental scientists and specialists use their knowledge of the natural sciences to protect the environment and human health.
career-opportunities.public_health_microbiologist: Providing information important for the detection and characterization of pathogens that are of public health concern.
career-opportunities.epidemiologist: Expert in the branch of medicine which deals with the incidence, distribution, and possible control of diseases.
career-opportunities.academic_and_research: One can also have carrer in writing, teaching and conducting research related to virology.

cons: • For becoming a successful virologist it’s a long way, which require lot of study and research.• The work can be hectic.

water_management.title: Water Management
water_management.summary: Water management involves planning, organizing, allocating and distributing water resources effectively. This profession has to take into account various water regulations and governmental policies in their work. It is a need of the hour to manage natural resources like water efficiently and justly.The demand for professionals in the field of water resources is rising because of global climate change, land usage changes, etc. Various national and state govermental agencies are providing opportunities in water management career. They are also required in most local and rural municipalities for developing appropriate water resource management plans. Flood control strategies, rainwater harvesting strategies, distribution of water in the town is carried out by a water resource manager. These individuals can also work with the private sector like with water conservation industries, some engineering firms, environmental consultancies, and with companies that utilise water resources in manufacturing or extracting work.To become a water resource manager, there are different options available in undergraduate as well as postgraduate degrees, even diplomas.

career-opportunities.water_resource_specialist: These professionals design plans to tackle and manage water resources. They are in charge of the implementation of various plans and strategies. They also carry out investigations on storage and preservation of water, water pollution, etc.
career-opportunities.water_resource_manager: These managers assist and plan the strategies to store, use and treat water. They can have a career in the government sectors, private sectors, or work individually.
career-opportunities.environment_manager: Also known as the “sustainability managers”, these people monitor the environmental performance of the industries that they work in.
career-opportunities.hydraulics_manager: These individuals keeps a check on the process of storage, conservation, flood control, and other damage control.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Maths, Chemistry and Physics as core subjects
path 1.graduation: B.Sc. in Environmental Science and Water Management/physical science/forestry/sustainibility management
path 1.after graduation: M.Sc in Water Management or Environmental Science or related fields

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Maths, Chemistry and Physics as core subjects
path 2.graduation: B.E. or equivalent engineering degree in discipline related to civil engineering
path 2.after graduation: M.E./M.tech in Water Management/Hydrology/Hydraulics/Related fields

path 3.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Maths, Chemistry and Physics as core subjects
path 3.graduation: B.Tech in water engineering and management or equivalent degree in this field
path 3.after graduation: M.Tech in Water Management/Hydrology/Hydraulics/Related fields

4.name: Acharya N.G. Ranga Agricultural University, Hyderabad

5.name: Sam Higginbottom Institute of Agriculture Technology and Sciences – SHIATS

entrance exam.name: Joint Entrance Examination Main (JEE Main)
entrance exam.elements: Mathematics, Physics, Chemistry

entrance exam.name: Joint Entrance Examination Advanced (JEE Advanced)
entrance exam.elements: Mathematics, Physics, Chemistry

entrance exam.name: Graduate Aptitude Test in Engineering (GATE) (Postgraduate)
entrance exam.elements: General Aptitude and Engineering Mathematics

pros: • It is the need of the hour and the awareness for the need of this profession is growing• There is a lot of diversity in careers you could pursue after studying water management• These professionals can work and help the communities in real-time and give back to the society
cons: • It requires a lot of persistence as these professionals are required to perform several tasks and deal with several problems• Not much is known about this field and the knowledge is still evolving• The opportunities in India are still scarce• The remuneration is quite less in comparison to other fields in B.E., B.Tech or B.Sc

web-designing-as-a-career-in-india.title: Web Design
web-designing-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Web designing is the process of the production and maintenance of the layout, colors, text styles, structure, graphics of the websites, etc. using both non-technical and technical skills. They are involved in producing not just the look of the website, but they determine its working as well. Their main role is to generate the look and the feel of the website through integrating multiple forms of media.

career-opportunities.online_and_print_publishing_companies: Online publishing companies employ web designers to help in designing portals.
career-opportunities.web_game_designing_studios: Web designers play a key role in Web/Game designing studios.
career-opportunities.corporates__marketing_corporate_communic: With the increase in the importance of internet, the demand of Web designers has increased in the corporate sector.
career-opportunities.freelancers: Most of the web designers work as freelancers.
career-opportunities.graphic_design_studios: Web designers can also work in graphic design studios.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII with Any Stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue Bachelors in Design (Graphics/Web Design) for 3 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue Post Graduation in Design (Graphics/Web Design) for 2 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII with any stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue Diploma in Web Designing
path 2.after graduation: Pursue Graduation in Web Designing

path 3.stream: Any Stream
path 3.graduation: Pursue certifications in Web Designing
path 3.after graduation: Pursue Diploma in Web Designing

web-designing-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: The candidate must have secured minimum 50% marks in class XII.Most colleges have an age limit of 20 years.
work description: Design web pages in accordance with the clients, need and target audience
Create wireframes, user flows, site maps to enable design and development of apps and websites
Take decisions regarding the layout, fonts, colour combinations and the content
Keep in touch with the clients for reviews and possible editions
Make sure that the web page is appropriate for the target audience
Ensure the captivity power of the web page
Ensure that the website is easy to use and access
Verify the content of the website for authentication
One should be able to use innovation in creation of user-friendly designs

pros: You can work as a freelancer.
There is a huge demand of website designers.
You can work on multiple projects at a time.
cons: You will be required to work for longer hours.
You should be up-to-date with the latest software.
It is a complete desk job.

wedding-planner-as-a-career-in-india.title: Wedding Planner
wedding-planner-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Although it may sound like an easy task, however lot of hard work goes behind making a wedding ceremony successful. A wedding planner is a professional who helps couples design, plan and manage their wedding. Wedding is a special and ceremonious day for most of the people thus they want this day to be as perfect as a fairytale. To make this come true, couples approach wedding planners who in turn look after everything starting from setting up a budget to shopping, decorations, venues, invitation cards, caterers, photographers etc. Hence, with an organizational and management skills along with good communication skills and the ability to deal with different kinds of people are few essential characteristic of wedding planners.

career-opportunities.event_management_companies: Event management companies hire skilled wedding planners who not only are experts in their jobs but also are promising enough to take the company to a much higher levels.
career-opportunities.wedding_planner_firms: Like event management companies, there are wedding planning firms who are solely devoted to the planning of weddings.
career-opportunities.hotels_resorts_and_banquet_halls: Wedding planners can start their career by getting employed as event coordinator at various hotels, resorts and banquet halls which can help in building up of contacts and gaining initial experience.
career-opportunities.bridal_boutiques: One can get hired in bridal boutiques to look after the bride in terms of their makeup, personality grooming, counselling etc.
career-opportunities.self_employed: For the ones who want to do their own work can start up their own company of wedding planning. This will require a team of people from different fields and backgrounds.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in Any stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue Diploma in Event Management for 1-2 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue PG Diploma in Event Management for 1-2 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII in Any stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue Graduation in Any Stream for 3 years
path 2.after graduation: Pursue PG Diploma / MBA in Event Management for 1-2 years

3.name: National Academy of Event Management & Development

4.name: Indian Institute of Learning & Advanced Development

work description: Plan and organise weddings and related ceremonies on behalf of clients
Be aware of different beliefs, cultures, traditions along with latest trends in a marriage
Coordinate and organize work with different vendors, suppliers or other stakeholders
Take charge of the event right from the beginning stage till the end
Discuss and negotiate the plan with the client before implementing it
Coordinate and make arrangements for guests, venues, decoration, invitation cards, food, clothing, DJ, etc
Monitor the expenses as per the budget plan
Communicate effectively to build a good network
Manage accounts and tasks in an organised manner

pros: Wedding planners also have the opportunity to travel to exotic locations for destination weddings
Can work independently and earn good.
The person becomes more open to different perspectives of people and strengthen team work abilities.
The person gets to travel around the city as well as outside city and sometimes country.
cons: Planning wedding can be exhausting, emotional and involve high-stress.
People who like to take total control can have problem as a wedding planner.
Lack of stability.
There is no fixed time of working hours

writer-editor-copywriter-as-a-career-in-.title: Writer, Editor, Copywriter
writer-editor-copywriter-as-a-career-in-.summary: The Headline, the body copy of an advertisement is all delivered by a copywriter. A copywriter must put forth the headline of an advertisement catchy enough to hold the interest of the audience that they move towards the "body copy" of the advertisement. He/she is considered as the salesman of the print. Copywriters use language to convey a story about the benefits of a brand or a product. Unlike writers who write fiction with comparatively less research work, copywriters work involves more of research, editing and less of writing. Editors often start out as writers, and in many cases their role involves substantial writing. They help writer's craft stories, make sure writers adhere to style guidelines and rules of grammar, and ensure that every article is suitable for a particular publication. Editors straddle management and production, often managing writers and budgets, setting deadlines, scheduling what will run and when, and enforcing general editorial standards of quality.

career-opportunities.editorial_assistants: With an attention to detail and a flair of writing and verbal skills, a person can do well in this filed. Work of an editorial assistant comprises of writing and editing copy, proofreading and checking the accuracy of the article. Editorial assistants take on increasing editorial responsibilities compared to others in the company starting from handling overflow from the copy desk, to assisting editors and reporters.
career-opportunities.copyeditors: The job of a copy editor is to present information without any mistake. They correct punctuations, grammatical mistakes, spelling so on and so forth. Copy editors work in organisations such as advertising agency, magazines, newspaper and websites.
career-opportunities.writerreporter: While reporters report in public, writers do their work in private. A reporter has to be someone who knows how to attract attention of the audience in a public place within a short period of time. Reporters engage in the direct communication with the public and gather their information. Reporters are often constrained by time and words whereas writers have no constrain to let their imagination flow.
career-opportunities.managing_editor: Managing director oversee the entire process from scratch and wear several hats. They assign work to the staff. They put forth their idea to the other team members who can then execute his/her vision. The managing director reports directly to the Editor in chief.
career-opportunities.executive__senior_writers: Executive editors and senior editors typically set editorial policy, write opinion pieces, and manage teams of editors. As with all types of editing, the foundation is writing, even most executive editors got started in writing. They oversee the content and intervene to enforce quality standards and style rules when necessary. They also plan budgets, set deadlines, and watch market trends.
career-opportunities.freelancers: Although freelancers are self- employed and have the choice to work in different publication house simultaneously but freelancing requires time and commitment. The more versatile a writer is, more are the chances of getting hired by different publication house.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII in Any stream
path 1.graduation: Pursue Bachelors in Journalism/Mass Communication / In Any Stream for 3 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue Masters in Journalism and Mass Communication for 2 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII in Any stream
path 2.graduation: Pursue working as a Editor/ Writer / Copywriter

work description: Prepare writing material for publication
Develop idea and concept to cater to the needs of the clients
Write articles, stories, slogans, one liners, tag lines, etc.
Check for right language and correct grammar
Collect information from standard sources
Promote the ideals of an organisation through words and writings
Give equal importance to art and imagery to captivate the viewers

pros: You can inspire and motivate people through your words. Your work impact masses, which follows with work satisfaction.
There is no time bound for a writer as career option. Even if you're 70, with no scope of working in corporate sectors, you can write as a freelancer and write your own story.
You get to travel a lot for research based extensive articles.
cons: Quality of writing is quite subjective and entails a lot of pressure to please everyone with your work. Criticism is a major part of this profession; 10 people can give you the 5 star rating but there will always be one who will write a scathing review and take you down.
Job stability and remuneration is low compared to other professions.
Working hours can be rigorous and would demand you to even work in weekends.

zoology-as-a-career-in-india.title: Zoology
zoology-as-a-career-in-india.summary: Zoology is a science that involves the study of the animal kingdom, both living and extinct. Zoologists, as a result, are also referred to as Animal Scientists. Zoologists analyze the structure, life processes, physiology, and classification of different species in detail. They also analyze how different animals interact with each other and adapt to their environments. They conduct research on both the species and individual organisms by collecting and analyzing data in laboratories and outdoor environments.

career-opportunities.wildlife_rehabilitators: It involves the treatment, care and feeding of injured, ill and wounded non-domestic animals, as well as caring for orphaned and abandoned animals. After the treatment, the animals are released back into their habitat. Employment opportunities exist in both government and private settings.
career-opportunities.wildlife_educators: Their primary work involves educating people about animals and their care and conservation. They explore various intricacies of wildlife behavior, research and write information to create printed materials, websites, information for educational visits, displays, etc.
career-opportunities.researchers: They perform experiments, collect data, conduct analysis and apply the results to help solve environmental and health problems, breed and raise specimens, etc. in varied settings.
career-opportunities.national_parkswildlife_sanctuary_manager: Their roles include animal care, monitoring and recording their behavior; ensuring their health; engaging in the care such as grooming, exercising and training; and teaching visiting groups about the animals.
career-opportunities.animal_breeders: They breed different animals, including pets, livestock, exotic animals, etc. Breeding involves the reproduction of animals to ensure the promotion of specific desired characteristics. Animal breeders have knowledge of genetics, genealogy, and insemination techniques.
career-opportunities.education: Zoology graduates also find employment as Biology/Zoology teachers and professors at different schools, colleges and universities.

path 1.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Biology
path 1.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. (Hons) Zoology or B.Sc. (Hons) Life Sciences or B.Sc. (Hons) Biological Sciences for 3 years
path 1.after graduation: Pursue M.Sc. Zoology or M.Sc. In Life Sciences for 2 years

path 2.stream: Clear Class XII with Science Stream with Biology
path 2.graduation: Pursue B.Sc. (Hons) Zoology or B.Sc. (Hons) Life Sciences or B.Sc. (Hons) in Biological Sciences for 3 years
path 2.after graduation: Pursue Diploma/PG Diploma in Zoology for 1-2 years

zoology-as-a-career-in-india.Important Facts: Some colleges/university have admissions in B.Sc. (Hons) in Zoology following their own entrance test or consider the marks in the qualifying exam.
work description: Recognizing , classifying, recording and monitoring animal species
Collecting data and interpreting it
Employing complex procedures, for example, computerized molecular and cellular analysis, and in-vitro fertilization
Executing field and laboratory research findings
Studying animals in their natural environment or in captivity
Generating comprehensive technical reports
Presenting and publishing information in journals and books
Supervising technicians

pros: Professionals get the opportunities to work on, and lead advanced research projects.
The work can be adventurous, if the professional is involved with field research.
The field is rapidly growing, and there are a number of research opportunities, both in India and overseas.
cons: The educational path for the career is long, as a Ph.D is generally preferred.
It can be hard to get into the career, as it requires extensive knowledge, skill and traning.
